debugText:
Join a leading Australian SaaS provider in the document automation space, with a strong presence in the Australian legal industry.

Seeking an experienced Full-stack Senior Angular, Python Engineer to join our dynamic development team. Your expertise will drive the creation of scalable, efficient, and secure software solutions that meet the evolving needs of our clients.

**Responsibilities:**

- Develop and maintain efficient and reliable web applications and RESTful APIs using Python and relevant frameworks (e.g., Django, Flask).
- Design, develop, and optimize SQL database schemas and queries to ensure high-performance data retrieval and manipulation.
- Utilize object-relational mapping (ORM) tools like SQLAlchemy for database access.
- Implement secure authentication and authorization mechanisms to protect backend APIs using cloud services such as AWS Cognito or similar.
- Integrate with third-party systems and services to enable seamless data exchange.
- Collaborate with frontend developers to integrate backend functionality with Angular-based user interfaces.

**Experience:**

- Proven experience as a Backend Software Developer, with at least 5 years of experience.
- Experienced in developing front-end using Angular.
- Strong proficiency in Python and experience with web frameworks such as Django or Flask.
- Extensive knowledge of RESTful API development and principles.
- Solid understanding of SQL databases and proficiency in writing efficient queries.
- Proficiency in cloud services (e.g., AWS, Google Cloud, Azure) including serverless functions and managed databases.
- Strong understanding of DevOps principles and experience with CI/CD pipelines using tools like Jenkins, GitLab CI, or similar.
- Familiarity with frontend technologies, particularly Angular, and ability to collaborate with frontend developers.
- Experience with source control systems (e.g., Git) and agile development methodologies.
- Strong problem-solving and debugging skills.
- Excellent communication and collaboration abilities.
- Ability to mentor and provide technical guidance to junior team members.
- Must be a team player and work together with the team to achieve the business goals.

**Global Technology Group Pty Ltd is an established gaming technology company that develops and licenses social gaming platforms, systems, and gaming content. GTG offers a supportive and open work environment that also fosters individual responsibility and initiative. We also offer flexible working hours, and opportunities for our team to grow and expand their skill sets, including training, conference attendance and mentoring.**

debugText:
## **About
Credabl**

Hi, we’re Credabl! Being nimble, flexible and responsive with the client top of mind are very important to us. Servicing the medical and healthcare professions means we use a human-to- human approach. Our shared purpose is to help our clients realise their goals and empower them to serve the greater Australian community.

In a fast-paced, agile and entrepreneurial environment, we encourage our people to _Fuel Ambition_. They take the initiative, aim for
excellence, stay curious with a
growth mindset, provide high-touch experiences and are digitally minded.

We
place
high
value
on
embracingexcellence
and
bringingthe
energy
needed
to
fuel
the ambition. Our culture and
work environment embraces belonging together as a team and
keeping
it real.

Credabl is an equal opportunity and LGBTI-inclusive employer.
www.credabl.com.au
www.linkedin.com/company/credabl/about/

## Scope

We are seeking a NSW based Full-Stack Developer who will design, build and develop enterprise grade software systems. Located in our Sydney office you will play a key role on some exciting projects, enhancing productivity of our internal users an uplifting mobile ad website experience for our clients.

The role will appeal to those who appreciate variety and learning from those around them. It is also largely autonomous, so you are given the responsibility to manage your tasks and your stakeholders appropriately. We encourage thinking outside the box and being innovative, all while having fun and being supported by/supportive of the team and the organisation.

This is an exciting opportunity to join a truly dynamic and creative team in an Australia-wide financial services organisation, with a dedicated focus on the medical, dental, veterinary and healthcare professions.

## Key Responsibilities:

**Leadership & Mentoring**

- Guide team development efforts towards successful project delivery.
- Provide technical leadership to teammates through coaching and mentorship.
- Maintain high standards of software quality within the team by establishing good practices and habits.
- Identify and encourage areas for growth and improvement within the team.

**Execution and Delivery**

- Assist in the collection and documentation of user %%U+0027%% s requirements, development of user stories, estimates and work plans.
- Collaborate with other software developers, business analysts and software architects to plan, design, develop, test, and maintain web and desktop-based business applications built on Microsoft Cloud technologies.
- Prepare reports, manuals and other documentation on the status, operation and maintenance of software.
- Design, develop, and unit test applications in accordance with established standards.
- Participate in peer-reviews of solution designs and related code.
- Package and support deployment of releases.

**Data and Cyber Security**

- Monitor application security ensuring integrity of confidential information and intellectual property.
- Identify gaps or vulnerabilities in current processes and recommend resolution plan.
- Promote user awareness on actions to assist in user security and highlight safe computing practices.

**Key Requirements**

Knowledge

- College or University degree in Technology/Engineering/Science or related discipline.
- Building enterprise could-native solutions on Microsoft Azure using PaaS, IaaS and SaaS platforms.
- Automating internal business processes to achieve operational efficiency and scalability.
- Strong grasp of modern security best practices and Software Architecture.
- Automated and unit testing.
- Source control management systems and continuous integration/deployment environments such as Azure DevOps.
- Strong knowledge of Angular 10+ and building modern responsive web applications.
- Comprehensive understanding of object-oriented and service-oriented application development techniques and theories.

Skills

- Proficient with using Microsoft .NET Core 5.0+ using C#, EF Core, Linq, NuGet packages and modern authentication mechanisms to build secure, modern REST APIs.
- Extensive experience designing and developing enterprise grade software using modern architecture patterns such as Domain Driven Design.
- In depth knowledge and experience with core Microsoft technologies including: Dynamics 365, Power Apps, Office 365, Azure, SQL Server, SharePoint and Teams development.
- Agile development methodologies including Kanban and Scrum.
- Multi-threading and concurrency
- Debugging, performance profiling and optimization
- Using an Enterprise Integration Bus and/or Pub-Sub eventing solutions.
- Building iOS and Android mobile apps using Ionic/Angular as well as Backend APIs built on .Net Core.

Abilities

- Engineering mindset, ability to think outside the box and ‘invent’ creative solutions.
- Strong communication skills with both internal team members and external business stakeholders.
- Strong initiative to find ways to improve solutions, systems, and processes.
- Internally motivated, able to work proficiently both independently and in a team environment.

Experience (Preferred)

- 3+ years’ experience as a Full-Stack Software Developer.
- Prior experience with technical leadership or mentoring.
- Experience with technology in the Finance Industry.
- Infrastructure as Code (IaC) deployment of Microsoft Azure platform resources using ARM templates and PowerShell.
- User interface design and prototyping.
- Building C# .Net Core APIs using OAuth for security.
- Database development including relational database design, SQL and ORM technologies.
- Use of Azure Logic and Function Apps. (Durable Functions experience desired)
- Proficient in developing applications using Microsoft Power Apps, Microsoft Dynamics 365, and Microsoft Dataverse, with specific expertise in creating plugins for Dataverse and a solid understanding of OData is a plus.

**Benefits**

Credabl offers an innovative and diverse culture, along with an approachable leadership team across a flat structure. We offer our people flexibility, a competitive compensation package, work- life harmony and even birthday leave. Our leaders actively foster career paths, learning and development, plus personal growth, to ensure you grow and progress with us.

Our people feel valued and well-supported, equipped with the technology to enable efficient hybrid/flexible work. To maintain a safe and healthy workplace for everyone, the company follows

its COVID-19 policy. We have fun, embrace coming together to boost productivity and workplace learning, and take pride in strengthening our internal relationships.

**Applications**

To apply, get in touch with our People team at careers@credabl.com.au

Credabl is an equal opportunity employer. We encourage applications from Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander and LBGTQIA+ candidates.

## **Credabl is an equal opportunity employer**

At Credabl, we believe that a diverse team brings a variety of perspectives, experiences and ideas, which are crucial for our success.

We actively encourage applications from candidates of all backgrounds and demographics and are committed to offering a fair, accessible and inclusive experience regardless of age, race, disability, gender identity, marital status, religion, sex or sexual orientation or cultural background, including Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander peoples and LGBTQIA+ individuals.

Your unique background and experiences could be exactly what we %%U+0027%% re looking for to help us achieve our goals.

This is a role for a strong Senior Software Engineer with an integration background to work in an agile environment that offers the opportunity to work closely with stakeholders and the broader engineering team.

Working in a smaller sub-team, you will have the visibility and autonomy to take on exciting feature work and contribute to the growth of the business alongside opportunities for your personal career growth.

The candidate must have a strong Java, Spring Boot, Microservices, Kafka, CI/CD, Kubernetes, and AWS background
to be considered.

What you’ll need to be successful:

- Capital Markets domain experience
- Hands-on experience in Java, Spring boot, and
 NodeJs

 This is a Sydney-based role for the candidates with Australian/NZ citizenship or PR.

postTitle: Senior Software Engineer (Java) - User Core (Remote across ANZ)
debugText:
**Join the team redefining how the world experiences design** .

Hey, g %%U+0027%% day, mabuhay, kia ora, 你好, hallo, vítejte!

Thanks for stopping by. We know job hunting can be a little time consuming and you %%U+0027%% re probably keen to find out what %%U+0027%% s on offer, so we %%U+0027%% ll get straight to the point.

**Where and how you can work**

Our flagship campus is in Sydney. We also have a campus in Melbourne and co-working spaces in Brisbane, Perth and Adelaide. But you have choice in where and how you work. That means if you want to do your thing in the office (if you %%U+0027%% re near one), at home or a bit of both, it %%U+0027%% s up to you.

**About the Team**

In User Platform, we break up existing services and build new ones from scratch to prepare our architecture for the future. We care about software design and its impact on the user. We constantly aim to get the most performance out of AWS resources, and along the way, we ship new features to improve the user experience for Enterprise and Education users.

**About the Role**

As a senior backend engineer, you will be collaborating to build up and scale the backbone of Canva’s User Management: the User Platform. The user platform team plays an essential role in keeping our services stable and scalable for our millions of daily users.

You will be involved in designing, building, and maintaining new features to improve and extend the experience for Pro and Enterprise teams and organisations by providing building blocks like Permissions and Product Capability controls. This role entails constant collaboration with other teams across Canva, giving you a lot of exposure to what other teams are working on and giving you the opportunity to connect the dots.

**Role Responsibilities:**

- Collaborate as part of a backend focussed team of engineers to extend and scale out the backbone of Canva %%U+0027%% s Microservice landscape: the User Platform
- Responsible for high performance systems to authenticate, authorize and manage users, avatars, groups and teams
- Collaborate with the team to envision, design & plan, build and maintain new useful and reusable building blocks for the User Platform
- Communicate with stakeholder teams to evaluate requirements, align timelines and optimise for value to the customers
- Focus on improving the experience for customers with large teams in Enterprise and Education environments

**Required Experience:**

- Working collaboratively with teammates and communicating effectively
- Firmly grounded computer science and engineering fundamentals, including concurrency, multithreading, data structures, solution design, architecture, and design patterns
- Strong background in designing, building and running high performance, large-scale Java backend systems
- Problem-solver
mentality
- Good written and verbal communication skills

**Nice to have:**

- Experience with Authentication and Authorization systems is a huge plus
- SQL experience
- DynamoDB experience is a plus

**What %%U+0027%% s in it for you?**

Achieving our crazy big goals motivates us to work hard—and we do - but you %%U+0027%% ll experience lots of moments of magic, connectivity and fun woven throughout life at Canva, too. We also offer a stack of benefits to set you up for every success in and outside of work.

**Here %%U+0027%% s a taste of what %%U+0027%% s on offer:**

- Equity packages - we want our success to be yours too
- Inclusive parental leave policy that supports all parents & carers
- An annual Vibe & Thrive allowance to support your wellbeing, social connection, office setup & more
- Flexible leave options that empower you to be a force for good, take time to recharge and supports you personally

Check out lifeatcanva.com for more info.

**Other stuff to know**

We make hiring decisions based on your experience, skills and passion, as well as how you can enhance Canva and our culture. When you apply, please tell us the pronouns you use and any reasonable adjustments you may need during the interview process.

Please note that interviews are conducted virtually.

debugText:
**Join the team redefining how the world experiences design.**

Hey, g %%U+0027%% day, mabuhay, kia ora, 你好, hallo, vítejte!

Thanks for stopping by. We know job hunting can be a little time consuming and you %%U+0027%% re probably keen to find out what %%U+0027%% s on offer, so we %%U+0027%% ll get straight to the point.

**Where and how you can work**

Our flagship campus is in Sydney. We also have a campus in Melbourne and co-working spaces in Brisbane, Perth and Adelaide. But you have choice in where and how you work, we trust our Canvanauts to choose the balance that empowers them and their team to achieve their goals.

**What you’d be doing in this role**

As Canva scales change continues to be part of our DNA. But we like to think that %%U+0027%% s all part of the fun. So this will give you the flavour of the type of things you %%U+0027%% ll be working on when you start, but this will likely evolve.

At the moment, this role is focused on:

- Developing self-service infrastructure from the ground up to empower our engineering teams to work more efficiently
- Working across CI/CD, build systems, test frameworks, cloud providers and other developer-related domains as necessary to ensure Canva’s engineering teams continue to scale with the demands of the product suite
- Working with product engineering teams to ensure build best practices and tools are rolled out in every service across the whole organization.
- Designing, building and optimising developer workflows to build, test and deploy a monorepo architecture.
- Participating in solution design meetings, hiring interviews, and code reviews
- Working to improve/maintain internal developer experience platforms that empower engineers to work efficiently.

**You %%U+0027%% re probably a match if**

- You have experience building internal tooling for CI/CD, infrastructure, or developer efficiency/productivity
- You have strong Computer Engineering / Science knowledge around fundamentals and first principles relating to concurrency, multithreading, data structures, architecture, and various design patterns
- You have **advanced coding proficiency in Python/ Java/ GoLang and strong Object Oriented Programming fundamentals**
- You have a good understanding of the DevOps ecosystem and how to improve developer efficiency.
- You have experience working in a modern distributed microservices environment.
- You have the ability to guide and mentor other members within the team and improve the way we collaborate, learn, and share ideas.
- You have strong written and verbal communication skills - both technical and plain language
- You thrive on teamwork, love being a team player, and enjoy mixing it up with folks from all walks of work life!
- You have a passion for creating and enjoy using your imagination to develop innovative engineering solutions.

**About the Group**

The Developer Platform Group owns the coding life cycle at Canva – from ideas through to production. Our mission is “To forge a delightful ecosystem for engineers at Canva, amplifying their craft and enabling them to ship fast and correct. At scale.” We create an environment in which developers can do their best work.


We work closely with product engineering teams to understand their needs and build solutions to best meet them. Our ecosystem spans platforms such as Git, build systems, CI systems, and knowledge management systems.


Riding the wave of technical development at a hyper-growth company offers a unique, once-in-a-lifetime opportunity to do some of the best engineering of your life. Tackle complex problems with innovative solutions and enjoy the exhilaration of seeing your contributions amplify developer velocity and workflow at scale. If you crave challenge, love growth and yearn for the satisfaction of seeing real results uplift the developer experience, come and join us in the Developer Platform group.

**What %%U+0027%% s in it for you?**

Achieving our crazy big goals motivates us to work hard - and we do - but you %%U+0027%% ll experience lots of moments of magic, connectivity and fun woven throughout life at Canva, too. We also offer a range of benefits to set you up for every success in and outside of work.

Here %%U+0027%% s a taste of what %%U+0027%% s on offer:

- Equity packages - we want our success to be yours too
- Inclusive parental leave policy that supports all parents & carers
- An annual Vibe & Thrive allowance to support your wellbeing, social connection, office setup & more
- Flexible leave options that empower you to be a force for good, take time to recharge and supports you personally

Check out lifeatcanva.com for more info.

**Other stuff to know**

We make hiring decisions based on your experience, skills and passion, as well as how you can enhance Canva and our culture. When you apply, please tell us the pronouns you use and any reasonable adjustments you may need during the interview process.

We celebrate all types of skills and backgrounds at Canva so even if you don’t feel like your skills quite match what’s listed above - we still want to hear from you!

Please note that interviews are conducted virtually.

debugText:
**Company Description**

**Be the inventor and enabler of our business!**

Where else will you get the chance to build products from scratch? Products that impact the lives of millions of people in the everyday. At Cuscal, our tech team are the hands and heart for what we do best. They’re the inventors, the creators, the enablers of our business. They turn ideas into reality. They test. They refine. They perfect.

**Job Description**

**We are looking for a Software Engineer to join our Shared Services domain.**

As a member of our Client Interface and Billing team, you’ll be responsible for developing, maintaining, and supporting applications and systems that support the business needs of the customer. This includes analysis, design, build, test, and documenting solutions according to approved current standards and best practice methodology.

**In this role you will be responsible for:**

- Preparing technical specifications and program design documents to meet user requirements and functional specifications.
- Performing analysis to support application and system design.
- Analysing, designing, developing and testing software solutions that meet user requirements according to approved IT standards and best practice methodology.
- Adhering to architecture, design, implementation, and security standards and best practices.

- Developing reusable software building blocks to enable faster delivery.

**Qualifications**

**To be successful in this position, you’ll need knowledge and experience in:**

- Proficient in full-stack development with a focus on Angular, React, jQuery, AJAX, HTML, CSS, JavaScript, Java, Apache Tomcat.

- Design Patterns.

- Webservices (REST & SOAP).

- Micro-services implemented using Spring Boot.
- Proficiency in SQL and experience with databases like MySQL, PostgreSQL, or Oracle.
- Automated Unit & Integration testing frameworks.

- Understanding security concepts within APIs security.

- Understanding CI/CD pipelines and test automation, and application deployments.

- Understanding of virtualisation and container orchestration technologies such as Docker.
- Awareness or experience in Secure Application Development methodologies.
- Understanding of secure authentication frameworks.

_Desirable:_

- Experience in modern API management and SaaS solutions.
- Exposure to Webseal, OKTA, LDAP, and SSO systems.
- Liferay platform expertise.

- Knowledge of DevOps principles.

**Additional Information**

**Why Cuscal?**

We are in the rapidly evolving world of payments, and we are committed to providing a diverse and inclusive workplace where the very best talent in Australia chooses to work. We support our colleagues with flexible work arrangements through our hybrid model whilst also offering a wide range of educational, financial, lifestyle, health & wellbeing benefits.

**Next Step**

If you think this role is the right fit for you, we invite you to apply. Let’s explore who you are and what drives you. We’d love to share our vision for the future of payments sector. Please note candidate screening and interviews may be conducted prior to the closing date of the job advert.

_Cuscal does not accept unsolicited resumes from recruitment agencies and search firms. Please do not email or send unsolicited resumes to any Cuscal employee, location or address._

debugText:
A great chance to join an Australian owned company who are in an organic growth phase. Their product has been well received in their market and have just acquired a bunch of new customers. With a technical founder, the tech team will always get to work with the latest and greatest!

As a Java Developer, you %%U+0027%% ll report to the Platform Lead, who oversees the team’s prioritization and planning. The team operates in a fast-paced environment, deploying enhancements and bug fixes every two weeks. Success in this role means contributing to the growth of the client %%U+0027%% s platform with secure, clean, well-abstracted, and testable code.

**Responsibilities:**

- Independently design and build small to medium-sized features and bug fixes using Java, Groovy, SQL, JavaScript, and CSS.
- Collaborate with the team to work on major platform features.
- Develop customer environment extensions using Java and Groovy.
- Build integrations with customer systems leveraging Apache Camel.
- Write unit and integration tests with JUnit and Mockito
- Evolve the platform’s database schema using Liquibase.

  Improve build and deployment processes using Ant, Maven, and Gradle.
- Contribute to the company’s knowledge base through Confluence.
- Track and manage your work through Jira.
- Collaborate with implementation consultants to design and spec new platform features.
- Ensure adherence to company information security policies.
- Escalate issues in a timely manner to meet SLAs.

**Ideal Candidate Profile**

- Minimum 3 years of experience as a developer.
- Expertise in Java (version 8+), SQL, and functional programming.
- Proficiency in dependency injection frameworks (Guice or Spring), and ORM tools like JPA/Hibernate.
- Experience with JUnit, Mockito, and writing unit tests.
- Knowledge of design patterns and object-oriented principles such as SOLID.
- Familiarity with build tools like Ant, Maven, or Gradle.
- Experience with distributed source control systems like Mercurial or Git.

- Strong interpersonal and relationship management skills.
- Desirable: Experience in insurance or start-up environments.
- A degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or related fields.
- Motivation, innovative thinking, and a desire to understand the complexities of a multi-channel cloud platform.
- Experience working in Agile environments with a strong team-oriented approach.

debugText:
**About LawY**

LawY is a member of the LEAP group of companies - the leading provider of Legal Practice Productivity Solutions in the world. Over a 30-year period we %%U+0027%% ve expanded across Australia, Canada, the United States, the United Kingdom, the Republic of Ireland, Poland and New Zealand and support more than 100,000 lawyers and their staff in small and medium sized law firms. We owe our success to our curiosity and commitment to our guiding purpose, to ‘Help lawyers who help people’.

 Enter....LawY - think early-stage disruptor in the legal software industry. Lawyers need trusted legal answers fast - we %%U+0027%% re here to join together AI technology and legal expertise. The small team who built this world class web application are determined, passionate, and just generally good at getting sh!t done! We built quality and quickly which is a testament to the skill levels. You will take their outcomes to the next level globally.

**What you %%U+0027%% ll do**

 We don %%U+0027%% t stay still for long, and with the ever-changing technology landscape it %%U+0027%% s time to start work on LawY version 2.0. This is where you come in......As an experienced hands-on Engineer you %%U+0027%% ll partner closely with the CEO of LawY to design and develop robust, scalable, and efficient web applications. You %%U+0027%% ll contribute to architectural decisions and build solutions that are well designed, built, implemented and you %%U+0027%% ll understand the “why” and “what for”. We have an ambitious roadmap, but as a lean and high trust team, we remain quick to collaborate and support each other with challenging problems. This is an incredible opportunity to help carve out what direction this product takes.

**What you %%U+0027%% ll bring** You are a smart, focused, motivated and hard-working Engineer who wants to make an impact, while expanding your skills. On top of that you will bring:

- Experience: 7+ years of professional experience in full stack web development, with a recent focus on Next.js and Vercel and previous experience working for a start-up.
- Track record: You are proud of your track record which includes building features and products that have been fully operationalised.
- Technical Skills: Proficiency in JavaScript, TypeScript, React, Node.js, and modern web development frameworks.
- Communication: You are concise in your verbal and written communication - sharing the what, the why and the how of what you are thinking and doing in all directions.
- Motivation: You are passionate about making products or services that help people. You %%U+0027%% re at peak satisfaction when you find users are happy with your products.
- Quality: You understand the trade-offs between quality and velocity and have a track record of striking the right balance

 LEAP is an inclusive, people-first company committed to breaking down institutional barriers that keep people from reaching their potential. If you meet some, but not all the requirements above, we encourage you to still submit your application.

**Why join LawY?**

- You will receive a highly competitive salary.
- Our hybrid work environment offers the best of both worlds, whether you prefer to be in the office or work from home you have the flexibility to work however suits you and your team.
- You %%U+0027%% ll get all the creative freedom that comes with an early-stage start-up but with all the benefits of working for a larger group of companies - stability, a large client base and the freedom to choose your own tech stack.
- Work with modern tech. Our tech-stack is built on top of modern serverless frameworks and tools. Our tech stack consists of React, Next.js, Tailwind, Supabase PostgreSQL, and Vercel.
- We will invest our time and money in you to help develop your career. Open discussions and reviews will help us understand your career aspirations.
- Free platinum gym membership
- Generous parental leave benefits
- Additional paid wellbeing day
- Unique social events, and MUCH MORE!

debugText:
_**Engineer the future. Start your dream career with Dematic today!**_

**WHAT IS SO AMAZING ABOUT THIS OPPORTUNITY**

Are you ready to create industry-leading software solutions that interface with cutting-edge **equipment, machinery, hardware, and robotics**? We have an exciting opportunity for a **Software Engineer** to join our Global Product and Solutions team, based in Belrose.

In this role, you’ll work with a talented team of engineers, developing high-quality software for impactful **warehouse automation projects**. You %%U+0027%% ll be more than just a coder—your solutions will come to life as you see them operating in real-time and engage with clients directly during site commissioning. Your work will play a pivotal role in transforming industries such as eCommerce, retail, manufacturing, exporting, parcel services, and more.

As a leading logistics systems integrator, Dematic delivers sophisticated, end-to-end warehouse solutions that combine advanced materials handling and storage systems with state-of-the-art software. Join us and be part of a team that %%U+0027%% s continually enhancing global supply chains with innovative technology.

**WHY YOU’LL LOVE THIS ROLE:**

- You’ll work on significant, hands-on projects, where your solutions have an immediate impact
- You’ll collaborate with a passionate team of engineers committed to driving innovation
- You’ll travel across the Asia-Pacific region, supporting key clients and seeing your work in action
- Your contributions will shape global project engineering and be a part of ground-breaking warehouse technologies used around the world.

**WHAT YOUR PROJECTS LOOKS LIKE**

- **Collaborative team-based Developers** working on projects encompassing software, configuration, documentation, customer communication and support.
- **Projects are implemented from start to finish**, with developers performing the on-site commissioning. Projects will start in the office, before final implementation and delivery on customer sites.
- “ **Goldilocks” balance** – just the right amount of travel to keep things exciting without it being excessively frequent, a software level that’s engaging to work on without being overly device level or overly abstract, and a friendly team size for collaboration. Projects conclude with delivering “real” physical systems with moving automation, not just an application.
- **Full stack development** on a tech stack consisting of backend modules utilizing C# and SQL + configuration based building blocks. C# full application GUIs, and Blazor based web. Mixture of legacy + new development tech. Control industrial hardware devices from a logical level.

**WHAT YOU WILL BE WORKING ON**

- Developing software products to required specifications
- Developing technical documents, including specifications and reports
- Delivering software projects to customer sites
- Participating in on site systems commissioning
- Test implemented solution to ensure contractual agreements are met
- Participating in design, code reviews and code documentation
- Providing assistance to the Software Service group for customer support acting as high tier support
- Perform in place upgrades to legacy/existing sites
- Interacting directly with customers via email and in person
- Providing IT, networking, and application support and configuration for customer sites
- Providing product expertise to support the sales process
- Agreeing on time schedules with Team Leaders and achieving specified targets of multiple projects in parallel
- Following Software Development Quality Processes and procedures
- Actively contributing to the improvement of Software Development processes
- Contributing to a Software Development environment that fosters technical excellence and teamwork

**SETTING YOU UP FOR SUCCESS**

- Degree in Software Engineering/Mechatronics or similar
- We will consider applications from recent
**Honour Graduates**
- Experience with networking, monitoring, diagnosis and trouble shooting

**Preferred Experience** in software languages and tools including Microsoft products:

- .NET, C# (including Blazor, ASP.NET, WPF  WinForms
- Skilled in modern technologies and languages
- OO design/development
- MS Windows programming experience
- Relational databases
- Excellent Testing skills
- Understanding of modern software development methodologies

**Highly Desirable**:

- hardware/electronics/equipment/controls experience/hobby
- Languages/platforms/DB: .NET/C#, Java/J2EE, Delphi XE, SQL Server, Windows Server
- Tech.: XML/XSL/CSS, http, SOA, WinForms, WPF, WCF, HTML5, JavaScript
- Modelling tools, e.g.: UML
- Development for mobile devices
- Multithreading
- Comms (TCPIP, http, https, etc.)

**Desirable**:

- Experience in Radio Frequency technologies
- Logistics & Material Handling or Manufacturing industries
- VMware/HyperV
- Server/DB configurations
- Middleware (Biztalk Server, WebSphere, etc.)

**WHAT WE OFFER YOU**

- Local and International travel
- Project based work
- Exposure to a wide range of technologies and processes, excellent experience in practical software engineering skills, SQL Database and infrastructure, IT infrastructure, and engineering
- Progressive and innovative global company experiencing high growth
- Career Development and Global Opportunities
- Competitive salary, with salary packaging and novated leasing available
- Corporate discounts on car rentals and IT products/accessories
- Paid Parental Leave + super: 12 weeks for primary carer/2 weeks secondary
- Purchase Leave
- Study Assistance
- Social Club
- Employee Referral Programme

**WHY BRING YOUR CAREER TO DEMATIC**

This is an exciting time to join Dematic. We are proud to design, build, implement, and support automated system solutions for warehouses, distribution centres, and production facilities. We live on the cutting edge of technology and industry and are a global leader with 11,000 employees worldwide and over 700 employees in Australia and New Zealand.

**HOW TO APPLY**

If you would like to apply for the above position, please click on the ‘ _**Apply for this job’**_ button and submit your resume. For more information on Dematic:
_www.dematic.com_

_Dematic is committed to proving equal employment opportunity in all areas of employment including recruitment, selection, promotion, training etc. and in accordance with federal and state legislation, Dematic Pty Ltd (Dematic or the Company) promotes a workplace free from discrimination and harassment._

postTitle: New Product Group - Software Application Developer (Flutter/C++)
debugText:
At RØDE Microphones we are Passionate about Audio

Want to work for one of the fastest-growing, most innovative manufacturer-exporters in audio technology in the world today? RØDE is looking for passionate, talented and dedicated open-source UI software developer to join our rapidly-growing team.

Part of The Freedman Group, RØDE is a leading manufacturer of high-quality microphones and audio equipment, which can be found in studios, venues, on-location, and in the hands of creatives in every corner of the world. Our products are designed and primarily manufactured by our industry-leading team in Sydney and are exported to over 119 countries globally through more than 6000 dealers, including Amazon, Best Buy, Sweetwater, Guitar Center, Thomann and JB Hi-Fi. Our employees are passionate, hard working, talented and are pivotal to our success.

Your responsibilities will include:

- Develop and maintain a series of software companion applications that operate alongside RØDE hardware products.
- Implement efficient and concise GUI code, in order to realise user interface designs provided by the UI/UX team.
- Collaborate with a diverse team of firmware, electronics and software engineers, to collate dependencies and requirements for the companion application(s)
- Deliver prototypes and final implementations,
 in a fast paced product development environment
- Ensuring all projects uphold a high standard of functional and technical performance – in line with the RØDE brand
- Manage inputs from key stakeholders and collaborators
- Report to the software architect and team leaders
- Be willing to mentor junior application developers and contribute to building a wider GUI focussed application development team

You will require the following skills and experience to be successful:

- Proven experience in FLUTTER (or similar DART based language).
 Solid understanding of object orientated software and graphical user interface design/implementation
- Mid-level proficiency in the following languages: C++, Python and/or other scripting languages
- Past experience developing cross platform applications and GUIs
- Experience with IOS, ANDROID, WINDOWS and/or MAC development environments and deployment pipelines.
- Past experience with source control tools such as GIT is mandatory.
- Meticulous attention to detail and process-orientated approach
- Self-disciplined team player, able to work in multi-disciplinary team environment
- Good written and verbal communication to all internal and external stakeholders

You would benefit from having the following skills and experience:

- Expert level of knowledge in DART and/or FLUTTER.
- Past experience developing using JNI on ANDROID.
- Past experience with C++ libraries such as JUCE.

debugText:
**About DiUS**

DiUS is an Australian-owned technology services company with an excellent reputation as a trusted consulting partner. We’re a go-to company for helping organisations of all sizes improve their delivery practices, tackle hard engineering problems, modernise legacy applications, and design, build and deliver a new product to market.

We have a powerful ability to figure out the best path forward for each of our clients by drawing upon our broad range of deep and specialist capabilities: software engineering, experience design, data and analytics, machine learning and the internet of things.

Further, we bring with us the ability to look towards the future. We look ahead to identify trends in technology, practices and approaches that will have an outsized impact on how technology products are built and delivered.

This makes us a great place for those who love tech, are inspired by learning, and who thrive through constant variety. A place where you’ll be surrounded by growth and opportunity. A place where you’ll have fun and be celebrated. A place where you’ll become the best version of yourself: a DiUS Navigator. We truly value our people and nurture an inclusive environment which has seen us close the gender pay gap, and be recognised as #7 best workplace on the Best Workplaces – Technology list for 2024 by Great Places to Work Australia.

**About the role**

As a DiUS Senior Software Consultant, you will have the opportunity to make a difference and make an impact across multiple products and clients. We work on problems our clients aren’t able to solve themselves: anything from playing and experimenting with innovative tech to helping a client transform legacy systems.

This is a role for the natural navigator, the problem solver, the constantly curious and the lifelong learner. You %%U+0027%% ll be a key contributor working with a DiUS team to partner with our team clients and help them build bespoke products and solutions, getting the most of their technology landscape, and leaving them in a better place. While this role is very much about systems and coding, it %%U+0027%% s also about asking the right questions, having good practices and collaborating on the bigger picture. You’ll also represent the DiUS brand internally and externally, positioning DiUS teammates as experts to the client.

**About you**

- Full-stack software engineer with a strong track record in data projects using: **Databricks,** **Spark, Snowflake**
- Backend experience in at least one of the following: **Java**, **Python, Kotlin, C#**
- Full-stack 
experience in various tech languages such as: **Typescript/JavaScript and either React, Angular, Vue,**
- Experience with multiple cloud platform
- Solid level of proficiency in modern architecture practices
- Good understanding of Agile, understanding its purpose, value and common practices.
- Demonstrates autonomy and proficiency in code practices such as TDD and CI/CD
- Previous experience in professional services, adapting quickly to different client needs and paces
- Excellent presentation & communication skills
- Able to lead self and coordinate / prioritise tasks and workload
- Passionate about 
spreading change through thought leadership, mentoring, meetups, writing blogs or staying active on GitHub.

**Our Promise**

At our core, we are driven by our values—Always be Growing, Move Humanity Forward, Seek Greatness for The Client, and Be About the Band. They reflect our passion, purpose, and beliefs.

Your experience with DiUS is one of our most important People priorities, and we understand this will look and feel very different for each person. Our navigators can expect:

- A DiUS contribution towards the tools of your choice, supporting you in doing your best work
- A home office allowance and an ongoing monthly WFH allowance
- An organisation that genuinely cares about you and your wellbeing, supported by a network of peers and team leads as well as additional leave options and EAP services
- Coaching and leadership to enable your growth, whether that be skill uplift, career progression, explore your passion, step into thought leadership or master your craft
- As your growth is in your hands, we offer you access to online learning pathways as well as professional development days to invest in the capabilities that are meaningful to you
- A workplace that values flexibility and champions hybrid working. As a consulting business, we are committed to our clients needs and strike the balance between sensible choices and business outcomes

debugText:
Are you a talented Software Developer who wants autonomy to create and build amazing products? You are confident working in a fast-paced environment where you can make a difference and create an impact. Want to be part of an engaged culture, where we learn together and support each other’s growth to reach our potential?

Developers at Ansarada believe that only through care for the customer, continuous collaboration, and improvement can a team achieve greatness. You will be responsible for building, maintaining, and supporting critical software and services that are responsible for providing our customers with the best-in-class experience for our Deals and Procure platforms.

**What %%U+0027%% s the job about?**

As a
**Middle** **Backend Developer,** you are part of a talented Software Development Team, responsible for the full lifecycle of a product using cutting-edge technologies to deliver exceptional value to our customers, while scaling our platform to meet the demands of global markets.

You are passionate about rethinking traditional ways of doing things while considering the practical benefits and looking beyond the obvious to come up with better and new ways of working. You are a problem solver who thinks outside of the box to challenge existing assumptions to achieve the best results.

**Some of the key activities you will be performing in this role are:**

- Develops new instances of existing architecture, or minor improvements to existing architecture.
- Working directly in parallel with your peers, owning small-medium features from design to completion.
- Delivering high-quality solutions on a regular basis that adhere to our design standards.
- Writing high-quality code that follows industry and our architectural standards.
- Collaborate with the team to design, develop, and implement innovative new modules, while also playing a vital role in the ongoing maintenance and optimization of existing functionalities.
- Supporting your colleagues by providing regular feedback on their code.
- Collaborate with cross-functional teams such as Design, Product, DevOps and Customer Success to design, implement, and maintain backend solutions aligned with our product vision and business goals.
- Dive into the intricacies of the “Deals and Procure” platforms and domains, proactively expanding your knowledge to provide valuable insights and support to our product team.
- Continuously growing and sharing your knowledge of emerging technologies and practices

**We would love to hear from you if you:**

- takes initiative, have a self-directed learning process and a growth mindset.
- have relevant practical experience
building and maintaining web-based software solutions and working with cloud-based platforms
- have experience working with C#, ASP.NET, and ASP.NET Core to build REST/RPC-styled API endpoints
- are experienced in Object-Orientated Programming (OOP), relational and key-value database principles (SQL Server, Postgres, DynamoDB, Redis)
- understand basic DevOps principles such as Infrastructure-as-code and CI/CD
- have experience in software testing techniques, including unit/integration testing, manual/exploratory testing, and automated testing
- are passionate about customer experience, curious and willing to challenge existing assumptions to achieve the best results.

**Nice to have:**

- Experience in working with GraphQL with Apollo/Hot Chocolate or any GraphQL frameworks.
- Experience in container orchestration platforms on Kubernetes.

**Who’s Ansarada?**

We’re proud to be Great Place to Work certified! Also, to be recognised as one of Australia’s Best Places to Work for Women and of course in Technology! Come work with us and experience a workplace culture that values and supports all employees.

We’re the software the Pros in business use to protect and grow!

We’re a SaaS platform that companies, advisors and governments rely on for securely managing critical information, workflow and collaboration in high-stakes processes like deals, risk, compliance, board governance and procurement. We %%U+0027%% re the software relied upon by business pros in over 180 countries.

Our mission is to raise and protect every company %%U+0027%% s potential by engineering powerful but simple software that gives our customers confidence in every business decision. We only achieve this through our world-class teams who are based in the main hubs across Sydney, Ho Chi Minh, Chicago, Amsterdam and London.

We care about the customer, and we exist to nurture their business potential. We love solving BIG problems and creating SIMPLE solutions for them. We love the challenge and are looking for people who are courageous, passionate, curious and collaborative.

**What’s in it for you?**

- We are a Great Place to Work certified company (for 14 years in a row!!) which means we have an awesome work culture and are committed to providing the best possible experience for our employees
- Be part of something bigger! We live our ‘Care’ value in everything we do, from our commitment to 1% profit Adara pledge to help others.
- Join our Certified Maxwell Leadership Program, get a Kindle with an allocated budget to buy books and time to read + many more opportunities to learn and grow
- State-of-the-art offices with barista coffee machine, gym, beer on tap, unlimited snacks, pool table and swings!
- Subsidised health insurance and generous paid leave entitlements, including parental, birthday, community and anniversary leave
- Flexible work environment (hybrid model), open-door policy and a casual environment
- Many other great compensation and employee benefits

**Take a virtual tour of our office and meet the team:**

https://team.ansarada.com/

debugText:
**Who is Evie Networks?**

 At Evie Networks our business is to accelerate the switch to sustainable electric transport to clean the air, reduce emissions and make our cities more liveable. Our electric vehicle charging solutions give people the freedom to go electric and go anywhere.

At Evie you’ll get involved in almost every aspect of what we do. You will be stretched, and you’ll learn and grow from the experience.

**The Role**

 We %%U+0027%% re seeking a mid-level backend developer to join our team and contribute to the development of our EV charging software solutions. This role focuses on backend development using Node.js and related technologies.

**Reporting to the Software Development Manager, your duties will include:**

- Develop and maintain backend services using Node.js and TypeScript
- Work with microservices architecture and Kubernetes
- Implement and optimize database solutions using MongoDB
- Contribute to the development of software adhering to the OCPP (Open Charge Point Protocol) standard
- Collaborate with the team in an Agile/Scrum environment
- Write clean, maintainable, and efficient code
- Participate in code reviews and contribute to improving our development practices
- Troubleshoot, debug, and upgrade existing systems

**The Person**

 You’re a self-starter with strong attention to detail, an inquisitive nature and eagerness to learn new technologies with an ability to work effectively in a team environment.

Electric cars in Australia is still largely uncharted territory which means your passion to make a difference, desire to use your initiative and continuous focus on excellence will ensure your success in this new role.

**Requirements to be successful:**

- 2 + years experience as a software developer in a related field
- Proven experience in backend development using Node.js and TypeScript
- Strong understanding of RESTful APIs and microservices architecture
- Experience with MongoDB and database optimization
- Familiarity with Kubernetes and containerization technologies
- Knowledge of cloud platforms, preferably Google Cloud Platform (GCP)
- Understanding of version control systems (e.g., Git)
- Ability to write clean, readable, and well-documented code

**Nice to have:**

- Experience with or knowledge of the OCPP standard
- Familiarity with EV charging systems or related IoT solutions
- Experience with CI/CD pipelines
- Understanding of test-driven development (TDD) practices

**Benefits**

What makes Cognizant a unique place to work? The combination of rapid growth and an international and innovative environment! This is creating many opportunities for people like YOU — people with an entrepreneurial spirit who want to make a difference in this world. At Cognizant, together with your colleagues from all around the world, you will collaborate on creating solutions for the world %%U+0027%% s leading companies and help them become more flexible, more innovative, and successful. Moreover, this is your chance to be part of the success story.

**Position Summary:**

- Lead and manage an agile team of diverse and talented software engineers.

- Be the decision maker that makes the tough technical choices that impact the direction of the project.

- Provide thought leadership in programming and software development.

- Be the key conduit for the Business to achieve the best outcome technically possible.

- Work closely with architecture to ensure the best possible solution and design in alignment with best practices and standards.

- Act as a key point of escalation for appropriate technical issues and prepare reports as appropriate.

- Understand and implement common technical/design patterns and programming paradigms. Oversee and develop test plans leveraging automated testing approaches.

- Plan and lead the deployment of Java multi-channel applications across multiple platforms within large/distributed client environments.

- Oversee the creation and maintenance of project documentation including detailed design documents.

- Mentor less experienced developers.

- Ensure tasks are undertaken at the appropriate level of quality and achieve client requirements.


**Mandatory Skills:**

**Technical competencies:**

- Understanding of strengths and weaknesses of common libraries and when to apply them. Significant expertise in Java technologies such as; Spring, Spring Boot, Spring Cloud, JPA, JMS and exposure to other Java libraries and frameworks.

- Significant expertise in Web technologies such as; Java script (ES2016+), NodeJS and Browser APIs.

- Knowledge of the 12 factor principles of microservice development.

- Expertise in designing well-formed RESTful APIs.

- Expertise using multiple frameworks/libraries to build SPA such as; ReactJS, Angular Platform, Redux or similar.

- Substantial experience in Java build automation technologies such as Gradle, Maven, etc.

- Substantial experience working with Git or other SCM tool.

- Expertise in relational databases, and data modelling.

- Knowledge of NoSQL databases, and when it is appropriate to use them.

- Experience with CI/CD platforms such as Bamboo, Jenkins etc.

- Experience with IaaS such as AWS, GCP and Azure.

- Experience using IDEs such as IntelliJ and WebStorm.

- Experience with rapid prototyping of application concepts.


**General competencies:**

- Experience in a consulting position, working within large, complex and distributed client environments.

- Proven ability to manage client relationships and expectations in relation to programming and software development.

- Highly developed oral and written communication skills.

- Ability to effectively report and manage or escalate risk(s), issue(s) and defects.

- Experience in the management of a small team of IT professionals. (desirable).


**Salary Range: >** $100,000

**Date of posting:** 03/10/2024

**Next steps:** If you feel this opportunity suits you, or Cognizant is the type of organization you would like to join, we want to have a conversation with you! Please apply directly with us.

debugText:
**About LEAP Matter Risk**

LEAP Matter Risk is a member of the LEAP group of companies - the leading provider of Legal Practice Productivity Solutions in the world. Over a 30-year period we %%U+0027%% ve expanded across Australia, Canada, the United States, the United Kingdom, the Republic of Ireland, Poland and New Zealand and support more than 100,000 lawyers and their staff in small and medium sized law firms. We owe our success to our curiosity and commitment to our guiding purpose, to ‘Help lawyers who help people’.

Law is largely about managing risks, such as:

1. If I buy this house what could cause significant financial loss?
2. If I go to court in a family law matter what could go wrong where I get less time with my kids or I get a worse financial outcome? What factors look bad for my case and what could I do to mitigate those negative factors.

Understanding those risks takes a lot of experience and careful diligence. Mistakes do get made. Mitigating the risks is a lot of effort and is very labour intensive.

LEAP Matter Risk is our newest start-up within the group. We will be utilising our in-house expertise and the power of AI, to help lawyers assess and mitigate risks for their legal cases (Matters). This will save them time, increase the accuracy of their work and ultimately, help their clients by reducing their cost and increases their chance of success in their matters.

LEAP Matter Risk is planned to be independent development team within LEAP product, and connecting to the rest of the system via established APIs.

You will have freedom to decide your technology stack, like a start-up.

**About you**

You are a smart, focused, motivated and hard-working Engineer who wants to make an impact, while expanding your skills. On top of that, you will bring:

- Experience: 7+ years of professional experience in full stack web development.
- Track record: Your past experience is full of achievements that you are proud of.
- Front End: Proficiency in JavaScript, TypeScript, React, Node.js, and modern web development frameworks.
- Backend: Strong knowledge of database systems and data modelling, as well as at least one backend language or platform. You can contribute towards software architecture and consider design decisions; you know what good looks like when it comes to building great software products.
- Communication: You are concise in your verbal and written communication - sharing the what, the why and the how of what you are thinking and doing in all directions.
- Motivation: You are passionate about making products or services that help people. You %%U+0027%% re at peak satisfaction when you find users are happy with your products.
- Quality: You understand the trade-offs between quality and velocity and have a track record of striking the right balance
- Team Leadership: You can build up a team from scratch (we will give you a hand if you need help). You can assess the performance of your team, motivate them for better performance and growth, keep the team lean, and drive high performance. You build a team that can replace yourself in a few years so you can grow into other positions and do the next big thing.

Even better, if you:

- Have experience working for a start-up.
- Have run your own business.

LEAP is an inclusive, people-first company committed to breaking down institutional barriers that keep people from reaching their potential. If you meet some, but not all the requirements above, we encourage you to still submit your application.

**What you’ll do**

- You will build the product MVP and subsequent iterations expanding the feature set and supporting market growth
- As an experienced hands-on Engineer, you %%U+0027%% ll partner closely with LEAP leadership and our extensive network of legal experts to design and develop a brand new web application.
- You will work autonomously to take charge of your projects, make decisions, and drive your work towards an ambitious roadmap.
- You will build a team as it becomes necessary, by defining new roles and hiring talented engineers to work with you.
- You join a small team of leaders who check the progress of the product and refine its roadmap as you go.

**Why join LEAP Matter Risk?**

- You will receive a highly competitive salary

• 12 Months Max term opportunity

• Work in a close-knit collaborative team

• Enjoy a hybrid model with 2 days of Work from home (WFH)

**OUR STORY**

FUJIFILM have a proud history of providing innovative products and services that contribute to the advancement of culture, science, technology and industry, as well as improved health and environmental protection in society. We are dedicated to achieving a sustainable society and ensuring a better world for future generations. Employees are ambassadors for living and breathing our Shared Values.

**THE OPPORTUNITY**

We are recruiting for a 12 Months Max term Java Application Engineer to join our supportive and collaborative team, based at our Macquarie Park, Sydney office.

You will share responsibility towards improving quality, modernising our stack, continuous delivery, production support and above all, bring a genuine passion for helping the organisation grow. You will work with remote development teams effectively, providing them with support to resolve technical queries.

We are looking for someone enjoys working in a fast-paced environment and is self-driven. We employ a hybrid working charter with flexible working options and 3 days/ week office attendance.

**Key Responsibilities**

• Design and build clean, efficient, robust and reliable java based solutions

• Capture requirements, specifications and technical design documents

• Troubleshoot and resolve production issues within business and after hours as and when required

• Ensure Java application code for enhancements, issue resolutions is written to meet quality standards

• Provide technical advice to stakeholders and contribute to team-based standards for programming tools and techniques

**Skills & Qualifications**

• Bachelor’s degree or higher in IT relevant field

• Extensive experience and skills with Java, Spring Boot/Spring, REST API’s, Web frameworks (React/Vue)

• Extensive experience working with AWS (EC2, ECS, S3, Cloudfront, Iambda)

• Working knowledge of azure cloud and application development highly desired

• Experience with one of the SQL databases (PostgreSQL, Oracle, SQL Server or similar)

• Experience in microservices, API Management platforms highly desired

• Experience in working in Linux environment

**BENEFITS:**

• 12 weeks full pay parental leave

• In house training and development and Generous Educational Assistance policy

• Diverse Career Development opportunities

• Employee Discounts through our “Gold Pass” rewards platform

• Income Protection and Life Insurance

• Salary Packaging & Novated Leasing available

**OUR COMMITMENT**

Diversity & Inclusion

Respecting diversity is the foundation of everything that we do at FBAU.

This allows us to Instil Trust and Collaborate through honest and fair Communication and helps cultivate an environment of Growth and Innovation.

We strongly encourage applicants from key communities including Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islanders, LGBTIQ+ people, and people living with disabilities.

**Vaccination Policy**

The (FBAU) COVID-19 Vaccination Policy requires employees to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19. Appropriate evidence that you are fully vaccinated against COVID-19 must be provided upon commencement with FBAU.

If this sounds like the role for you, please click the below “Apply Now” button and kickstart your application.

For further information, you can also contact our Talent Acquisition team at FBAUrecruitment@fujifilm.com.

As the  %%U+0027%% go-to %%U+0027%%  mid-tier Service Provider for many Australian and International clients, FinXL enjoys a diverse client portfolio, boasting some of the industry %%U+0027%% s leading: Telecommunication, Banking and Finance and Commercial Corporations, along with many State and Federal Government Departments.

We are seeking a Analyst Programmer/Software Developer to join our team full time who will be working onsite in the CBD of Sydney. You will join a dynamic and fast-paced environment and work with cross-functional teams to design, build and roll-out products that deliver the company %%U+0027%% s vision and strategy.

**Analyst Programmer / Software Developer**

Summary:

We are seeking a Analyst Programmer - Software Developer to join our team full time who will be working onsite in the CBD of Sydney. You will join a dynamic and fast-paced environment and work with cross-functional teams to design, build and roll-out products that deliver the company %%U+0027%% s vision and strategy.

FinXL IT Professional Services is an established, innovative Australian company, providing technology enabled business solutions and consulting services across a number of industries. debugText:
**Overview**

Come build community, explore your passions and do your best work at Microsoft. This opportunity will allow you to bring your aspirations, talent, potential - and excitement for the journey ahead.

As a Software Engineer you will develop software, tools and code to be used in support of design, infrastructure, and technology platforms as well as commercial or end-user applications. This opportunity will allow you to create and implement extensible and maintainable code for a product, service, or feature. You will partner with stakeholders to determine user requirements for a feature and consider a variety of feedback channels to incorporate insights into future designs or solution fixes. You will collaborate with others to create a clear and articulated plan for testing, assuring quality of solutions, while applying knowledge of debugging tools, logs, telemetry, and other methods to proactively flag issues. This opportunity will allow you to learn about customer scaling requirements and the application of best practices for meeting scaling needs and performance expectations, while ensuring the correct processes are followed to achieve a high degree of security, privacy, safety, and accessibility.

Microsoft’s mission is to empower every person and every organization on the planet to achieve more. As employees we come together with a growth mindset, innovate to empower others, and collaborate to realize our shared goals. Each day we build on our values of respect, integrity, and accountability to create a culture of inclusion where everyone can thrive at work and beyond.

**About the team:**

Microsoft Azure Edge + Platform (E+P) is a globally distributed team of engineers, architects, program managers, product managers, business program managers, business administrators, user experience researchers and designers who are responsible for the platform for Microsoft and for delivering Microsoft’s edge vision. We create the most reliable and trustworthy OS and platform services to empower Microsoft and our customers to achieve more. We unlock the next wave of opportunity at the edge through an at-scale ecosystem driving widespread adoption of our Microsoft cloud services.

Join our mission at the Sky team, where we face the exhilarating challenge of empowering Microsoft Cloud teams and their customers to effortlessly deliver high-quality services using standardized cloud architecture and infrastructure. Our goal is monumental yet clear: enhance the global tech landscape by making cloud services more accessible and robust.

Our projects are at the forefront of innovation, focusing on areas such as containerization, security, large-scale distributed systems, and more, all within Microsoft’s expansive cloud ecosystem. As part of our team, you will contribute to initiatives that directly improve customer experiences and influence the success of millions globally.

We are a group of dedicated problem solvers, continuously pushing the boundaries of technology to engineer sophisticated solutions to complex challenges. We value deep collaboration and are committed to fostering an environment where diverse opinions and approaches are welcomed. Our team thrives on technical excellence and a relentless pursuit of innovation.

We are looking for a Software Engineer to join us to be at the center of pioneering cloud technology, where your work not only supports massive, scalable solutions but also drives groundbreaking advancements in the cloud sector.

**Qualifications**

**Required Qualifications:**

- Bachelor %%U+0027%% s Degree (or currently pursuing a degree) in Computer Science or related technical discipline with proven experience coding in languages including, but not limited to, C, C++, C#, Java, JavaScript, or Python.
  - OR equivalent experience.

**Preferred Qualifications:**

- Strong understanding of computer science, including data structures and algorithms.
- Experience with modern software engineering practices including continuous integration and test-driven development.
- Able to operate in ambiguity and drive clarity through partnerships.
- Excellent technical writing skills. Willingness and ability to respectfully challenge the status quo.

**Responsibilities**

- Learn to review and break down work items into tasks with stakeholder collaboration, provide estimations, and escalate delays, while also supporting feature deployments to customers, considering user and service impacts, and adhering to best deployment practices for safety.
- Collaborate with key stakeholders to define feature requirements, integrate feedback to enhance design, and establish feedback loops for continuous improvement based on customer metrics.
- Learn and apply coding standards and best practices through code reviews, developing maintainable and extensible code with guidance. Utilize debugging tools to proactively and reactively address issues in product features, ensuring code quality and reliability.
- Support the identification of dependencies and design documentation for product features, learn about system interactions and back-end dependencies, and contribute to architectural processes under guidance. Produce code to test hypotheses for technical solutions and assist with technical validation efforts. Collaborate on quality assurance plans, augment test cases, and integrate automation into testing, while understanding the implications of security and compliance in system architecture.
- Contribute to data analysis and feedback integration for product engineering decisions, acting as a Designated Responsible Individual (DRI) for monitoring and restoring system functionality within Service Level Agreement (SLA) timeframe. Participate in live service operations, and support telemetry data integration for system behavior insights, with a focus on performance, reliability, and safety.
- Develop and apply best practices for reliable code building, understand global and local regulations, customer scaling requirements, and support communication with key partners across Microsoft for user experience enhancement and partner needs.
- Ensure compliance with security, privacy, safety, and accessibility standards, leverage developer tools for code creation and debugging, contribute to automation in production and deployment, and proactively seek knowledge to improve product availability, reliability, efficiency, and performance at scale.

**Benefits/perks listed below may vary depending on the nature of your employment with Microsoft and the country where you work.**

__ Industry leading healthcare

__ Educational resources

__ Discounts on products and services

__ Savings and investments

__ Maternity and paternity leave

__ Generous time away

__ Giving programs

__ Opportunities to network and connect

- World-class learning and leadership programs! Progression to Senior Engineering Manager!
- Flexible working hours, we mean it when we say we value work-life balance!

 Join us in tackling challenges that redefine the way Engineers work and shape the very essence of the Technology landscape! This opportunity empowers you to address problems that not only transform work processes but also pioneer innovations yet to be imagined. You %%U+0027%% ll be at the forefront of creating groundbreaking solutions with global impact, reaching over 500 million customers.

 As we expand our engineering division, we %%U+0027%% re actively seeking talented backend Tech Leaders and Senior Software Engineers to join our team. If 2024 marks the time for you to explore new horizons, I %%U+0027%% d love to have a brief conversation to provide more insights.

 In this role, you %%U+0027%% ll lead a dynamic team focused on delivering next-generation features. From conceptualization to launch, you %%U+0027%% ll tackle the most significant and intricate challenges, leading code reviews, documentation efforts, and addressing high-risk issues. Additionally, you %%U+0027%% ll collaborate closely with leadership, offering valuable technical insights to shape our roadmap planning.

Work will always be different, and you will have the chance to spearhead solution design and development. Focusing on Architectural decisions and driving changes.

**Nice to have:**

- Knowledge in Backed coding languages Java and Spring Framework (Node.Js OR GraphQL bonus)
- Experience architecting and executing large-scale, performant systems that are critical to the business
- Broad experience architecting, designing, and building large-scale systems with multiple dependencies.
- Skilled at working to build alignment, drive decision-making, and communicate transparently
- Hands-on experience with public or private cloud offerings (e.g., AWS, GAE, Azure) Or interest in learning
Containerization (Docker, Kubernetes)
- Execution mindset and the ability to deliver with cross-functional teams that are globally distributed

You’re not expected to have 100% of these skills. At the heart of our culture, we actively encourage people to try new things.

If this is something you are passionate about then we would love to support you in getting onboard!

Reach out to Luke on 0406 811 336, email luke@preactarecruitment.com or click  %%U+0027%% Apply.

debugText:
**About Objective:**

At
Objective, we create software that makes a difference. With over 400 people and five development labs spread across Australia, New Zealand, the United States of America, and the United Kingdom, Objective is a leading developer of SaaS solutions for the government.

**Our role:**

We are currently looking for a Senior Software Engineer to join our team in Sydney. The Senior Software Engineer is a key member of the product development team, responsible for designing, developing, and delivering high-quality software products that meet customer needs. This role involves full-stack development, including both front-end and back-end components, with a strong emphasis on quality, security, and customer satisfaction.

This role reports to the Development Manager and does not have people management responsibilities.

**A day in your role:**

- Design and build scalable, secure and performant web products.
- Collaborate closely with product managers, designers, technical writers, and team members to understand user needs and develop features that meet those needs.
- Support roadmap and delivery planning by making pragmatic decisions and balancing customer value, business impact, and technical quality.
- Own operational excellence through monitoring, system observability, error management, documentation, and user analytics.
- Contribute to team and company culture through thought leadership, improving team practices, and involvement in new initiatives.
- Support fellow engineers through mentorship, feedback, code reviews, and improvement of internal tools and processes.
- Proactively learn new technologies, techniques and methods that may benefit the team, customers, or product and share these with others in the business.

**Your skills, experience and beyond:**

- Demonstrated commercial experience in building SaaS and contemporary web applications.
- Hands-on experience in Advanced Java development such as Springboot.
- Experience frontend frameworks, particularly ReactJS.
- Good understanding of databases and RESTful web services.
- Solid experience with automated testing methodologies
- Exposure to contemporary cloud services, such as infrastructure (AWS), container orchestration, IaC, CI/CD, tooling, and monitoring.

**Our benefits:**

- Hybrid work arrangements to support work-life balance.
- Access to EAP for confidential counselling.
- Extensive learning resources to develop your skills.
- Regular social events to promote team bonding.
- We are recognized as an endorsed employer for women. Learn more about our benefits on WORK180.

We are an equal opportunity employer. We do not discriminate based on any protected characteristics or on any other basis prohibited by the applicable laws in the regions we operate in.

To provide a positive experience, please advise our Talent Team of any adjustments or accommodations required during the recruitment process so we can support you.
