debugText:
**Senior Software Engineer - React**

- **_You are_** _collaborative and enjoy solving analytical problems to help our team to reach highest potential_
- **_We are_** _a team of big thinkers who are engineering the future of banking_
- **_Together we_** _will build tomorrow %%U+0027%% s bank today, using world-leading technology and innovation_

**Do work that matters**

We %%U+0027%% re building tomorrow %%U+0027%% s bank today, which means we need creative and diverse engineers to help us redefine what customers expect from a bank. Envisioning new technologies that are still waiting to be invented and reimagining products that support our customers and help build Australia %%U+0027%% s future economy.

CommBank is recognised as leading the industry in IT and operations with its world-class platforms and processes, agile IT infrastructure, and innovation in everything from payments to internet banking and mobile apps. Our Software team are the brains behind Australia %%U+0027%% s number one banking app, Netbank, Cardless Cash, Comm Sec Pocket and Spend Tracker. We go beyond a passion for web and mobile development, creating reliable APIs at a unique scale in Australia. And you could be a part of that journey.

**See yourself in our team**

Our Crew  %%U+0022%% Secure Money Movement %%U+0022%%  sits in the Customer Engagement and Digital Domain, and we %%U+0027%% re responsible for designing and building intelligent solutions and features for NetBank and CommBank App. Our mission is to deliver best-in-class digital experiences for moving money, while safeguarding our customers from the ever-evolving landscape of fraud and scams.

As a Senior Software Engineer, you %%U+0027%% ll utilise your advanced knowledge of software engineering principles and practices to achieve business outcomes and draw on core technology and domain knowledge to lead the design, enhancement and maintenance of technology solutions.

**We %%U+0027%% re interested in hearing from people who:**

- Have **strong front-end technical skills** while being able to understand and troubleshoot **backend APIs**
- Have a passion for designing, developing and deploying high quality software solutions with comprehensive test coverage.
- Are familiar with the full software development lifecycle with a focus on excellent **UX, CI/CD, automated testing, logging and monitoring**.
- Work well in teams and have strong collaboration skills in driving continuous improvement initiatives.
- Enjoy mentoring and developing more junior engineers

**Tech skills:**

This is a highly technical role, requiring a broad range of tools, languages, and frameworks.

_We don %%U+0027%% t expect you to know them all but experience or exposure with most of these will set you up for success in this team:_

- Full Cycle engineering (design, build, run and manage)
- **UI design & web accessibility**(WCAG 2.1)
- Full Stack technologies - **React JS, TypeScript, C# .NET Core / Web APIs**
- Testing Frameworks - **React Testing Library, Jest, Selenium, Cypress, Playwright**
- **DevOps & CI/CD pipelines** - GitHub Actions, TeamCity, Octopus, Jenkins
- **Monitoring & observability** - Splunk, Prometheus, Grafana, AWS Cloudwatch
- **Cloud**- Azure or AWS
- Containerization - Docker, Kubernetes

If you %%U+0027%% re ready to be part of a forward-thinking company that values innovation, teamwork, and security, **apply now** and help shape the future of fintech with us!

We support our people with the flexibility to balance where work is done with **at least half their time connecting in office.**

_Whether you %%U+0027%% re passionate about customer service, driven by data, or called by creativity, a career here is for you._

_Our people bring their diverse backgrounds and unique perspectives to build a respectful, inclusive and flexible workplace._ _We are working hard to build a team of people who represent the rich diversity of our customers and communities. If you %%U+0027%% re excited about this opportunity but you don %%U+0027%% t meet every single requirement, or your experience doesn %%U+0027%% t align perfectly, we still want to encourage you to apply. You may just be the perfect candidate for this opportunity or another within CommBank._

_At CommBank we will inspire you with work that makes a difference, surround you with talented people that respect and value each other, and empower you to grow professionally and personally. Most of all, making_ _a positive impact for customers, communities and each other is part of our every day._

_We %%U+0027%% re determined to make a real difference for Australia %%U+0027%% s first peoples. We encourage all interested applicants to apply._ _If you %%U+0027%% re already part of the Commonwealth Bank Group (including Bankwest), you %%U+0027%% ll need to apply through Sidekick to submit a valid application. We %%U+0027%% re keen to support you with the next step in your career._

postTitle: Backend Engineer (Java), Integrations at Scale (Open to remote across ANZ)
debugText:
**At the moment, this role is focused on:**

- Your day-to-day activities will consist of solution design and hands-on software development – working closely with leads, designers, and product managers to deliver features and functionality to our customers all over the world.
- Developing and iterating on technical proposals – outlining how solutions will be structured and developed.
- Developing solutions you’ve designed with engineering leads and product stakeholders from the ground up through to deployment into production.
- Identifying and addressing performance bottlenecks within the application and broader infrastructure.
- Participating in design meetings, hiring interviews, and code reviews.

**You %%U+0027%% re probably a match if**

- You have 3+
years of commercial experience developing complex, distributed applications and writing services in Java.
- You have disciplined coding practices, and experience with code reviews and pull requests. You model best practices to your peers.
- You have strong communication and team collaboration skills, both written and verbal. A Canva engineer strives to understand the exact problem before jumping into writing code.
- You will have the ability to work with a diverse range of individuals from different backgrounds and with different professional and personal needs.

**About the team**

The Ecosystem group contributes to Canva’s growth towards 1 billion users by creating an abundant ecosystem that tailors to the diverse needs of our users across all demographics. As Canva continues to play a larger role in organisations with larger teams it is essential that we continue building an ecosystem that supports integrations with 3rd party tools/apps/services. We are introducing a public REST API for Canva to serve third-party developers and support integrations with enterprises and SaaS software!

The Integrations at Scale teams play a vital role in the Ecosystem strategy by working closely with internal and external stakeholders to build a suite of API capabilities and integrations using backend REST APIs (aka Connect API) that meet Canva’s engineering best practices.


The team is also responsible for maintaining an existing suite of APIs that are widely used by Enterprise customers.

**What %%U+0027%% s in it for you?**

Achieving our crazy big goals motivates us to work hard - and we do - but you %%U+0027%% ll experience lots of moments of magic, connectivity and fun woven throughout life at Canva, too. We also offer a range of benefits to set you up for every success in and outside of work.

**Here %%U+0027%% s a taste of what %%U+0027%% s on offer**

- Equity packages - we want our success to be yours too
- Inclusive parental leave policy that supports all parents & carers
- An annual Vibe & Thrive allowance to support your wellbeing, social connection, office setup & more
- Flexible leave options that empower you to be a force for good, take time to recharge and supports you personally

Check out lifeatcanva.com for more info.

Other stuff to know

We make hiring decisions based on your experience, skills and passion, as well as how you can enhance Canva and our culture. When you apply, please tell us the pronouns you use and any reasonable adjustments you may need during the interview process.

We celebrate all types of skills and backgrounds at Canva so even if you don’t feel like your skills quite match what’s listed above - we still want to hear from you!

Please note that interviews are conducted virtually.

Join the team redefining how the world experiences design.

Hey, g %%U+0027%% day, mabuhay, kia ora, 你好, hallo, vítejte!

Thanks for stopping by. We know job hunting can be a little time-consuming and you %%U+0027%% re probably keen to find out what %%U+0027%% s on offer, so we %%U+0027%% ll get straight to the point.

**Where and how you can work**

Our flagship campus is in Sydney. We also have a campus in Melbourne and co-working spaces in Brisbane, Perth and Adelaide. But you have a choice in where and how you work, at a hub or remote, we trust our Canvanauts to choose the balance that empowers them and their team to achieve their goals.

**What you’d be doing in this role**

As Canva scales change continues to be part of our DNA. But we like to think that %%U+0027%% s all part of the fun. So this will give you the flavour of the type of things you %%U+0027%% ll be working on when you start, but this will likely evolve.

debugText:
**About LawConnect**

LawConnect is a member of the LEAP group of companies - the leading provider of Legal Practice Productivity Solutions in the world. Over a 30-year period we %%U+0027%% ve expanded across Australia, Canada, the United States, the United Kingdom, the Republic of Ireland, Poland and New Zealand and support more than 100,000 lawyers and their staff in small and medium sized law firms. We owe our success to our curiosity and commitment to our guiding purpose, to ‘Help lawyers who help people’.

LawConnect is a small, focused team utilising our in-house expertise and the power of AI to make legal services more accessible and fair for all people worldwide.

You will join the  %%U+0027%% Matchmaker %%U+0027%%  side of the LawConnect team: Building the LawConnect User -> Lawyer connection engine. We develop the Legal Talent  %%U+0027%% pipeline %%U+0027%%  which finds the best Lawyer to connect to the LawConnect end-user.

**About you**

You are a smart, focused, motivated and hard-working Developer who wants to make an impact, while expanding your skills. On top of that, you will bring:

- **Experience:** 5+ years of professional experience in full stack web development
- **Track record:** Your experience is full of achievements that you are proud of.
- **Front End:** Proficiency in JavaScript, TypeScript, React, Node.js, and modern web development frameworks.
- **Backend:** Strong knowledge of database systems and data modelling, as well as at least one backend language or platform. You can contribute towards software architecture and consider design decisions; you know what good looks like when it comes to building great software products.
- **Communication:** You are concise in your verbal and written communication - sharing the what, why and how of what you are thinking and doing in all directions.
- **Motivation:** You are passionate about making products or services that help people. You %%U+0027%% re at peak satisfaction when you find users are happy with your products.
- **Pragmatism:** You understand the trade-offs between quality and velocity and have a track record of striking the right balance
- **Team Leadership:** You motivate and help your teammates to drive performance and growth. You are interested in growing your career down the engineering leadership track.

LEAP is an inclusive, people-first company committed to breaking down institutional barriers that keep people from reaching their potential. If you meet some, but not all the requirements above, we encourage you to still submit your application.

**What you %%U+0027%% ll do**

- As an experienced hands-on Engineer, you %%U+0027%% ll partner closely with the broader team at LEAP and our extensive network of legal experts to design and develop a fledgling web application.
- You will work autonomously to take charge of your projects, make decisions, and drive the team towards an ambitious roadmap.
- You will cultivate and nurture your team, help your manager define new roles and hire talented engineers to join you as it becomes necessary.
- You assist your manager in checking the progress of the product and refine its roadmap as you go.

**Why join LawConnect?**

- Work with modern tech. Our tech-stack is built on top of modern serverless frameworks and tools. Our tech stack consists of React, Next.js, Drizzle, Neon PostgreSQL, deployed on Vercel.
- You will receive a highly competitive salary
- You %%U+0027%% ll get all the creative freedom that comes with an early-stage start-up but with all the benefits of working for a larger group of companies - stability, a large client base and the freedom to choose your own tech stack
- Our hybrid work environment offers the best of both worlds, whether you prefer to be in the office or work from home you have the flexibility to work however suits you and your team
- We will invest our time and money in you to help develop your career
- Free platinum gym membership
- Generous parental leave benefits
- Additional paid wellbeing day
- Unique social events, and MUCH MORE!

debugText:
**Work options:** Hybrid

Possibility to work from Melbourne office

**We are oOh!media (pronounced “oh!” media).**

oOh!media is the #1 Out of Home company in Australia and New Zealand.

We exist to make public spaces better and brands unmissable, proudly leading the market with innovation, creativity, data and results. Our network plays an important role in the communities they are located, creating engaging environments that inform, entertain and inspire, while connecting brands with audiences at scale.

We are oOh!media, and we are unmissable.

**The Opportunity**

We are seeking a talented and motivated fullstack Software Engineer to join our dynamic engineering product team at oOh!media to help build out the next generation of oOh!media %%U+0027%% s products based on an event driven architecture (EDA). We adopt a serverless first approach, primarily using the tech stack golang, Nodejs for backend services and svelte / react for frontend. You will be applying DORA identified best practices to ensure our CI / CD, security and testing processes enable you to deliver high quality, maintainable software solutions.

**Key responsibilities:**

- Design, develop, and maintain high-quality, scalable software solutions using event-driven architecture and serverless patterns.
- Participate in code reviews and provide constructive feedback to peers.
- Provide mentorship to junior engineers, fostering a culture of continuous learning and improvement.
- Investigate and resolve production incidents.
- Ensure all software solutions meet the company %%U+0027%% s quality standards through rigorous testing and validation.

**In order to be considered for this role:**

- Experience in Typescript / Nodejs.
- Experience in SQL (Postgres) and NoSQL databases (DynamoDB / MongoDB).
- Experience in Event Driven Architecture and serverless patterns.
- Experience with AWS services using Infrastructure as code.
- Experience with front-end frameworks such as React, Vue, or Svelte.
- Understanding of CI / CD practices.
- Ideally have exposure with golang and AWS CDK.

**Benefits and perks:**

- Flex your way: Whether you %%U+0027%% re working partly in the office or remotely (where business allows), we give you the flexibility to make time for what matters.
- Grow sustainably: Personal and career growth is key. Through tailored training programs, development planning, NGEN memberships, and more, we’re here to help you thrive every day.
- Leave your way: From extra leave options and inclusive paid parental leave to wellbeing days and community service leave, we’ve got your back. Plus, you can swap a public holiday for a personal day of significance.
- Support for you: Your wellbeing matters. With free support through Sonder, discounted gym memberships, and online wellness perks, we help you feel your best.
- Celebrate you: Our Active Reward and Recognition Program highlights the great work you do. When you go above and beyond, we’ll make sure you’re seen and celebrated.

If you’re curious, ready for a unique challenge, and want to make a real impact,
we want to hear from you!

At oOh!, we celebrate diversity and strive for an inclusive environment. We welcome applications from all backgrounds, including Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander peoples, people with disabilities, LGBTQIA+ individuals, and refugees.

- Develop new components and modify existing ones for an inhouse solution
- Involved in troubleshooting and testing
- Perform peer code reviews
- Create product specifications and technical documentation

**Skills and experience**

- 6+ years of experience working in software development
- Expertise in Core and Enterprise Java and Spring Frameworks and Sping Boot
- Experience with AWS cloud technologies
- Good knowledge of Rest APIs and Microservices
- Knowledge of DevOps tools
- Experience with big data technologies (e.g. Cloudera, Hadoop, Apache Spark) preferred
- Excellent communication and interpersonal skills

**What %%U+0027%% s on offer**

- 12+ months %%U+0027%%  engagement working at a banking client
- Hybrid working with 3 days per week in the office in Sydney CBD
- Offering $120k to $140k including super (depending on experience)

debugText:
At CoreLogic, we are driven by a single mission—to make the property industry faster, smarter, and more people-centric. CoreLogic is the trusted source for property intelligence, with unmatched precision, depth, breadth, and insights across the entire ecosystem. Our talented team of 5,000 employees globally uses our network, scale, connectivity and technology to drive the largest asset class in the world. Join us as we work toward our vision of fueling a thriving global property ecosystem and a more resilient society.

CoreLogic is committed to cultivating a diverse and inclusive work culture that inspires innovation and bold thinking; it %%U+0027%% s a place where you can collaborate, feel valued, develop skills and directly impact the real estate economy. We know our people are our greatest asset. At CoreLogic, you can be yourself, lift people up and make an impact. By putting clients first and continuously innovating, we %%U+0027%% re working together to set the pace for unlocking new possibilities that better serve the property industry.

**Who are you?**

- You have a track record delivering high quality designs and Java code set you apart. While Java is your strength you can also do one or more of JavaScript, React, SQL, Python, or AWS.
- You’re autonomous and can craft and build solutions with minimal oversight. This doesn’t mean you’re a lone wolf though and collaboration helps you build the best solutions.
- You’re a full stack dev and equally comfortable designing and building scalable, resilient, cloud native RESTful microservices as you are building front-end SPAs with JavaScript and React.js.
- You have a natural curiosity and willingness to learn helps you keep up with latest trends and makes you a better all-round technologist.
- You’ve worked in an agile environment before, understand the concept of DevOps, and may even have experience with release automation.

**­­­What is the role?**

We are looking for a Senior Software Engineer who will be joining a cross functional team that works across the real estate, banking and financial sector. You will be joining an agile team that services the entire technology, product and data business. New challenges will lurk around every corner, and you’ll be in the company of a highly motivated team solving Customer problems collaboratively. **Please note that we are open to candidates from both Sydney and Brisbane locations.**

**What will you be doing?**

- Collaborate with customers, key stakeholders, Product teams and across all business functions to define, elicit, disseminate and assist as a technical SME with the rollout of changes Preparing and maintaining systems documentation.
- Promote understanding, facilitate business decision making processes, capture and ensure information is clearly communicated to the target audience.
- Work in web applications and middleware solutions reviewing external design specifications and providing feedback to the product.
- Work in an agile team environment delivering digital transformation.
- You’ll be designing and building solutions in Java from start to finish in a small but talented team.
- Some frontend experience or exposure to React (or Angular, Vue) will help as there will be some light frontend work from time to time.
- Your apps will be deployed in the cloud and if you don’t have a cloud background you can learn on the job!
- Design, code, test and debug complex software while developing new functionality, and enhancing existing functionality, in order to satisfy customer requirements, both internal and external.
- Design work encompasses a broader project/system scope. Work is assigned via broad guidelines. Work includes developing detailed specifications from which applications will be written, designed, coded, tested and debugged.
- Consult with product owners/business partners to define requirements and software design. Evaluate feasibility and make recommendations, considering things such as customer requirements, time limitations, system limitations.
- Define scope and develop testing methods, collaborating with QA team and other developers. Work with QA team to improve all levels of testing efforts, developing and enhancing testing methods and processes. May also perform testing.
- Support, maintain and document software functionality. Makes recommendations on and influences engineering processes and methods.
- Provide operational support on complex/escalated issues to diagnose and resolve incidents in production systems.
- Incidents tend to be fewer but more complex, requiring analysis of issues, determination of additional resources to resolve the issue, and an in-depth system perspective.
- Explore and research new and alternate technologies and platforms. Evaluate, recommend, and apply these alternate/new technologies, disseminating information throughout the team/department. This includes documenting large and complex assignments for knowledge transfer and developing expertise in multiple areas.
- Mentor other team members on area(s) of expertise. Provide technical guidance on a wide range of systems/projects.

**­­­­­­Are you the right fit?**

You need to have:

- Excellent ability to communicate and work with technical and non-technical people.
- Strong problem-solving skills.
- Exceptional skills in partnering with clients/staff and in developing and maintaining long term supportive relationships.
- Ability to assess the effectiveness of processes and procedures and recommend improvements.
- Assist with the delivery of solutions end-to-end and ensuring customer outcomes are delivered.
- Ability to work independently and as a contributing, collaborative team member.
- Experience in driving agile ceremonies like sprint planning, retrospectives and backlog grooming across multiple projects.

­­­ **What credentials do you need?**

- Formal qualifications/degree in IT or software engineering.
- 5+ years’ experience of an applicable software development environment with in-depth knowledge of Java, Spring boot, API development, Terraform, SQL, Python.
- **2+ years’ experience with developing on authorisation and access gateways such as PingFederate, PingDirectory, PingID and APIGee.( Mandatory) 
or experience with Forgerock identity platforms.**
- Experience with Streaming frameworks such as Kafka and
RabbitMQ.
- Domain specific industry experience in Real Estate, Insurance or Mortgage is a plus.
- Hands on experience with using Cloud Platforms (specifically AWS, GCP or Azure).
- AWS certified developer certification (desirable).

**Why join CoreLogic**

CoreLogic is highly collaborative and yes fun! To support you at work, we offer some fantastic perks:

- Opportunity for flexible working conditions that works best for you and the business.
- CoreLogic has a culture of collaboration. We champion ownership, initiative and leadership and provide the guide ropes to get you there.
- Free mindfulness tools, online health and nutrition courses.
- Complimentary access to Australia’s most comprehensive property research platforms including RP Data.
- Exclusive employee-only market updates and access to the industry’s best property experts.
- Two community and volunteer leave days each year to support meaningful causes and our charity partners.
- Modern offices in four convenient locations around Australia fitted with recreation rooms, chill out zones and sensational end of trip facilities
- Monthly social get-togethers and a globally recognised rewards platform and points system.
- An inclusive and diverse working environment that celebrates cultural weeks and advocacy months.
- Free membership to Udemy online training courses.
- 4 hour/week Personal Development Plan.

If this sounds like somewhere you want to work and you are seeking professional growth, don’t delay, apply today- we ‘re looking for you!

debugText:
Join Macquarie’s Engineer team and be at the forefront of diagnosing problems and implementing effective solutions.

At Macquarie, our advantage is bringing together diverse people and empowering them to shape all kinds of possibilities. We are a global financial services group operating in 34 markets and with 55 years of unbroken profitability. You’ll be part of a friendly and supportive team where everyone - no matter what role - contributes ideas and drives outcomes.

**What role will you play**

**As a Full Stack Engineer you will take a lead role in our technical support team, focusing on fault finding and resolving simple issues across both web applications and server-side services and infrastructure.**

**Your role is crucial in maintaining the high performance and reliability of our applications by offering comprehensive support, ranging from level one to level three.**

**What you offer**

- **Proven experience in providing level one through level three support, showcasing an ability to troubleshoot, diagnose, and resolve issues efficiently and effectively.**
- **Solid understanding of web development technologies and frameworks, with a preference for knowledge in the Spring Framework and React.js.**
- **Experience with Java, Typescript, and the ability to develop and troubleshoot RESTful services.**
- **Knowledge of modern authorization mechanisms, such as JSON Web Token (JWT).**
- **Familiarity with database technologies (e.g., PostgreSQL, MongoDB) and proficiency in SQL/NoSQL databases.**
- **Proficient in using common front-end development tools such as Babel, Webpack, NPM, etc.**
- **Exceptional problem-solving skills, with a keen eye for detail and an inquisitive mindset that drives you to thoroughly understand the systems you work with.**
- **Excellent communication and teamwork abilities, with a passion for digging deep into technologies and methodologies.**
- **Knowledge of distributed computing like Kubernetes, EKS, Spark would be beneficial.**

**We love hearing from anyone inspired to build a better future with us, if you %%U+0027%% re excited about the role or working at Macquarie we encourage you to apply.**

**Benefits**

**Macquarie employees can access a wide range of benefits which, depending on eligibility criteria and location, include:**

- **Hybrid and flexible working arrangements**

In our Corporate Operations Group, you will work at the heart of Macquarie. Join a collaborative team who accelerate digitalisation, sustainability and social impact for the benefit of our people, customers, shareholders and communities. Our teams include technology, digital transformation and data, operations, human resources, business services, corporate strategy and solutions and the Macquarie Group Foundation.

**Our commitment to Diversity, Equity and Inclusion**

We are committed to providing a working environment that embraces diversity, equity, and inclusion. We encourage people from all backgrounds to apply for a role regardless of their identity, including gender, race, ethnicity, cultural identity, nationality, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, intersex status, marital or family status, neurodiversity, religion or belief, disabilities, or socio-economic background.

Seeking an experienced ICD Software Developer for a large Government Agency commencing early 2025.

**Responsibilities**

- Responsible for the design, development, and implementation of subject applications, to deliver value to users & stakeholders. Collaborates with ICD-focussed resources to ensure seamless integration and co-development of applications as relevant.
- Design and Development, develop application, API, hooks and connectors ensuring it meets the specified functional requirements, using Agency-provided facilities and computing environments. This includes both front end
and back end
development, integration, and test performance.
- Deployment and Defect Rectification, prepare software packages for deployment onto platform infrastructure. Assist with diagnosis and defect identification. Use the Agency supplied IDE for control, deployment and pipeline management.
- Data Tagging and Upload, implement functionalities that allow users to tag data appropriately and upload it to S3-compliant object stores. This involves integrating with various data sources and ensuring seamless data flow.
- Workflow Development, develop and document the process work flow
for data management. This includes creating detailed flowcharts and process diagrams, defining data pipelines, and ensuring that all stages of data processing are clearly outlined and efficient.

**Expectations:**

- Design and develop the architecture of the web application.
- Implement functionalities for data tagging and uploading to S3-compliant object stores.
- Collaborate with the Database Designer, UI Designer, and other team members to ensure seamless integration.
- Write clean, efficient, and well-documented code.
- Troubleshoot and debug issues as they arise.
- Participate in code reviews and ensure adherence to coding standards.

**Accountability:**

- Delivering a functional and well-documented web application.
- Ensuring the application meets performance and security standards.
- Meeting project deadlines and milestones.
- Collaborating effectively with other team members and stakeholders.
- Maintaining high-quality code and documentation.

debugText:
**VGW is an interactive entertainment company, harnessing technology and creativity to deliver world-class, free-to-play games.**

**We have an exciting opportunity to join our** **Engineering team in Sydney** **and are currently looking for a Software Engineer to join the team.**

**What you should know about our Engineering team:**

- We make room to do things the right way, rather than hacking stuff in
- You own your projects: you build it, you ship it, you run it
- We were born in the cloud: practices and principles like CI/CD, IaC, O11y and CyberSec are part of what we do

**When it comes to Learning and Development:**

- Learning is part of our fabric. We have a world class Engineering Learning and Development program and we are passionate about career development.
- Thought Leaders regularly give tailored talks and workshops for our team
- We are proactive in the community attending many local and international conferences; and when covid hit we held our own day-long conference: Techtonic
- We have both a technical and management track for career progression and promotions
- We have a library of books and videos with good content and encourage staying on top of new practices.

In terms of our tech stack, we %%U+0027%% re hosted on AWS containerised in Docker. In the containers, we run our servers with Java / Kotlin connecting to PostgreSQL databases. Our clients use React and Typescript.

**What you will bring to the role:**

- Robust coding practices including writing clean well structured code, automated tests, and managing source control
- Strive to improve the code base. Deep understanding of why design and architectural decisions are made
- Ensuring product features are being delivered effectively as measured by lead time, deployment frequency, change failure percentage, mean time to resolution and number of bugs in production
- Experience implementing and using event-driven architectures
- Cloud development (we are hosted on AWS)
- Containerisation (Docker and/or Kubernetes would be great)
- Strong fundamental knowledge of OO and Functional programming paradigms
- A collaborative approach to software engineering

**About VGW**

VGW is an interactive entertainment company, harnessing technology and creativity to deliver world-class, free-to-play games.

With high-quality, acclaimed brands including Chumba Casino, Global Poker and LuckyLand Slots, we entertain and delight over one million players in North America.

As pioneers in sweepstakes promotions for online social games, we also offer our players the opportunity to redeem incredible prizes.

At VGW, one of our core values is  %%U+0022%% our players come first %%U+0022%% . This means always striving to deliver a safe, responsible and positive player experience.

**Why VGW?**

At VGW, we’re more than just a team. We’re a diverse and inclusive group of individuals, each playing a vital role in our success.

Our core values are clear and strong; we win together, do what’s right, put our players first and are powered by passion.

We believe in our people and are committed to creating an environment where everyone feels welcome, inspired, and supported. We recognise that life is more than just work - that’s why we’re all about flexibility so you can strike a healthy balance between your personal life and career. We’re also here to champion your growth in your current role and future aspirations, providing opportunities for learning and career advancement. And to top it off, we back this all up with competitive compensation, perks and benefits.

But it’s not all business. We inject fun into the workplace, celebrate together and create lasting memories, from a mix of in-person and online events, to social gatherings and much more.

It’s our combined skills, ideas and visions that drive us forward. Join us on this exciting journey, and together, we’ll achieve remarkable things.

If you want to join a team that does things differently, apply today - we look forward to seeing what you can bring to our team.

Find out more at www.vgw.co

debugText:
**At Mako, we believe in the power of collaboration to drive innovation in pursuit of our collective ambition; excellence in trading. Our diverse community is connected through a commitment to being the best we can be with the highest standards of integrity.**

Join the Technology team which is responsible for supporting the trading, back office and analytic database estate as well as the data pipelines that feed the trading analytic platform, along with database support.

The Junior Data Systems Support Analyst will work closely with the Data and Trading teams. This role needs a problem solver and somebody willing to learn, with excellent communications skills, a team player able to help others to deliver the companies objectives.

**What you’ll be involved in:**

- Provide first line support for the trading data pipelines and systems used around the world
- Monitor and maintain the data pipelines and systems
- Help support PostgreSQL databases
- Work with the Data Engineering team to ensure the tools delivered are supportable and fit for purpose
- Help Quantitative Developers and Traders to navigate the data estate
- Ensure documentation is in place for all tooling to be handed over into support

**What we need from you:**

- Ability to troubleshoot and think of creative solutions to problems
- Excellent communication skills and a team player
- Proactive, and demonstrates ability to follow issues through to resolution
- A self-motivated problem solver and intellectually curious
- Attention to detail
- A desire to work in a fast paced and dynamic environment
- Desirable: Familiarity with Linux and Windows operating systems and environments
- Desirable: Knowledge of PostgreSQL and MS SQL
- Desirable: Familiarity with SQL and Python

**We are Mako**

At Mako, we are welcoming, inclusive and collaborative. We work fast and smart in a supportive and dress-down environment that allows colleagues to be themselves and achieve great things. We uphold the principles of a flat structure that offers unrivalled engagement with senior leadership and career development opportunities. We have a comprehensive benefits package, including:

- Flexible leave and hybrid working policies
- Healthcare allowance
- Comprehensive insurance benefits for life and salary continuance
- Employee wellbeing guidance and support
- Novated car leasing
- Generous paid parental leave scheme
- Opportunity become involved in the rewarding work of the Mako foundation

**About Mako**

Mako is a leading options market maker with a global trading footprint. It has been at the forefront of options market making since 1999, from the open outcry trading pits to screen trading and automated algorithmic execution strategies that are driving the future of the industry.

From offices in London, Dublin, Amsterdam, Singapore, Sydney, Brisbane and Chengdu, Mako offers the best-in-class liquidity solutions across Equities, Fixed Income, Commodities and FX derivatives markets and prides itself in its entrepreneurial, collaborative and philanthropic culture.

If you require any reasonable adjustments or assistance during the recruitment process, please email hrsydney@mako.com and we will arrange this.

For further information on the Mako Group please refer to our website: www.mako.com.

_Mako does not accept unsolicited CVs or candidate details from recruiters or search firms and will not pay any fees to such firms without a signed agreement._

debugText:
**Our partner %%U+0027%% s cutting-edge AI solution is revolutionising the legal industry!**

They are a small but mighty team of 10 based in Surry Hills, Sydney, and would love a skilled Software Engineer to join them on a 6-month contract.

Your mission? To seamlessly integrate this AI platform with three leading Document Management Systems (DMS): _iManage, Smokeball_
and _NetDocuments_ (don’t worry, experience with these DMS’ not required).

**What you %%U+0027%% ll be doing**

- Month 1: Get familiar with their tech stack and dive deep into the iManage API. You %%U+0027%% ll be working with a pre-existing integration (approx. 50% complete) and collaborating with the Founding Engineer to understand the existing architecture.
- Month 3: Successfully launch the iManage integration! This will involve testing, debugging and ensuring seamless data flow between the platform and iManage.
- Month 6: Repeat the process for Smokeball and NetDocuments, leveraging your learnings from the iManage integration to deliver efficient and robust solutions.

**Challenges you %%U+0027%% ll tackle**

- API problem solving: Each DMS has its own unique API documentation and potential support limitations. You %%U+0027%% ll need to be resourceful, persistent, and adept at problem-solving to ensure successful integrations.
- As a growing start-up, you %%U+0027%% ll be collaborating closely with the team but will often need to take ownership and work independently.
- With client expectations and pilot programs depending on these integrations, delivering high-quality solutions within the timeframe is crucial.

**Your toolkit >**

- Proven experience building **API integrations**.
- Strong **JavaScript** skills – our front-end relies heavily on it.
- Proficiency in **Python** for backend development.
- Understanding of **cloud platforms** like Azure.
- Excellent communication skills for seamless team collaboration.

**What we offer**

- Play a vital role in a rapidly growing start-up disrupting the legal tech industry.
- Join a passionate and supportive team of experienced engineers and entrepreneurs.
- Flexible work arrangements: Enjoy a hybrid WFH / WFO work model in our Sydney office, with the possibility of remote work for the right candidate.

**Interested?**

 If you %%U+0027%% re a problem solver with a passion for building impactful integrations, we want to hear from you! Apply now and join us on this exciting journey.

Join a global leader operating at the forefront of innovation, providing essential technology solutions across various industries. With a strong presence worldwide, this organisation is continuously advancing in delivering high-tech systems.

We are looking for a Junior to Mid-Level IT Systems Analyst/Programmer to join my client. You’ll be involved in the development, support, and maintenance of web-based applications, working with technologies such as .NET, SQL, Visual Studio, VB, C+, and more. Your duties will include:

**The Company:**

Our Client, a leading and rapidly growing Financial Services business is looking to add a mid-level data engineer to their growing technology team. This is a unique opportunity to work with some of the best in the industry. This role initially requires 5 days per week in the office and is based in Sydney.

**The Role:** The data engineer will be part of a dynamic engineering team who are committed to delivering exceptional work. The role is responsible for the design, development, optimisation and maintenance of data infrastructure and pipelines. Working with cross-functional teams, you will be given autonomy to deliver scalable and robust data solutions that enable decision making, ensure optimal performance and ensure operational efficiency.
**Key Areas of Responsibility:**

- Requirements gathering & development of data pipelines including front/backend architecture, databases and documentation
- Optimisation of existing data solutions including the support of systems & bug fixes across a range of Fintech & eCommerce projects
- Close collaboration with team members and stakeholders to ensure delivery of solutions according to agreed timeframes
- Manage data from multiple sources and consumption of internal/third party APIs
- Writing automated tests, data code review, documentation, adhering to the highest coding standards
- Create reports and data analytics for stakeholders to assist in data-driven decision making
- Ensure data quality and integrity

**Your Profile:**

- Degree in Computer Science or related technical field
- A minimum of 3+ years of experience in developing and delivering scalable data solutions with clean and maintainable and easy to understand code
- Demonstrated experience with AWS architecture
- SQL & Python coding
- Data modelling and designing data warehouses - Snowflake
- Experience in designing and working with relational databases including MySQL, PostgreSQL, NoSQL (DynamoDB)
- ELT/ETL tools
- Data visualisation tools (PowerBI /Tableau)
- Experience with Web applications on multi-cloud environments
- CI/CD, Automated testing
- Jira & Confluence
- Strong problem solving, collaboration and communication skills
- Interest in learning new technologies and trying new ways of working with a continuous improvement mindset
- Strong stakeholder management skills

You must hold Australian Permanent Residency or Citizenship to be considered for this role and be willing to work in the office 5 days per week.

Please apply below.

debugText:
**About Laing O %%U+0027%% Rourke**

Laing O’Rourke is a $6 billion international operation with 70 years of involvement in Australian construction and infrastructure, including nearly two decades under the Laing O’Rourke banner. The business delivers projects as diverse as the environments in which they are built, from high security military bases and major rail transport infrastructure projects, through to landmark buildings at the transport interface. Laing O’Rourke owns one of Australia’s largest plant and equipment hire company called Select Plant Australia. We know the right culture combined with purposeful technology will help us meet demand and deliver certainty for our clients. That’s the #powerofexperience.

**About the role**

We are seeking a highly skilled Full Stack Engineer with experience in building backend services and APIs for SaaS platforms to join our team. The ideal candidate will have extensive software engineering background using Python, ReactJS, PostgreSQL, and software frameworks such as Django. They will also demonstrate strong knowledge of modern application architectures such as microservices and event-driven, and expertise in building cloud-native applications on AWS.

**Key responsibilities**

- Design and develop scalable backend services and APIs using Python, Django, and PostgreSQL using engineering best practices.
- Implement microservices and event-driven architectures using AWS services like Lambda, API Gateway, Aurora, and EKS.
- Develop web-based UIs using React and TypeScript.
- Develop integrations with 3rd party applications and services using various approaches including RES APIs as well as file based.
- Collaborate with cross-functional teams and business stakeholders, guiding the definition, design and implementation of new product features.
- Actively review solution designs and help maintain code quality and organization through code reviews.
- Identify and correct bottlenecks and fix bugs.

**About you**

- 10+ years of proven experience as a Full Stack Engineer or similar role.
- Solid software engineering background with experience in writing software for backend systems / APIs/ services and web-based UIs using programming languages (such as Python and ReactJs), relational databases (such as PostgresSQL), and frameworks (such as Django).
- 3+ years of experience in building applications using cloud-native applications in AWS using services such as Lambda, API Gateway, RDS.
- Strong track record of using modern application architectures such as microservices and event-driven architectures.
- Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field.
- Strong problem-solving skills and attention to detail.
- Excellent communication and teamwork skills.
- Experience with Agile/Scrum methodologies.

**Preferred Qualifications:**

- Knowledge of containerization and orchestration tools like Docker and Kubernetes.
- Familiarity with CI/CD pipelines and DevOps practices using tools such as Gitlab.
- Experience in development of B2B SaaS platforms.

**Benefits**

We work hard to create an environment that brings out the best in our people. We believe in building careers through providing a safe, connected and innovative culture that supports ongoing growth and development. We offer industry-leading benefits such as specialised learning and development programs, a mental health and wellbeing program, industry leading paid parental leave policy, an additional purchased leave option and coaching programs for staff on parental leave.

**Diversity & Inclusion**

We are committed to building a workforce that reflects the diverse society in which we live and work. Laing O’Rourke is proud to hold the Workplace Gender Equality Agency (WGEA) Citation - Employer of Choice for Gender Equality.

_Laing O %%U+0027%% Rourke actively supports a diverse workforce and strongly encourages applications from Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander Peoples and people from culturally diverse backgrounds. Download our Stretch Reconciliation Action Plan at https://www.laingorourke.com/company/diversity-and-inclusion_

_Applications from recruitment agencies will not be considered._

High growth FinTech Scaleup in Sydney looking for Mid-Level Software Engineer (Python, AWS)

**Your new company**

You %%U+0027%% ll be joining a high-growth FinTech company in Sydney CBD. The business has hit some major milestones over the last few years and is one of the most promising, up & coming FinTechs in Australia %%U+0027%% s startup ecosystem.

They have a dynamic, flexible culture and have some of the best engineers and startup leaders in the country working with them. If you thrive in an autonomous environment and love working with ambiguity on complex applications, then this could be a great option for you. You %%U+0027%% ll work alongside an Engineering Lead who has been part of some of Australia %%U+0027%% s most high profile and successful startups so this is a fantastic opportunity to learn from the very best.

**Your new role**

You %%U+0027%% ll be joining as an Engineer reporting into the Engineering Lead. The role will initially be focused on engineering a brand-new AI solution, however there are plenty of other initiatives to be getting on with in the long term.

The role would really suit a Software Engineer who loves solving complex problems. Ideally, you %%U+0027%% ll have some experience in working with high-growth startups and love the chaos that goes with working for a fast paced company in growth mode.

**What you %%U+0027%% ll need to succeed**

Tech Stack: Python, AWS, Fast API

The Engineering Lead is looking for a solutions focussed engineer who can be flexible with languages. If you %%U+0027%% re not a python expert but are a startup enthusiast who thrives within a fast paced enironment then it %%U+0027%% s worth still applying.

● Strong proficiency in Python

● Expertise in designing, building, and consuming REST APIs

● Proficient in AWS infrastructure, including Lambda, API gateway, DynamoDB, and

other core AWS services

● Experience with using Terraform, or other similar Infrastructure as Code (IaC) tools

● A test-oriented mindset, with experience writing effective test cases

● The love of working for a tech startup: a fast-paced and unpredictable environment

with a wide-range of challenges and real opportunities for impact and ownership

**Desirable Skills**

● Familiarity with FastAPI or other Python-based web frameworks (eg. Flask or

Django)

● Experience with Continuous Integration / Deployment (CI/CD)

● Experience with SQL and database management (both relational

**What you need to do now**

debugText:
**Purpose;**

Angle Auto Finance is an independent financier in Australia, bringing a modern platform and a flexible business approach to help more Australians with their car purchase.

The Web Developer plays a key role in ensuring delivery of new capability to our customers. The role will work closely with Product Owners, Scrum Masters and subject matter experts to build and execute test cases that ensure great products are delivered to customers

**Key Responsibilities;**

- Designing modern highly responsive web-based user interfaces
- Building reusable components and front-end libraries for future use
- Translating designs and wireframes into high-quality code
- Learn and understand user interactions
- Optimising components for maximum performance across a vast array of web-capable devices and browsers
- Monitoring front-end performance
- Create and update any technical documentation required
- Stay up-to-date on latest developments within the field
- Coordinating with various teams working on distinct layers

**Qualifications**

- Relevant qualification in Computer Science or Information Technology

**Experience**

- In-depth knowledge of web technologies, in particular: JavaScript, TypeScript, HTML, CSS, and front-end languages
- Strong proficiency in JavaScript, including DOM manipulation and the JavaScript object model
- Experience with cloud platform (AWS, Azure), primarily Azure
- Thorough understanding of React.js and its core principles
- Expertise with Next.js and its principles
- Prior experience with popular React.js workflows (such as Flux or Redux)
- Familiarity with more current specifications of EcmaScript
- Prior experience with data structure libraries (e.g., Immutable.js)
- Knowledge of isomorphic React is a plus
- Familiarity with RESTful APIs
- Familiarity with HTML / CSS
- GIT experience is a plus
- Knowledge of modern authorisation mechanisms, such as JSON Web Token
- Familiarity with modern front-end build pipelines and tools
- Experience with common front-end development tools such as Babel, Webpack, NPM, etc.
- Familiarity with Node.js

postTitle: Staff Python Infrastructure Engineer (remote across ANZ)
debugText:
**Join the team redefining how the world experiences design.**

Hey, g %%U+0027%% day, mabuhay, kia ora, 你好, hallo, vítejte!

Thanks for stopping by. We know job hunting can be a little time consuming and you %%U+0027%% re probably keen to find out what %%U+0027%% s on offer, so we %%U+0027%% ll get straight to the point.

**Where and how you can work**

Our flagship campus is in Sydney. We also have a campus in Melbourne and co-working spaces in Brisbane, Perth and Adelaide. But you have choice in where and how you work, we trust our Canvanauts to choose the balance that empowers them and their team to achieve their goals.

**What you’d be doing in this role**

As Canva scales change continues to be part of our DNA. But we like to think that %%U+0027%% s all part of the fun. So this will give you the flavour of the type of things you %%U+0027%% ll be working on when you start, but this will likely evolve.

At the moment, this role is focused on:

- Shaping the crucial ML and Python specialty roadmap for the group, leveraging a strong product/platform mindset. Your role will be pivotal in defining the investment needed to elevate Python support and close the existing capability gaps.
- Building and delivering solutions to improve the Python and ML engineering experience at Canva, ensuring high standards of engineering excellence.
- Developing advanced tooling and metrics to enable both our team and platform users to understand and respond to the health of our systems.
- Improving and updating documentation, establishing best practices and guidelines for Python and ML engineering.
- Leading solution design meetings, participating in hiring interviews, and code reviews.
- Mentoring and guiding other engineers, playing a key role in their professional growth and development.
- Influencing and advocating for engineering best practices across the organization, ensuring alignment with Canva’s long-term strategic goals.

**You %%U+0027%% re probably a match if**

- You have solid expertise in Python development which is essential. Experience in modern development tools such as Bazel or Nix is a plus.
- You have experience with containerization, Terraform, and GitOps principles for automation and deployment is highly valued.
- You have prior experience or a strong willingness to learn about ML concepts and applications, with a desire to integrate new capabilities into existing ML infrastructure.
- You have familiarity with ML frameworks such as pandas, NumPy, PyTorch, Ray, and TensorRT is advantageous. Hands-on experience with CUDA as a platform operator is desirable.
- You have a proven track record of leading and executing large-scale engineering projects, showcasing an ability to handle increased scope and complexity compared to a similar senior role.
- You have demonstrated self-motivation and ownership over complex problems and their solutions, with a strong sense of accountability.
- You’re passionate about engineering excellence, systems architecture, and meeting non-functional requirements.
- You have a proven ability to foster team collaboration, driving collective success through shared challenges and goals.

**About the team**

You %%U+0027%% ll be joining the Language Ecosystem team, whose mission is to uplift language and ecosystem support across Developer Platform products. Working directly with teams across the group, your role will focus on enhancing support for specific language-related workflows and delivering solutions that eliminate capability gaps.

As Canva continues to invest in ML, there is a growing need to bridge the gap between the experience of our ML Engineers and that of our frontend and backend engineers. Python is the language of choice in the AI/ML space. However, our current developer experience has been primarily focused on TypeScript (frontend) and Java (backend), leading to challenges with Python support. Currently, the AI Platform teams have built some key capabilities, but further investment in Platform Engineering teams is required to elevate Python support to be on par with Java and TypeScript. This investment will enable AI Platform to concentrate on AI-specific capabilities while the Platform Engineering teams enhance the overall Python experience.

The ML Parity program outlines a staged approach to incrementally invest in Python-based ML-serving technologies, empowering our ML engineers and applied scientists to leverage all Canva platforms effectively. This role is essential in driving this transition and ensuring Python becomes a first-class citizen at Canva.

As a Python Specialist on the Language Ecosystem team, you %%U+0027%% ll:

- Lead collaborations with engineers across the organization to understand their requirements and jointly design platform infrastructure solutions with a strong emphasis on Python.
- Work alongside Developer Platform product managers and leadership to define strategic priorities and roadmap for ML and Python-related initiatives within the team.
- Proactively engage with engineers across Developer Platform by seconding into teams and collaborating on high-impact projects to uplift Python and ML expertise. Provide hands-on guidance and servant leadership to empower teams in owning and operating platform products supporting Python and ML.
- Drive innovation in Python and ML engineering practices and development experience, contributing to the development of a unified and resilient infrastructure.

**What %%U+0027%% s in it for you?**

Achieving our crazy big goals motivates us to work hard - and we do - but you %%U+0027%% ll experience lots of moments of magic, connectivity and fun woven throughout life at Canva, too. We also offer a range of benefits to set you up for every success in and outside of work.

Here %%U+0027%% s a taste of what %%U+0027%% s on offer:

- Equity packages - we want our success to be yours too
- Inclusive parental leave policy that supports all parents & carers
- An annual Vibe & Thrive allowance to support your wellbeing, social connection, office setup & more
- Flexible leave options that empower you to be a force for good, take time to recharge and supports you personally

Check out lifeatcanva.com for more info.

**Other stuff to know**

We make hiring decisions based on your experience, skills and passion, as well as how you can enhance Canva and our culture. When you apply, please tell us the pronouns you use and any reasonable adjustments you may need during the interview process.

We celebrate all types of skills and backgrounds at Canva so even if you don’t feel like your skills quite match what’s listed above - we still want to hear from you!

Please note that interviews are conducted virtually.

debugText:
**ABOUT US**

In the rapidly changing world, RDA ranks as one of Australia %%U+0027%% s leading developers of data enhancement and market planning tools that combine enriched synthetic population data with in-depth analytics and ease-of-use.

Our unique **geoTribes Platform** is enabling some of Australia’s best companies in Media, Retail & Financial Services to deepen their customer engagement with rich consumer profiling data and bring advanced demand modelling to their market planning activities.

RDA is a client-focused, team-orientated company where innovation & results are rewarded. We are based in the heart of Sydney CBD next to QVB.

Join our Professional Data Team.

**ABOUT THE ROLE**

As a Junior Data Analyst/Scientist at RDA, you will be challenged to understand client problems and formulate exacting solutions as part of a professional technical team. You’ll use a range of programming languages and tools such as SAS, SQL and R to maintain and improve our modelled consumer data while developing a strong knowledge of AWS tools and infrastructure. You will be building and interpreting sophisticated statistical models like general linear models, regression trees and clustering, always with a priority of developing a deep understanding and producing valuable outcomes.

**RESPONSIBILITIES**

- Work with clients to understand their business objectives and provide analytical solutions to meet their needs using our geoTribes Platform.
- Present and articulate analytical findings, sometimes to non-technical audiences.
- Take responsibility for running & prioritising high quality analytical projects with on-time delivery.
- Apply and develop your statistical skills in predictive modelling, data fusion, segmentation & geospatial analysis with SAS programming and other languages/tools.
- Use your critical thinking and analysis skills to continuously improve our innovative and unique suite of Consumer Data.
- Assist RDA in expanding its Consumer Data suite in international markets, particularly the US and Great Britain.
- Build a strong practical understanding of AWS tools and operations

**SKILLS & EXPERIENCE**

- Degree with a **strong quantitative** focus such as: physics, statistics, engineering, actuarial studies, computer science or psychology.
- Work experience in analytics, data science or quantitative market research is desirable. Recent graduates with a strong academic record are welcome to apply.
- Minimum Distinction average academic record.
- Proficient in a programming language e.g. R, Python, SQL or MATLAB.
- Experience in data engineering, AWS, SAS, GIS Software or a major in Computer Science would be highly regarded.
- Excellent verbal & written English.

**CULTURE & BENEFITS**

- Personal
development through in-house training,
collaborative technical teamwork
& mentoring.
- Career development through direct exposure to highly relevant data engineering & analysis problems.
- We strive for a respectful & positive workplace with the right work-life balance & competitive salaries.

RDA is an equal opportunity employer. We work 5 days per week in-office. Please visit our website at
www.geoTribes.com

Please note that a **COVERING LETTER, CV and FULL ACADEMIC TRANSCRIPT are MANDATORY** to be considered for the role.

We look forward to receiving your application at **accounts@rdaresearch.com**

Please note that only short-listed candidates will be contacted.

**Applicants must be an Australian citizen or permanent resident of Australia.**

debugText:
**UI Embedded Software Engineer**

**About Breville** Over the past 90+ years Breville has grown to become an iconic global brand, delivering kitchen products to over 70 countries around the globe. Breville enhances people %%U+0027%% s lives through the delivery of brilliant innovation and thoughtful design based on deep consumer insights, empowering people to do things more impressively or easily than they %%U+0027%% d thought possible in their own home and ultimately allowing them to  %%U+0022%% Master Every Moment %%U+0022%% .

**A career at Breville is truly a one-of-a-kind experience. It %%U+0027%% s more than working for a global leader; it %%U+0027%% s an opportunity to be a part of something that impacts people all over the world.**

**About the role**

We are looking for skilled React Native developers to join our expanding software development team. In this role, you will report to the Head of Embedded Software and collaborate with project teams and subject matter experts. Your primary focus will be designing and developing software that provides intuitive user interfaces for our connected kitchen appliances. This role involves close collaboration with designers and engineers, as well as interfacing with hardware, cloud, and mobile apps.

**Key responsibilities include:**

- Android app development
- Designing and developing re-useable software using JS/TS, C/C++ and Python
- Collaboratively work with a cross functional team to develop a unique user experience
- Optimising and improving system architectures in software stack and hardware interfaces

**We %%U+0027%% re interested in hearing from people who have:**

- Bachelor %%U+0027%% s degree or more in Computer Engineering, or similar
- Experience in mobile app development using JS/TS and React Native for Android
- Design systems and its realization for React / React Native
- Hands on experience configuring and troubleshooting hardware
- Experience working with Git version control, source code management, unit testing, code review, and issue tracking systems
- Experience with AWS or other IoT platform
- Strong communication skills and passion to create the most amazing products and a team player

**Some nice-to-haves include:**

- A passion for coffee or cooking
- Linking Framer or Figma to design system components
- Hands-on experience in Python for high-end embedded systems like RPi and PC
- Some Embedded Linux development - user space and system level
- Some understanding of computer control system, digital signal processing, filters etc.
- Test driven development coding style
- Build/automation systems such as Jenkins, Gradle and CMake
- Familiarity with C and C++ programming in embedded targets

**What we offer you:**

- Flexible work arrangements
- Competitive compensation package
- A fun and rewarding team environment
- Opportunity to work for an Australian Stock Exchange listed company
- Employee assistance program
- Paid parental leave policy
- Employee discounts of up to 50% on all our electrical products
- Corporate health and wellness benefits

**To Apply**

Come and make your mark with this global leader by applying today via the Apply Now button.

Please note Breville Group will never ask applicants through email, phone, text message, or direct message on social media to provide identity documents, personal details, or financial information such as bank details.

Breville Group is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer.

**Shape the Future of Generative AI & Automation**

We’re not just following trends in Generative AI and Automation—we’re creating them. Our mission is to help businesses unlock new levels of efficiency and intelligence through AI-powered solutions. If you’re passionate about AI, automation, and solving real-world challenges, this is your opportunity to make a significant impact.

**About the Role:**

We’re looking for a Junior Developer with 1 to 3 years of experience, proficient in Python and with commercial experience in Microsoft Azure. Ideally, you’ve already delivered an Azure AI project—either professionally or through personal projects. You’ll work alongside a team of innovators to develop cutting-edge AI and automation solutions that drive the future of enterprise operations.

**What You’ll Do:**

- **Develop AI Solutions**: Collaborate with the team to design, build, and deploy Generative AI and automation systems.
- **Collaborate & Learn**: Work with experienced engineers to push technological boundaries.
- **Refine Your Craft**: Enhance your skills in Python and Azure by working on impactful projects.
- **Innovate Daily**: Troubleshoot, debug, and refine AI-driven solutions to solve real-world challenges.

**What You’ll Bring:**

- **1-3 Years’ Experience**: Strong Python skills and commercial experience working with Azure.
- **Azure AI Experience**: Ideally, you’ve worked with Azure AI services like Form Recognizer or Custom Vision, either in a professional setting or on personal projects.
- **Problem Solver**: You’re ready to tackle complex challenges and contribute innovative solutions.

- Experience with Azure Functions, Logic Apps, or other Azure services.
- Knowledge of machine learning or data tools like Azure Databricks.
- Familiarity with Agile frameworks and tools such as GitHub and Azure DevOps.

**Why Join Us?**

- **Limitless Growth**: We offer clear career progression with hands-on learning opportunities.
- **Global Impact**: Work on high-impact projects that make a real difference in enterprise automation.
- **Flexibility**: Enjoy remote work flexibility while staying connected with an innovative team.
- **Competitive Compensation**: We offer a market-leading salary with performance-based bonuses.

Be part of the future of Generative AI and enterprise automation!

postTitle: Data Engineer | Multiple Roles | Both Senior and Junior
debugText:
**About Bi3 Technologies**

Bi3 has been recognised for being one of the fastest-growing companies in Australia by Australian Financial Review (FAST 100). We specialise in Data, BI and analytics. Our team has delivered substantial & complex projects for some of the largest organisations around Australia and the globe. We’re quickly building a brand that is well known for superior delivery excellence & impressive track record of creative and efficient solutions.

We
have
a culture
of
high-performance
in our workplaces and
celebrate the diversity of
our employees
who
contribute to the
success of our and our client’s organisation.

## **Background**

Are you a passionate Data Engineer looking to make a significant impact? Join our dynamic team as we embark on an exciting journey to build a cutting-edge data platform. We are integrating numerous new data sources and leveraging the latest technologies to drive innovation and efficiency. This is your chance to be a part of a transformative project and work with a talented team of professionals.

This role is part of the data engineering team that is responsible for building and maintaining the data platform for a large and complex data echo system. The data platform is currently running on Azure and provides data ingestion, transformation, quality, governance and analytics capabilities for various use cases.

**Existing Technology Stack**

1. A metadata driven ingestion framework built in Python and Pyspark.
2. DBT
3. Azure
4. Databricks
5. Snowflakes

## **Required Skills**

- Strong experience in data engineering
- Proficiency with DBT (Data Build Tool)
- Expertise in Databricks
- Solid understanding of data integration and ETL processes
- Strong analytical and problem-solving skills
- Excellent communication and teamwork abilities

## **Roles and Responsibilities**

As a Data Engineer, you will play a crucial role in designing, developing, and maintaining our new data platform that can handle large volumes of data and support business intelligence and analytics needs. You will also be working independently and collaborating with other engineers, analysts and stakeholders to deliver high-quality outcomes.

Your responsibilities will include:

- Integrating multiple new data sources into the platform
- Developing and implementing data pipelines using DBT and Databricks
- Ensuring data quality, consistency, and reliability
- Collaborating with cross-functional teams to understand data requirements and deliver solutions
- Monitoring and optimizing data processes for performance and scalability
- Creating and maintaining comprehensive design documentation
- Performing data modelling to support various business needs
- Understanding and applying Databricks Medallion architecture
- Implementing and optimizing various data ingestion patterns
- Staying updated with the latest industry trends and best practices
- You are self-motivated, proactive, and able to work under pressure and tight deadlines.

debugText:
LEAP Dev is the “Software House” powering LEAP Legal Software, the leading provider of Legal Practice Productivity Solutions in the world. We’re part of ATI Global – one of the largest international LegalTech companies. For more than 30 years, our curiosity and commitment to continual improvement has kept us reimagining productivity tools for lawyers and their staff to support our guiding purpose, to ‘Help lawyers who help people’. The market leading software we develop and support is used by more than 100,000 lawyers and their staff in small and medium sized law firms.

Working alongside our team of passionate high achievers, you’ll join a fast-growing technology business where things seldom stay the same for long. With more than 1000 smart, caring and ambitious ‘LEAPsters’ working together across Australia, Canada, the United States, the United Kingdom, the Republic of Ireland, Poland and New Zealand, you’ll find yourself in good company here.

**Meet the DevOps team**

Working alongside a dynamic and passionate team of law and technology experts alike, you’ll harness your technical aptitude and curiosity to understand our clients %%U+0027%%  needs and translate them into innovative software solutions. This is an exciting opportunity to work at the frontier of the technology space and make a powerful impact streamlining our customers ways of working and giving them space to do more for their clients. A place where your unique perspective and a little human touch will do wonders, not just for lawyers who help people, but in shaping the future of legal technology.

DevOps is at the forefront of our operations, working collaboratively to support all our products. Over our decade-long journey on AWS, we have grown our workload from a handful of EC2 instances to a platform supporting hundreds of containerized workloads across multiple accounts and regions. As our newest Junior Cloud Database Engineer you %%U+0027%% ll support multiple Dev teams in all things AWS. This will include everything from user and permission request to assisting in companywide ‘Top 5’ projects, delivering apps and services that span multiple AWS Services, accounts and regions. You will be part of an established, talented and friendly team who will train and mentor you in both general AWS DevOps skills and practices, as well as bespoke in-house tools.

**What you %%U+0027%% ll do**

- Build, deploy and manage data services related resources of LEAP Dev’s AWS Infrastructure in AWS Accounts/Private VPCs (RDS, EC2, Elasticache Redis, OpenSeach/ElasticSearch domains, Databases, DynamoDB tables, Security Groups, IAM roles, S3 buckets, CloudFormation etc.)
- Work with databases like SQL Server and Aurora MySQL etc.
- Work with Python (For Infrastructure as code)/T-SQL (databases) programming
- Use in-house custom tools and automations to deploy workloads into multiple AWS Accounts and Regions.
- Use JIRA to manage incoming tickets for Problems, Incidents, Service Requests and Project Epics
- Work with LEAPs developers/DevOps engineers to build/deploy AWS data services resources
- Work with multiple 3rd party applications and tools, including JIRA, Confluence, Slack, Sumo Logic, PagerDuty, SolarWinds DPA etc
- Work directly with our AWS Technical Account Manager and enterprise support team to resolve data services related issues
- Create and maintain documentation using Confluence
- Work with the rest of the team on Company-wide goals each sprint
- Participate in on-call rotation for production issues

**What you %%U+0027%% ll bring**

You don %%U+0027%% t need to be super knowledgeable we can teach you what you need to know. A positive, focused and hard-working attitude will take you far here. That being said, we will be looking out for some base knowledge in your application:

- Basic/Intermediate experience in AWS Data Services (RDS, Elasticache etc.) in a technical role
- AWS Cloud Practitioner certificate (or higher) or demonstrable knowledge of key AWS services
- You want to learn and grow your skills specifically in AWS data services landscape
- You have strong troubleshooting and problem-solving skills

**You %%U+0027%% re also going to need:**

- Excellent collaboration and communication skills - with teams and customers alike
- A great attitude, with a passion for delivering excellent service and a readiness to pick up a task, no matter how big or small
- A natural curiosity to learn, ask the right questions and ask for help when needed. You %%U+0027%% re also a team player who will offer help too.

LEAP is an inclusive, people-first company committed to breaking down institutional barriers that keep people from reaching their potential. If you meet some, but not all of the requirements above, we encourage you to still submit your application.

**Why join LEAP Dev?**

- We build and develop a market leading, “Legal Tech” product, with offices in Australia, New Zealand, United States, Canada, United Kingdom and the Republic of Ireland.
- We are committed to innovation and global expansion of our products and are constantly utilising new technologies to better our client experience.
- Our hybrid work environment offers the best of both worlds, whether you prefer to be in the office or work from home you have the flexibility to work however suits you and your team.
- We encourage our employees to have a voice and to collaborate with each other to work on technical solutions, of course we have company visions and goals, but we want you to help us achieve these!
- We will invest our time and money in you to help develop your career. Open discussions and reviews will help us understand your career aspirations, maybe it’s a new AWS certification you are after or an internal move to a new area, we will support you and your goals
- As a LEAP Dev employee, you will receive a competitive salary, paid learning and development opportunities, free platinum gym membership, generous parental leave benefits, an additional paid wellbeing day, social events and MUCH MORE!

At Macquarie, we are working to create lasting value for our communities, our clients and our people. We are a global financial services group operating in 34 markets and with 54 years of unbroken profitability. You’ll regularly exercise problem solving skills and apply creative solutions to a varied range of technical problems. You will support the development of data pipelines and new platform features and play a critical role with our operational and business stakeholders.

- A broad knowledge of technical solutions, design patterns, and code for medium/complex applications deployed in a clustered environment
- Experience with Docker, Kubernetes and AWS
