postTitle: Specialist Sales - Junior Client Quant Developer (Excel & Python), Desktop
debugText:
Specialist Sales - Junior Client Quant Developer (Excel & Python), Desktop Build Group - Sydney


**Description & Requirements**

Bloomberg is a global leader in business and financial information, news and insight. We use innovative technology to deliver trusted data and bring transparency to the financial markets. Our customers around the globe rely on us for the information and tools they need to make critical investment decisions and remain connected across all sides of the financial community. To ensure the best experience for our 20,000+ employees across 176 offices globally, we provide the spaces and systems that allow our teams to work together with agility, productivity and collaboration, no matter where they are.

The Desktop Build Group (DBG) works closely with Bloomberg’s existing and prospective clients to find solutions to business needs using Bloomberg’s API for Excel and Python. Last year we delivered over 2500 projects to clients and our API solutions on the Bloomberg Terminal are used by over 120,000 financial professionals. We are a global team with colleagues based in London, New York, San Francisco, Sao Paulo, Hong Kong, Singapore, Tokyo and Sydney.

**What %%U+0027%% s the role?**

You will use your financial markets knowledge to consult with Bloomberg clients or prospective clients, helping them to develop and implement their investment strategies and research on leveraging our Excel APIs, VBA, our cutting edge query language (BQL) and new Python based quant platform (BQNT).

You’ll directly impact our revenue by working closely with our Sales teams to develop new tactical desktop applications to sell Bloomberg Terminals. Your role will involve full life-cycle development, from initial demos to prospective clients, requirement gathering, prototyping, implementation, deployment and adoption. In addition to software development, you will be expected to create resources and client-facing content that is both strategic in its appeal to our audience, while also taking advantage of current events in the marketplace.

**We %%U+0027%% ll trust you to:**

- Partner with Sales teams to build tactical Excel and Python solutions to increase revenue opportunities for the company

- Provide assistance on new strategies or migration projects the clients wish to implement by using Bloomberg APIs

- Work on projects to provide short-term product gap solutions for the Bloomberg Terminal

- Provide continued support for clients to ensure adoption

- Maintain and support Excel models accessible via the Bloomberg Terminal

- Work closely with our Product Development and Software Engineering teams to help drive improvements to our Excel APIs


**Training and team support will allow you to gain:**

- In depth knowledge of the Terminal and Bloomberg APIs

- A deep understanding of financial markets and investment processes on both buy-side and sell-side

- Experience of open source Python technologies for advanced data visualizations, widgets and analytics


**You’ll need to have:**

- Minimum 3 years of experience working in financial services or a financial technology company

- Experience developing financial models using MS Excel/Python

- Experience in pitching or providing support on quant products / research to external clients

- A strategic mindset and proven commercial acumen which allows you to weigh up the business opportunities of a project before execution

- Confidence to have highly articulate and consultative interactions with clients

- Demonstrated continuous career growth within an organisation

- Strong presentation and communication skills in English


**We %%U+0027%% d love to see:**

- Experience or qualifications in Data Science


**If this sounds like you:**

Apply if you think we %%U+0027%% re a good match. We %%U+0027%% ll get in touch to let you know what the next steps are, but in the meantime feel free to have a look at this: https://www.bloomberg.com/professional

**Why Bloomberg?**

We’re individuals with diverse backgrounds, talents, and experiences who take on big challenges and create even bigger impact through our work. We’re interested in what makes you you, and how we can create opportunities for you to channel your unique, personal energy and grow to your fullest potential.

**Learn more about our office and benefits:**

debugText:
**ABOUT THE ABC**

The ABC is the nation %%U+0027%% s most trusted and independent source of Australian conversations, culture, and stories. With over 4,000 employees from diverse backgrounds across over 50 locations around Australia and overseas, we are proud to create, curate and deliver high-quality content that informs, educates and entertains Australian communities.

**ABOUT THE ROLE**

Working with the Technical Lead you will contribute to the development and enhancement of new and existing digital web-based products, with a focus on building high performance, secure and accessible APIs and services.

**KEY ACCOUNTABILITIES**

- Provide advanced technical development skills within ABC Digital Network’s Technology team, to develop high performance, secure and accessible APIs and services in an efficient manner across ABC’s platforms.
- Under the broad direction of the Technical Lead, contribute to the analysis, design and development of complex, re-usable components, and functionality for a broad range of uses.
- Maintain a high level of awareness of best practice in the industry for server-side development, particularly in areas such as performance, security; and proactively identify opportunities for improvement.
- Continually improve the quality of output and maintain the integrity of professional documentation.

**ABOUT YOU**

- Outstanding enterprise-level experience with Golang and extensive background in server-side development are essential, in conjunction with a willingness to work with PHP as part of ongoing maintenance and periodic feature enhancements on the legacy system.
- Demonstrated detailed knowledge and experience in using modern frameworks and build tools, implementing automated/unit testing, and version control branching, merging and versioning strategies.

  Demonstrated substantial experience developing very complex, secure and high-performance software for a range of platforms and devices.
- Excellent verbal and written communication skills with an ability to foster open and creative relationships within and across teams.
- Excellent planning and organisational skills with an ability to prioritise projects and tasks, and investigate, diagnose, and solve complex technical problems.
- Knowledge of publishing, media delivery and content workflows is highly desirable.

**WHAT’S IN IT FOR YOU?**

Come and join the vibrant Digital Product department in the ABC. Our mission is to enable ABC’s digital future, where ABC transitions from a traditional broadcaster to Australia’s most trusted and valued digital media organisation. Through harnessing our talents in digital, collaborating with our partners and delivering beyond expectations, we ensure the ABC not just remains relevant but thrives.

As a group of product and platform teams, we develop and maintain the ABC %%U+0027%% s audience facing digital products across mobile, connected TV, desktop, and smart speakers. Whether it is staying informed of the latest breaking news, bringing some great TV on ABC iview, streaming the Hottest 100 on the triple j app and website, or entertaining the kids with our ABC Kids app - the ABC %%U+0027%% s Digital Product offerings are some of Australia %%U+0027%% s most loved and most used platforms.

Your work will be appreciated by millions of audiences across Australia. We are an open and cohesive team where your voice will not get lost. You can get a sneak peek into our product engineering world through our blog: [https://www.abc.net.au/digital-product](https://www.abc.net.au/digital-product)

We are committed to career development and invest in our people to grow and become leaders in their fields. Everyone in the Digital Product department has a designated budget for training and development. We believe in flexible approaches to working and building self-organising and collaborative teams that offer friendly and supportive environments in which all team members can strive and grow.

For further information on this position please contact **Brett Whyte, Digital Talent Acquisition Lead via email whyte.brett@abc.net.au**

_**We are unable to accept email applications, please ensure that you submit your application via the online portal. We respectfully request that Recruitment Agencies do not submit applications for this position.**_ In line with our focus on diversity, applications are strongly encouraged from Indigenous Australians, people from a range of cultural and linguistic backgrounds, people with disability and LGBTIQA+ individuals. The ABC also aims to achieve a gender-balanced workforce.

For more information on inclusive employee networks within the ABC please refer to Life Page on ABC LinkedIn. For more information on working at the ABC visit abc.net.au/careers

**About us:**

Making a meaningful difference with mission-critical software that empowers communities to thrive.

ReadyTech is more than just a one-trick pony playing in one market with one product, or one customer. We re-imagine, design, develop and deliver technology to solve our customer’s diverse problems – supporting multiple businesses across a variety of markets to be ready for anything.

We’re an ASX-listed company which means we are stable, have a strong track record of sustainable growth and have a significant number of long-term customers.
 So, what does this mean for you? It means we can offer you an experience that will push you to be your best, provide career-building challenges, and that will offer you numerous growth opportunities that can’t be found in any other company.

It’s an inclusive environment where there is no place for politics, where we get our heads together to solve the problems that really matter to our customers, and where we always stay focused on our north star – the communities we serve, and society at large.

As a Senior Software Engineer, you will play a critical role in designing and developing features
for our education products. You will collaborate closely with various stakeholders, including
technical leads, product managers, and product designers, to deliver high-quality, scalable
solutions.
Our main technology stack includes Python, FastAPI, Next.js, Ruby on Rails, Postgres, MySQL
and AWS.

**Accountabilities:**

- Develop working software across the full stack (end to end) according to requirements
and development standard
- Contribute to feature and solution design with both technical and non-technical
stakeholders
- Assist the support and customer success team with diagnosing issues with the software
and providing guidance or helping with appropriate fixes
- Provide mentoring and guidance for developers in any areas of expertise

and maintain robust and scalable server-side applications.

user interfaces. **React and Next.js** are preferred

ensure clean, maintainable code
- Competent with software version control systems, particularly Git,
including experience with collaborative workflows such as
branching, merging, and pull requests

participating in iterative development cycles and team
ceremonies

ReadyTech is committed to seeing things through each other %%U+0027%% s eyes. We invest deeply in relationships by offering positivity, fairness and empathy in every interaction and love that everyone is different. As part of our commitment to ensuring a safe and secure working environment for all employees and in compliance with Australian regulations, please note that if selected for this role, you will be required to complete a comprehensive police check and an Australian working rights check. Should you have any questions or concerns regarding these requirements, please feel free to contact us.

Position: Junior IT Solutions Engineer

Apek Computer Technology is a Sydney based IT solutions provider that caters to small-to-medium businesses (SMB). Established in 1994, Apek offers innovative and engineered solutions for cloud infrastructure and services, enterprise networking, unified communications and bespoke software development. Our client focus includes professional services, education, not-for-profit, aged-care, architects and manufacturing.

Apek is proud to be a Microsoft Gold partner while also holding industry partnerships with other leading vendors such as Cisco, Trend Micro, Hewlett-Packard Enterprise and TPG Business.

**The Role**

We are currently looking for a Junior Solutions Engineer to join our team. The role is suitable to all recent graduates of relevant IT degrees and no previous industry experience is required. The successful candidate will primarily be involved in the design, implementation and servicing of enterprise IT solutions. Onsite field work will also be required from time to time. The role is technical in nature and is most suitable for candidates looking for a challenge and an opportunity to constantly learn new technologies and processes.

**Key Responsibilities**

- Perform basic management of customer IT infrastructure
- Design and implement IT infrastructure solutions
- Configuration and setup of new customer endpoint devices including desktops and laptops
- Problem solution for Level 1, and 2 helpdesk support
- Perform onsite visits to install, maintain or troubleshoot customer IT infrastructure from time to time
- Communicate with end customers on helpdesk support issues

**Requirements**

- Relevant undergraduate university degree
- Ability to communicate fluently in English and an excellent grasp of professional and technical writing
- The unrestricted right to work full-time permanently and live in Sydney, Australia

While the role expects a candidate to have little to no prior professional IT experience, it may also be advantageous but not essential, for the candidate to have:

- Microsoft certifications (i.e. MCSE, MCITP etc.)
- Cisco certifications (i.e. CCNA, CCNP etc)
- Microsoft Exchange, SharePoint, SQL experience
- Programming experience (eg. C#, C++, Java, PHP, Python etc.)
- Database programming experience (SQL Server, MySQL etc)
- Website design
- Experience with IT systems administration or enterprise networking
- Valid Australian driver %%U+0027%% s license

If you believe you have these qualities then this may be the position for you.

An attractive remunerations package is on offer for the right candidate.

**Contact:**

Alfred Lam - recruitment@apek.com.au

You will directly contribute to core innovations, enterprise solutions, and build unique AI team members within our product suite.

**Responsibilities**

- Develop AI-driven applications using Flutter, ReactJS, NodeJS, and Python.
- Ensure high standards of code quality, organisation, and automation.
- Collaborate with a diverse team to develop and launch new features.

- Strong understanding of generative AI principles and applications.

- Familiarity with large language models, their architectures, and fine-tuning techniques.
- Experience incorporating automated testing into the development workflow.
- Familiarity with Git version control and Agile development.
- Excellent English communication, self-motivation, and time management skills.

**Nice to Have**

- Experience with cloud services (Google Cloud, Firebase, Azure).
- Hands on experience setting up and maintaining CI/CD Pipelines such as GitHub Actions.
- Experience using Docker and Docker Compose for containerisation and orchestration.
- Experience with RESTful and gRPC APIs and Protobuf.

**Skills**

- Essential: Robust coding, problem-solving, and teamwork.
- Preferred: AI/ML technology experience, excellent communication.
- Comprehensive knowledge of generative AI strategies, including reasoning, retrieval, memory management, and orchestration.
- Strong problem-solving skills with the ability to debug complex issues across the stack.

**Growth and Support**

At 1Qlabs, we believe in nurturing talent and fostering a learning environment. We encourage continuous professional development and engagement with the latest technology and AI.

- Access to professional development resources, conferences, workshops, and online courses.
- Opportunities for career advancement within the company.

**Benefits**

- Competitive salary and Equity plans.
- Flexible work arrangements.
- Inclusive, dynamic, and supportive work culture.

**Schedule**

This is a full-time salaried position.

- Expected 8-hour work day
- Monday to Friday

**Work Authorisation**

- Australia (Required)

**Work Location**

- Remote

**No recruitment agencies please.**

🚀 Join the 1Qlabs team as a Full Stack Generative AI Developer and be part of shaping the future with AI. Your contribution will be pivotal in our journey towards innovative AI solutions.

**Your Team**

The People, Transformation & Technology Group is responsible for delivering transformational change across ASIC through investment in people, processes, and technology. Bringing together our people, digital, data, and technology teams supported by our enterprise program office, this group delivers transformational change while supporting our core technology environments and our people. Our Registry Interactions Services team and the Modernising Business Registers teams also form part of this portfolio. The Information Technology team forms part of the Transformation Office, Digital, Data & Technology, which is accountable for driving ASIC %%U+0027%% s transformation agenda, including the use of digital and data products as well as providing the technology platforms.

**Your Role**

The Junior AWS Engineer supports the design, deployment, and maintenance of Amazon Web Services (AWS) solutions. Your responsibilities include:

- Assist in the design, deployment, and maintenance of AWS infrastructure.

- Implement best practices for security, backup, and recovery of AWS resources.

- Basic understanding of core AWS services such as EC2, S3, RDS, and VPC.

- Strong problem-solving and analytical skills.
- Excellent communication and teamwork abilities.

ASIC %%U+0027%% s remit is one of the broadest of regulators across the world. ASIC regulates corporations, markets, financial services, and consumer credit and monitors and promotes market integrity and consumer protection in the Australian financial system. Through our enforcement work, we hold to account those who contravene the law, working to achieve strong outcomes that address the greatest consumer and investor harms.

Through Moneysmart, we aim to improve the skills and knowledge of Australians and provide information and tools to help them in their decision-making. postTitle: Full Stack Web Developer Intern (University Student)
debugText:
**Job title:**

Full Stack Web Developer Intern (University Student)

**COMPANY DESCRPTION:**

HA TECH is an Australian based Biotechnology company dedicated to research and development of innovative Diagnostic Products, Biopharmaceuticals and Medical Technologies. The company has a diagnostic manufacturing facility at Castle Hill, and Kings Park Sydney, Australia. Manufacturing capacity of 40 million RT PCR tests/month and capacity of 10 million Antigen tests/month. Winner of 2022 NSW Premier Export Award.

Our team is seeking a highly motivated university student with a passion for full stack web development to join us for a short-term project. This is a unique opportunity to gain hands-on experience in both frontend and backend development, working closely with our research team to ensure the development of our web application aligns with project requirements.

**ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES**

As a Full Stack Web Developer, you will work on a web application project focused on delivering comprehensive frontend and backend development. You will be involved in all stages of development, from building and refining user interfaces to integrating backend APIs, with a focus on maintaining performance and scalability. This is a great opportunity for a student to gain valuable experience in a professional environment. Your responsibilities will include:

- Assist in building and maintaining frontend applications using modern frameworks and libraries (React, TypeScript, Vite).
- Develop backend solutions, focusing on REST API integration and serverless architecture using AWS Lambda.
- Work with state management tools such as Redux, including redux-thunk and redux-persist, to manage application data flow.
- Implement authentication and authorization features, including role-based access control (RBAC).
- Collaborate with the development team to ensure smooth integration between frontend and backend systems.
- Debug, troubleshoot, and optimise existing codebases for better performance and scalability.

**Note: Other duties may be assigned**

**ESSENTIAL QUALIFICATIONS / EXPERIENCE**

- Currently enrolled in a university program related to computer science, software engineering, or a similar discipline.
- Strong foundational knowledge of frontend technologies (React, JavaScript/TypeScript).
- Familiarity with backend technologies such as REST APIs and cloud services (AWS Lambda preferred).
- Basic understanding of state management (Redux) and how to handle async actions.
- Some experience with tools for building and bundling frontend applications (Vite or similar).
- Ability to work independently and collaborate effectively in a remote environment.

**DESIRABLE FOR THE ROLE**

- Experience with AWS services, particularly AWS Amplify for authentication and API management.
- Familiarity with Axios for API requests and handling errors gracefully.
- Understanding of role-based access control and security best practices in web development.
- Knowledge of testing and debugging tools like Jest or similar.

Email:
hr@ha-tech-ltd.com
, Direct contact:
0431 581 133/ 0404 631 485, website: ha-tech-ltd.com

Deputy is a global SaaS workforce management company headquartered in Sydney, San Francisco, and London, backed by top investors and recently surpassed $100m in annual recurring revenue. We %%U+0027%% ve helped millions of workers across industries and aim to empower 80% of the global workforce. As a Staff Engineer (Full Stack), you will lead the build of key technical projects that further the companies products and platforms. In turn, you’ll be progressing our company mission of improving our customers business productivity, wage compliance and employee satisfaction.
You will be working closely with your peers, product, design and leadership to build amazing products and features for the Deputy platform, delivering services and products to millions of users and businesses from small & medium to enterprise.

debugText:
**Junior Integration Engineer**

**Information Technology Unit: Enterprise Platforms**

 At UTS, we’re changing the game. We’re on a journey to be the leading university of technology and we’re moving the world forward with our breakthroughs. Our state-of-the-art campus in Sydney’s vibrant Tech Central precinct is a hub of creativity, innovation, and collaboration, where curiosity thrives.

 As we transform our Digital Strategy, we’re modernising and adopting Agile methodologies, including the SAFe framework, to boost efficiency and responsiveness.

 You’ll be joining a supportive and inclusive community that values diverse perspectives and encourages you to bring your whole self to work.

 Ready to make a difference? Join us at UTS and help shape the future!

**The Opportunity**

 We %%U+0027%% re hiring two Junior Integration Engineers to join us at UTS.

As a Junior Integration Engineer, you will have the opportunity to build your technical expertise by assisting in the delivery of real-time, serverless-based integrations that connect a variety of academic, administrative, and research platforms, while ensuring security, compliance, and scalability.

 This entry-level role allows you to work closely with experienced engineers, contributing to the ongoing support and enhancement of data services. You will gain hands-on experience in implementing secure scalable serverless cloud native data services as well as troubleshooting, system performance optimisation, and operational support, all within an agile and collaborative environment at UTS.

**A Day in the Life of a Junior Integration Engineer at UTS**

- Implementation of modern API, event-driven, and serverless frameworks.
- Learn Domain Driven Design, DevSecOps, Infrastructure as Code and container orchestration tools.
- Implement data services from systems such as Technology One Student, Canvas and Salesforce CRM and Marketing Cloud
- Provide technical support to resolve integration-related issues and optimise system performance.
- Collaborate with senior integration engineers to diagnose and troubleshoot integration incidents.
- Assist in implementing integration enhancements and bug fixes while adhering to established standards.
- Perform testing and validation of integration solutions, ensuring data integrity and quality.
- Maintain detailed documentation of incidents and integration processes.
- Stay updated on emerging integration technologies and best practices to enhance your knowledge.
- Contribute to cybersecurity efforts by adhering to data privacy regulations and security best practices.
- Participate in agile ceremonies such as sprint planning and stand-ups to contribute to team goals.

**What You’ll Need to Succeed**

- Proficiency in programming languages such as: Python, Go, or JavaScript (Node.js). Knowledge of Java is beneficial although not essential.
- Understanding of cloud architecture, cloud first principles and integration.
- Strong verbal and written communication skills to work effectively with senior staff and contribute to problem-solving efforts.
- A passion for developing technical skills and gaining knowledge from senior engineers, with a proactive approach to troubleshooting and problem resolution.
- Ability to manage multiple tasks, meet deadlines, and maintain attention to detail while balancing support tasks and project work.
- Understanding of agile methodologies and tools, such as Scrum or Kanban, to contribute effectively within an agile environment.
- Basic understanding of cybersecurity best practices and data privacy regulations.
- A commitment to continuous learning and staying updated with emerging technologies and industry trends.

**Remuneration & Benefits**

**A competitive and comprehensive remuneration package will be offered.**

 This role attracts 17% superannuation **in addition** to the base salary.

 UTS staff also benefit from a wide range of Employee Benefits. We prioritise your growth with extensive learning and development opportunities, including leadership programs, study time support, and access to resources like LinkedIn Learning. Enjoy a comprehensive health and wellbeing package featuring on-campus health services, fitness discounts, and childcare support.

 Financially, we offer competitive benefits, including salary packaging options, and exclusive discounts on various products and services. Plus, benefit from generous leave entitlements and staff recognition programs that celebrate your achievements.

 This position is **full-time** and appointment will be made on a **continuing basis.**

**How to Apply**

- Please submit your application with your updated Resume and Cover Letter.
- Only those applications submitted via the UTS online recruitment system will be accepted. If you are a current UTS staff member, for help on how to apply through NEO please click here.
- Specific enquiries or issues with your application may be directed to the UTS Recruitment Team at ITOM.recruitment@uts.edu.au
- Applicants must have current and valid work rights in Australia.

**This job will close on the 31st October 2024.**

**Accessibility**

 If you require any adjustments to the recruitment process or an alternative application pathway please contact ITOM.recruitment@uts.edu.au for assistance.

Cited as a WGEA Employer of Choice since the inception of the award, we were_ _among the first Australian institutions to receive the Athena SWAN Bronze Accreditation for our commitment to action addressing gender equity in the STEMM disciplines._

debugText:
**Overview**

Overview

Susquehanna International Group is seeking a Software Engineer to join our Post Trade technology team who are responsible for processing and storing all trading activity across the APAC region.

This team builds applications used to reconcile Prime Broker data, produce valuations / P&L, provide services used in critical business processes and generate reporting across the firm.

The successful candidate should have a proven track record of
designing, developing, and implementing client/server applications using C# and Oracle, being equally adept in either one. Taking projects through the entire software development cycle from requirements gathering to production release. Collaborating closely with core development/engineering teams to provide data and services to the business.

What you can expect from us:

Real Impact:
By integrating sophisticated coding techniques with innovative engineering ideas, we design and optimize systems that process massive amounts of data while still ensuring high performance and stability.

Collaboration:
You will work closely with Trading, Middle-office, Operations and Compliance to make data available to support their applications and processes. In addition, you will work with groups such as Connectivity, Risk and Core Trading technology on delivering strategic projects.

Growth:
 For many of our roles, we don’t expect you to have prior industry experience in proprietary trading or financial services to succeed at Susquehanna International Group. We’re looking for people who are naturally curious, relentless problem solvers, and have the desire to continuously innovate, learn, and grow.

Benefits: Susquehanna offers a wide array of competitive employee perks & benefits.

**What we %%U+0027%% re looking for**

What we’re looking for:

- 5+ years of experience in software development (Oracle and C#)
- An excellent understanding of Database design allied with a knowledge of Object-oriented programming.
- Strong verbal communication skills and the ability to deal effectively with both technical and non-technical teams.
- Minimum of a Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics, or a related discipline.
- Experience with any of the following would be beneficial
- Working with very large datasets / Hadoop
- Python
- NoSQL databases
- Messaging technologies / Kafka

About Susquehanna:

Susquehanna is a global quantitative trading firm founded by a group of friends who share a passion for game theory and probabilistic thinking. We have incorporated this approach into our culture, where you will find relentless problem solvers within each of our core disciplines: Trading, Technology, and Quantitative Research. From offices around the world, our employees collaborate to make optimal decisions and are driven by the desire to achieve winning results together.

**What we do:**

We are experts in trading essentially all listed financial products and asset classes, with a focus on derivatives trading. Through market making and market taking, we handle millions of trading transactions around the world every day, providing liquidity and ensuring competitive prices for buyers and sellers. While our presence in the market is broad, our trading desks are highly specialized, allowing for a deep understanding of unique drivers of each asset class.

Equal Opportunity Statement

We encourage applications from candidates from all backgrounds, and we welcome requests for reasonable
adjustments
during the recruitment process to ensure that you can best demonstrate your abilities.

Susquehanna does not accept unsolicited resumes from recruiters or search firms. Any resume or referral submitted in the absence of a signed agreement will become the property of SIG and no fee will be paid.

postTitle: Software Development Engineer, AWS - Graduate or Entry-Level (24 months)
debugText:
Tips

- Study area: computer science, Information technology, Information systems, Software engineering, and related;
- Has graduated already, or will graduate before September 2024 (included);
- If candidate has already started career after graduation, 24 months of working experience are eligible, but not longer than it;
- Nice to have Tech related experience, both full-time and internship experience works.
- Locations: Sydney, AUS

At AWS, you’ll join a team solving challenging problems with innovative software 
solutions, building global software at scale every day and having a ton 
of fun while you do it.

Amazon/ AWS offers a unique, inclusive work 
environment where you’ll be able to work on the A to Z of problems, at 
scale, for real customers. You’ll join a team solving challenging 
problems with innovative software solutions, building global software at 
scale every day and having a ton of fun while you do it.

We are a 
group of engineers that values diversity and collaboration to help each 
other succeed as a team. Bring your experiences, perspectives and 
skills to help build a great shopping experience for customers all 
around the world. We %%U+0027%% re looking for developers with a passion for 
solving challenging problems, learning on the go and working with 
teammates to have a global impact.

## KEY JOB RESPONSIBILITIES

You 
will own the development of software end to end, from working with 
stakeholders on requirements through to owning the ongoing operations of 
the software that you build at scale. You will work with a great, 
global team to tackle new challenges. You will have the opportunity to 
experiment and learn from your successes and your failures.

Apply today to join our incredible team building software for our customers around the world. Have fun and build great software!

We are open to hiring candidates to work out of one of the following locations:

Sydney, NSW, AUS

## BASIC QUALIFICATIONS

• 
You must be in the final semester/ trimester of a university 
undergraduate or postgraduate degree or have completed your university 
studies within the past 24 months of applying and able to commence a 
role within the next 3 months

• Enrolled/Completed a degree in 
Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Information Technology at 
university or relevant tertiary institution

• Strong, object-oriented design and coding skills (C/C++ and/or Java preferably on a UNIX or Linux platform)

• Knowledge of Perl or other scripting languages a plus

• Experience with distributed (multi-tiered) systems, algorithms, and relational databases

• Experience in optimization mathematics (linear programming, nonlinear optimization)

• Ability to effectively articulate technical challenges and solutions

• Deal well with ambiguous/undefined problems; ability to think abstractly

## PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS

Experience developing in a Linux environment

• Experience developing software on Amazon Web Services (AWS) platforms

Note: 
Applications are reviewed on a rolling basis. For an update on your 
status, or to confirm your application was submitted successfully, 
please login to your candidate portal. Please note that we are reviewing 
a high volume of applications and appreciate your patience.

## APPLICATION AND ASSESSMENT PROCESS

Selected candidates will be invited to complete an online assessment which we 
encourage you to complete within 5 business days. Your application will 
then be reviewed for suitability for the role. If successful, you will 
be invited to attend a phone interview follow by two virtual interviews, 
focusing on our Leadership Principles.

If you have a disability 
and need an adjustment during the application and hiring process, 
including support for the interview or onboarding process, please email 
us (anzcampus@amazon.com.au) and put Applicant-Candidate Accommodation 
Request in the subject line for expedited processing.

If you have any questions, please contact us at (anzcampus@amazon.com.au)

Acknowledgement of country:

In 
the spirit of reconciliation Amazon acknowledges the Traditional 
Custodians of country throughout Australia and their connections to 
land, sea and community. We pay our respect to their elders past and 
present and extend that respect to all Aboriginal and Torres Strait 
Islander peoples today.

IDE statement:

Amazon is committed to a 
diverse and inclusive workplace. Amazon is an equal opportunity 
employer, and does not discriminate on the basis of race, national 
origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, disability, age, or 
other legally protected attributes.

debugText:
## **#ONEr2p**

Are you a passionate, solution-oriented Software Engineer and do you want to work in a future-oriented and sustainable industry that is driven by innovation and the latest technology? Then keep reading!

## **This is how You Make a Difference**

As a highly skilled and motivated Software Engineer you will be part of our small, talented team in Sydney that is dedicated to the ongoing development of hardware and software used extensively throughout the transport industry. You will support this mission with the following tasks:

- Design, develop and maintain software and systems in accordance with the quality system
- Design, develop and maintain Linux based distributions used in supplied devices
- Software development in accordance with predefined specifications
- Analysis of customer requirements
- Participation in development through all stages of SDLC
- Post-implementation support
- Support during pre-sales in creating system design and estimating time/effort

## **You are**

- Passionate about learning and growing
- Communicative and strongly team orientated
- Equipped with strong analytical abilities
- Motivated and ambitious to work on your own initiative
- Organized and able to manage and document your tasks and time
- In possession of an Australian citizenship, permanent residency or a temporary work visa

## **What you Bring to the Table**

You have completed a tertiary degree, preferably in computer science or electrical/electronic engineering.

Your skills include:

- Advanced proficiency in C/C++ programming, with a proven track record of delivering high-quality software solutions
- Strong understanding of Linux and Operating System concepts
- Basic knowledge of electronic hardware concepts
- Experience in Linux user space programming and shell scripting
- Demonstrated expertise in TCP/IP network programming
- Solid background in multi-threading programming
- Excellent troubleshooting skills with a methodical approach to problem-solving
- Strong communication and documentation skills
- Ability to collaborate effectively in a team environment and adhere to project schedules
- Familiarity with development processes, cybersecurity principles, and quality standards


**Bonus skills:**

- Cross platform user space network application development in Linux and Windows
- Understanding of and experience with communication protocols and methods such as REST, GraphQL, Message Queues and SOAP
- Understanding of and experience with VoIP systems and associated control and streaming protocols
- Proficiency in other programming languages including Java, C#, Python, Lua, and JavaScript
- Knowledge of encryption, authentication and authorisation methods
- Experience in device driver development for embedded devices

## **Your Benefits**

r2p offers great job opportunities in various fields and job profiles and offers a competitive salary package that commensurate with your skills and experience level. We are a globally expanding company our employees have the chance to grow with us and to work in an international environment.

You will join us at our new office in Bella Vista, Sydney, conveniently located near Bella Vista metro station (10-minute walk) and just off the Westlink M7 (5-minute drive). Once established in your new role, we offer a hybrid work model which allows to flexibly split your time between working in the office and from home, to suit your personal circumstances and needs.

We are a dynamic and open-minded company with flat hierarchies and an open-door philosophy. The team not only works together but also shares laughs and good times. We place high value on sustainability and respect – also, for us, humour is always part of the game. r2p operates in an innovative and future-oriented industry which is what keeps us moving, constantly keen on finding new solutions to make public transport amazing!

## **Interested?**

If this sounds like something you would like to be a part of, we invite you to click  %%U+0022%% apply now %%U+0022%%  and share your application stating your earliest possible starting date and salary expectation. We look forward to hearing from you.

At LifeByte, we are a dynamic and innovative collective of tech visionaries driven by a relentless pursuit of excellence. Each of us brings a unique set of skills to the table, collaborating on projects that shape the future.

Founded in 2017, we are dedicated to fostering an ecosystem of seamless resource exchange, where efficiency and precision are paramount. With cutting-edge solutions, we empower businesses to thrive and individuals to unlock their full potential. Committed to high-tech innovation, we are actively reshaping the future, one Byte at a Time.

We are looking for a highly skilled Data Engineer to help build and optimise the company %%U+0027%% s data infrastructure. This position will work closely with data scientists, analysts and business teams to improve the efficiency of the company %%U+0027%% s data processing and decision making by building efficient data pipelines and storage solutions.

**Job Responsibilities:**

- Design, build, install, test and maintain scalable data management systems, ensuring that the system meets business requirements and industry standards.
- Integrate emerging data management and software engineering technologies into existing data structures, ensuring compliance with data management and security policies.
- Monitor performance and data accuracy of data processing systems.
- Maintains Cl/CD systems and code base.
- Establishes and operates to maintain high quality standards and maintains cloud architecture systems across accounts.
- Mentor and guide junior data engineers.
- Adopt new technologies while leveraging your accumulated expertise in modern big data tools and cloud services.

**Requirements**

- Bachelor %%U+0027%% s degree or above in Computer Science, Engineering or a related field, English can be used as a working language.
- At least 1 years of relevant experience in data engineering with project experience in designing and implementing complex data solutions.
- Proficiency in Python and experience in developing robust, maintainable, and scalable data processing pipelines.
- Experience with CI/CD systems, automated workflows, and integrating data quality checks into deployment processes.
- Strong experience with cloud services (preferably AWS), including the use of AWS data services and knowledge of Snowflake as a data warehouse solution.
- Expertise in working with all forms of data infrastructure and adept at managing streaming and batch data systems.
- Solid understanding of data modelling, ETL (Extract, Transform, Load) processes and data warehousing principles with a commitment to improving data quality and accuracy.

**Benefits**

- Celebrate your tenure with us! Receive generous milestone anniversary gifts that grow with each year of service.
- Join a vibrant workplace culture with fantastic team-building activities, fostering camaraderie and collaboration among colleagues.
- Prioritize your well-being! Access our Flexible Spending Account (FSA) for various health and wellness needs.
- Welcome your newest family member with a special gift!
- Hybrid working arrangement

debugText:
**Role: AI Engineer**

**Company: Pearson**

**Division: Workforce Skills**

**Location: Hybrid/Remote Options - Sydney, New South Wales (Australia) OR Hoboken, New Jersey, (United States)**

*Our Team: * Workforce Skills – We provide upskilling and reskilling that ensures people can thrive in a digital, automated future. Faethm is a SaaS platform that uses artificial intelligence to help prepare people for the future of work and was acquired by Pearson in 2021. Workforce Skills is the newest division at Pearson with ambitious and exciting plans for growth.

**About the role:**  Reporting to our Lead Engineer, you will work alongside Faethm’s AI and Backend Engineers to solve interesting technical challenges and implement our product roadmap. To give you a sense of our work, we have designed and implemented systems like:

- large scale on-demand GPU clusters with Machine Learning / NLP pipelines to extract billions of data points from job ads within a few hours

- deep learning and LLM based based learning content recommendation system

- libraries and APIs for bleeding edge transformer-based NLP model pipelines

- high-concurrency, low-latency analytics environment across 7 geographic regions to serve enterprise customers all over the world


*As a Backend Engineer in AI Systems, you’ll be responsible for: *

- Build RESTful APIs and micro-services for compute heavy and data intensive Machine Learning models

- Design and build highly scalable AI backends using Python, AWS, MongoDB, and Postgres

- Support the consumption of Faethm’s APIs and data outputs by other teams and organisations

- Drive code quality by facilitating code reviews within the team and ensuring that our engineering practices are followed in relation to testing, security and monitoring

- Work closely with data scientists and product managers to understand the needs of the customer and our business so that you can build the right features


*To be successful in this role, you will ideally have:  *

- BS, MS, or PhD in Computer Science, Software Engineering, or equivalent experience

- 0-2 years of experience in a software engineering role

- Practical experience in Python, including at least one web application framework like FastAPI, Django, or Flask

- Knowledge of SQL and/or NoSQL database technologies

- Familiarity with micro-services, and containerization

- Understanding of distributed systems and scalability

- Understanding of Artificial Intelligence, Machine Learning, and Big Data Concepts

- Interest in Natural Language Processing, Embeddings, Large Language Models, and Recommendation Systems


**Our tech stack:**  Python, FastAPI, PyTorch, AWS, MongoDB, Postgres, Databricks, Kubernetes, Terraform

**Our purpose:**  At Pearson we ‘add life to a lifetime of learning’ so everyone can realise the life they imagine. We do this by creating vibrant and enriching learning experiences designed for real-life impact.

**Our company:**  Pearson was founded in 1844 and has been built on our ability to grow with and adapt to a constantly evolving market. Our 20,000+ employees are dedicated to creating the high-quality, digital-first, accessible and sustainable resources for lifelong learning.

*Diversity: * At Pearson we value the power of an inclusive culture and a strong sense of belonging. We promote a culture where differences are embraced as strengths and opportunities are equal and accessible.

If you are as passionate as we are about changing lives through learning, then help us to learn more about you and why you want to work with Pearson. Click ‘Apply Now’ to create your application online.

**What to expect from Pearson**

Did you know Pearson is one of the 10 most innovative education companies of 2022?

At Pearson, we add life to a lifetime of learning so everyone can realize the life they imagine. We do this by creating vibrant and enriching learning experiences designed for real-life impact. We are on a journey to be 100 percent digital to meet the changing needs of the global population by developing a new strategy with ambitious targets. To deliver on our strategic vision, we have five business divisions that are the foundation for the long-term growth of the company: Assessment & Qualifications, Virtual Learning, English Language Learning, Workforce Skills and Higher Education. Alongside these, we have our corporate divisions: Digital & Technology, Finance, Global Corporate Marketing & Communications, Human Resources, Legal, Strategy and Direct to Consumer. Learn more at We are Pearson.

We value the power of an inclusive culture and also a strong sense of belonging. We promote a culture where differences are embraced, opportunities are accessible, consideration and respect are the norm and all individuals are supported in reaching their full potential. Through our talent, we believe that diversity, equity and inclusion make us a more innovative and vibrant place to work. People are at the center, and we are committed to building a workplace where talent can learn, grow and thrive.

Pearson is an Affirmative Action and Equal Opportunity Employer and a member of E-Verify. We want a team that represents a variety of backgrounds, perspectives and skills. The more inclusive we are, the better our work will be. All employment decisions are based on qualifications, merit and business need. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, ethnicity, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, age, national origin, protected veteran status, disability status or any other group protected by law. We strive for a workforce that reflects the diversity of our communities.

To learn more about Pearson’s commitment to a diverse and inclusive workforce, navigate to: Diversity, Equity & Inclusion at Pearson.

If you are an individual with a disability and are unable or limited in your ability to use or access our career site as a result of your disability, you may request reasonable accommodations by emailing TalentExperienceGlobalTeam@grp.pearson.com.

Note that the information you provide will stay confidential and will be stored securely. It will not be seen by those involved in making decisions as part of the recruitment process.

Partnering with some of **Australia %%U+0027%% s biggest companies**, we’re looking for 15 ambitious graduates to work on exciting projects with our clients.

postTitle: Software Engineers - All Levels - Typescript, React, Node, AWS
debugText:
The Squiz product team is working to deliver a cloud-based Digital Experience Platform (DXP) with several core capabilities including Content Management, Optimisation tooling, and Platform services.

We %%U+0027%% re seeking a **Software Engineer %%U+0027%% s of all levels** to join our product engineering team on a permanent basis, with a focus on improving capability across various parts of the DXP. All with experience across our stack - Typescript, React, Node & AWS. (Fullstack)

**Roles we are currently hiring for:**

**Team Leads (hands on)**

**Senior Software Engineers**

**Software Engineers**

**We’re location-flexible!
 This role is open to all candidates on the east coast of Australia.**

This role is hybrid, allowing you to work where and when works best for you.

**For this role, we ask that you can demonstrate the following experience:**

- Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, or a related field, or equivalent professional experience in related fields
- Professional hands-on experience in software development building and maintaining large-scale software products
- Proficiency in full-stack development, with expertise in web based languages and frameworks including Node, TypeScript, React or similar, and cloud platforms such as AWS
- Strong understanding of testing principles and demonstrated experience in implementing testing strategies to improve software quality and robustness
- Experience with Agile or other iterative development methodologies. We use Scrum for most of the teams, with some using Kanban
- Strong understanding of secure coding practices, particularly community standards such as OWASP
- Previous experience mentoring junior and mid level software engineers

**Nice to have**

- Previous experience working on DXP or CMS platforms, or experience integrating or using DXP/CMS platforms
- Previous experience creating or maintaining site builders, page builders or WYSIWYG interfaces

**What you would do (the role day to day):**

- Work within a team of 3-5 software engineers to help build our Digital Experience Platform. Each team consists of a Team Lead, and 3 or 4 software engineers at different levels - junior, mid and senior
- Develop/enhance robust application code which meets all technical requirements
- Collaborate with team members to generate User Stories, Acceptance Criteria and estimates
- Provide guidance to junior engineers and assistance to senior engineers
- Write and maintain software documentation
- Assist Team Leads and Engineering Managers to create and deliver technical roadmaps
- Lead best practices in software development, code quality, and architecture across our tech stack within your team - Node, TypeScript, React, AWS, Cloudflare, GitLab CI/CD

**Locations:** Sydney, Melbourne or Brisbane

**Why work for Squiz?**

You’ll work with some of the most intelligent and down to earth people you’ve ever meet. We are made up of a diverse range of passionate professionals who love challenging the status quo. Every day is different, but what is constant is we all love what we do.

We have a lived commitment to flexibility, we know the success of our people is dependent on them having a balanced life. You will be offered flexibility as to where and how you work every day. We want you to be able to work in a way that drives productivity, efficiency and outcomes; along with connection and collaboration.

**Who we are:**

Squiz helps complex, service-led organisations harness the power of digital, improving the services they offer online.

Founded in 1998, Squiz grew during the rise of the internet. Since then, we have evolved from a simple web content management system into a full digital experience platform (DXP), helping customers make the shift from being content managers to experience creators.

The Squiz DXP brings together content, search, data and applications in one place. To get the most out of the platform, customers can collaborate with our digital experts to design solutions and adapt as demands change.

We are headquartered in Australia, with teams and customers across the globe, and offices in New Zealand, the United States, the United Kingdom and Poland.

Come as you are -We celebrate diversity and unite on the elements of our company DNA, starting every customer conversation with “why?” to really understand their needs, working hard to find a way to overcome every challenge, and fighting for better outcomes with the work we do. We also check our egos at door, we don’t take ourselves too seriously and we have fun along the way.

**We are a 2024 Circle Back Initiative Global Employer – we commit to respond to every applicant**

**Recruitment Agencies:** We politely ask that you avoid making any approaches or sending any unsolicited resumes to our Recruitment Team or Hiring Leaders across our business. Squiz is not responsible for any fees related to unsolicited resumes.

debugText:
Freelancer.com is the world %%U+0027%% s largest freelancing and crowdsourcing marketplace in the world, with over 74 million freelancers across the globe. Our marketplace hosts a real life economy, where work is undertaken in every area you can think of. From design, writing, data entry and software development; through to cleaning, plumbing and dog walking - even NASA uses us!

This won %%U+0027%% t be your typical cog-in-the-machine type of job. If you %%U+0027%% re a high achiever with talent, looking for something more than a boring job in corporate, want to work with the best and brightest and don %%U+0027%% t need to be handheld, this is the job for you.

If you join a mega-cap technology company as the 10,000th hire you might struggle to figure out the impact you are making. If you join a startup, you might get to work on the latest fad, but likely have few mentors to learn from, work on toy problems and never change the world.

At Freelancer you’ll get to work on a highly diverse, global set of internet-scale challenges where you will make a meaningful difference with real responsibility, while rapidly building your skills. We run a meritocracy - we actively promote from within.

You’ll also change lives - our mission is to provide one billion jobs. Not many companies actually make a difference
like Freelancer does
in providing opportunity and income to people all around the world.

We have a very wide range of engineering challenges to sink your teeth into. You’ll get a chance to be exposed to a wide variety of technologies across our businesses. Freelancer.com is an Alexa top 1000 website with a cutting-edge frontend stack incorporating Angular, TypeScript and RxJS. Our backend powers a large suite of services running a modern global marketplace; messaging, payments, translations, file services and a notification system sending millions of notifications an hour. We deploy code to production multiple times a day.

**Our companies include:**

Escrow.com - a global payments platform for high value items with over $6 billion USD transacted.

Loadshift - a global heavy haulage freight marketplace.

**So you think you have what it takes to be an Engineer at Freelancer?**

We are looking for fullstack senior software engineers. Our teams
work with the latest tech, and push code 30-40 times a day in a high-performance cloud environment. We develop core, revenue-generating products, and so this represents an opportunity to have a fundamental impact on our global business.

Not only will you build features and software that scale, but your work will have a direct impact on tens of millions of users worldwide. You would be architecting web applications at scale, enjoying the challenge of writing optimised lightning fast SQL for massive data sets, you will be structuring extensible data and application logic, and be passionate about designing high quality APIs.

Our advanced Angular codebase runs in the browser for desktop and mobile devices, runs on the server to deliver fast, server-side rendered pages for SEO, and inside our iOS and Android mobile apps, all tested with cutting edge automated test suites.

**Requirements:**

**Musts haves:**

- Proficiency in a few web development languages, such as Python, Golang, PHP, Node.js or Ruby
- Experience with relational databases and SQL, preferably MySQL
- Background or interest in web engineering at scale
- Experience working in an agile team environment, continuously shipping environment
- Linux experience
- Experience building SaaS products
- Cloud computing experience, preferably AWS
- Strong writing and verbal communication skills
- Strong sense of ownership and able to self-manage work
- Self-motivated and tracked-record of learning new technologies
- Strong troubleshooting skills and creative problem-solving ability
- Experience with designing and implementing complex software systems
- Experience with mentoring/training junior engineers

**Nice-to-haves:**

- Experience with SOA, microservice and containerisation architecture
- Experience with development of public facing APIs
- Experience with modern Javascript framework, such as Angular, React or Vue
- Experience with TypeScript
- Domain experience in payments or customer
ID verification
- Strong knowledge of computer networking
- Sound understanding of OWASP and the best web security practices

**We would love you to have:**

- Strong academic achievements
- MS or PhD degrees
- A Github page with contributions to open source software
- Experience with leading an engineering team

**Benefits:**

- A meritocratic culture with the ability to take ownership and fast track your career growth.
- You will be working on an Alexa top ranked website, solving complex, internet scale and global challenges in systems engineering with over 74 million customers across 247 countries, regions & territories.
- Weekly Town Halls with the all important Q&A session with the CEO (you really can ask him anything)!
- Friday lunches - We finish each week with a catered lunch. Every Friday we offer a different cuisine from local restaurants.
- Fully stocked kitchens + yes we do have beer taps (and a bar with a killer view!)
- Hack-a-thons - Get hacking and programming in this quarterly company-wide where teams create solutions to existing problems and win prizes. The 2-day event is filled with games, events, shows, food and more.
- Fun events (we once built a soccer stadium in the office with two tonnes of turf).
- Located at Grosvenor Place - Home of Freelancer HQ, this iconic building and location with harbour views with weekly and complimentary classes, activities, events, promotions, competitions and deals

**Just when you thought it couldn’t get any better:**

- Change lives every day – Everything we do as part of our jobs contribute to improving the lives of our users on a global scale.
- Fast-track your career - We boast a meritocratic culture, renowned for hiring into senior roles from within and producing many business and product leaders in the technology industry

**What is the role?**

We are seeking a highly skilled and motivated Professional, Data Scientist that specializes in statistical modelling and machine learning to join our dynamic team. The primary focus of this role will be to design and implement machine learning models to extract insights and patterns from complex, structured and unstructured data. **Please note that we are looking for Sydney based candidates only for this role as the role is based in Sydney.**

**What will you be doing?**

- ​Understand the problem statement and take a logical approach to problem solving.
- Curious to deep dive into our data assets and willingness to perform a thorough exploratory data analysis.
- Collaborate closely with cross-functional teams, including data engineers, stakeholders and domain experts, to identify data-driven opportunities and translate them into actionable solutions.
- Be a subject matter expert of various machine learning algorithms and able to apply the appropriate algorithms.
- Stay up to date with the latest advancements in machine learning techniques, frameworks, and tools, and recommend their adoption to enhance our model capabilities.
- Scale up solutions, by being a publisher of data to cater for wider audience and products.

Job Qualifications

­­­­­ **Are you the right fit?**

- 2-3 years of similar data science experience
- Master’s or Ph.D. in Computer Science or Mathematics or related field
- Proven strong experience in machine learning and well versed in utilizing cutting edge technologies and productionising models
- Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with the ability to communicate complex technical concepts to technical and non-technical audience

- Quick on feet to adapt to CoreLogic’s cloud stack.

debugText:
We are CORTO, a cutting-edge software company dedicated to revolutionizing the legal industry. Our mission is to empower legal practitioners with AI-driven solutions that streamline their workflow, boost productivity, and provide more efficient client service.

Our team of AI experts and engineers collaborate to develop intelligent software tailored to the unique needs of lawyers, paralegals, and legal assistants.

Our innovative AI solutions automate routine tasks, simplify document management, and enhance decision-making, allowing legal professionals to focus on what they do best—providing expert legal counsel.

As a Software Engineer in the AI and Automation Team, you will be responsible for developing the APIs that power Corto’s Core AI capabilities. The team is also responsible for building a robust system that extracts and ingests
large amount data from various sources to provide data used in Retrieval Augmented Generation (RAG).

**What will you be working on as an AI Software Engineer ?**

This is an incredible opportunity to be part of an engineering team building the next generation of our products. The day to day will include:

• Design and develop AI architectures and solutions to meet business requirements.

• Lead the experimentation of internal AI projects, ensuring alignment with best practices and industry standards.

• Collaborate with cross-functional teams to integrate AI technologies into existing systems and processes.

• Conduct research and stay up-to-date with the latest advancements in AI and machine learning.

• Provide technical leadership and mentorship to team members.

• Evaluate and recommend appropriate AI tools, frameworks, and technologies for various projects.

• Develop and maintain documentation for AI solutions, including design specifications, test plans, and user guides.

• Ensure the scalability, reliability, and security of AI systems.

• Participate in code reviews and contribute to the continuous improvement of development processes.

**What experience do you need to become a, AI Software Engineer?**

You are a focused, motivated and hard-working developer who wants to join a fantastic growing team at a critical time and learn on the job to expand your skills. In addition to that you will bring:

• Strong foundation in software design and development principles

• Experience with Generative AI based application development

• Experience with Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG)

• Experience with AWS technologies for software development

• Experience with PostgreSQL / PGVector is an advantage

• Experience with Python Development is an advantage

• Big Data / ML experience is an advantage

You %%U+0027%% re also going to need loads of:

• Positive attitude – things might not always go as expected but we maintain optimism and win, nonetheless

• Ability to think out of the box – not all our tasks are standard so neither are the solutions

• Being a team player – we reach our goals together and help each other to succeed

**Your benefits include:**

• Flexible hybrid work environment. We engage, share, and collaborate on ideas and workflows on Wednesdays as a full team, and the rest of the week is up to you! Our cadence is twice/week in a modern and spacious office in the CBD.

• Generous paid parental leave policy

• Career and learning opportunities; we move fast and need smart people to get us where we %%U+0027%% re going. We are a scaling business and looking for people who want to grow with us.

• Wellness focus with additional time off, gym membership and other perks

• fast-paced tech environment, if we don %%U+0027%% t disrupt ourselves someone else will do it!

• Unique and fun team events, ask us about them

• Yes, we have a pool table table and snacks

Join our talented and motivated team dedicated to revolutionizing the legal industry. If you are driven by innovation, thrive in a collaborative environment, and are passionate about creating seamless and intuitive user experiences, we would love to hear from you.

debugText:
**Job Title: Software Engineer**

RASSURE is a fast-growing, early-stage technology company based in Sydney, Australia, aiming to become the global leader in helping airlines protect their revenue. With our proprietary technology, big data solutions, and advanced analytics, we are driving innovation in airline revenue management.

As we continue to grow, we are looking for a Software Engineer who is passionate about problem-solving, technical excellence, and eager to learn the complexities of the airline industry. This role is perfect for someone with 0-3 years of experience who wants to tackle exciting challenges in a dynamic and fast-paced environment.

**Key Responsibilities:**

1. **Software Development & Support:**

- Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand business requirements and convert them into technical solutions.
- Develop, test, and deploy new features for our automated airline revenue protection system.
- Troubleshoot and provide support for existing applications to maintain system performance and uptime.
- Work closely with the QA team to ensure the delivery of high-quality airline revenue audit results.
- Utilize production tools such as Jira or Zoho Ticket to track progress, manage tasks, and resolve support tickets.
- Leverage code management tools like Git for version control and collaborative development

2. **Airline Industry Knowledge:**

- Understand airline reservation, pricing, and ticketing processes by analysing ATPCO and IATA documents.
- Assist in translating airline revenue audit logic into executable rules and solutions within the system

3. **Continuous Learning & Innovation:**

- Stay updated on new technologies, explore innovative approaches, and propose improvements to enhance the system.

- Embrace the complexities of the airline industry, focusing on learning its revenue management intricacies.

- Suggest and implement new technologies that can drive program enhancement.

4. **Collaboration & Problem Solving:**

- Collaborate with different teams and stakeholders to ensure smooth integration of system functions.
- Apply strong problem-solving skills to address challenges, contributing fresh ideas and solutions.
- Take ownership of solutions from concept to implementation, testing, and support.

**What We Are Looking For:**

**Technical Skills:**

- Strong proficiency in Python and SQL.
- Solid knowledge of computer science concepts, including algorithms and data structures.
- Familiarity with AWS Cloud services (Glue, Athena, API Gateway, Lambda, SQS, etc.) is a plus.
- Experience with PySpark and Big Data technologies is advantageous but not required – we welcome candidates eager to learn.
- Experience with production tools such as Jira or Zoho Ticket for task and issue tracking.
- Proficiency with code management tools like Git for version control

**Desirable Traits:**

- Self-motivated, disciplined, and able to work independently with minimal supervision.
- Eager to learn about the airline industry and revenue management.
- Strong communication skills for effective collaboration with both technical and non-technical teams.

**Why Join RASSURE?**

**Innovation & Growth:** Work on innovative products with a significant impact on the airline industry, gaining high visibility and freedom to explore your ideas.

**Dynamic Environment:** Be part of an agile, entrepreneurial organization that thrives on challenges and values your contributions.

**Learning & Development**: Grow with us, mastering new technologies and gaining industry knowledge while playing a pivotal role in shaping the future of the company.

**Exciting Perks:** Competitive salary, flexible work environment, staff share options, and performance-based bonuses.

If you %%U+0027%% re passionate about problem-solving, eager to learn, and excited to explore the dynamic airline industry, we %%U+0027%% d love to hear from you!

**Do work that matters**

CommBank is recognised as leading the industry in IT and operations with its world-class platforms and processes, agile IT infrastructure, and innovation in everything from payments to internet banking and mobile apps. Our Software team are the brains behind Australia %%U+0027%% s number one banking app, Netbank, Cardless Cash, Comm Sec Pocket and Spend Tracker. We go beyond a passion for web and mobile development, creating reliable APIs at a unique scale in Australia. And you could be a part of that journey.

**See yourself in our team**

You %%U+0027%% ll be joining our ML Ops Capabilities team, which is dedicated to enhancing the deployment, monitoring, and management of machine learning models in production. Our mission is to streamline the end-to-end machine learning lifecycle, ensuring robust and scalable solutions that drive business value.

As a Senior Software Engineer, you will bring your expertise in engineering, quality assurance, test automation, risk management, solving business problems, optimising our systems, and contributing to strategic test automation initiatives to evolve testing automation practices and tools. You will be creating and maintaining front-end and back-end automation frameworks to ensure the quality and reliability of our systems. You will be embedded in a cross-functional team that is self-managing with end-to-end responsibility for designing, delivering, and optimising a broad range of customer-focused outcomes.

**We %%U+0027%% re interested in hearing from people who:**

· Will be the squad %%U+0027%% s  %%U+0022%% Quality Advocate, %%U+0022%%  encouraging a critical thinking mindset and driving the prevention of defects over the detection of defects.

· Drive a learning culture through activities such as guild presentations and blogs.

· Contribute to the design and build of the services and tools that enable DevOps and testing.

· Ideate and build innovative tools to solve automation challenges.

· Build robust test doubles to minimise dependencies.

· Influence product design, implementation and enhancement to support testability and quality.

· Automate basic real-time anomaly detection through services such as log monitoring.

· Create well-engineered, scalable and reliable tests.

**Tech skills**

We use a broad range of tools, languages, and frameworks. We don %%U+0027%% t expect you to know them all but experience or exposure with some of these will set you up for success in this team:

· Advanced Python coding, Python Libraries

· API and Database testing automation (Python and Blazemeter)

· Playwright

· Code repository & version control tools such as Git.

· CI/CD

· Behaviour Driven Development (BDD).

· Knowledge of Machine Learning tools is a plus.

**Working with us**

Whether you %%U+0027%% re passionate about customer service, driven by data, or called by creativity, a career with us is for you.

We support our people with the flexibility to balance where work is done with at least half their time connecting in the office. We also have many other flexible working options available, including changing start and finish times, part-time arrangements and job share to name a few.

Our people bring their diverse backgrounds and unique perspectives to build a respectful, inclusive, and flexible workplace with flexible work locations. We %%U+0027%% re looking for people who truly live our values: Care, Courage and Commitment, and we %%U+0027%% ll offer you great opportunities to develop your career with us.

_Whether you %%U+0027%% re passionate about customer service, driven by data, or called by creativity, a career here is for you._

_Our people bring their diverse backgrounds and unique perspectives to build a respectful, inclusive and flexible workplace._ _We are working hard to build a team of people who represent the rich diversity of our customers and communities. You may just be the perfect candidate for this opportunity or another within CommBank._

_At CommBank we will inspire you with work that makes a difference, surround you with talented people that respect and value each other, and empower you to grow professionally and personally. Most of all, making_ _a positive impact for customers, communities and each other is part of our every day._

_We %%U+0027%% re determined to make a real difference for Australia %%U+0027%% s first peoples. We encourage all interested applicants to apply._ _If you %%U+0027%% re already part of the Commonwealth Bank Group (including Bankwest), you %%U+0027%% ll need to apply through Sidekick to submit a valid application. We %%U+0027%% re keen to support you with the next step in your career._

At Kelly+Partners, we operate with one clear mission:  %%U+0022%% to help our people, Private Business Owners, and the communities we work in be better off %%U+0022%% . We are committed to providing personal and professional growth opportunities to ensure all our team members are set up for a fulfilling and successful future.

About Kelly+Partners

- Top 25 accounting firm in Australia
- Certified Great Place to Work 3 years running
- Winner of the Australian Business Awards for Employer of Choice 2022
- Awarded one of Australia’s Best Workplaces for Women 2023
- Certified B Corp – We believe in business for good
- Established in 2006 and growing at over 30% per annum

Why Join Us?

In addition to working in an organisation that is committed to offering the best services and opportunities to both our clients and our team, you will also have access to the following benefits:

- Diverse role and opportunity to grow your skills
- Interstate retreats and company events
- Modern, bright workplaces with state-of-the-art technology
- Awards and bonuses for top performers
- WFH and flexible work arrangements
- Employee Assistance Program
- Paid Community Service Leave

Overview

Kelly+Partners is looking for a highly motivated, and self-directed Full Stack Web Developer to join our team. You will be part of an existing team working towards upgrading features to the platform. You will be working across React.JS, C#, .Net Core, Blazor Server and Azure across the board.

The Role

- Designing and developing web application/APIs
- Designing and implementing new user-facing features for both clients and internal users
- Continuous improvement of new features and enhancements
- Collaborate with team to test all feature changes and ensure proper functionality and bug-free deployment
- Producing clean, maintainable, and efficient code based on specifications.

Skills & Requirements

- 1+ years React.JS web development experience for single page apps
- 1+ years .NET Core web development experience (C#)
- Good understanding of front-end HTML, CSS, JS
- Good experience and understanding of SQL Server and T-SQL
- Experience in MS Azure
- Git, Continuous Integration with Azure DevOps
- Good communication skills
