debugText:
**Overview**

Susquehanna is a global privately held financial trading firm. Our founders are entrepreneurs with a drive to deeply understand the world around us and to use that understanding to make the best business decisions every day, everywhere. We don’t rely on hunches. We challenge each other and use our collective wisdom to make optimal decisions under conditions of uncertainty. This approach gives us the edge we need to be the best. At Susquehanna, we have winning down to a science.

**Your role**

As part of our trading technology team, you will perform support, deployment and automate tasks related to the management of SIG’s data pipelines throughout the Asia Pacific region.
This role is an integral part of our quant data development team, collaborating closely with both developers, traders, and quant researchers.

The position offers the opportunity to be involved in maintaining daily operations, automating tasks, and developing new tools improve the monitoring, management, and deployment of market data pipelines on mainly Linux operating systems and gives you exposure to exchange market data.

**Your daily tasks will include**

- Performing daily monitoring and market pre-open system checks utilizing automation.
- Developing new tools and utilities to help building data pipelines and studies.
- Becoming a subject matter expert in our in-house systems and data pipelines across market data and static/reference data.
- Build and use automation tools/scripting to automate tasks ensuring overall system performance, reliability, and accuracy.
- Providing a link between developers, traders, and various in-house technology teams, ensuring smooth information flow relating to system issues/changes, market data and market connectivity.
- Writing and maintaining technical and user documentation for new/existing systems and procedures.
- Identifying opportunities for improving the system stability and reliability and the trading environment through improved use of technology.

**What we %%U+0027%% re looking for**

- Degree with a major in Computer Science, Mathematics, or a related technical discipline.
- Must be proficient in Python.
- Ability to communicate effectively with a range of technical and non-technical staff across the organisation.
- Ability to work under demanding deadlines with changing priorities in a trading room environment.
- Understanding of financial markets, including financial instruments, and market data concepts across equities and derivatives.

**Your ideal technical experience will include**

- Experience in application support, deployment, and monitoring.
- Experience in data pipelines and processing.
- Experience in Linux.
- Experience in git, gitlab, CI/CD.
- Experience in Jenkins, Airflow.

**About SIG:**

Susquehanana is a global quantitative trading firm founded by a group of friends who share a passion for game theory and probabilistic thinking. We have incorporated this approach into our culture, where you will find relentless problem solvers within each of our core disciplines: Trading, Technology, and Quantitative Research. From offices around the world, our employees collaborate to make optimal decisions and are driven by the desire to achieve winning results together.

**What we do:** We are experts in trading essentially all listed financial products and asset classes, with a focus on derivatives trading. Through market making and market taking, we handle millions of trading transactions around the world every day, providing liquidity and ensuring competitive prices for buyers and sellers. While our presence in the market is broad, our trading desks are highly specialized, allowing for a deep understanding of unique drivers of each asset class.

**Equal Opportunity Statement**

We encourage applications from candidates from all backgrounds, and we welcome requests for reasonable adjustments during the recruitment process to ensure that you can best demonstrate your abilities.

Susquehanna does not accept unsolicited resumes from recruiters or search firms. Any resume or referral submitted in the absence of a signed agreement will become the property of Susquehanna and no fee will be paid.

debugText:
**DATAMESH**

DataMesh Group is revolutionising the payment systems available to merchants and retailers, delivering integrated payment capabilities and valuable customer insights through bespoke payment and data processing solutions.

**THE ROLE**

We are looking for a Senior Software Engineer - Full Stack to join our engineering team and help build high-quality enterprise grade software. We are looking for someone to foster effective team collaboration, mentor, and empowering team members, driving innovation in solutions, and ensuring alignment with business objectives. We have a hybrid working environment so require this person to be based in Sydney, NSW.

**RESPONSIBILTIES**

- Producing quality code, raising the bar for the whole team on quality and speed.
- Interpreting business requirements and ensuring technical requirements are an accurate reflection.
- Estimating complexity of implementation tasks.
- Writing code and unit tests, building prototypes, solving issues, profiling, and analysing bottlenecks.
- Designing performant, robust APIs.
- Managing and optimising scalable distributed systems on the cloud.
- Optimising applications for performance and scalability.
- Developing automated tests to ensure business needs are met and allow for regression testing.
- Regularly communicating with stakeholders, project managers, quality assurance teams and other developers regarding progress on the long-term technology roadmap.
- Creating and maintaining workflows with teams to provide visibility and to ensure workload balance for consistent visual designs.

**REQUIREMENTS**

- Computer Science degree or equivalent experience.
- Excellent foundation in computer science, algorithms, and application design.
- Experience writing highly secure applications.
- Experience with core AWS or Azure technologies.
- Growth mindset, challenging status quo to find new solutions and out-of-the-box ideas.
- experience designing RESTful APIs.
- A unique blend of technical expertise and insatiable curiosity, with a methodical, analytical mindset.
- Experience working in a team as well as independently in the design and development of mission-critical enterprise software.
- Demonstrated experience with MERN technology stack.
- Experience with Golang.
- Knowledge of dockerized applications and kubernetes.
- Experience working autonomously and in teams.
- Demonstrated experience interpreting business requirements and writing technical documentation.

_DataMesh Group is an Equal Opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, colour, religion, sex, sexual orientation and gender identity, national origin or disability._

debugText:
**Who we are:**

We are a leading operator in Australia and New Zealand’s fast-growing Out Of Home advertising industry and our purpose is to make public spaces better! We create deep engagement between people and brands through Unmissable location-based media solutions that inform, entertain, and inspire. Our network is unparalleled, with a diverse portfolio of 37,000 classic and digital signs across roadside, retail, airport and place-based media offering in CBD office towers and universities.

**Join Us:**

Join an organisation united by drive, creativity, innovation, and community.
We show up and we are all here to be bold, to be brave and to push the boundaries in Out Of Home advertising.
United by our commitment to imagination, you will have the opportunity to collaborate with diverse, talented, and dedicated colleagues across Australia and New Zealand who are all passionate about raising the bar each and every day. Realise your potential and make an impact with us.

**The role:**

We are seeking a talented and motivated fullstack Software Engineer to join our dynamic enterprise domain team at oOh!media. The enterprise stack adopts a 3-tier application architecture with integration applications that follows serverless approach, using Nodejs or Python for backend or serverless and react for frontend. You will be applying DORA identified best practices to ensure our CI / CD, security and testing processes enable you to deliver high quality, maintainable software solutions.

Key responsibilities:

- Design, develop, and maintain backend/serverless applications using Node.js (express) and python on AWS
- Design, develop, and maintain web applications using React and/or DJango ORM
- Architect and implement microservices and serverless solutions leveraging AWS Lambda, API Gateway, DynamoDB, and other cloud-native services.
- Develop robust, scalable, and efficient database solutions using PostgreSQL and Microsoft SQL Server.
- Collaborate with cross-functional teams to define, design, and ship new features.
- Ensure the performance, scalability, and reliability of deployed applications.
- Write clean, maintainable, and efficient code while following best practices for software development.
- Optimize system performance and troubleshoot issues as needed

In order to be considered for this role:

- Bachelor %%U+0027%% s degree in computer science, Engineering, or a related field.
- 5- 7+ years of experience in software development with a focus on Node.js and/or Python.
- Strong experience with AWS services, including Lambda, API Gateway, DynamoDB, S3, and CloudWatch.
- Expertise in building serverless applications on AWS focusing on event-driven design
- Familiarity with Docker and other container orchestrations in AWS (EKS or ECS (Elastic Container Service)
- Experience with relational databases like PostgreSQL and Microsoft SQL Server, and familiarity with NoSQL databases such as DynamoDB.
- Proficient in building and managing CI/CD pipelines for deploying AWS architectures (e.g. GitActions).
- Familiarity with infrastructure-as-code (IaC) using tools like AWS CDK (Cloud Development Kit), AWS CloudFormation or Terraform.
- Strong understanding of RESTful/SOAP API design and implementation.
- Excellent problem-solving skills and ability to work independently or in a team. • Familiarity with Agile/Scrum methodologies
- Ideally have exposure with golang and AWS CDK.

Our Benefits:

You flex
– We are all different and we recognise that. You can flex how and when you need and we
have the opportunity to flex as work in a flexible capacity in an environment where you can bring your best self

Best You
- We strongly encourage our people to be their best selves and we have internal and external training plus structured and defined career paths, NGEN memberships, peer mentoring, team shadow opportunities

Your leave, your way
- purchase additional annual leave, inclusive paid parental leave policy that supports all parents and carers, paid wellbeing day, paid community service and volunteering leave days, swap a public holiday for a day of significance

Support You
– We have partnered with wellbeing market leader, Sonder, which provides our people and their immediate family, free human centric wellbeing and care support 24/7. We also provide discounted gym memberships, clothing apparel and discounted online wellbeing retailers

Celebrate You
- Active Reward and Recognition Program for peer-to-peer kudos!

If you’re curious, brave, and ready to leap into a career like no other, then apply now!

If you meet some of the requirements of the role, but not all, we encourage you to submit your application. oOh! actively seeks to include and values the unique talents, perspectives, experiences, and contributions of all people, and is committed to equality, diversity, and inclusion.
We are committed to providing a work environment in which everyone is included, treated fairly and with respect. We celebrate our uniqueness and know that our strength lies in our different background, ideas, and perspectives.
As an equal opportunity employer, we strongly encourage applications from all peoples, all cultures and all gender identities from Australia and New Zealand.

oOh! is committed to employing team members who align with our Values and who meet the requirements of the role. As part of the recruitment process, there are a number of checks which may be conducted to demonstrate your suitability for a role including police / criminal background checks, medical, drug and alcohol testing, due diligence checks, right to work checks, and/or reference checks.

Back to Top

postTitle: DevOps Manager - Azure, CGP, AWS, Kubernetes, Terraform, CI/CD
debugText:
**DevOps Manager - Azure, CGP, AWS, Kubernetes, Terraform, CI/CD**

The
**DevOps Manager - Azure, CGP, AWS, Kubernetes, Terraform, CI/CD** will build, maintain, optimise and uplift self-service infrastructure delivering and driving an agile, stable, and secure platform across Public & Private Clouds and Data Centres, whilst managing a team of 6 Cloud and Infrastructure Engineers. With a focus on driving operational enhancements and driving the Cloud platform strategy across the business. Working with architects to design and deploy cloud first services. Collaborate closely with Product Management, Solution Architecture, stakeholders, and governance teams to deliver solutions aligning with architectural requirements, across an Australian Enterprise business within Queensland.

**DevOps Manager - Azure, CGP, AWS, Kubernetes, Terraform, CI/CD -**

**Essential Skills:**

- Demonstrated (8+ years) experience working with GCP/Azure/AWS and a proven track record of building cloud infrastructure
- Demonstrated track record of managing high calibre Cloud and Engineering teams across high profile corporate companies
- Strong understanding of VPC, security and monitoring and experience implementing best practices
- Good knowledge of Kubernetes, Containers, Terraform, GitHub, Infrastructure as Code (IaC), Docker
- Proficient in CICD tools and technologies including Jira, GitHub, Buildkite
- Excellent troubleshooting and analysis skills.
- Ability to effectively present information to different target audiences both verbally and in writing

**DevOps Manager - Azure, CGP, AWS, Kubernetes, Terraform, CI/CD** Please apply by uploading your CV through the link and one of the Expertech team will be in touch with further details. You must currently have Australian permanent residency or be an Australian Citizen to be considered for this role.

postTitle: Senior Network Engineer - Cloud / Terraform / Automation
debugText:
**A leading Financial Services provider is seeking a Senior Network Engineer with strong Cloud (AWS / Azure), Terraform and automation expertise to join their team on a permanent basis.**

You will be joining a growing, high-performing team who are responsible for the design, engineering, implementation and support of network devices deployed on public cloud (AWS / Azure). In this role you will be required to utilise your strong automation and Terraform knowledge and help write IaC from scratch based on requirements from the team to ensure the stability and operations of their cloud network.

You will be a self-starter who is inquisitive, keen to learn and keen expand your skills and knowledge within cloud networking. Being a senior role, this client is seeking candidates who can help contribute and build the team %%U+0027%% s skills and experience, especially in relation to writing clean IaC and automating where possible.

**To be successful in this role you will need:**

- Tertiary qualifications and/or relevant vendor certifications (CCIE, AWS, etc.)
- Demonstrated cloud network engineering delivery experience gained within large, complex environments
- Advanced knowledge and experience using Terraform to write IaC
- Strong automation experience using tools such as Ansible
- Excellent scripting skills (Python)
- Superior troubleshooting and problem-solving skills
- Excellent verbal and written communication skills
- Strong teamwork skills with the ability to work independently as required

**This is a Sydney based role and requires candidates to attend the office two days per week.**

**An attractive salary package is on offer. To be excited for this exciting opportunity, please apply online today.**

postTitle: AWS Solution Designer with DevSecOps - Sydney based
debugText:
Leading software company requires a AWS Solution Designer with DevSecOps for a permanent role based in North Sydney.

 Your role will see you responsible for designing and implementing secure, reliable, and scalable systems on the AWS cloud platform, working in alignment and directions from the organisation %%U+0027%% s Enterprise Architect. Ideally you will have a strong background in AWS services, infrastructure automation, and information security.

**You day to day responsibilities will include:**

- Develop and maintain system architecture designs and documentation, ensuring alignment with business goals and technical requirements.
- Design and implement solutions on the AWS platform that are scalable, reliable, and secure, with a focus on infrastructure automation and integrating security into all phases of the software development lifecycle.
- Work with development teams to ensure that solutions are designed with security in mind, and that best practices are followed.
- Develop and maintain security controls, including vulnerability management, access controls, and intrusion detection.
- Conduct security testing and assessments, including penetration testing, code reviews, and vulnerability scanning.
- Collaborate with operations teams to ensure that solutions are designed with operational excellence in mind, including monitoring, logging, and automation.
- Provide technical leadership and guidance to development and operations teams, and ensure that technical best practices are followed.
- Participate in incident response and lead investigations into security incidents.

**To succeed in this role, you will have:**

- Bachelor %%U+0027%% s degree in Computer Science, Information Security, or related field.
- Extensive experience in AWS solutions architecture, infrastructure automation, or information security.
- Strong experience in AWS services, including EC2, S3, RDS, and Lambda.
- Effective experience in infrastructure automation using tools such as Terraform, Ansible, and AWS CloudFormation.
- Experience in information security, including vulnerability management, access controls, and intrusion detection.
- Strong experience in security testing and assessments, including penetration testing, code reviews, and vulnerability scanning.
- Knowledge of industry-standard security frameworks such as NIST, ISO 27001, and OWASP.
- AWS Certified Solutions Architect - Associate or Professional.
- Excellent communication and collaboration skills, able to work effectively with development and security teams.
- Certifications such as CISSP, CISM, OSCP, and/or Azure Certified Solutions Architect are a plus.

**In return a fantastic salary is on offer for the successful candidate.**

**A hybrid work model is in place.**

**Public transport consisting of Trains, Buss & Trams are a 5 min walk away.**

**Please call Patrick Egan @ TalentWeb on 0407 261 441 for a Confidential Discussion or just hit the apply button below.**

postTitle: Senior Software Engineer (Open to remote locations across Australia)
debugText:
**Job Description**

**Hi.** We’re OFX, a global provider of online, international payment services. We solve the complexity of moving money and enable better decisions. Headquartered in Sydney with offices worldwide, we’re a customer-focused business that is all about inspiring customer confidence.

At OFX, you’ll have the opportunity to reach beyond your role and function across disciplines. Make use of your diverse skill set at a business that values your expertise and turn your potential into reality.

**Purpose of your role**

The Senior Software Engineer role is responsible for delivering high quality code in a timely manner while leading and working with the engineering managers to design solutions as appropriate. Working in an agile environment you will provide technical leadership and provide senior technical expertise and support while delivering quality software. On a day to day basis the Senior Software Engineer is actively helping lead the continuous improvement of our technical delivery and agile processes while positively leading and contributing to discussions and team dynamics.

The Senior Software Engineer will proactively help push the technical standards and quality of the team forwards. The Senior Software Engineer is responsible for delivering high quality application, automation and testing code in accordance with industry best practice and OFX guidelines.

This exciting new position involves becoming an integral part of our agile team dedicated to crafting and overseeing the heart of OFX. You %%U+0027%% ll contribute to impactful engineering and product initiatives, focusing on core capabilities like FX and treasury services.

Where required, the Senior Software Engineer will take on the technical leadership of a piece of work by performing the function of a technical lead on a task.

**What you do**

- Work closely with the solution and application architects, help improve our coding practices while delivering code and participating in code reviews.
- Ensure code is efficient and adheres to OFX coding standards and guidelines and industry best practices.
- Ensure that our capability and expertise continue to evolve by motivating the teams and promoting a collaborative working environment.
- Identify complex areas of code that require refactoring and technical debt and ensure these are addressed as appropriate.
- As part of an agile team assist outside of your core skills including deployments, QA and level 3 support when appropriate.
- Actively provide appropriate leadership as part of the product development team including mentorship and coaching.
- Work collaboratively within the agile team to deliver user stories. Owning stories to ensure they meet all functional and non-functional acceptance criteria.
- Work with the solution and application architects to create solutions and conduct spikes when required.
- Participate in design reviews and proof of concepts.
- Maintain consistent and constant communication with stakeholders.

**Qualifications**

**Valuable Experience**

- Demonstrated experience developing software. We’d like you to come equipped with expert knowledge in
 C# and .NET (Core and Framework).
- Extensive experience with commercial software development required.
- Experience designing, building, and working with RESTful APIs.
- Experience building and running distributed systems
- Experience operating services on serverless or containerized environments
- Good understanding of cloud-native application architectures (we use AWS)
- Knowledge of the client/server technology stack and tools (HTTP, Auth, Timeouts, Retries)
- Extensive experience with relational databases like SQL Server or Postgres.
- Knowledge of event-driven architecture and systems
- Excellent understanding of Agile development methodology and development practices such as TDD, Scrum, Kanban etc.
- Extensive experience with unit testing and acceptance criteria frameworks
- Experience with architectural design patterns and data modelling and design

**Desirable Experience**

- Experience with Infrastructure as Code (CloudFormation/CDK/Terraform) and DevOps practices
- Experience working with NoSQL storage solutions like DynamoDB
- Experience with Software as a Service (SaaS) product development
- Knowledge of cross-border payments and systems

**Additional Information**

**What it %%U+0027%% s like working at OFX**

We’re OFXers because we want to make a difference. We see challenges as opportunities and we’re not afraid to roll up our sleeves to get stuff done. We’re committed to making things easier for our clients, pushing boundaries and continuing to move with the times so that we can continue to inspire confidence every day and through every transaction.

We operate as one team, cross-functionally and globally, to drive outcomes that deliver excellence for our customers. We %%U+0027%% re curious self-starters who love learning and sharing our knowledge with others. We embrace change and use our initiative and resilience to overcome challenges.

- **Always keep learning.** We offer a wide range of learning and career development opportunities to help every OFXer build their capacity and career, with leadership training, secondments, internal mobility and access to a large library of online learning.
- **Make a difference.** Through our Make a Difference program, we encourage OFXers to give back to causes and communities that are important to them. We celebrate this with an annual volunteer day, which OFXers can use together or individually, as well as matched giving and the opportunity to nominate charity of choice every quarter.
- **Reward and recognition.** We recognise a job well done. OFXers are encouraged to celebrate their peers’ effort, technical expertise or support through a range of global and regional channels and awards, including quarterly and annual awards, milestones and shout outs.
- **Showing our social side.** Our Good Vibes employee-led committees around the globe organize events to help keep our employees engaged inside and outside the office. Whether it’s a wellbeing activity, end of year celebration, or a monthly team get-together, our team wants you to feel welcome!
- **Benefits that mean something.** We offer a range of fantastic benefits, including health insurance, primary and secondary gender neutral carer parental leave (16 weeks) or birthday leave, you %%U+0027%% ll feel well-supported at OFX.
- **A great work environment.** Enjoy work-life balance and flexibility with our hybrid work model, in an inclusive, diverse and non-hierarchal culture.

At OFX, we are committed to fostering a diverse, inclusive and accessible workplace where we value, respect, and encourage our people to be their authentic selves. With an employee base as diverse as the clients we serve, we know that fostering an inclusive workplace is fundamental to our continued success. If you require accommodation for any portion of the recruitment and hiring process, please email us at people.culture@ofx.com.

We encourage you to apply if this role aligns with your career aspirations.

Join our team at FinXL as an **AWS DevOps Engineer** and work onsite at one of our banking clients in Sydney CBD.

**About the role**

- Support an existing Kafka platform
- Build and on-board new tools and technologies
- Provide operational support for Kafka and related AWS services, including on-call rotation

- 6+ years of experience with DevOps and AWS technologies
- Proven experience with Confluent Kafka: setup, configuration and management of clusters
- Good knowledge of AWS computing, storage, networking and security
- Experience with scripting languages (Python or Bash) and automation tools

- Hybrid working with 3 days per week in the office in Sydney CBD

If you would like to be considered, please click the apply button and address your application to Julia Leung. Because of the high volume of applications we can only contact successful candidates.

FinXL IT Professional Services is an established, innovative Australian company, providing technology enabled business solutions and consulting services across a number of industries. Through the delivery of services and implementation of new systems, processes and technology, we assist our clients to gain competitive advantage and reach new heights.

postTitle: Senior Development Security Operations Engineer/Tech Lead- Fintech
debugText:
We are hiring a Senior - Lead Dev **Sec** Ops engineer for an award-winning Fintech. You %%U+0027%% ll work with very talented peers across Software Engineering, Data Science and DevOps / Platform engineering and directly influence future strategy and tools in security. This is a hands-on role where you will own the continued maintenance, implementation of best practices when it comes to the Security and compliance (ISO 27001) for their product which leverages Data and AI for banking and financial clients.

Because of the Software x Data product nature, we are seeking someone who began their career in Software Engineering (Java) before focussing on **DevSecOp** s / Security.

For the successful candidate, this is quite a unique and attractive opportunity!

- Successful scale-up (they have been around for years, have steady revenue, won awards from major cloud provider, continued growth)
- Flexible work (2 Days in Sydney CBD) and good work-life balance, no crazy expectations sometimes associated with  %%U+0027%% start-ups %%U+0027%% .
- You will be the expert - hands-on for all things security and compliance which includes staying on top of evolving requirements around data privacy and security
- Work with large banking data sets, AI and a SaaS product used by tier one banks - but part of a faster-moving team that values innovation

**Required Skills & Experience:**

- 4 + years of experience in a security engineering or DevSecOps role
- 4 + years of prior experience in software engineering, with very heavy preference for Java / J2EE
- Experience with ISO 27001
- Some experience doing Penetration testing / Vulnerability testing on applications
- Experience with GCP, AWS or Azure, including event / messaging such as Kafka or PubSub or Rabbit MQ
- Full Australian Work rights and ability to work 2 days / week in Sydney CBD

**Desirable Skills & Experience:**

- Python, Go or Rust experience
- Build and integration of APIs
- Specific experience with banking data and applications
- DevOps/platform experience across Docker, Kubernetes, Jenkins, Elastic, Kibana, Terraform or alternatives

- Build and manage **Kubernetes**, logging, and monitoring systems.

debugText:
At the Bank we recognise people who want to be part of a team, to be recognised for what they do, and how they help the Australian people.

RBA is currently seeking a Tech Lead to join our Platform Engineering team in IT for a 2-year fixed term contract.

**About the Team**

At the RBA, Platform Engineering is shaping the future of DevOps at the Bank. It is key to leading the way in which automation changes the way we deliver.

This role is central to the Group and supporting the DevOps services of the entire Bank.

- Work as part of a team managing and supporting our platforms with a focus on CI/CD Pipelines, and DevOps practices.

- Automate and establish new frameworks and patterns.

- Support and maintain the DevOps Security ensuring platforms are secure and stable.

- Advocate the DevOps practices and DevOps principals across the teams.


**About you**

- You are passionate about DevOps and toolchains.

- You love to solve problems.

- You love to write code.

- You are enthusiastic about change, and want to help make things better.

- You look to complete tasks the right way, not necessarily the fastest or easiest way.


**Skills & Expertise required**

- Experience with DevOps tools such as Azure DevOps Services, Maven, and Artifactory or equivalent technologies.

- You have at least 6 years of programming or scripting experience.

- Highly experienced on PowerShell and Java or .Net. Also, across few languages such as Python, Bash, JavaScript, YAML.

- Experience establishing and maintaining CI/CD and Release Pipelines.

- Deep understanding of GitOps and DevSecOps.

- Deep understanding of security tools and processes

- Experience working with API %%U+0027%% s.

- Experience working in Agile/Scrum/Kanban teams.

- Experience with Kubernetes.

- Experience with Azure Cloud.


**Good to have**

- Previous automation experience on any scripting language.

- Familiarity on building pipelines on Azure Devops Services


**Your development & career**

We recognise that you may only know some of the technologies we use at the Bank. That is why we will work with you to fill any knowledge gaps and provide training where necessary to ensure you can fulfil your role. Platform Engineering as well as the Bank has job progression pathways to ensure each team member can explore and grow their career at the Bank.

Team members get to explore technology, products, and services with the wider Platform Engineering team, regularly crossing over and contributing where they can.

**Be More**

The RBA makes an important contribution to the Australian economy through the pursuit of national economic policy objectives and associated activities in financial markets and banking. We also issue Australia %%U+0027%% s banknotes and operates infrastructure critical to the payments system, all of which contribute to the welfare of the Australian people.

Made up of specialists across a wide range of fields, our people have a meaningful role to play in achieving these objectives. Our people conduct themselves with a high degree of integrity, while striving for excellence in the work they perform and the outcomes they achieve. We encourage intelligent inquiry, and we treat one another with respect while promoting the public interest through our efforts.

We know it is the growth and success of our people that drives the Bank forward. Come and make a bigger contribution while you build and develop your own skills too, because being more means you can do more, for yourself and for Australia.

**The Reserve Bank of Australia is an equal opportunity employer. We are committed to crafting a diverse and inclusive environment and encourage applications from expert candidates seeking workplace flexibility.**

debugText:
**How will I help?**

The Senior Automation Engineer function plays an important role in the development and maintenance of technical solutions on the hybrid cloud and ensures that the detailed design and operations are fit for purpose.

Your key responsibilities include:

- Provide expert technical expertise to Enterprise Compute and Storage Services teams, covering all aspects of the cloud within a specific service or pattern.
- Set direction and oversight for the consistent use and implementation of tools, standards, methods and processes to ensure that quality services are developed with consistent and maintainable code which supports risk, secure operations, and compliance management.
- Apply expert knowledge of service or pattern to inform Platform Architecture and Service Engineering to continuously improve pattern and/or platform designs.
- Deliver cost estimates for the design and development of services in partnership with the Service Engineer, Cloud Lifecycle Manager, subject matter experts and solution providers to provide accurate and timely cost estimates.
- Deliver the build, deployment, and operations of automated cloud enabled patterns, tools, and platforms.
- Apply Agile frameworks, techniques and processes and overlay agile reporting and governance to deliver incremental value to areas of responsibility.
- Demonstrate a deep understanding and a high level of experience with DevOps, CI/CD, SecOps, test driven development (TDD) and other high maturity practices.
- Accountable for backup and recovery procedures to ensure effective Disaster Recovery plans are developed, documented, tested and implemented.
- Contribute to the common “one team” mindset that includes collaboration and a sense of joint responsibility between Westpac teams and suppliers.
- Keep abreast of business strategies and developments and use this knowledge to advance technology and requirement solutions to assist our customers and suppliers.

**What’s in it for me?**

You will play an important and significant part in the future of a business that has been around for 200 years. Our vision is to become one of the world’s great service companies. So, we will back you in the development of your career, with internal career prospects and flexible working. You will also be backed by a fantastic team of people in a can-do, supportive structure.

Whatever shape your family takes, we offer generous paid and unpaid parental leave for your nominated primary and support carers. This includes leave to organise adoptions, surrogacy, and foster care arrangements.

**What do I need?**

- Proficiency in advanced analysis, problem-solving, troubleshooting, and consultative skills with a strong emphasis on Ansible automation.
- Comprehensive knowledge, problem solving, troubleshooting and consultative skills of the AIX or Redhat Enterprise Linux Operating Systems and Services.
- Demonstrated expertise in Ansible or related automation tools such as Chef and AWX.
- Ability to develop automation code using Ansible, along with proficiency in scripting languages like Ruby, PowerShell, and Python.
- Demonstrate ability to develop automation code within RUBY, PowerShell,
Python
or any other scripting language.
- Demonstrable knowledge in one or more of automation and orchestration products/platforms (like vRO, Terraform, Azure Resource Manager, AWS CloudFormation etc.)
- Proficient in DevOps tools including Artifactory, Jira, Bamboo, and Git, with a focus on integrating Ansible playbooks into CI/CD pipelines.
- Applied understanding of technical concepts of enterprise architecture and contemporary IT strategies.
- Experience in Agile methodologies with good understanding and working knowledge of Scrum, Kanban, Scaled Agile Framework (SAFe), test driven development (TDD), customer centric design, and behaviour driven development (BDD).
- Tertiary qualifications in IT or related.

**What is it like to work there?**

We are a collaborative team of passionate people with a shared ambition to make a difference for our customers, our communities and each other. At Westpac, making a difference means creating impact, unlocking our own and each other’s passions, and transformative success stories to create better futures together.

As well as competitive remuneration and a great culture, joining the Westpac family gives you access to a wide range of employee benefits
to help you manage your priorities - whether that means family life, work/life balance, ambition to grow or all the little perks in between.

We’ll empower you to shape your career path.
Through personalised upskilling, mentoring, and training opportunities, you’re in control of where you start and how you’ll grow.
 As an equal opportunity employer, we are proud to have created a culture and work environment that values diversity and flexibility – and champions inclusion.

Hear from some of our people
and their experiences working with us. #LI-Hybrid.

**How do I Apply?**

Start here. Just click on the **APPLY** button.

At Westpac, we’re all about creating a supportive culture and ensuring our workplaces, branches, products, and services are accessible and inclusive for everyone—our customers, employees, and the wider community. If you’re interested in discussing workplace flexibility, please feel free to mention it in your application.

We invite candidates of all ages, genders, sexual orientation, cultural backgrounds,
people with disability, neurodiverse individuals, veterans and reservists, and Indigenous Australians to apply. If you have questions about the recruitment process,
please email [talentacquisition@westpac.com.au](mailto:talentacquisition@westpac.com.au).

**Do you need reasonable adjustments during the recruitment process?**

We can provide reasonable adjustments for individuals with disability and/or neurodiversity. If you require an adjustment to be made during the recruitment process at any stage, please email
[talentacquisition@westpac.com.au](mailto:talentacquisition@westpac.com.au)

- Join a customer-obsessed technology business at the heart of Australia %%U+0027%% s largest retailer
- Opportunity to work on the latest technology and methodology

**Welcome to WooliesX**

As a business inside one of Australia %%U+0027%% s largest retailers, WooliesX aims to bring the best of Woolworths Group to our customers.

We %%U+0027%% re an innovation business that brings together the brightest minds in e-commerce, technology, media, and data to transform how people live and shop. With an industry-leading technology team backed by analytics, we %%U+0027%% re resourceful and willing to experiment. Our agile teams are empowered to innovate and deliver an excellent experience for our customers - whether they shop in-store or online.

**What you %%U+0027%% ll do**

As a leader in this space your aim is to balance current operations with transitioning technologies. This includes planning and reviewing changes to the architecture while working with teams to evangelise and coordinate solution roll out. The investments in the data and application hosting spaces enable squads to focus more on the customer value proposition while gaining resiliency and efficiency through collaboration.

- Define and drive a squad %%U+0027%% s roadmap
- Discuss with stakeholders to refine priorities and allocate resources
- Work closely with Architects and Engineers to design, build, deploy, manage and operate environments
- Coach and assist engineers to uplift capability and spread domain knowledge
- Bring the best practices from across the Engineering practice into the delivery cycle
- Evaluate all platform and service consumption to optimise costs

**What you %%U+0027%% ll bring**

- DevSecOps
- Cloud Native Application Development
- Relational & Document Databases
- Service Integration Patterns
- Automated Testing Practices

- Cloud - Microsoft Azure, Google Cloud Platform
- Code - Powershell, Bash, C#, .NET Core, NodeJS, GoLang

- CI - Azure DevOps, GitHub
- Infrastructure - Kubernetes (AKS / GKE), Terraform
- Observability - App Insights, Dynatrace, Azure Log Analytics, Google Cloud Monitoring

**What %%U+0027%% s in it for you**

We embrace diversity of thought and love to take on challenges with a pragmatic and innovative approach. Our culture thrives on mutual respect, care, curiosity, openness, and a proactive attitude. We continually seek ways to pair, collaborate, support, and learn from each other as a team!

**Endless possibilities with Woolworths Group**

We %%U+0027%% re a proud part of the Woolworths Group - 200,000+ bright minds, passionate hearts and unique perspectives working together connected by a shared Purpose - ‘to create better experiences together for a better tomorrow. %%U+0027%% 

Here you %%U+0027%% ll be supported and empowered to explore new ideas, make brave commitments and innovate better ways to meet the food and everyday needs of more than 24 million customers every week. As one of the largest employers in Australia and New Zealand, we aim to create a truly inclusive workplace where everyone feels that they belong, can be their best selves, and reach their full potential.

We encourage all candidates to apply; please let us know in your application if we can support you with any adjustments in the hiring process.

Our Talent Acquisition Team and Hiring Leaders kindly request no unsolicited resumes or approaches from Recruitment Agencies. Woolworths Group is not responsible for any fees related to unsolicited resumes.

postTitle: Lead Software Engineer - Sydney / Melbourne / Adelaide
debugText:
We %%U+0027%% re seeking **Lead Software Engineers** to join our development teams in Sydney, Melbourne or Adelaide! In this role, you %%U+0027%% ll be pivotal in designing, building, and maintaining products and platform services, and infrastructure that powers global logistics.

**About you:**

We value your coding skills, regardless of whether you specialize in C#.NET or other programming languages. We prioritize expertise over mere checkboxes.

- Experience in building large-scale services and enterprise software.
- Proficiency in C#, Python, Java, JavaScript, C++, and similar languages.
- Expertise in databases like SQL, NoSQL, or MongoDB.
- Strong knowledge of DevOps tools like Docker, Kubernetes, or Jenkins.
- Proven experience designing and developing complex software solutions focusing on scalability, reliability, and performance.
- Experience leading technical teams, mentoring and guiding junior developers.
- Ability to drive technical excellence and innovation through best practices, code reviews, and architectural improvements.

**Our Development Team**

WiseTech Global is a renowned **Australian Software Development Company** specializing in advanced solutions for the logistics industry. Our flagship product **CargoWise One** is a testament to our commitment to innovation. With a mission to enhance the efficiency of global supply chains, we offer a comprehensive platform that integrates all aspects of logistics from origin to destination. Over the last five years, we %%U+0027%% ve invested over AUD 1 billion in product development, resulting in more than 5500 enhancements to our CargoWise platform.

By joining our development teams, you %%U+0027%% ll have the autonomy to drive meaningful projects. We pride ourselves on our flat structure and collaborative culture. With 3500 weekly upgrades facilitated by continuous delivery and automated deployment, you %%U+0027%% ll be part of a team committed to pushing boundaries. Quality is central to our engineering ethos with **Test Driven Development** as our guiding principle.

While we value problem-solving skills, curiosity, and passion in our Engineers, here are some of the technologies you can expect to work with:

- Languages: C#, SQL, TypeScript/JavaScript

debugText:
ONE REC Global are working exclusively with a Software Engineering company who are leading the way in delivering outstanding solutions to their customers.

Due to continued growth they are looking to add a Principal DevSecOps Engineer to the team. Ideally we would be looking for someone in Sydney but also open to people in Melbourne and Brisbane.

This role will be primarily work from home but may require travel interstate and international from time to time.

Your Skills:

- 8+ years of experience in IT, with at least 5 years in DevSecOps or cloud security roles.
- Proven track record of designing and implementing secure Azure cloud solutions.
- Experience with security automation and orchestration.
- Hands-on experience with Azure Security Center, Azure Policy, and Azure Monitor.
- Previous involvement in incident response and threat mitigation in Azure.


Your Knowledge:

- Strong proficiency in Microsoft Azure services and resources.
- In-depth understanding of cloud security concepts and practices.
- Knowledge of DevOps and CI/CD tools (e.g., Azure DevOps, Jenkins, Git).
- Familiarity with containerization technologies such as Docker and Kubernetes.
- Experience with scripting and automation using PowerShell, Python, or similar languages.
- Expertise in identity and access management (Azure Active Directory).
- Understanding of security compliance standards and regulatory requirements.
- Threat detection and incident response skills in Azure environments.
- Knowledge of infrastructure as code (IaC) principles and tools (e.g., ARM templates, Terraform).

About You:

- Driven attitude that thrives on working as an integral part of team that strives for success
- Highly organised and detail-oriented
- Ability to work in a fluid, fast-paced environment
- A quick learner who seeks to continually improve their capacity to take on increased responsibilities
- Excellent communicator

With a developing company culture, true career progression, work/life balance and a competitive salary package ($120,000 - $160,000 plus superannuation) to match this is a fantastic opportunity to take the next step in your career.

debugText:
**_Together we shape thriving communities, public spaces, places and economies._**

- **Are you a seasoned DevOps professional with a passion for leading complex cloud deployments?**
- **Temporary (up to 2 years) full-time opportunity**
- **Parramatta/ Sydney Office preferred however other established NSW locations may be considered.**
- **Clerk Grade 11/12 - Salary relative to experience and ranges from $139,787 to $161,663 + super**

**What’s in it for me?**

Join our team for a **fantastic culture** with dynamic collaboration and **genuine long-term career support**. We offer **flexibility in work arrangements**, diverse and fulfilling assignments, and prioritize **work/life balance** and wellbeing with initiatives like flex leave and access to support programs. Additionally, we are committed to **fostering a diverse and inclusive workplace** where everyone feels welcome, respected, and empowered to succeed.

**The role**

As the **Principal DevOps Lead**, you will take charge of our critical public cloud applications hosted in both AWS and Azure. You will provide technical leadership and expertise in software deployment, manage technology-based services, and ensure the integrity of our systems while implementing new initiatives. Your role will involve recognising and remediating cyber security vulnerabilities, updating infrastructure and application stacks, and scripting in multiple languages. With at least 5 years of multi-cloud experience, you’ll excel in writing templates in YAML, JSON, BICEP & ARM, and reverse engineering CI/CD pipelines to create new automation stacks.

This challenging role requires a proactive approach to managing support requests, sustaining service integrity, and meeting customer deadlines. You will be at the forefront of evaluating new technologies, resolving service problems, and leading deployment projects.

For more information read the full Role Description:
**[Principal DevOps Lead](https://www.dpie.nsw.gov.au/?a=621015)**

**What you will bring to the role**

- Excellent communication skills, both verbal and written, to effectively articulate and convey complex or technical information to diverse stakeholders.
- Outstanding problem-solving abilities to navigate complex challenges and adapt to evolving situations in a project delivery environment.
- Enjoys autonomy and demonstrates strong proficiency in working independently, taking initiative, and making decisions.
- Solid time management and organisational skills to prioritise tasks and meet deadlines efficiently.
- Creativity and innovation to bring fresh ideas and approaches to problem-solving and project development.
- Capable of driving outcomes while effectively involving stakeholders throughout the process, fostering collaboration and buy-in.

**What is an essential requirement:**

- Relevant experience or tertiary qualification in computer science or related field and/or recognised industry certifications.
- This role may include being on-call, weekend and after-hours work.

**About us**

The [Department of Planning, Housing and Infrastructure](https://www.nsw.gov.au/departments-and-agencies/department-of-planning-housing-and-infrastructure)
(DPHI) improves the liveability and prosperity of NSW. To achieve this, we: create vibrant, productive spaces and precincts; manage lands, assets and property effectively and deliver affordable and diverse housing. We strive to be a high-performing, world-class public service organisation that celebrates and reflects the full diversity of the community we serve and

debugText:
**Job Title:** Senior Data Engineer (AWS)

**Location:** Sydney

**Responsibilities:**

**Data Architecture and Design:**

- Design and implement scalable and efficient data pipelines for processing and analyzing large volumes of structured and unstructured data.
- Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand data requirements and contribute to the development of robust data architectures.

**AWS Cloud Expertise:**

- Leverage AWS services such as S3, Glue, Redshift, EMR, Lambda, and others to architect and implement end-to-end data solutions.
- Ensure optimal performance, security, and reliability of data infrastructure on the AWS cloud platform.

**Data Modeling and ETL:**

- Develop and maintain data models for efficient storage and retrieval of information.
- Implement Extract, Transform, Load (ETL) processes to integrate data from various sources into the data warehouse.

**Code Development:**

- Write efficient, modular, and maintainable code in languages such as Python, SQL, and others to support data processing and transformation.

**Quality Assurance:**

- Implement data quality checks and validation processes to ensure the accuracy and completeness of data.

**Collaboration and Documentation:**

- Collaborate with data scientists, analysts, and other stakeholders to understand data requirements and deliver solutions.
- Maintain clear and comprehensive documentation of data engineering processes and workflows.

**Performance Optimization:**

- Identify and implement strategies for optimizing data processing and improving overall system performance.

debugText:
**See yourself in our team**

You will be joining our CTO Engineering team. We are seeking passionate, cloud savvy, data engineers across diverse levels to help drive our commitments in our Data Strategy and achieve our vision for Commbank.data, a unified, world-class data platform enabling the next generation of AI (Artificial Intelligence) enabled applications.

You will collaborate with industry leaders to drive forward our mission of revolutionising the fintech landscape. As part of our team, you will be empowered to deliver world-class, competitive banking products and services with unparalleled levels of service and reliability.

We support our people with the flexibility to balance where work is done with at least half your time each month connecting in office. We also have many other flexible working options available including changing start and finish times, part-time arrangements and job share to name a few. Talk to us about how these arrangements might work for you.

**We are** **interested in hearing from people who:**

- Are proficient in languages such as Python, SQL, DBT.


- In-depth knowledge of AWS services, especially related to data storage and processing such as S3, RDS, Redshift, Glue.


- Are familiar with the full software development lifecycle with a focus on data ingestion process, data transformation pipelines, data integration and visualisation.


- Understand data profiling, basics of numerical statistics and data quality calculations.


- Has experience in handling large-scale data processing and analytics.


- Can provide code quality control through peer programming, code review and automated pipeline release management.


- Can coach junior engineers, share knowledge to uplift and improve software development practices.


**Te** **chnical** **skills**

This is a senior technical role, requiring a broad range of tools, languages, and frameworks. You will be a good match if you have previous experience in:

- Developing 3-tier application both on-premises and on cloud covering Frontend, Backend and Databases.


- Developing data warehouses or data lakes.


- Experience with AWS services such as Glue, Lambda, SageMaker, or EMR.


- Infrastructure as code using CloudFormation or Terraform (desirable)


- Microservices design and implementation of highly scalable APIs.


- CI/CD tools (i.e. GitHub Actions).


- Familiarity with technologies like Apache Kafka, AWS Kinesis, or similar.


- Familiarity with visualisation tools such as PowerBI, Tableau or similar.


**Developed knowledge/understanding of (good to have)**

- AWS certification with exposure to any of the following AWS Lambda, S3, Redshift, Athena, EMR, Glue, DynamoDB.


- Application Security


- Containerization (Docker, Kubernetes)


- Observability tools (i.e. Splunk or AppDynamics).


- Scripting using Python, SQL, DBT, Scala, Go.


- Tableau, PowerBI for data visualization.


**Working with us**

Whether you are passionate about customer service, driven by data, or called by creativity, a career with us is for you.

Our people bring their diverse backgrounds and unique perspectives to build a respectful, inclusive, and flexible workplace with flexible work locations. We are looking for people who truly live our values, care, courage and commitment and we will offer you exceptional opportunities to develop your career with us.

If you are ready to be part of a forward-thinking company that values innovation, teamwork, and security, **apply now** and help shape the future of fintech with us!

_Whether you %%U+0027%% re passionate about customer service, driven by data, or called by creativity, a career here is for you._

_Our people bring their diverse backgrounds and unique perspectives to build a respectful, inclusive and flexible workplace._ _We are working hard to build a team of people who represent the rich diversity of our customers and communities. If you %%U+0027%% re excited about this opportunity but you don %%U+0027%% t meet every single requirement, or your experience doesn %%U+0027%% t align perfectly, we still want to encourage you to apply. You may just be the perfect candidate for this opportunity or another within CommBank._

_At CommBank we will inspire you with work that makes a difference, surround you with talented people that respect and value each other, and empower you to grow professionally and personally. Most of all, making_ _a positive impact for customers, communities and each other is part of our every day._

_We %%U+0027%% re determined to make a real difference for Australia %%U+0027%% s first peoples. We encourage all interested applicants to apply._ _If you %%U+0027%% re already part of the Commonwealth Bank Group (including Bankwest), you %%U+0027%% ll need to apply through Sidekick to submit a valid application. We %%U+0027%% re keen to support you with the next step in your career._

debugText:
**BizCover who ?**

You haven’t heard of us? We dominate the SME business insurance market by having an online platform that makes comparing and buying business insurance a super easy process. Not to toot our own horn but we have been recognized in Deloittes fast 50 companies as one of the fastest growing technology companies and Westpac’s top 20 businesses of tomorrow - #killingit

**So what?**

We are looking for a Senior Software Engineer to join our growing Engineering team and be an integral part of a team working on the core platform. There is a lot of opportunities to innovate and to learn from teammates. You will be working alongside senior engineers on BAU and project with the focus of moving into our newly built microservice platform.

**Requirements**

**What you %%U+0027%% ll be doing**

- Working in a scrum team delivering and documenting new features to the platform
- Working closely with the BA to ensure there is a good understanding of the requirements and delivering to those
- Collaborating with the QA in the team to ensure the right level of testing is implemented on both the engineering and QA side
- Collaborate with devops to improve our processes
- Help teammates both within and outside of the team
- Be proactive in clearing roadblocks that may come up
- Work directly with Clients / Stakeholders

**About you**

- Passionate about web development and enjoy creating amazing customer experiences
- Recognise the importance of high quality code through non negotiables like unit tests, integration/acceptance tests, performant, secure, robust clean code, etc.
- Solid Understanding of software delivery processes and tools eg. CI/CD
- Works in a structured logical way and doesn’t just jump into new tech without fully understanding it.
- Built applications used by a large number of external users and dealing with the challenges this brings.
- Good understanding of design patterns such as CQRS, DDD and why and when to use them.
- Functional understanding of cloud services (AWS/Azure/Google)
- Solid understanding of relational databases and ORMs (SQL Server and Entity Framework) and NoSql databases (nice to have)
- Worked in an Agile Scrum environment
- You would have a good high level understanding of the architecture you are working in
- We %%U+0027%% re building a new platform using microservices/apps and you would have a good understanding of it.

**Technical Requirements**

- Strong .Net 4.0+, C#, Web API, .Net Core
- Automated testing frameworks and approaches (Unit, Integration, Acceptance/End to End)

**Benefits**

- Attractive salary package with bonus potential!
- Hybrid working model

- Team/company events
- Business Casual dress code
- Growing company with huge progression opportunities

**What Kind of Person Works Well in our Company**

Diversity of employees makes for a creative and fun workplace.  BizCover is a melting pot of cultures and personalities, but to constantly strive to be the best we can, we look for people who are –

Customer Fanatics - _noun:_ a person who delivers a first class customer experience every time

Drumbeaters - _noun:_ a person who enthusiastically celebrates and supports their team mates and the business

Finishers - _noun:_ a person you can trust to get it done

Advancer - _noun:_ a person who always wants do better

**About the role**

Synechron Australia is seeking an experienced Sr. AWS Data Engineer to join our growing team in Sydney. In this full-time role, you will be responsible for designing, building, and maintaining scalable and efficient data solutions on the AWS cloud platform. You will work closely with our clients to understand their data challenges and provide innovative solutions to drive business value.

**What you %%U+0027%% ll be doing**

Design and implement robust and scalable data pipelines and data lakes on AWS
Develop and optimise data transformation and processing workflows using AWS services like Glue, Athena, Redshift, and EMR
Ensure data quality, security, and compliance by implementing appropriate data governance policies
Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including data analysts and business stakeholders, to understand requirements and deliver tailored solutions
Automate and streamline data engineering processes using tools like AWS CloudFormation, AWS Lambda, and CI/CD pipelines
Provide technical leadership, mentoring, and knowledge sharing within the data engineering team

**What we %%U+0027%% re looking for**

8+ years of experience in data engineering, with a strong focus on AWS technologies
Proficient in designing and implementing scalable, fault-tolerant, and cost-effective data pipelines on the AWS platform
Expertise in working with AWS services like S3, Glue, Athena, Redshift, EMR, and Kinesis
Hands-on experience with data processing frameworks like Apache Spark, Apache Airflow, and Apache Kafka
Strong programming skills in Python, Scala, or Java, and familiarity with SQL
Understanding of data modelling, data governance, and data security best practices
Excellent problem-solving and critical thinking skills, with the ability to work independently and collaboratively

**What we offer**

Competitive salary and bonus structure
Opportunities for career growth and professional development
Flexible work arrangements, including remote work options
Access to the latest technologies and industry-leading tools
Supportive and collaborative team environment
Comprehensive health and wellness benefits

**About us**

Synechron is a leading digital transformation consulting firm with a focus on the financial services industry. We combine our award-winning expertise in technology, business, and design to help our clients achieve their business goals. With a global presence and a diverse team of talented professionals, we are committed to driving innovation and delivering exceptional results for our clients.

Apply now to join our team and be a part of shaping the future of data engineering!

debugText:
**Company Description**

Nine. Australia’s Media Company.

Underpinned by our people, our strategic focus is on content, connections and growth.

Driven by our purpose - Australia belongs here - and guided by our values - walk the talk, turn over every stone, keep it human - we are the home of Australia’s most loved content
 and trusted brands across News, Sport, and Entertainment.

We lead the total television market in Australia through our key brands of Channel 9, Gem, Go, Rush and Life, and of course you can consume all our content, live or on-demand, on Australia’s leading free streaming platform, 9Now. We also own Stan, the market leading local subscription streaming service.

Our total publishing business covers The Sydney Morning Herald, The Age, The Australian Financial Review, to the breadth of nine.com.au and The Pedestrian Group.

In our total audio business we are building talk radio for the next generation across
 2GB, 3AW, 4BC and 6PR.

Nine is also an active participant in Australian consumer marketplaces through our majority shareholding in Domain and our ownership of Drive.

 **Job Description**

The Platform Solutions Team are central to how Nine deploy workloads to the cloud. You’ll be leading from the front in building out Nine’s cloud infrastructure to deliver the content that Australia loves.

You contribute to a learning-oriented workplace culture, being curious about the world around you, seeking new ways to explore and bring new thinking and practices to bear within your team. You remain open to learning new technologies and techniques, and finding creative ways to leverage this knowledge to further team goals.

You work in partnership with various product teams and practices enabling them to conduct rapid, stable, secure and repeatable deployments on Cloud and Kubernetes at scale.

You are structured and methodical in your process and have demonstrated skills building and delivering support services for 24/7 systems.

Day to Day, you will:

Enabling your team:

- Assist the team in a hands-on capacity as required
- Work with stakeholders to provide technical solutions to problems or issues
- Act as a enabler, removing roadblocks to progress as needed
- Work with team members to guide solutions towards business and technology goals
- Drive the continuous improvement of processes and ways of work to improve team capacity and capability

Technical Leadership:

- Drive adoption of best practice and best in class technology for workload management using Kubernetes (especially
EKS)
- Remove single points of failure by cross-skilling staff and making sensible, strategic resourcing decisions
- Always be on the lookout for products, solutions and enhancements which address current or perceived future business problems

Drive high performance:

- Provide one on one feedback, career advice and coaching for your team members
- Communicate openly and be the voice of the business within your team, keeping them informed of and working towards the business vision & goals
- Participate in hiring and other HR processes affecting your team where needed
- Mentor team members to create a highly motivated, coherent, and cohesive culture which rewards high performance

 **Qualifications**

- AWS certifications, such as AWS Certified Solutions Architect - Associate or AWS Certified DevOps Engineer - Professional highly regarded
- Extensive experience in AWS infrastructure design and management, with a focus on account governance
- Experience provisioning and managing Cloud Services “as code” using: CDK, Terraform, Cloudformation, Saltstack, Ansible etc. via Jenkins, Teamcity, Concourse, etc
- Experience using a wide variety of AWS products in production environments
- Demonstrable understanding of designing, deploying and managing Kubernetes clusters (plural) at scale

 **Additional Information**

**Our Commitment to Diversity and Inclusion:**

We %%U+0027%% re committed to a safe, respectful and inclusive Nine. From day one, you %%U+0027%% ll be encouraged to bring your whole self to work and will be supported to perform at your best.

We encourage applications from Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people, people with disabilities, and of all ages, genders, nationalities, backgrounds and cultures as we recognise the importance and value of diverse perspectives. Should you require any adjustments to the recruitment process, please advise us when you apply.

_**Disclaimer**: We do not accept unsolicited agency resumes and are not responsible for any fees related to unsolicited resumes._

A Senior DevOps Engineer oversees the entire lifecycle of systems within the Platform Engineering domain, while also focusing on knowledge transfer and empowering other teams. They take the lead in solution design, working closely with Staff and Principal Engineers for support. Senior DevOps Engineers set the standard for efficient delivery and provide mentorship and guidance to their peers. They often become the go-to experts in their domain or for a specific technology.

**Essential Criteria:**

- Over 6 years of software development experience, with exposure to diverse technology stacks, including .NET technologies (C#, ASP.NET, .NET Core).
- Proven track record in DevOps or Site Reliability Engineering (SRE) roles, with a solid grasp of both software development and operations principles.
- Extensive hands-on experience with cloud platforms such as AWS, Azure, or Google Cloud Platform (with a preference for AWS).
- Practical knowledge of implementing and utilizing monitoring and observability tools like AWS CloudWatch/CloudTrail, DataDog, or Splunk.
- Proficiency in multiple programming and scripting languages, ideally C#, SQL, or PowerShell.
- Experience developing and managing applications built on the Microsoft stack (.NET, MS SQL).
- Familiar with CI/CD tools like Azure DevOps, Jenkins, GitHub Actions, or Octopus Deploy.
- Skilled in infrastructure as code (IaC) and configuration management tools such as Terraform, Puppet, Chef, or Ansible.
- Knowledge of containerization technologies (e.g., Docker) and orchestration platforms (e.g., Kubernetes).
- Awareness of security best practices in infrastructure and application security.

- Competitive salary and benefits package.
- Professional growth and development opportunities.
- Flexible working environment.

- You are a motivated .Net Engineer with a passion for Problem Solving
- Join one of our high-performing .Net engineering teams
- We are a team of big thinkers who are engineering the future of banking

**Do Work that Matters**

As a Senior Staff Software Engineer, you will be part of Cloud migration & application modernising team that enables Cloud adoption for the rest of the Bank. We put customers at the centre of everything we do. Together we use technology to drive efficient and timely processing, an essential component of great customer service.

The size and nature of our systems and the pace at which our customers %%U+0027%%  expectations are changing means we %%U+0027%% re always seeking out the latest technology, experimenting and pushing the boundaries. Our work is key to future proofing one of Australia %%U+0027%% s largest companies.

**See yourself in our team**

You %%U+0027%% ll migrate and modernise the applications used to power our entire business. You %%U+0027%% ll have the opportunity to pave the way for Cloud journey for complex applications and ensuring they are simpler, faster and more secure.

The cloud movement at CommBank is going strong and continues to grow. We %%U+0027%% re looking for out-of-the-box thinkers who want to use technology to work on real-world problems that have the potential to change the lives of our 17 million+ customers.

You %%U+0027%% ll be helping all CBA Business Units to adopt and deliver applications at scale by leveraging standard hosting patterns. In doing so, you will be helping the application teams with troubleshooting their application deployments from their code, the web servers and the cloud deployments. Your expertise in .NET and Software engineering will be a crucial element for you to be successful in this role.

**We %%U+0027%% re interested in hearing from people who**

- Proven experience in solution design and architecture.
- Have a passion for designing, developing and deploying high quality software solutions and Systems design.
- Have excellent debugging and troubleshooting skills on .Net
- Have experience in coaching & mentoring developers

- Are passionate about DevOps/Automation and have a powerful desire to solve complex problems in a systematic approach - e.g using PowerShell

- Work well in teams and have strong collaboration skills in driving continuous improved initiatives
- Solid understanding of software engineering fundamentals and best practices
- Take ownership of issues and follow through with end-to-end resolution of issues
- Work with various application teams to ensure the stability and security of the cloud platform
- Have natural drive to educate, communicate and positively influence various stakeholder groups
- Willingness to continuously learn new tools and technologies
- Should be well-versed in deploying, maintaining and troubleshooting .Net applications on IIS
- Good understanding on Software Development Kit (SDK) and runtime environments
- Have ability to think outside the box and break boundaries to solve complex problems
- Driving automation through understanding processes and implementing improvements
- Good understanding of networking and network protocol will be advantageous
- Strong presentation, verbal communication, and written communications skills
- Hands on skills with scripting
- Experience with the full software development lifecycle and delivery using Agile practices with specific focus on the following concepts: source control, CI/CD, automated testing, logging and monitoring
- Knowledge on cloud especially AWS is an added advantage
- Have a great understanding of software delivery practices and lifecycles in Agile methodologies

**Tech skills**

We use a broad range of tools, languages, and frameworks. We don %%U+0027%% t expect you to know them all but having significant experience and exposure with some of these (or equivalents) will set you up for success in this team

- Demonstrate strong experience developing applications using MS technologies - C# and .NET / .NetCore
- Sound knowledge of Microservices architecture and RESTful APIs
- Excellent debugging skills with ability to solve complex technical issues in .NET
- Experience operating and troubleshooting CI/CD pipelines
- Hold strong technical coding standards and contribute extensively to code reviews.
- Lead design discussions in developing robust systems
- Experience with Infrastructure as code and automating manual tasks
- Mentoring and coaching capabilities, able to influence practices and mindsets in the crew
- Develop, lead, and deploy CI/CD strategies
- CI/CD tooling such as GitHub, TeamCity, Artifactory, Octopus Deploy
- Logging & monitoring: CloudWatch, AppDynamics, Splunk, Grafana and Prometheus knowledge are desirable
- Automating repetitive tasks using Python, shell scripting, PowerShell etc.
- Ability to diagnose and troubleshoot problems across the CI/CD toolchain
- Have a fair understanding of networking, preferably on Cloud

**Apply today!**

We operate in a **hybrid working environment**, meaning a blend between being in the office and working remote.

_Whether you %%U+0027%% re passionate about customer service, driven by data, or called by creativity, a career here is for you._

_Our people bring their diverse backgrounds and unique perspectives to build a respectful, inclusive and flexible workplace._ _We are working hard to build a team of people who represent the rich diversity of our customers and communities. If you %%U+0027%% re excited about this opportunity but you don %%U+0027%% t meet every single requirement, or your experience doesn %%U+0027%% t align perfectly, we still want to encourage you to apply. You may just be the perfect candidate for this opportunity or another within CommBank._

_At CommBank we will inspire you with work that makes a difference, surround you with talented people that respect and value each other, and empower you to grow professionally and personally. Most of all, making_ _a positive impact for customers, communities and each other is part of our every day._

_We %%U+0027%% re determined to make a real difference for Australia %%U+0027%% s first peoples. We encourage all interested applicants to apply._ _If you %%U+0027%% re already part of the Commonwealth Bank Group (including Bankwest), you %%U+0027%% ll need to apply through Sidekick to submit a valid application. We %%U+0027%% re keen to support you with the next step in your career._

debugText:
- Based in Sydney, working in the Surry Hills Head Office 4 days a week
- Up to $170k to $180k base + super + 10% bonus + benefits
- Serverless Enterprise AWS, Node.Js, JavaScript / TypeScript, React Environment

**About the role**

Opportunity to join a fast-growing food retailer with a huge eCommerce environment looking at setting up their environment for exponential growth in Australia and international markets.

Their Digital Platforms (Web and Mobile) handle 100s of millions in revenue, with plans to grow this platform and help scale their business across Australia.

Your role will be an end to end full stack developer, refactoring code, adding features, following best practices within a modern server-less environment

**Key responsibilities will include:**

- Write clean, scalable, and maintainable code
- Revise, update, and refactor existing code
- Implement unit tests and E2E tests
- Take part in code reviews
- Get involved in weekly planning sessions
- Work closely with design, marketing, and sustainability teams

**Current technology stack**

- Our backend is an AWS hosted Node.js and PostgreSQL stack.
- We have RESTful API microservices created in strict Typescript
- We’ve recently added a GraphQL intermediate  %%U+0022%% backend for frontend %%U+0022%%  gateway, and we’re leveraging the OpenAPI specification to maintain consistency for internal communication.
- Frontend is built using React, mobile with React Native and backend in Node.Js
- For hosting, we’re using a mixture of Lambda and ECS instances.
- Events are handled using AWS queuing technologies (SQS, SNS). All provisioned using a mixture of Serverless framework and Terraform  %%U+0022%% infrastructure as code %%U+0022%%  tooling.

**Your background**

- High performing engineer operating at a Principal / Lead level, able to guide technical discussions, as well as develop and build robust environments.
- Sound experience as a Developer building, testing and developing applications
- Solid experience working with modern JavaScript development frameworks such as React or similar
- Sound Experience working with Node.JS
- Proven experience with SQL and relational databases (PostgreSQL).
- Proven experience in writing clean, scalable code (JavaScript / TypeScript)
- Ability to work within an agile team and an understanding of the processes
- Excellent communications, both verbal and written
- Experience with JIRA, Confluence, Git (we use bitbucket)
