- **Deloitte Australia %%U+0027%% s 2022 Best Managed Companies award**
- **Structured Mentoring, Training and Career Development opportunities**
- **Fun, Vibrant & Collaborative team. Hybrid work (2-3 days/week from home)**

************* Must hold Australian PR or Citizenship and be based in
 Sydney or Melbourne ****************

**About the company** AC3 is an Australian owned Multi-Cloud Solutions Provider with offices in Sydney, Melbourne and Auckland, servicing 1,200+ customers in AUS & NZ, across both private and government sectors.

Our expertise:

- Cloud and infrastructure

- Cyber security

- Software and data integration.

We %%U+0027%% ve been growing extensively, won exciting projects and are looking for more awesome tech lovers to join our family!

**About the role**

As an experienced DevOps Engineer, you will bring your technical expertise across AWS, Cloud Infrastructure, DevOps and IaC to deliver the best solutions for our customers.

Working closely with some of the brightest AWS gurus in Australia and NZ, you will grow and accelerate your learning.

- Deliver end to end design and deployment of complex cloud solutions
- Ensure all facets of infrastructure, security, automation, logging and monitoring are considered for each project.
- Work across a multitude of cloud infrastructure, security, systems and application platforms
- Implement cloud infrastructure, systems and application solutions and services with focus on CI/CD and automation tasks to treat

  Infrastructure as Code.
- Strong focus on Automation for all solutions
- Participate in code and design reviews
- Create infrastructure deployment templates (Terraform or CloudFormation)
- Create CI/CD pipelines
- Manage tools like JIRA and Git workflows according to best practices.
- Prepare relevant handover documentation needed for transition into ongoing support

**Skills & experience**

- 3-5 years of experience working as a DevOps Engineer
- Previous experience working with AWS
- Experience in Windows and Linux operating systems
- Experience working for an IT Services Provider across multiple customers highly regarded
- Strong skills across Python, Bash, Git, Jira, Terraform, Jenkins, Ansible
- Experience working in an agile environment

**Benefits**

- AWS Premier partner, Microsoft Gold & Tier 1 CSP partner
- Work with some of the brightest AWS gurus in the Industry
- Mature team environment with a high level of engagement
- Exposure to diverse customer environments (private and government)
- Strong investment in training & upskilling
- Structured mentoring and career growth opportunities
- Friendly, Flexible, and Supportive team environment
- Convenient Sydney CBD or Melbourne CBD location with modern offices... great vibe!!!
- Hybrid working environment - WFH 2 to 3 days per week
- Company benefits including discounted lifestyle services such as health insurance, salary packaging, and
half-day Fridays once a month!
- Lots of company social events
- $110,000-$130,000 + super + bonus + allowances

**Culture** People here have real relationships that go beyond work, and maintaining our awesome culture is a top priority at AC3. We believe it’s important that everyone is heard and treated with respect, whether you have the next big idea or simply a question. We keep it real and live by the 3 AC3 ways:

- **Work Wise**– As one AC3, we put our combined skills to work to ensure we do more good, for much less. All in service of our customers and each other.
- **Work Humble**– As a team, we bring our authentic selves to the world of tech. It’s our down-to-earth, humble nature that makes us unique and easy to work with.
- **Work Honest**– We’re here to do an honest day’s work, individually and as a team. We’re constantly looking for opportunities to take the initiative and implement practical solutions.

We’d love for you to experience the AC3 way for yourself!

**The Role:**

 Our client are a Global Fintech business based in Sydney. Through continued growth and a number of exciting new projects they have a requirement for a senior DevOps engineer to join on an initial 6 month daily rate contract.

**Key Responsibilities:**

Ensure CI/CD design and engineering processes adhere to existing engineering standards, have well defined process controls, and deliver an overall compliance reporting model.

Collaborate with engineers across the group to uplift and streamline environment management by implementing automation capabilities such as CI/CD.

Become an SME of the overall toolsets/processes used by software engineers across the SDLC including source code management, development tools and engineering practices with the goal of continuous improvement in agility, quality & process/tooling maturity.

Collaborate with the test automation and release management to embed best practices into the CI/CD process.

Ensuring major software development milestones are aligned to environment strategy.

**Key Skills:**

Cloud Engineering, DevOps, or Architecture certifications on AWS or GCP

Experience in delivering major programs of work in a complex, agile environment

Worked with, and delivered on, enterprise CI/CD capabilities and tools, providing guidance on best practices and helping enable major programs to deliver business value.

Demonstrated experience working in a Senior Cloud Engineering role in public, private and hybrid cloud environments.

Experience with running multi-cloud environments and a strong understanding of multitenancy and security implications.

Knowledge and experience with cloud concepts such as Infrastructure as a Service (IaaS), Platform as a Service (PaaS), and Software as a Service (SaaS).

Experience in working with cloud deployment and orchestration technologies at scale with strong knowledge of the fundamentals to include service discovery, deployment, monitoring, scheduling, and load balancing.

Knowledge of containerisation concepts and implementation considerations.

Experience with complex data structures and semi structured data (JSON, XML).

Experience with Design Governance, taking responsibility for the end-to-end software design process across a large program of work, collaborating with Architecture, Engineering, Developers, and Suppliers

Experience with CI/CD tools such as GitLab, GitHub, Cloud Build, CodeBuild

Experience in building and working with Docker container-based services or other CRE.

- Partner with multiple squads to collaborate and drive innovation
- Surry Hills based with hybrid working

**We are Woolworths Group**

We are Woolworths Group. 200,000+ bright minds, passionate hearts and unique perspectives connected by a shared Purpose - ‘to create better experiences together for a better tomorrow. %%U+0027%%  It %%U+0027%% s that Purpose that fuels our ambition to explore new ideas, make brave commitments and innovate better ways to meet the food and everyday needs of more than 24 million customers every week.

If you %%U+0027%% re excited to turn today %%U+0027%% s blue sky thinking into a better tomorrow for future generations, you %%U+0027%% ll find yourself supported and enriched in a dynamic, inclusive and empowering workplace that reflects the diverse communities we serve. With a culture of genuine care, a flexible approach to work and opportunities across the group to grow your career and make a meaningful impact, the possibilities for what we can achieve together are endless.

As a leader in this space your aim is to balance current operations with transitioning technologies. This includes planning and reviewing changes to the architecture while working with teams to evangelise and coordinate solution roll out. The investments in the data and application hosting spaces enable squads to focus more on the customer value proposition while gaining resiliency and efficiency through collaboration.

- Define and drive a squad %%U+0027%% s roadmap
- Discuss with stakeholders to refine priorities and allocate resources
- Work closely with Architects and Engineers to design, build, deploy, manage and operate environments

- Evaluate all platform and service consumption to optimise costs

- Kubernetes Expertise - Not afraid to get down to the nitty-gritty of things to troubleshoot and improve
- Infrastructure - Expert level in Kubernetes (AKS), Terraform, Platform/Services Disaster Recovery, Platform Security and Upgrades etc..
- Cloud - Microsoft Azure Management, Google Cloud Platform

- CI/CD - Azure DevOps, GitHub

Nice to have:

- Databases: Microsoft SQL Server, MongoDB, CosmosDB, PostgreSQL

**What you %%U+0027%% ll experience**

- A progressive and flexible ‘work from anywhere %%U+0027%%  policy that gives you more control over your work, life and wellbeing
- Team discounts across our range of Woolworths Group brands you know and love and a robust rewards program that celebrates and incentivises purpose-driven work
- Market leading Chapter Time, giving you 1 day within the working week to learn whilst you earn!

**Grow with the Group**

As an inclusive, team-first company, our people are at the core of everything we do.

We care deeply about creating a workplace where our team members feel valued, respected and empowered. We are committed to providing equal opportunity regardless of gender identity, ethnicity, disability, sexual orientation or life stage. We are proud to be recognised as a Gold Tier Employer in the Australian Workplace Equality Index for LGBTQ+ inclusion and as an Employer of Choice for Gender Equality by the Workplace Gender Equality Agency.

As our Group continues to evolve, innovate and support our communities, we encourage our team members to do the same with their own careers, by providing ongoing opportunities to grow and make a real difference.

We value flexibility, and encourage our team members to work in ways that meet their work/life commitments and support their wellbeing.

We work hard to create a safe and inclusive environment for all, and most importantly, we %%U+0027%% re all about creating better experiences - for our customers and for each other.

If you meet a number of the requirements, but not all, we encourage you to submit your application. You can follow us on LinkedIn or see more opportunities via www.wowcareers.com.au.

- Build world class capability in your DevOps Chapter within Insurance Technology
- Coach, mentor, and inspire teams to increase capability and maturity
- Melbourne, Sydney, or Brisbane location

**About the role**

As the Lead of Insurance Technology DevOps Chapter, you will manage and mentor a highly skilled team of DevOps Engineers, driving innovation and operational excellence. Your leadership will focus on increasing capability and maturity across Insurance Technology domains, including Continuous Planning, Development, Integration, Deployment, Testing, Delivery, Monitoring, and Feedback. This role is central to enhancing our DevOps maturity and ensuring smooth technology delivery across the business.

**What you’ll do**

- Working with Tribe Leads and Product Owners to oversee efficient allocation of Chapter members to Tribes and Platforms in line with needs
- Recruitment, develop, and retention of Chapter members including career pathway development
- Providing an inclusive environment where Chapter members have freedom and safety to innovate, experiment, and learn
- Performance management including overseeing, providing feedback, and developing Chapter members
- Manage team performance to achieve departmental strategy, targets, goals, and budget

**What you’ll bring**

- 10+ years of technology experience, including 5+ years in leadership roles
- Previous background as a DevOps / Systems / Software Engineer
- Extensive experience with DevOps processes and cloud services (AWS)
- Proven ability to develop, coach, and engage technology professionals
- Excellent leadership skills in coaching, providing feedback, and handling difficult conversations
- Successful track record in managing distributed teams and partnerships, both offshore and onshore

**What we can offer you**

- Competitive benefits package and excellent work culture
- Excellent discounts on a range of retail favourite stores as well as insurance products
- A range of flexible working and leave options, including 20 weeks paid parental leave and unlimited paid emergency response leave

**About Suncorp Group**

We’re proud to be a part of the Suncorp Group family alongside some of Australia’s most trusted and diverse names in insurance. debugText:
The Region Services team is looking for a System Development Manager to support Operations in Australia.

The AWS Region Services team builds and provides operational support for internal tools used by developers across AWS. Our Corporate Systems Development Managers work in a fast-paced environment across many disciplines, collaborating with other AWS teams to deliver cutting-edge services for our customers.

You will be passionate about both development and operations, and have a strong desire to learn about Amazon %%U+0027%% s development lifecycle. This is a true DevOps role; you will be both allowed and expected to follow problems all the way to the end and work on implementing real solutions, not just quick fixes. You will want to dive deep and understand how these large systems work.

If you like to focus on customer experience, think, and act globally and want to contribute to the operational excellence of Amazon.com data centers, we’d like to meet you!

Key job responsibilities

- Develop and deploy operational tools to automate processes and reduce operational overhead

- Hire, Develop, and Mentor team members

- Work with other engineers to build and manage massively scaled services

- Work with other engineers to diagnose and resolve customer issues

- Track the health of our services, identify and fix problems on complex systems with massive scale

- Collaborate with some of the leading minds in distributed systems

The candidate should be familiar with Linux, including the following:

- Various distros and their corresponding package management tools

- Permissions and permissions management

- System logging and auditing

- Log parsing using grep, awk, sed, cut, tr, etc

- Remote access via ssh

- Knowledge of procfs & sysfs

- Linux tools (ip, ifconfig, netstat, tcpdump, strace, netcat, ping, telnet, etc)

- System Monitoring Tools (top, *stat tools, etc)

- DNS and tools (bind, host, dig, nslookup, etc)

- Runlevel management tools (systemd, rc.d, inittab, chkconfig, etc)

The candidate should also be familiar with generic development tools and best practices:

- Git (or other CM tools)

- Agile development

- CICD or development pipelines

Hold or be able to attain an Australian Government Security Vetting Agency clearance (see https://www.agsva.gov.au/applicants/eligibility-and-suitability)

A day in the life

In this role, you will collaborate with Product Teams to design solutions that make efficient use of resources and technologies. You will bring a detail-oriented approach and excellent problem-solving abilities, backed by a deep understanding of distributed system design and delivery. Your contributions will leverage cross-functional business and technical skills, assessing and managing risks, measuring and reporting on progress, anticipating and resolving bottlenecks, providing escalation management, making tradeoffs, and balancing business needs with technical constraints.

You will drive engineering deliverables through influence rather than authority, manage repair requests in a high-volume environment, and respond to high-severity events. Regular presentations to senior leadership will require you to synthesize problems and solutions into a simple and consumable manner. Additionally, you will be responsible for data collection, analytics, and dashboard creation to help others identify the best paths for business improvement.

Expect the opportunity to travel globally as needed to manage and support team initiatives, working closely with data center technicians to ensure success.

About the team

Utility Computing (UC)

AWS Utility Computing (UC) provides product innovations — from foundational services such as Amazon’s Simple Storage Service (S3) and Amazon Elastic Compute Cloud (EC2), to consistently released new product innovations that continue to set AWS’s services and features apart in the industry. As a member of the UC organization, you’ll support the development and management of Compute, Database, Storage, Internet of Things (Iot), Platform, and Productivity Apps services in AWS, including support for customers who require specialized security solutions for their cloud services.

The Region Services team redefines the way AWS designs, builds, and operates AWS regions to enable new AWS Cloud Infrastructure and Services offerings to customers across every industry and of every size, including start-ups, enterprises, and public sector organizations.

Diverse Experiences

Amazon values diverse experiences. Even if you do not meet all of the preferred qualifications and skills listed in the job description, we encourage candidates to apply. If your career is just starting, hasn’t followed a traditional path, or includes alternative experiences, don’t let it stop you from applying.

Why AWS

Amazon Web Services (AWS) is the world’s most comprehensive and broadly adopted cloud platform. We pioneered cloud computing and never stopped innovating — that’s why customers from the most successful startups to Global 500 companies trust our robust suite of products and services to power their businesses.

Work/Life Balance

We value work-life harmony. Achieving success at work should never come at the expense of sacrifices at home, which is why we strive for flexibility as part of our working culture. When we feel supported in the workplace and at home, there’s nothing we can’t achieve in the cloud.

Inclusive Team Culture

Here at AWS, it’s in our nature to learn and be curious. Our employee-led affinity groups foster a culture of inclusion that empower us to be proud of our differences. Ongoing events and learning experiences, including our Conversations on Race and Ethnicity (CORE) and AmazeCon (gender diversity) conferences, inspire us to never stop embracing our uniqueness.

Mentorship and Career Growth

We’re continuously raising our performance bar as we strive to become Earth’s Best Employer. That’s why you’ll find endless knowledge-sharing, mentorship and other career-advancing resources here to help you develop into a better-rounded professional.

## BASIC QUALIFICATIONS

- 3+ years of engineering team management experience

- 7+ years of engineering experience

- 7+ years of leading the definition and development of multi tier web services experience

- Knowledge of engineering practices and patterns for the full software/hardware/networks development life cycle, including coding standards, code reviews, source control management, build processes, testing, certification, and livesite operations

- Experience partnering with product or program management teams

## PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS

- Experience in communicating with users, other technical teams, and senior leadership to collect requirements, describe software product features, technical designs, and product strategy

- Experience in recruiting, hiring, mentoring/coaching and managing teams of Software Engineers to improve their skills, and make them more effective, product software engineers

Acknowledgement of country:

In the spirit of reconciliation Amazon acknowledges the Traditional Custodians of country throughout Australia and their connections to land, sea and community. We pay our respect to their elders past and present and extend that respect to all Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander peoples today.

IDE statement:

Amazon is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Amazon is an equal opportunity employer, and does not discriminate on the basis of race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, disability, age, or other legally protected attributes.

debugText:
Quality Cloud Engineer role with heavy Azure flavour. Mix of design, build and support working with one of the heavyweights of IT services.

The role sits in the public cloud engineering team & largely deal in Azure. There %%U+0027%% s a bit of AWS and GCP in the mix, but the focus is Azure. They also deal in terraform, scripting, automation & devops.

You %%U+0027%% d be one of their most senior engineers in the team. The other senior engineer largely deals in the DevOps & integration aspects, and this position is more platform centric - think AD, VMSS, VMAS, networking, security, etc. As such the role probably best suits someone coming from more the traditional infrastructure side of the fence.

Ideally you %%U+0027%% ll also have some Azure certs and experience with Terraform to go along with a long history working with Azure.

Linux skills, GCP, kubes, CI/CD, AWS - all that stuff would be a bonus. **But the Azure piece is absolutely essential**.

We also need you to be an Australian Citizen (no PRs sorry)

Your reward?

- A great business to work for: a great brand & an excellent company culture
- A mix of design, build and support work
- A friendly collaborative team
- A nice hybrid split, with the offices based in North Ryde
- A great salary (up to $180K base)

If that sounds like the role for you, apply now! No need for a cover letter - your CV will speak for itself

 We celebrate diversity and encourage people from all sections of the community to apply._

debugText:
**Company Description**

**About us:**

We are NCS Australia! We have brought together Australia’s best tech talent, working as one to harness technology and advance our communities, to make the extraordinary happen.

We %%U+0027%% re proud of our rich history of partnering with our clients to develop end to end digital technology solutions to accelerate their transformation and innovation journey.
For over 40+ years our diverse global teams have delivered large-scale, mission-critical, multi-platform projects to governments and enterprises.

**Job Description**

As a Senior Platform Engineer and Consultant at NCS Australia, you %%U+0027%% ll play a crucial role in driving innovation and helping our clients get the most from their technology landscape.

You %%U+0027%% ll leverage your problem-solving skills to help clients build and modernise their applications while also shaping requirements, designing and deploying solutions, and setting up effective engineering and quality practices.

Beyond your technical expertise, you %%U+0027%% ll also provide valuable advice to clients on how to upskill their teams and achieve outstanding outcomes. By joining NCS Australia, you %%U+0027%% ll have the opportunity to collaborate with a talented and supportive team of professionals, while also enjoying the benefits and growth opportunities that come with being part of a global organization.

NCS Australia is committed to fostering a collaborative and supportive work environment. We offer competitive benefits, opportunities for professional development, and a chance to make a real difference. If you %%U+0027%% re a passionate and skilled Senior Platform Engineer and Consultant ready to take on new challenges, we encourage you to apply.

 **Qualifications**

- **Cloud Platforms:** In-depth experience with AWS (VPC, EC2, ECS Route53, S3, CloudFormation, APIs, SDKs), with a working knowledge of Google Cloud Platform.
- **Infrastructure Orchestration:** Proficiency with software-defined infrastructure orchestration tools like SaltStack or Terraform.
- **Containerisation:** Experience with immutable architectures and containerisation technologies like Docker, Kubernetes, LXC, OpenVZ, or Xen.
- **Configuration Management:** Expertise with configuration management tools such as Puppet, Chef, or Ansible.
- **Version Control:** Proficiency in using distributed version control systems like Git.
- **ArgoCD is highly desirable**
- **Continuous Integration/Deployment:** Experience with continuous integration and continuous delivery tools like Argo CD
Jenkins or Bamboo etc
- **Automation:** Familiarity with software build and release management workflows.
- **Programming:** Proficiency in at least one programming language (e.g., Java, 
Python,).
- **System Administration:** Linux/Unix system administration experience.
- **AWS:** AWS Architecture or Operations Certification.
- A strong understanding of networking concepts and security best practices would be beneficial.
- Good problem solving attitude.

 **Additional Information**

**Why join us:**

NCS Australia is where you can feel at home, nurturing your talents and skills as we make tomorrow together, one day at a time. Our benefits include paid parental leave, initiatives focused on your well-being and discounted health insurance. You will also enjoy discounts on various products and services and be regularly recognised and rewarded for high performance. We are committed to your career development through our Capability Fingerprint, industry and partner training programs, special interest groups, and an AI-driven learning platform. No matter where you are in your career, we offer meaningful work and opportunities for growth.

NCS Australia is an equal-opportunity employer, and we take pride in our commitment to valuing and supporting our people and the communities we serve.We are dedicated to attracting, retaining and developing our people regardless of gender identity, ethnicity, sexual orientation, disability and age. Applications are encouraged from all sectors of the community and we strongly encourage applications from the Veterans, Aboriginal and/or Torres Strait Islander community.

At NCS Australia, we are committed to supporting adjustments throughout the recruitment and selection process, as well as during employment. We actively support and encourage people with disability to apply. To discuss adjustment requirements, please email recruitment@au.ncs-i.com.

**Agencies:**

We’ve got this. We request that you do not contact NCS employees outside of the Talent Acquisition team. NCS exclusively accepts resumes from agencies on our preferred supplier panel through the NCS Agency Portal. Agencies that submit resumes must have a valid fee agreement and be assigned to the particular requisition by the Talent Acquisition team. Any resumes that are submitted outside of this process will become the sole property of NCS. If a candidate is hired outside of this process, no fee or payment will be given.

**Work rights and background checks:**

To be eligible for a position with us, applicants will need to have valid work rights for Australia and be willing to undergo a comprehensive background checking process, including probity and police checks

debugText:
**About the business**

Established in 1991, Cyient provides engineering, geospatial, design-led manufacturing, and network and operational support services to global industry leaders, including many Fortune 500 clients. We leverage the power of digital technology and advanced analytics capabilities, along with domain knowledge and technical expertise, to solve complex business problems across several industries, including aerospace and defense, industrial, medical, utilities, semiconductor, telecommunications, rail transportation, energy and natural resources. Our 15,000 associates are located in more than 21 countries, supporting 12 industries, including aerospace, rail transportation, power generation, telecommunications and medical technology. With a sound track record of growth and profitability, we are committed to developing a sustainable society and actively promoting education and inclusive growth initiatives in our
local communities.

**Roles and responsibilities.**

- **Infrastructure Management:** Design, deploy, and maintain scalable and secure infrastructure using Infrastructure as Code (IaC) tools such as Terraform, Ansible, or CloudFormation.
- **CI/CD Pipelines:** Build and maintain continuous integration and delivery pipelines using tools like Jenkins, GitLab CI, CircleCI, or equivalent.
- **Cloud Services:** Manage cloud-based environments (AWS, Azure, GCP) including networking, security, and monitoring.
- **Containerization:** Develop and manage containerized applications using Docker and Kubernetes, ensuring efficient orchestration and scaling.
- **Monitoring & Logging:** Implement monitoring, logging, and alerting solutions (Prometheus, Grafana, ELK Stack, etc.) to ensure the health and performance of production environments.
- **Automation:** Automate routine tasks and configuration management processes using scripting languages such as Bash, Python, or Go.
- **Security:** Ensure system security by implementing best practices in cloud infrastructure, automation, and deployment pipelines.
- **Collaboration:** Collaborate with development, QA, and operations teams to ensure smooth and reliable software releases.
- **Incident Management:** Participate in incident response and troubleshooting, ensuring fast recovery and root cause analysis for production issues.

**Technologies and Experience**

- **Experience:** 4-7 years of experience in DevOps, Systems Administration, or related fields.
- **Cloud Expertise:** Strong hands-on experience with at least one major cloud provider (AWS, Azure, GCP).
- **IaC Tools:** Proven experience with Infrastructure as Code tools such as Terraform, Ansible, or CloudFormation.
- **CI/CD:** Solid understanding of CI/CD pipelines and related tools (Jenkins, GitLab CI, CircleCI).
- **Containers & Orchestration:** Expertise in containerization (Docker) and orchestration (Kubernetes).
- **Scripting:** Proficiency in scripting languages like Python, Bash, or Go.
- **Version Control:** Strong knowledge of Git, branching strategies, and GitOps methodologies.
- **Monitoring & Logging:** Hands-on experience with monitoring tools (Prometheus, Grafana) and logging systems (ELK Stack, Splunk).
- **Security:** Experience with cloud security best practices, vulnerability assessments, and mitigation strategies.
- **Problem-solving Skills:** Strong analytical skills with the ability to troubleshoot complex systems under pressure.
- **Communication:** Excellent communication and teamwork skills with the ability to work cross-functionally.

**Benefits and perks**

- Unique company culture focused on building interpersonal relationships
- Career and personal development courses
- Flexible working environment
- Competitive salary
- Health Insurance
- Work-Life-balance
- Rewards & Recognition

Cyient is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Cyient recruits, employs, trains, compensates, and promotes regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender, gender identity or expression, veteran status, and other protected status as required by applicable law. We are proud to be a diverse and inclusive company where our people can focus their whole self on solving problems that matter.

**Do work that matters:**

As Australia %%U+0027%% s leading technology bank, we process millions of transactions every day. Around 40% of all payments made by Australians go through our systems. Our scale means unparalleled opportunity to accelerate digital innovation and positively impact customers. Supported by some of the world %%U+0027%% s best systems and processes you will play a key role to unleash the power of our payments data for our business to make our customer %%U+0027%% s future bright.

**See yourself in our team**

We %%U+0027%% re delivering on this by working hand-in-hand with our business colleagues to jointly solve problems with customer centricity and technical innovation, cultivating a world-class team of empowered people, and building technology solutions for the future.

We support our people with the flexibility to balance where work is done with at least half your time each month connecting in office. We also have many other flexible working options available including changing start and finish times, part-time arrangements and job share to name a few.

**Your core responsibilities will include:**

- Provide overall engineering leadership for the platform including software, systems, quality and site reliability.

- Remain hands on, and take the lead on the largest and most complex engineering challenges

- Proven experience as a Software Engineering leader.

- Expert-level and hands on experience in **TypeScript, Aurora and other AWS technologies.**

- Experience building public **APIs** that support mission critical applications

- Experience building secure, scalable and highly available cloud-native applications.

- Though leadership in AI.

- Ability to contribute to strategy and architecture, and translate this into pragmatic engineering design decisions.

- Ideally experience in Financial Services, Payments or related domains.

- Bachelors, Masters, or PhD in Computer science or similar experience


**If this sounds like you then apply today!**

_Whether you %%U+0027%% re passionate about customer service, driven by data, or called by creativity, a career here is for you._

_Our people bring their diverse backgrounds and unique perspectives to build a respectful, inclusive and flexible workplace._ _We are working hard to build a team of people who represent the rich diversity of our customers and communities. If you %%U+0027%% re excited about this opportunity but you don %%U+0027%% t meet every single requirement, or your experience doesn %%U+0027%% t align perfectly, we still want to encourage you to apply. You may just be the perfect candidate for this opportunity or another within CommBank._

_At CommBank we will inspire you with work that makes a difference, surround you with talented people that respect and value each other, and empower you to grow professionally and personally. Most of all, making_ _a positive impact for customers, communities and each other is part of our every day._

_We %%U+0027%% re determined to make a real difference for Australia %%U+0027%% s first peoples. We encourage all interested applicants to apply._ _If you %%U+0027%% re already part of the Commonwealth Bank Group (including Bankwest), you %%U+0027%% ll need to apply through Sidekick to submit a valid application. We %%U+0027%% re keen to support you with the next step in your career._

**About Us**

**Greenstone is a leader in the sales and distribution of insurance products under a portfolio of credible owned and white-labelled brands. Brands include Real Insurance, RSPCA Pet Insurance, Guardian, Australian Seniors Insurance Agency and Choosi. We aim to make a positive difference in people %%U+0027%% s lives by providing quality solutions that help people protect the things closest to them.**

**Principal Engineer - Full Time Perm Opportunity**

Our Principal Engineer will play a critical role in leading the modernisation of our core systems, from a legacy monolithic architecture and desktop application to a modern, cloud-based platform, primarily utilising Amazon Web Services (AWS).

This role requires a combination of strong technical expertise, leadership skills, and a deep understanding of modern software engineering practices. In collaboration with the Head of Engineering, the role is accountable for setting the technical and architectural direction, elevating engineering standards, modernising & uplifting engineering practices, and ensuring a seamless transition to a more secure, scalable, efficient, and agile technology stack.

They will be a key player in driving innovation and experimentation across the Product Engineering organisation.

**What are we looking for?**

- Bachelor %%U+0027%% s or Master %%U+0027%% s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field.
- 10+ years of experience in software engineering, with a proven track record of leading large-scale Modernisation / migration projects.
- Extensive experience with AWS cloud services and ecosystem.
- Strong understanding of modern architecture patterns, such as cloud-native, microservices, serverless computing, and containerisation
- Proficiency in a range of programming languages and technologies relevant to cloud-based development.
- Excellent leadership, communication, and problem-solving skills.
- Demonstrated ability to work collaboratively in a fast-paced, dynamic environment.

**Desirable**

- Knowledge of digital transformation and the latest technology trends.
- Experience in strategic planning and execution at an enterprise level

**Our Promise to Our People**

We are passionate about our core values of Customer First, We Care, One Team, and Results Driven, which define how we approach our work. We recognise that our colleagues are the key to our success. That %%U+0027%% s why you can expect to be rewarded for the hard work you put in through job satisfaction, career development and the fantastic range of benefits we offer:

- Fantastic employee benefits including flexi days, flexible working, annual $1200 travel/parking allowance & more
- State of the art building facilities including a dedicated & subsidised on-site company café (weekly free lunch)
- On-site gym, and health & well-being initiatives and programs
- Opportunity to take part in in-house leadership & emotional intelligence workshops
- Quarterly award functions and a grand annual conference to recognise our people
- Insurance cashback discounts on a number of our products through the Real Insurance brand
- Retail discounts e.g. movie tickets, live shows + more
- Morsl market (a fully automated self-serve, food and drink marketplace with a wide variety of meals, snacks and drinks)

**Location**

Great central location in Norwest Business Park, Norwest, only a short walk from Norwest Metro station and also direct bus access from Parramatta and Blacktown.

**Apply Now**

If this role interests you, we would love to hear from you!

- **Opportunity to collaborate with some of the brightest and best minds in Australia**
- **An exciting career - as our business grows, so do the opportunities for our Team Members**
- **Surry Hills (Sydney) based with flexible working arrangements**

**We are Woolworths Group**

We are Woolworths Group 200,000+ bright minds, passionate hearts and unique perspectives connected by a shared Purpose - ‘to create better experiences together for a better tomorrow. %%U+0027%%  It %%U+0027%% s that Purpose that fuels our ambition to explore new ideas, make brave commitments and innovate better ways to meet the food and everyday needs of more than 24 million customers every week.

If you %%U+0027%% re excited to turn today %%U+0027%% s blue sky thinking into a better tomorrow for future generations, you %%U+0027%% ll find yourself supported and enriched in a dynamic, inclusive and empowering workplace that reflects the diverse communities we serve. With a culture of genuine care, a flexible approach to work and opportunities across the group to grow your career and make a meaningful impact, the possibilities for what we can achieve together are endless.

**What you %%U+0027%% ll do**

Reporting to the Chapter Lead of Service Foundations and DevX, you will play a key role in the design, implementation and operations of the critical components like DNS, CDN, WAF, APIGateway and GraphQL. You will be responsible for ensuring the reliability and stability of our traffic management technologies like Akamai, Apigee and Apollo.

This is a role for a technologist with a strong background in Infrastructure engineering who can apply their experience and knowledge to influence decisions and develop highly scalable and reliable services. In this role you will have the opportunity to sharpen these skills while evangelising and developing new capabilities that are critical to the organisation %%U+0027%% s technology strategy.

- Define and drive a squad %%U+0027%% s roadmap
- Discuss with stakeholders to refine priorities and allocate resources
- Work closely with Architects and Engineers to design, build, deploy, manage and operate environments
- Coach and assist engineers to uplift capability and spread domain knowledge
- Bring the best practices from across the Engineering practice into the delivery cycle
- Evaluate all platform and service consumption to optimise costs

**What you %%U+0027%% ll bring**

We expect strong skills with the following tech stack

- Cloud - Microsoft Azure, Google Cloud Platform
- Domain Naming Systems - DNS
- Certificate Management - SSL/TLS
- APIGateway
- GraphQL Technologies
- DevSecOps
- Observability Platforms

Specific experience which align with current state

- Apigee - APIGateway
- Apollo - GraphQL Federation
- Cloud - Microsoft Azure, Google Cloud Platform
- Code - Powershell, Bash, C#, .NET Core, NodeJS, GoLang
- CI - Azure DevOps, GitHub, Jenkins
- Infrastructure - Kubernetes (AKS / GKE), Terraform
- Observability - App Insights, Dynatrace, Azure Log Analytics, Google Cloud Monitoring

**What you %%U+0027%% ll experience**

**​​** We embrace diversity of thought and love to take on challenges with a pragmatic and innovative approach. Our culture thrives on mutual respect, care, curiosity, openness, and a proactive attitude. We continually seek ways to pair, collaborate, support, and learn from each other as a team!

**Everyone belongs at Woolworths Group**

We recognise the value our team %%U+0027%% s diversity brings to our business, customers, and communities and that teams with diverse experiences and backgrounds enrich our group and are better able to innovate and solve problems. As one of the largest employers in Australia and New Zealand, we aim to create a truly inclusive workplace where everyone feels that they belong, can be their best selves, and reach their full potential.

debugText:
**Who we are**

Brain health conditions impact millions annually, preventing many from reaching their full potential. At BrainEye, we have developed a proprietary AI-based eye-tracking platform that utilizes smartphones to measure ocular biomarkers, assessing changes in brain function in real time. This technology enables the early detection of neurodegenerative diseases and acute abnormalities such as concussions, head trauma, strokes, and drug use.

Our platform leverages cutting-edge smartphone technology, advanced algorithms, and years of scientific research led by world-renowned professors with more than 125 neuro-ophthalmic publications to their name. This ensures that our eye measurements are quantified with precision and consistency, whether in a clinical setting or at home. By making this innovative technology accessible to everyone, everywhere, we are dedicated to saving lives and improving health outcomes.

The science is here. Now, BrainEye needs your expertise to turn this vision into reality. Join us in revolutionizing brain health assessment and making a profound difference in people %%U+0027%% s lives.

**We are seeking**

A highly motivated Head of Engineering to help us build a high-performing engineering team. We are looking for experience in tech team leadership, software architecture and great communication skills, with specific familiarity with MLOps, AWS Cloud, scale-ups and working with an international R&D team.

**What you bring**

- Lead and coordinate design, architecture, planning, and resourcing across our team to ensure key features are shipped on time, with a specific focus on AWS.
- Lead on the formation and execution of technical strategy that is focused on maximizing the continued success of our AI based mobile health app.
- Lead our cloud engineering team whilst collaborating closely with our mobile based VP of Engineering, as well as our product, mobile, engineering, data science, and QA teams, to understand context and guide the design of simple, secure and scalable solutions.
- Excellent agile project management and personal management skills.
- Be ultimately accountable for the quality, scalability, observability, and security of the product.
- Collaborate with engineers to guide the design and implementation of simple, secure, and stable systems that can support continual change.
- Coaching and mentoring engineers on technical, project management, leadership and performance matters.
- Define and articulate BrainEye’s engineering principles and standards, and guide the engineering team in embedding these in their day to day practice.
- Implement strategies to prevent customer incidents, fix incidents quickly, and lead effective and respectful post-mortems.
- Foster a high performance, high trust, inclusive, collaborative and positive engineering culture that values delivering excellent products regularly.
- Lead recruitment and onboarding; conduct performance reviews, career planning, and regular 1-on-1s for the engineering team.

**Who you are**

- Keen to learn the fundamentals of eye-tracking technology.
- Have the aptitude and desire to gain deep technical knowledge about services and systems we operate.
- Passionate about engineering excellence, agile delivery, systems architecture, and meeting non-functional requirements, but also deeply pragmatic.
- Understand how to create technology strategies that leverage data and AI to bring incredible products to market and change people’s lives.
- Clear, concise in written and spoken communication. As a remote-first team this is particularly important!
- You have prior experience in, or a desire to, work in a startup with ambitious goals and a huge market opportunity.

**Must haves**

- BSc in Software Engineering, Computer Science, or a related field.
- Hands-on experience managing and growing cross-functional teams.
- Hands-on experience with AWS Cloud Architecture.
- Strong software engineering and architecture fundamentals.
- Strong written and verbal communication skills in English.

**Should haves**

- Masters or PhD in Software Engineering, Computer Science, or a related field.
- Relevant AWS certifications.
- Experience engaging with external parties.
- Experience in system architecture across Mobile and AWS.
- Experience in a start-up or scale-up environment.
- Experience in a Software-as-a-Medical-Device environment or ISO environment.
- Familiarity with DevOps, MLOps, and image processing AI.

**Our stacks**

- AWS, CloudFormation, Serverless, Event-Driven-Design
- Python, NodeJS
- Java, KMM, Kotlin, Swift/Objective C, React Native
- Bitbucket, Confluence, Jira, Figma, Slack
- Agile/scrum, ISO rated Quality Management System

**What we can offer**

- We are passionate about making a positive difference to brain health around the world.
- We are a growing company where our direction may pivot, new problems to solve arise, and we are constantly learning.
- The opportunity to benefit from the continued success of the company with competitive remuneration options.
- The opportunity to gain first-hand experience working in a Medical Device Quality Management System, a widely transferable skill to any regulated industry.
- The experience of bringing a State of the Art Software as a Medical Device to market and changing attitudes to our brain health.
- A supportive team environment where we work with you to learn, grow, achieve success and advance your career.

debugText:
**About Yojee**

Yojee Limited (ASX: YOJ) is a cloud-based (SaaS) logistics platform that seamlessly and uniquely manages, tracks and optimises freight movements along the entire logistics chain, from sender to end customer, across borders and between logistics providers (land, sea, air), with subcontractors and for multi-leg journeys. Rarely is a single carrier servicing an entire goods journey from sender to end customer, or exclusively using one transportation method. Yojee ensures connectivity and more efficient planning along the entire journey.

**About the Engineering team at Yojee**

The backbone of Yojee focused on building the core platform and product using best-in-class technology. We love clean code, well-designed architecture, and applying best practices.
 We build cool technology that lasts long and scales well.

**About the role**

Yojee is looking for a Technical Fullstack Lead Engineer who enjoys developing and designing software services in a cloud platform environment focusing on scalability and performance. Together with the team, you will have ownership of the services you build, and you love to share your ideas regarding architecture and functionality.

**Duties and Responsibilities**

- Guide technical design and architecture
- Work with product people to understand and flesh out requirements for implementations
- Design, develop, and maintain highly scalable services
- Drive best practices and produce high-quality code
- Lead troubleshooting of complex bugs and issues
- Do hands-on coding alongside the team and serve as a mentor
- Ensure deliverables meet the quality bar

**Requirements**

- Minimum Bachelor %%U+0027%% s Degree in Computer Engineering or its equivalent related experience.
- 6+ years of experience in the development of various complex systems.
- Experienced and proficient in working with one of these languages, preferably Elixir, Javascript, Ruby on Rails, Go, Scala, Haskell or any other functional programming language.
- Experienced in high load, high traffic transactional systems.
- You enjoy driving things over getting tasks assigned.
- Attention to detail and reliability are what you take pride in.
- Ability to lead a team or liaise with vendors in managing project delivery.
- Excellent communication and collaboration skills.

**Nice to have**

- Experience with Microservice architecture.
- Node.js, React.js or React native.
- DevOps experience with AWS or Azure, Docker.
- Production experience with Elixir & Phoenix.
- Open-source repositories and contributions.

**Reporting Structure - Who Will Help You Win**

This role will be located in Sydney and will report to the SVP of Engineering.

Learn more about how Binancians embody the organization’s core values, creating a unified culture that enables collaboration, excellence, and growth.

Apply today to be a part of the Web3 revolution!

debugText:
Create impact as a Senior Software Engineer.

Join the largest general insurance group in Australia and New Zealand Insurance, so much more than you think.

YOUR ROLE

This role will be part of Ambiata Application Engineering team. Part of IAG, Ambiata is an AI and engineering expert unit which provides Machine Learning (ML) and Artificial Intelligence (AI) platforms, products & solutions as well as supporting software infrastructure to IAG (as our parent company) and in a limited fashion to the market. We focus on ethical automated decision systems leveraging advanced AI/ML/GenAI technology

As a Senior Software Engineer, you will design, implement, and maintain our AI and ML services that support personalization and automated customer decision-making. You will collaborate with the team to understand client, product, and internal requirements, translating them into software solutions that enhance business impact and customer experience.

Your role will encompass the full application lifecycle, from design to delivery and deployment, including CI/CD practices, and developing scalable web service APIs.

Additionally, you will document solutions through various formats, such as flowcharts and code comments, while improving operations by analysing systems and recommending policy and procedure changes.

This permanent position is open to candidates based in Sydney or Melbourne and offers a hybrid work model.

ABOUT YOU

A successful candidate will be a flexible software practitioner with strong Linux and Unix skills, a background in software development and architecture, and a solid understanding of DevOps processes and practices. They should also have the following skills:

- Extensive experience developing in Python 3
- Proven expertise in REST API design and implementation using current web server development tools and methodologies; For e.g. FastAPI (preferred), Flask, Django Rest Framework, etc.
- Proficiency in Software Development Best Practices (SCM / Unit Tests); and within the DevOps area, broad knowledge and experience with: Cloud technologies (GCP preferred); CI/CD pipelines; and Docker and Kubernetes deployments.
- General knowledge, passion, experience and interest in ML technologies and approaches, (desirable).
- Prior experience with two or more of the following: TLS, Docker, Kubernetes, Terraform, Helm, minio, flask, fastAPI, PostgreSQL, (desirable).
- Experience of deployment for the cloud using microservices and Docker to facilitate continuous integration and product delivery.
- A history of developing robust and secure applications. (We love code examples – please send us anything you have developed that we can look at, e.g., open-source projects);
- Experience with Frontend Development using Javascipt and associated libraries is desirable.

Start your career journey with us and click ‘Apply’! Applications close, Friday, 25th October 2024.

ABOUT US

IAG is not only the largest general insurance group in Australia and New Zealand, underwriting over $AUD13 billions of premiums per annum, we are also a tech and research facility, a hub for climate change experts and a centre of resilience design. We chat over coffee with customers, advocate for them in the corridors of Parliament and back them up in the community when life’s moments hit hardest.

You’ll know our brands – CGU, WFI, NRMA Insurance, AMI, NZI, and State Insurance to name a few. Together they turn our IAG purpose of making your world safer into action by helping, supporting ambitions and making insurance accessible.

When you join IAG, you’re not joining one brand. You’re joining a large purpose-led, Trans-Tasman group dedicated to making your world a safer place.

We’re ready to grow your career, acknowledge every part of you, recognise your brilliance, lead you with purpose and help you live your own purpose through us.

At IAG you’ll enjoy:

- Grow your financial future with 13% superannuation as standard.
- Access up to 50% off home and motor insurance.
- Flexibility and support so you can live life to the full.
- A team who cares about people and community.

We’re ready for you. Apply today.

Cloud computing infrastructure is at the heart of the IT platform, and spans across many business areas including research technology, trading tools, market execution and data processing.

debugText:
**Principal DevOps Engineer - Join Nuix and Help Us Transform Data into Actionable Intelligence!**

**UpperGround by Hudson** have exclusively partnered with **Nuix** in search for their next Principal DevOps Engineer. Are you passionate about empowering organisations through innovative software solutions? Join **Nuix**, a global leader in eDiscovery, information governance, and forensic investigations. With over 2,000 customers in 75+ countries-including top financial institutions, government agencies, and tier-one advisory firms-Nuix provides a truly unique workplace where your expertise can make an impact.

**About the Role**

As a **Principal DevOps Engineer**, you will lead and continuously improve Nuix %%U+0027%% s DevOps practice, ensuring the development, implementation, and maintenance of CI/CD pipelines across multiple platforms. Your role will help simplify complex processes, optimise developer productivity, and drive improvements to shared platforms such as AWS networking infrastructure, CI/CD tools, and security. You will also mentor junior engineers and collaborate closely with development teams to design deployment strategies.

**Key Responsibilities**

- Develop and enhance the DevOps practice across Nuix engineering teams
- Mentor and provide technical assistance to junior team members
- Create, maintain, and optimise CI/CD pipelines across applications
- Drive improvements in key areas including CI/CD tools, AWS infrastructure, security, logging, monitoring, and cost efficiency
- Automate systems and processes, identifying opportunities for simplification
- Establish an internal developer platform (IDP) and service catalogue for engineering teams
- Collaborate with development teams on deployment patterns and non-functional system requirements
- Foster a  %%U+0022%% safety culture %%U+0022%%  through security monitoring and incident response tools

**Skills and Experience Required**

- Expertise across all phases of testing within the SDLC
- Extensive experience with AWS, Kubernetes, Terraform, and Helm
- Familiarity with CI/CD platforms, particularly Jenkins, and configuration management tools (Puppet, Chef, or Vagrant)
- Proficiency in cloud-based platforms and SaaS environments
- Experience with Docker containers, registries, and building installation packages
- Solid scripting and programming skills (Java, Python, Ruby, Bash, Powershell, etc.)
- Strong communication skills and ability to manage stakeholders and incident response
- Proven experience managing high-availability (HA) environments and cloud infrastructure
- A problem-solving mindset with the ability to work collaboratively across functions

**Desirable Skills**

- Experience with Splunk, DynamoDB, and messaging platforms
- A hacker mentality, with a deep understanding of systems under the bonnet
- Experience with infrastructure project completion

**Why Nuix?**

At Nuix, you %%U+0027%% ll be part of a global team that %%U+0027%% s revolutionising the way data is managed and understood. With opportunities for growth, cross-functional collaboration, and innovation, you %%U+0027%% ll be empowered to make an impact.

Are you ready to find the truth in a digital world? Apply today to join a passionate, forward-thinking team!

**This role requires 3 days per week in the Sydney CBD office, therefore local candidates will be considered for this role. Only unlimited full working rights in Australia will be accepted.**

debugText:
Senior Software Engineer - Sydney Office - Permanent Full Time

**Who are we?**

We shine a light on all things property. Our business aims to simplify the property journey for all involved; motivated by expertise and our exclusive data. Changing the way people engage with property requires a team of diverse thinkers.

The role of a Senior Software Engineer is pivotal in supporting the delivery of our Domain Strategy by driving innovation and ensuring the development of high-quality software solutions. By leveraging advanced technical skills and a deep understanding of software engineering principles, the Senior Software Engineer contributes to the creation of robust, scalable, and efficient applications that align with our strategic goals. This role involves not only writing and reviewing code but also architecting solutions that meet both current and future business needs.

**Who are you?**

The ideal candidate will have…

- Experience designing software solutions for scale
- Deep expertise in Javascript, ReactJS and NodeJS
- Deep expertise in GraphQL and Apollo technology
- Experience with either highly trafficked customer-facing websites and/or complex mobile apps
- Experience working with one of the common Cloud Platforms such as AWS, Azure, and/or GCP
- Experience implementing DevOps practices and CI/CD
- Experience with Microservices architecture

**Why join us?**

We’re the kind of place you can make a real impact, with a workplace culture where you can be you. It’s a fun, safe space where you’ll always feel you belong. Perks of the role include:

- Discover your ideal work-life balance with our approach to flexibility;
- First-rate parental leave and wellbeing policies;
- Access to Perkbox, giving you discounts across healthcare, entertainment, food, utilities and more
- Continuous opportunities to leap, learn and grow

We don’t just talk, we do. Every day we solve property problems for Australians and beyond. We encourage our people to see the possibilities, and turn them into realities.

We trust our people’s expertise and vision, so when they come up with great ideas, we build the right team around them, and empower them to make those ideas real through products and services that set a new standard.
That’s why we want you.

**What’s next?**

One of our talent partners will give your application a good look and give you a call if it’s a good match, so apply now!

Don’t meet every single requirement? We’re committed to building an inclusive, diverse and supportive workplace and welcome applications from all people regardless of age, gender, orientation, ethnicity, cultural background or disability. If you’re excited about this role but your past experience doesn’t align perfectly, we encourage you to send in your application.

We also warmly welcome applications from Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander peoples, recognising and valuing your unique experiences.

debugText:
At the Bank we recognise people who want to be part of a team, to be recognised for what they do, and how they help the Australian people.

RBA is currently seeking a Tech Lead to join our Platform Engineering team in IT for a 2-year fixed term contract.

**About the Team**

At the RBA, Platform Engineering is shaping the future of DevOps at the Bank. It is key to leading the way in which automation changes the way we deliver.

This role is central to the Group and supporting the DevOps services of the entire Bank.

- Work as part of a team managing and supporting our platforms with a focus on CI/CD Pipelines, and DevOps practices.

- Automate and establish new frameworks and patterns.

- Support and maintain the DevOps Security ensuring platforms are secure and stable.

- Advocate the DevOps practices and DevOps principals across the teams.

**About you**

- You are passionate about DevOps and toolchains.

- You love to solve problems.

- You love to write code.

- You are enthusiastic about change, and want to help make things better.

- You look to complete tasks the right way, not necessarily the fastest or easiest way.

**Skills & Expertise required**

- Experience with DevOps tools such as Azure DevOps Services, Maven, and Artifactory or equivalent technologies.

- You have at least 6 years of programming or scripting experience.

- Highly experienced on PowerShell and Java or .Net. Also, across few languages such as Python, Bash, JavaScript, YAML.

- Experience establishing and maintaining CI/CD and Release Pipelines.

- Deep understanding of GitOps and DevSecOps.

- Deep understanding of security tools and processes

- Experience working with API %%U+0027%% s.

- Experience working in Agile/Scrum/Kanban teams.

- Experience with Kubernetes.

- Experience with Azure Cloud.

**Good to have**

- Previous automation experience on any scripting language.

- Familiarity on building pipelines on Azure Devops Services

**Your development & career**

We recognise that you may only know some of the technologies we use at the Bank. That is why we will work with you to fill any knowledge gaps and provide training where necessary to ensure you can fulfil your role. Platform Engineering as well as the Bank has job progression pathways to ensure each team member can explore and grow their career at the Bank.

Team members get to explore technology, products, and services with the wider Platform Engineering team, regularly crossing over and contributing where they can.

**Be More**

The RBA makes an important contribution to the Australian economy through the pursuit of national economic policy objectives and associated activities in financial markets and banking. We also issue Australia %%U+0027%% s banknotes and operates infrastructure critical to the payments system, all of which contribute to the welfare of the Australian people.

Made up of specialists across a wide range of fields, our people have a meaningful role to play in achieving these objectives. Our people conduct themselves with a high degree of integrity, while striving for excellence in the work they perform and the outcomes they achieve. We encourage intelligent inquiry, and we treat one another with respect while promoting the public interest through our efforts.

We know it is the growth and success of our people that drives the Bank forward. Come and make a bigger contribution while you build and develop your own skills too, because being more means you can do more, for yourself and for Australia.

**The Reserve Bank of Australia is an equal opportunity employer. We are committed to crafting a diverse and inclusive environment and encourage applications from expert candidates seeking workplace flexibility.**

postTitle: Senior Platform Engineer - AWS, IaC, Terraform
debugText:
- **_You are_** _a problem solver with a strong background in platform engineering working across AWS, IaC & Terraform._
- **_We are_** _one of the best and most advanced Cyber Security teams in Australia._
- **_Together we can_** _contribute to protecting the Group, its customers and community._

**Your business:**

The Technology division delivers the Group %%U+0027%% s information technology and banking operation functions to ensure the highest levels of customer service through world-class process excellence and technology innovation. Cyber Security protects the bank and our customers from theft, loss and risk events, through effective and proactive management of cyber security, privacy and operational risk.

We support our people with the flexibility to balance where work is done with at least half your time each month connecting in office. We also have many other flexible working options available including changing start and finish times, part-time arrangements and job share to name a few. Talk to us about how these arrangements might work for you. We %%U+0027%% re hiring from across all of our technology hubs in Sydney, Melbourne and Perth. We really love working here, and we think you will too.

**Your new team:**

The Cloud Security Technology crew is part of the group %%U+0027%% s wider cyber security landscape. This division ensures the delivery of complex security initiatives with a key focus in the group %%U+0027%% s cloud security offerings across platforms and various systems. Our mandate is to protect the business %%U+0027%%  platforms, systems, data, digital assets, and reputation that is interconnected with the organisation %%U+0027%% s cloud estate.

We also support the group in developing innovative and market-leading offerings, which are underpinned by security, privacy, and trust.

**Your impact and contribution:**

As the Senior Platform Engineer you will be reporting directly to the Chapter Lead of Cloud Security Tech - Systems Engineering. You will managing key control services across the wider public cloud environment to ensure the safety of our organisation and customers.

This role will enable you to work on vital project solutions and uplifts across **AWS cloud, and Infrastructure as Code (IaC) toolsets using Terraform** and developing new tools and **AWS native cloud solutions** across the group.

You will also:

- Work on key control services across the Group, **building cloud native solutions in AWS**.
- Monitor for key alerts across the Group %%U+0027%% s protective controls to prevent noncompliance.
- Oversee and manage key vendor relationships.
- Consult with key stakholders on technical and non-technical solutions.

**We are interested in people who:**

Are an experienced Senior Platform Engineer with proficient expertise across **IaC toolsets using terraform** and possesses the ability to develop new **AWS native cloud solutions**.

You will bring:

- Knowledge and experience in **IaC toolset** working with **Terraform essential**.
- Experience developing new tools and **AWS native cloud services** to be integrated across the bank.
- Expertise working with **AWS Infrastructure essential.**
- A history in working with Infrastructure as Code e.g Lambda, Cloudformation, CDK, AWS CodeBuild/CodePipeline highly regarded.
- In depth understanding of scripting/programming languages such as PowerShell, Bash, Python etc, as well as good Windows/Linux Server experience.
- Experience with and knowledge of CI/CD and automation tools like Github, GitHub Action, TeamCity, CI/CD pipeline desirable.

If this role is of interest to you, please apply directly or reach out to have a confidential discussion in more detail.

_Whether you %%U+0027%% re passionate about customer service, driven by data, or called by creativity, a career here is for you._

_Our people bring their diverse backgrounds and unique perspectives to build a respectful, inclusive and flexible workplace._ _We are working hard to build a team of people who represent the rich diversity of our customers and communities. If you %%U+0027%% re excited about this opportunity but you don %%U+0027%% t meet every single requirement, or your experience doesn %%U+0027%% t align perfectly, we still want to encourage you to apply. You may just be the perfect candidate for this opportunity or another within CommBank._

_At CommBank we will inspire you with work that makes a difference, surround you with talented people that respect and value each other, and empower you to grow professionally and personally. Most of all, making_ _a positive impact for customers, communities and each other is part of our every day._

_We %%U+0027%% re determined to make a real difference for Australia %%U+0027%% s first peoples. We encourage all interested applicants to apply._ _If you %%U+0027%% re already part of the Commonwealth Bank Group (including Bankwest), you %%U+0027%% ll need to apply through Sidekick to submit a valid application. We %%U+0027%% re keen to support you with the next step in your career._

debugText:
- **Join Wpay - the largest non-bank acquirer and payment processor in Australia**
- **We simplify operations and innovative payment offerings by transforming transactions into rich payment experiences.**
- **Role up your sleeves and play a key part in an agile, customer-centric team based in Sydney**

**We are Wpay**

Founded within the Woolworths group, Wpay has unparalleled expertise in customer-led payment experiences for businesses across Australia and New Zealand.​ ​ We %%U+0027%% re ready to help businesses move beyond payments by transforming transactions into rich payment experiences.

With an unrivaled understanding of people and the way they pay, we simplify operations and innovative payment offerings. Keeping businesses safe from fraud, improving customer satisfaction, and enabling growth.

Wpay is Australia %%U+0027%% s largest non-bank payments provider, processing >1.2Bn transactions and >$50bn in volumes, servicing >30m customers in-store and >19m customers online - every week! You %%U+0027%% ll be working with Australia %%U+0027%% s largest retail operations - both online and in-store, along with pushing the innovation boundaries with marketplaces and the subscription and gig economy businesses.

**What you %%U+0027%% ll do**

The Digital Payments Platform is comprised of the following technologies:

- C# with .net
- Angular
- Dapr
- Azure Service Bus
- MongoDB
- Apigee Edge API gateway
- Microsoft Azure and Azure Devops
- Dynatrace
- Github

This role is for a software engineer who is able to work across the technology stack to build out the Payments Experience features as defined by the product and technology

roadmap.

- Reporting to the Engineering Manager and working collaboratively with Product
- Owners, BAs, QAEs and other engineers to develop high quality, scalable and performant solutions.
- Participate in the technical delivery of the squad, building and deploying solutions and ensuring correct operation.
- Following secure coding standards and practices.
- Work closely with tech leads and senior engineers to design maintainable, robust, secure systems.

**What you %%U+0027%% ll bring**

- Strong experience in modern engineering practices and disciplines.
- Good understanding of Agile & Lean delivery principles (Scrum preferred).

- Strong experience in C# and microservice architecture.
- Good experience with Microsoft Azure Cloud technologies (or AWS, GCP).
- Experience in Unit Testing Principles, Test Driven Development and Behavioural
- Driven Development.
- Experience in developing REST APIs including OpenAPI standards.
- Experience with CI/CD, infrastructure as code, DevOps, automation.
- Strong understanding of web security (OWASP TOP 10, etc.).
- NoSQL database experience (MongoDB preferred) including performance optimisation is highly desirable
- Experience in financial services or backend payments processing is highly desirable

**What you %%U+0027%% ll experience**

Our Team Members are at the heart of everything we do and we %%U+0027%% re always looking for ways to support your career journey and reward great work:

- A progressive and flexible ‘work from anywhere %%U+0027%%  policy that gives you more control over your work, life and wellbeing
- Team discounts across our range of Woolworths Group brands you know and love and a robust rewards program that celebrates and incentivises purpose-driven work
- A range of programs to help you prioritise and manage your wellbeing, including 24/7 access to the Sonder app.
- A progressive and competitive leave policy that gives you more space for what matters to you


**Grow with the Group**

As an inclusive, team-first company, our people are at the core of everything we do.

We care deeply about creating a workplace where our team members feel valued, respected and empowered. We are committed to providing equal opportunity regardless of gender identity, ethnicity, disability, sexual orientation or life stage. We are proud to be recognised as a Gold Tier Employer in the Australian Workplace Equality Index for LGBTQ+ inclusion and as an Employer of Choice for Gender Equality by the Workplace Gender Equality Agency.

As our Group continues to evolve, innovate and support our communities, we encourage our team members to do the same with their own careers, by providing ongoing opportunities to grow and make a real difference.

We value flexibility, and encourage our team members to work in ways that meet their work/life commitments and support their wellbeing.

We work hard to create a safe and inclusive environment for all, and most importantly, we %%U+0027%% re all about creating better experiences - for our customers and for each other.

**We %%U+0027%% d love to hear from You**

If you meet a number of the requirements, but not all, we encourage you to submit your application. You can follow us on LinkedIn or see more opportunities via www.wowcareers.com.au.

debugText:
Our Enterprise Data Platform team is responsible for managing Macquarie’s Corporate Data Platform. The businesses we support are highly reliant on the platform for a broad range of use cases including data science, self-service analytics, operational analytics and reporting.

At Macquarie, our advantage is bringing together diverse people and empowering them to shape all kinds of possibilities. We are a global financial services group operating in 34 markets and with 55 years of unbroken profitability. You’ll be part of a friendly and supportive team where everyone - no matter what role - contributes ideas and drives outcomes.

**What role will you play**

As a Senior Cloud Engineer, you will help deliver new platform capabilities leveraging various AWS and Kubernetes technologies. You will have the opportunity to be a part of several greenfield projects that will transform the platform and the way the business uses it.

Your day to day will be varied and include deploying new tools on AWS infrastructure and/or Kubernetes, conducting PoCs to assess new technologies, automating manual tasks, enhancing the platform CI/CD pipeline and supporting the platform applications.

**What you offer**

- 5+ years’ of enterprise experience as a Cloud/Devops/Data Engineer
- Hands-on experience with AWS cloud platforms and their respective services
- Hands on experience with Kubernetes
- Experience with Big Data processing technologies like Hive, Spark, Starburst Presto
- Strong scripting skills - python, bash
- Experience working in DevOps, Agile, Scrum, Continuous Delivery environments
- Ability to support the businesses and colleagues through your effective communication skills
- Ability to effectively collaborate with cross-functional teams
- Passionate problem solver with a learning mindset and a keen interest in Big Data and Cloud Technologies

We love hearing from anyone inspired to build a better future with us, if you %%U+0027%% re excited about the role or working at Macquarie we encourage you to apply.

**Benefits**

Macquarie employees can access a wide range of benefits which, depending on eligibility criteria and location, include:

- Hybrid and flexible working arrangements
- Wellbeing and service bonus leave
- Up to 20 weeks paid parental leave as well as benefits to support you as you transition to life as a working parent
- Paid volunteer leave and donation matching
- Range of benefits to support your physical, psychological and financial wellbeing

**About the Corporate Operations Group**

In our Corporate Operations Group, you will work at the heart of Macquarie. Join a collaborative team who accelerate digitalisation, sustainability and social impact for the benefit of our people, customers, shareholders and communities. Our teams include technology, digital transformation and data, operations, human resources, business services, corporate strategy and solutions and the Macquarie Group Foundation.

**Our commitment to Diversity, Equity and Inclusion**

We are committed to providing a working environment that embraces diversity, equity, and inclusion. We encourage people from all backgrounds to apply for a role regardless of their identity, including gender, race, ethnicity, cultural identity, nationality, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, intersex status, marital or family status, neurodiversity, religion or belief, disabilities, or socio-economic background.

If you require adjustments to your working arrangements or the recruitment process, please let us know when applying.

- Solid experience in system and data security
- Demonstrable experience in designing scalable, robust and high performing technology systems

- Experience with Microservices
- Strong communication and stakeholder management skills

**Desirable**

- Exposure to infrastructure design concepts e.g. virtualisation, cloud services, monitoring.
- Experience with Atlassian suite (Jira, Confluence)
