debugText:
## **IT Manager - Financial Services Industry**

- Full-time Work From Home Opportunity!
- Competitive Package - Negotiable Based on Skillset and Experience
- Complementary Access to Trading / Investment Platforms and Education

**Join a Dynamic and Innovative Team**

Are you ready to take on an exciting opportunity with a long-tenured, high-performing team in the financial services industry? We are passionate about delivering market-leading trading and investment services to the global retail market and are looking for an energetic, organised, and highly skilled IT Manager to join us.

If you thrive in dynamic environments, love solving complex technical problems, and have a proactive, solution-driven mindset, we want to hear from you!

**The Role**

We are seeking an energetic, organised, and highly skilled IT generalist with at least 5 years of experience and strong interpersonal skills. This role is best suited to someone with a broad range of IT skills who specializes in building and managing Azure or Google Cloud environments.

Your role will be critical in ensuring high availability, scalability, and security across our cloud and production infrastructure. You will lead efforts to scale, optimise and secure our systems while adhering to industry best practices, and your expertise will be vital in managing our Office 365 environment and providing 24/7 after-hours on-call support for critical production issues.

**Key Responsibilities**

**Cloud Infrastructure Management:**

- Manage and optimise Azure and Google cloud environments for high availability, performance, security, and scalability.
- Administer MS Application Servers and SQL clusters, ensuring backups, disaster recovery, and security practices are implemented effectively.
- Monitor resource usage, optimise cost management, and implement scaling strategies across cloud platforms.

**Network and Security:**

- Implement and manage DNS, DDoS protection, SSL certificates, and VPNs while ensuring robust security practices.
- Conduct regular security audits, vulnerability assessments, deploy security patches as needed and manage access controls using IAM policies.

**Office 365 and User Management:**

- Manage Office 365 accounts, groups, and licenses (SharePoint, OneDrive, Teams).
- Enhance configuration and security of SharePoint, OneDrive, and Teams for an optimal user experience.
- Provide technical support for Office 365-related issues and integrations

**Automation and DevOps Practices:**

- Automate infrastructure management for efficiency and scalability.
- Collaborate with the development team for seamless code deployments and manage software release cycles across staging environments.

**Systems Management:**

- Implement best practices for proactive monitoring, alerting, capacity planning, and incident management.
- Respond to and resolve infrastructure-related issues quickly to minimise downtime.
- Regularly test backups and disaster recovery procedures to ensure business continuity.

**Documentation and Compliance:**

- Develop and maintain documentation for system architecture, configurations, and incident responses.
- Ensure compliance with industry standards by developing, implementing, and managing IT security policies, procedures, and audits to safeguard company data and resources.

**After-Hours On-Call Support:**

- Provide 24/7 on-call support for critical production issues to ensure minimal disruption to services.

**Legacy Systems:**

- Receive training on proprietary legacy systems to provide ongoing support and maintenance.

**About You**

You have a deep understanding of cloud infrastructure, IT systems management, security best practices, as well as a passion for innovation. You %%U+0027%% ll be self-motivated, a natural problem solver, your proactive approach helps you identify opportunities to improve efficiency, and your strong communication skills enable you to work well with cross-functional teams.

**Essential Technical Skills:**

- **Cloud Platforms:** Expertise in Azure and/or Google Cloud for network design and configuration.
- **Microsoft Technology:** Proficiency in managing MS Active Directory, Application Server, DFS Replication, IIS, SQL Server (SQL queries, stored procedures, optimisation, Indexing, SSIS & SSRS), and Office 365 (Teams, SharePoint, OneDrive).
- **Networking:** Solid understanding of DNS, firewalls, VPNs, load balancers, DDoS protection and general network security.
- **Windows Administration:** Strong knowledge of Windows environments and server management.

**Soft Skills:**

- Strong communication and interpersonal skills.
- Ability to independently manage multiple tasks and prioritise in a fast-paced, dynamic environment.
- Detail-oriented and committed to continuous improvement in performance, efficiency, and security.
- Passionate for innovation and new technologies

**Preferred, but Not Essential:**

- Stock and/or Derivatives Trading experience
- Certifications in Azure, Google Cloud or Microsoft technologies
- Project Management or Leadership experience
- Familiarity with SaaS Platforms like MailChimp, Twilio, SendGrid, ActiveCampaign, Zapier and Stripe
- Knowledge of HTML, ISAPI, COM+

**Location**

While our team is distributed across Australia and North America, the ideal candidate will be based in the Greater Sydney, NSW region to facilitate occasional face-to-face meetings with our Sydney-based team. However, we are open to considering applications from other Australian locations for the right candidate.

**Benefits**

- **Competitive Base Salary + Super Package**
- **Full-time Work from Home**
- **Flexible Working Hours considered**
- **Access to Trading and Investment Platforms for Educational Purposes**
- **Financial Services Industry Role**

**Next Steps**

Are you ready to take the next step in your IT career? We’d love to hear from you! If this sounds like the right opportunity for you, please send your CV and we’ll be in touch shortly to discuss this exciting role.

postTitle: Senior Solution Architect - IT Application Services
debugText:
- Based in Macquarie Park, short walk from Metro Station
- 7 Additional leave days per year + Salary Packaging + WFH 2 days pw
- Join a large internal IT & Applications Team at Catholic Healthcare

**Immediate start – Must be available to start by end of October.**

Exciting things are happening at Catholic Healthcare! We’ve grown to 5000+ employees and we’re celebrating our 30th year of providing care in 2024. Our Mission is to promote the dignity, life and spirituality of older people through connected and inclusive communities.

To help shape the future of our IT infrastructure and its alignment with our mission we have a new permanent opportunity for an experienced and driven Senior Solution Architect to join our dedicated and collaborative Apps team and be part of the large broader internal IT team.

Reporting to the IT Applications Services Manager, you will play an integral role in a large digital transformation project where you will design, implement and manage technology solutions that are aligned with CHL’s Enterprise Architecture plan to improve efficiency, scalability and quality of care services.

Your role will cover architecture governance, design, solution and technical expertise, and stakeholder management. Your ability to communicate and collaborate effectively with a broad range of stakeholders, translate requirements, manage expectations and influence to achieve positive successful outcomes, with be critical to your success.

Apply your demonstrated experience working on large scale enterprise transformation projects involving significant core systems such as Finance and Operations, Enterprise Supplier Management, Enterprise Asset Management, Enterprise Risk and Incident Management together with your expertise in designing and implementing complex solutions within a **Microsoft technology stack**.

Your days will include;

- Effective implementation of an architectural framework that ensures scalability, security, and compliance with aged care regulatory standards, while aligning technology strategies with business goals
- Working with the IT Systems Architect and IT Application Services Manager to define, design and oversee the implementation of the architectural framework for systems and platforms
- Collaborating with IT Leadership and Senior Business Management to align technology strategies with business objectives
- Successful architecture of scalable, secure, and cost-effective solutions that align with CHL’s architecture principles and actively support business processes
- Work closely with broader team in the design and delivery of fit-for-purpose technical solutions
- Proactive identification of design risks, with mitigation strategies implemented effectively
- Provision of technical leadership and architectural insights throughout the project lifecycle
- Establishment of strong relationships, ensuring clear communication of architectural concepts, resolving design conflicts, and facilitating smooth transitions to new systems

The ideal applicant will have exceptional technical, analytical and problem-solving skills with the ability to set realistic expectations and deliver agreed outcomes, in addition to;

- 7-10+ years IT experience with 6+ years’ solution architecture experience
- **Proven expertise in Microsoft environments, architectural frameworks, standards and practices**
- Expert level proficiency in creating solution designs and associated documentation
- Relevant Aged Care/Healthcare industry experience in a technology environment
- Technical knowledge of corporate systems (e.g., Finance, HR, Enterprise Risk Management)
- Technical knowledge/experience of Aged Care Clinical systems
- Technical knowledge of **Power Automate, Azure, and other Microsoft applications**
- Strong understanding of software delivery frameworks including Agile, DevOps and TOGAF
- Knowledge of ITSM processes and ITIL framework.
- ITIL v4 Foundation certificate (Desirable)
- Willingness to obtain Police Check

_**What we can offer you as an employee of Catholic Healthcare**_

- Not-for-profit tax benefits - pay less tax
- Fitness Passport - discounted gym benefits
- Paid Parental leave
- Paid Family leave, additional days off each year
- Long Service leave after 5 years
- A values-based organisation that welcomes applicants from all faiths and backgrounds

If you’re looking for a role where you can make a positive impact in a rewarding organisation like ours, we’d love to hear from you.

Apply online now!

debugText:
Are you a seasoned startup CTO with a passion for building groundbreaking products that deliver unmatched value to customers? We’re seeking an exceptional engineering leader with both technical depth and proven experience in guiding teams to success. As CTO, you %%U+0027%% ll lead our engineering department while remaining hands-on with coding and technical problem-solving. This role is for someone who thrives in a fast-paced, growth-oriented environment and is excited to contribute directly to the codebase while shaping the future of our technology. If you %%U+0027%% re not willing to both head the team, as well as code day to day, this role is not for you.

About Audience Republic:

Audience Republic is an all-in-one CRM and marketing platform for events, venues, artists, and creators. Our clients include some of the world’s most renowned names, with events featuring artists like Justin Bieber, Post Malone, RÜFÜS DU SOL, ODESZA, and Flume.

We are a rapidly growing B2B SaaS startup, having secured $12M in funding. Our headquarters is located in Sydney, with other roles distributed across North America and UK/Europe. This role is onsite at our Redfern office.

The Role:

As CTO, you will lead our engineering function and work closely with our Chief Architect to refine and implement our technical strategy, along with our Engineering Managers to drive day to day execution of our roadmap. This role requires a focus on delivering commercial outcomes and maximizing customer value through our products. As a key member of our executive leadership team, you will guide the engineering organization to ensure alignment with business goals while fostering a culture of innovation and excellence.

Responsibilities:

Technical Strategy & Leadership:

- Develop and execute a technology strategy that aligns with Audience Republic’s business objectives, in partnership with the Chief Architect and other executives.
- Collaborate with the Chief Architect, who owns our technical direction, on critical architectural decisions, ensuring scalability, security, and performance.


Product & Customer Focus:

- Work closely with design and customer success teams to ensure our technology solutions deliver maximum value to customers.
- Lead the engineering team in prioritizing and delivering features that align with our commercial goals and enhance the customer experience.
- Regularly engage with customers to understand their needs and translate them into actionable engineering priorities.

Team Leadership & Development:

- Lead, mentor, and develop Engineering Managers and their teams, fostering a high-performance culture that reflects the company’s values.
- Spearhead recruitment efforts to attract and retain top engineering talent, building a world-class engineering team.
- Implement and uphold best practices in software development, quality assurance, and continuous delivery.

Operational Excellence:

- Oversee the end-to-end execution of the product roadmap, ensuring timely and high-quality delivery.
- Establish and monitor key engineering metrics to measure employee happiness, productivity, quality, and team performance.
- Ensure robust processes are in place for incident management, performance monitoring, and continuous improvement.

Innovation & Growth:

- Stay ahead of industry trends and emerging technologies, identifying opportunities for innovation that drive business growth.
- Foster a culture of experimentation and continuous learning within the engineering team, encouraging innovation and improvement.
- Guide the team in scaling our systems to handle growing demand, ensuring reliability and efficiency.

Qualifications:

- Proven experience in a CTO role, preferably within a technology-driven startup environment.
- Demonstrated success in leading engineering teams to develop customer-focused products that drive commercial success.
- Strong technical background with experience in scaling systems including large-scale production environments.
- Excellent leadership skills with the ability to inspire and motivate teams.
- Exceptional communication skills and a collaborative mindset.


How do we work?

- #Customer Obsessed - You’ll be dedicated to understanding our customers, becoming an expert on their challenges and how to solve them. Your focus will be on delivering an exceptional customer experience.

- #Raise The Bar - You’re always pushing the limits of your capabilities, continuously improving and leveling up your skills.

- #Massive Impact - You think like an owner, focusing on making a significant impact on collective goals, not just your individual ones.

- #Hungry & Humble - You have a strong work ethic, resilience, and tenacity, but also the humility to accept feedback and be open to new approaches.

postTitle: Laboratory Information Management Systems Technical Lead, Executive Level 2
debugText:
## About the Department

The Department of Industry, Science and Resources and our broader portfolio are integral to the Australian Government’s economic agenda. Our purpose is to help the government build a better future for all Australians through enabling a productive, resilient and sustainable economy, enriched by science and technology. We do this by:

- Growing innovative & competitive businesses, industries and regions
- Investing in science and technology
- Strengthening the resources sector.

The APS and the department offer a clear direction and meaningful work. You will be able to create positive impact in people’s lives whilst contributing to improved outcomes for Australia and our people.

If you would like to feel a strong connection to your work and you are accountable, committed and open to change, join us in shaping Australia’s future.

Please see the
[**APSC’s APS Employee Value Proposition**](https://www.apsc.gov.au/working-aps/joining-aps/aps-employee-value-proposition)
for more information on the benefits and value of employment within the APS.

## About the National Measurement Institute

The National Measurement Institute (NMI) is the Australian Government’s national measurement authority. We play an important role in the Australian economy. NMI does this by leading, maintaining and regulating Australia’s measurement system.

We deliver world-class measurement products, advice and client services. NMI also administers the regulatory framework for measurement. Our national measurement standards are internationally recognised. We work to enhance and maintain these standards.

We value the different skills, knowledge and perspectives our employees bring. NMI provides all employees with learning and development opportunities. We work to give everyone an equal opportunity to contribute and progress.

NMI %%U+0027%% s is committed to our values.

The Chemical and Biological Metrology Branch provides measurement standards such as certified reference materials, these include pure chemicals, gas standards, matrix materials and DNA standards. The branch also co-ordinates proficiency testing programs to assist laboratories assess their ongoing quality and performance. The branch houses three of Australia’s national testing laboratories for anti-doping, forensic drugs and ultra-trace analysis. The branch delivers services across all of these fields and carries out research and development to enhance our capabilities in line with national and international requirements.

The Analytical Services Branch (ASB) consists of a team of over 100 staff based in Port Melbourne and North Ryde. We are responsible for conducting chemical and biological measurements for sectors including food, health and environment. We perform a diverse range of tests, including but not limited to:

- Microbiological
- Allergen
- Element
- Nutrient
- Contaminants

Providing analytical solutions and technical expertise to the private sector and government agencies to allow them to meet their business, research and regulatory compliance needs.

## About the LIMS Simplification Project

NMI has commenced a project to implement a new Laboratory Information Management System (LIMS). The LIMS Simplification Project is a collaborative project involving stakeholders from across different branches of NMI and the Department. The aims of the project are to:

- Provide a unified foundation for NMI’s chemical and biological laboratories
- Reduce risks related to the maintenance and security of ICT systems
- Improve process efficiency and service delivery
- Improve client satisfaction

## The opportunity

As the LIMS Technical Lead, you will contribute towards the LIMS Simplification Project by managing the design, development, implementation and post-go-live administration of the LabWare LIMS. You will be responsible for driving the architecture, coding standards and integration of LIMS within the NMI’s laboratory operations. You will manage a team of developers and subject matter experts drawn from across NMI and work closely with DISR IT, LabWare LIMS consultants to ensure delivery of an optimal LIMS that meets the operational and regulatory requirements.

This position reports to the NMI LIMS Product Owner.

## What’s in it for you?

Working at NMI means you are joining one of the world leaders in measurement science. NMI has a diverse range of roles and priorities that will enable you to learn new skills and expand your career in interesting and exciting ways. As part of the department, employees at NMI are covered by the relevant enterprise agreement and benefits include:

- 15.4% employer superannuation contribution
- 4 weeks annual leave per year
- 18 days paid personal leave per year.
- maternity and paternity leave
- a vacation care subsidy
- $235 healthy lifestyle subsidy
- flexible working arrangements such as teleworking, part time and job sharing where possible.
- salary packaging which allows you to make certain payments using your pre-tax salary.
- access to study assistance
- access to staff counselling services.

## Our ideal candidate

- A Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Information Technology or related field.
- At least 5 years of experience working with LabWare LIMS, including system configuration, customisation and development.
- Demonstrated ability to lead a team of developers and collaborate with cross-functional teams, providing technical guidance, task management, and mentorship.
- Experience working in a high paced project environment.
- Demonstrated ability to work co-operatively and effectively in a team environment in accordance with equity provisions.
- Knowledge of scientific laboratory processes and the Quality Assurance and Quality Systems principles and practices.
- Demonstrated experience in programming languages such as SQL, VB Scripts, LIMS Basic, HTML and Java Script.
- Proficiency in creating and managing complex LabWare LIMS workflows and interfaces.
- Expertise in system administration of LIMS and database management.
- Excellent verbal and written communication skills with the ability to explain complex technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders.
- Experience using DevOps is desirable.

Ideal candidates will have personal drive and integrity in the context of the APS values, NMI values (Inclusive, Innovative, Accountable, Adaptable, Influential and Strategic) and code of conduct.

Demonstrated experience working with LabWare LIMS, including system configuration, customisation and development, and leading technical teams to deliver on large scale LIMS solutions.

Our department has a commitment to inclusion and diversity, with an ambition of being the best possible place to work. This reflects the importance we place on our people and on creating a workplace culture where each one of us is valued and respected for our contribution. Our ideal candidate adds to this culture and our workplace in their own way.

## What you will do

- As NMI’s LIMS Technical Lead you will work closely with the NMI Product Owner and DISR IT Project Manager to deliver on a new LIMS solution for the Chemical and Biological laboratories of the National Measurement Institute.
- You will be responsible for leading the design, customisation and configuration of the LabWare LIMS within the timeline of the project.
- Work with Product Owner and Project Managers on project planning and resource forecasting.
- You will mentor and manage a team of NMI subject matter developers and IT developers, creating a high functioning team to deliver an optimal LIMS solution.
- You will be responsible for the quality of the technical delivery of the LIMS ensuring it meets the business requirements and the Departments security requirements.
- You will work closely with the LIMS vendor to resolve any technical issues relating to the LIMS solution.
- You will provide technical expertise to the project including at the requirements gathering stage, solution design workshops, implementation of the solution, user acceptance testing and post-go-live enhancements.
- Maintain and improve best software engineering (coding) practice.
- Participate in user acceptance testing activities including scenario gathering, configuration and scenario mapping, bug fixing, and unit testing.
- Provide expert advice in business improvement and process improvement strategies.
- Manage, document and review the development of LIMS documentation.
- Work with LIMS Administrators for BAU support and implementing enhancements.
- Upskill and share knowledge of proprietary LIMS scripting language with NMI team.
- Promote a culture of safety and a safe working environment, ensuring adherence to health and safety protocols.

## Eligibility

Tertiary qualifications in Science or Computer Science.

To be eligible for employment in the APS and the department, candidates must be Australian Citizens.

Positions require a Baseline security clearance and successful candidates will be required to obtain and maintain a clearance at this level.

## Notes

A merit pool may be established and used to fill future vacancies within 18 months from the date the vacancy was first advertised in the Gazette.

The department does currently offer flexible work opportunities for many roles. This vacancy is NSW - Sydney - North Ryde based, although flexible or remote work arrangements may be considered. Please reach out to the contact officer to discuss this further.

## Application information

Your application must not contain any classified or sensitive information. This includes in your application responses, CV and any other documents. The selection panel may not consider applications containing classified information.

Please provide a pitch explaining how your skills, knowledge and experience will be relevant to this role and why you are the best candidate for the position. Your pitch can contain no more than 500 words and should align to the key duties listed above.

Please complete your application online and provide your current CV with your application. (CVs must be in .doc, .docx, or .pdf format).

Accessible application documentation is available in other formats on request. Please contact
[**recruitment@industry.gov.au**](mailto:recruitment@industry.gov.au)
or (02) 6276 1235 if you require assistance with your application.

Please refer to our
[**Applying for a position**](https://www.industry.gov.au/work-us/application-process)
information for additional information on how to apply.

## Contact Information

For more information regarding this opportunity, please contact Helen Salouros on 02 9449 0187 or via email on helen.salouros@measurement.gov.au

A large government organisation is on the lookout for a Cyber Security Architect for a 2 Year Fixed Term Contract based from their head office in the Sydney CBD. The purpose for the role is to be a key contributor to the overall technical direction of the team %%U+0027%% s security capability. The role works closely with the client engagement, large cyber programs of maturity, leaders across the Security and Risk team providing specialist advice and skills to ensure the successful migration, implementation, delivery, and continuous improvement of cyber defence, risk and resilience services across the wider business. The role has flexible working arrangements and will up to $188k INCL super for the right candidate.

**Key Accountabilities:**

- Execute the security architecture design development for key projects through the application of architectural

  methods, standards and principles.
- Define security solutions architectures, high-level designs, and impact assessments for initiatives and/or

  systems across the client
- Assess new technologies, vendors and cloud services against the clients security standards.
- Define security requirements for an application or specifying optimum security design for major IT

  implementations.
- Take ownership of deliverables for Security Architecture and Security Risk Assessments and ensure that they

  are agreed and endorsed by all stakeholders
- Work with analysts in defining business requirements, and work with subject matter experts (such as

  infrastructure leads, cloud specialists, architects, operators, developers, and business experts) to develop high

  level designs, in line with the security architecture, patterns and practices. This may occasionally extend to

  assist with detailed design work.

**Experience Required:**

- Deep knowledge of information security risk management and cyber security technologies
- **Must have experience as a Cyber Security Architect working on an application migration project.**
- Strong experience in implementing security architectures , tools and practices with a working knowledge of OT and IT
- Demonstrated knowledge of ISO27001, ISO31000, IEC 62443, ASD Essential 8, and or NIST Framework
- IT skills, including knowledge of computer networks, protocols, operating systems, software, hardware and security, across enterprise networks and OT environments is desirable
- Experience in undertaking major security projects including the design and implementation of security

  technologies.

If this sounds like your next opportunity, please send an updated CV to Todd Thorn and I will call you to discuss.

debugText:
**So, what’s the role all about?**

After key NICE CX customers have purchased and are implementing our products, the Technical Account Management (TAM) team takes ownership of the customer relationship and becomes their advocate within NICE CX. The Technical Account Manager (TAM) begins to engage with the customer before they go live on the contact center platform, and works closely with the customer from that point forward to ensure their success.

Our TAMs are seasoned account management and technical resolution professionals who are at the top of their field and are unified in exceeding customer expectations, improving our processes and technology, and meeting company growth objectives. The TAM is a very experienced TAM, responsible for resolving complex problems and providing excellent technical and customer service to specific key accounts. He/she will help them overcome issues that arise, succeed in their business using our technology and services, expand their usage of our products, be a reference to prospective customers, and be a long-term and loyal customer. The accounts assigned may include any of our paid service packages, where the services of an experienced TAM are expected. TAMs are generally assigned customers with a top-level service package, have high complexity, are high-touch, or are enterprise-level.

​Interaction with customers will be done via phone, email, chat and WebEx, with face to face meetings as necessary and/or appropriate. Travel is more frequent than with other TAMs due to the higher level customers being served and the increased services offered with higher level service packages. The TAM will work both independently and in concert with Sales, Technical Support, Professional Services and other teams to ensure the highest levels of customer success, providing a collaborative solution that will leave the customer with a positive experience and a product that meets their needs.

**How will you make an impact?**

You will be responsible for:

- Work largely during the customers %%U+0027%%  core business hours, with occasional extended hours as needed
- Occasional on-call after-hours work may be required as needed by the customer
- As their account management professional, be the assigned accounts %%U+0027%%  single point of contact to our company, and engage resources across several teams as needed to resolve their issues and requests
- Develop and maintain an effective and productive relationship with assigned accounts, hold regular discussions to review open issues, understand their contact center and business, know how NICE CX %%U+0027%% s
 solutions meet their needs, share best practices, determine ways to increase their success, and become their trusted partner and advisor
- Excellent triage and troubleshooting skills, teaching peers those same skills to improve their success
- Personally resolve as many customer issues as possible while scheduling time for proactive activities
- Partnering with other NICE CX employees and teams (technical support, professional services, product management, engineering, etc.), ensure that all technical challenges and other issues/cases/requests are being handled properly, are within SLA targets, and are progressing toward resolution
- Demonstrate superior in depth knowledge of NICE CX products and associated technologies, especially those employed by assigned accounts
- Demonstrate subject matter expertise in one or more technical areas
- Demonstrate expertise and maintain currency in telecommunications, contact center, and related technologies
- Gain a deep understanding of each customer %%U+0027%% s environment, identify customer needs, propose solutions that will accelerate their success
- Demonstrate a working knowledge of competitive product lines, differentiators and industry trends through self-education and NICE CX %%U+0027%% s resources
- Develop and present customized presentations to assigned accounts that both quantify and qualify product/service usage, realized benefits, achievements, opportunities and next steps
- Provide training to accounts to ensure that they get the most out of their NICE CX investment
- Capture common questions, techniques and best practices in daily workflow, sharing that information by regularly creating and improving knowledgebase content
- Provide coaching to peers and demonstrate consistent and high-value participation in knowledge creation and improvement
- Ensure that all communication, interactions, assignments, details and actions are clear, effective, timely (within established SLA), and are logged into the CRM system
- Appropriately contribute to and take charge of meetings, calls and other discussions to convey ownership, organization, progress and direction
- Consistently and regularly update customer and account information, keeping it current in the CRM system
- Tactfully, confidently and professionally communicate with all stakeholders, especially in emotionally-charged and escalated situations, bringing people together with the common goal of resolving issues and accelerating the customer %%U+0027%% s success
- Communicate and work with customers in a way that they do not escalate and are confident that their issues and concerns are being properly represented and handled by NICE CX
- Assist the team by taking ownership of escalations in your area of expertise, exemplifying the effective handling of difficult situations
- Develop and drive business cases that outline problems, impacts, proposed solutions and outcomes that help NICE CX improve our performance and success
- Make and meet all commitments, building trust with customers and help others to do the same
- Present a professional image in communication, conduct, attitude and attire
- Demonstrates professionalism and leadership with customers, and helps peers to develop the same level of expertise
- Accountable for all actions, and tactfully reinforce accountability across all employees and teams in the company for delivering to OLA and SLA. Professionally and tactfully teaches proper process and methods that ensure customer service excellence
- Assist assigned customers in preparation for go-live, and build confidence with them as they begin using our products in a live environment
- Responsible for customer satisfaction, retention and referenceability for all assigned account
- Participate in team goal achievement and set personal goals that increase effectiveness and success
- Identify opportunities to improve or modify products and services to improve customer effectiveness and experience, and recommend those improvements through proper channels, driving product/services enhancements and development
- Employs an assertive yet positive attitude in working with others to improve process issues that cause inefficiency, risk, missed targets, and frustration.
- Add value to the company by participating in projects, tasks and initiatives that improve process, methods, tactics and success within the team and across NICE CX. Participation in these things does not detract from the service, value, and outcomes provided to assigned accounts
- Mentor Associate TAMs and other peers as appropriate toward increased success
- Provide technical and process training to others based on skills and expertise, which training improves others %%U+0027%%  effectiveness and efficiency
- Successful at turning struggling accounts into successful accounts
- Manage and document certain NICE CX technical projects with each assigned account to ensure that they are successful
- Occasional travel (up to 25%) required, visiting customer sites
- Perform other tasks and duties as assigned or needed
- Follow the company Code of Ethics and NICE CX policies and procedures at all times
- Communicate in an effective and professional way with customers in and outside of NICE CX

**Have you got what it takes?**

- 10+ years in a Technical/Service role in software, telecommunications or in customer service, call/contact center and/or service delivery
- Demonstrated technical problem solving proficiency
- Excellent analytical and advanced troubleshooting skills with end-users/customers
- Excellent customer service and communication skills, both verbal and written
- Ability to multitask and work well in a fast-paced environment
- Proficient in Microsoft Office applications
- Able to work with little supervision and complete projects
- Working technical knowledge of contact center software/design/functionality
- Demonstrated experience in a fast paced environment and meeting customer time constraints
- Implementation: broad skills in both technology & analysis; experience in communicating at a technical and functional level while managing business rapport

**You will have an advantage if you also have:**

- TCP/IP networking knowledge and VoIP technology exposure
- Comprehensive knowledge of TCP/IP, telecom circuits from DS0 through OC-48
- Understanding of network topology and telecommunications architecture (PBX, Carriers and VoIP)
- Understanding of basic scripting fundamentals
- Solid understanding of TCP/IP and internet fundamentals
- Extensive software, telecommunications and IP Telephony
- Experience using SIP signaling
- Competent in database and SQL concepts and scripting
- Analytical, inquisitive, service & team-oriented, friendly demeanor, early adopter

**What’s in it for you?**

Learn more about the
Benefits at NICE

Join an ever-growing, market-disrupting, global company where the teams – comprised of the best of the best – work in a fast-paced, collaborative, and creative environment! As the market leader, every day at NICE is a chance to learn and grow, and there are endless internal career opportunities across multiple roles, disciplines, domains, and locations. If you are passionate, innovative, and excited to constantly raise the bar, you may just be our next NICEr!

postTitle: Engineering Manager - Data Engineering/ Analytics group
debugText:
**Engineering Manager - Data Engineering/ Analytics group**

- **You are** passionate, driven, flexible and collaborative
- **We are** a team of big thinkers who are engineering the future of banking
- **Together we** will build tomorrow %%U+0027%% s bank today, using world-leading technology and innovation

**Do work that matters**

We %%U+0027%% re building tomorrow %%U+0027%% s bank today, which means we need creative and diverse engineers to help us redefine what customers expect from a bank. Envisioning new technologies that are still waiting to be invented and reimagining products that support our customers and help build Australia %%U+0027%% s future economy.

Our Software team are the brains behind Australia %%U+0027%% s number one banking app, Netbank, Cardless Cash, Comm Sec Pocket and Spend Tracker. We go beyond a passion for web and mobile development, creating reliable APIs at a unique scale in Australia. And you could be a part of that journey.

**See yourself in our team**

Business Banking Technology is responsible for the world-leading application of technology and operations across every aspect of CommBank - from innovative product platforms for our customers, to essential tools within our business. We also use technology to drive simplicity and better banking, an essential component of great customer service underpinning a strong emphasis on software development as a craft and the adoption of industry best engineering practices.

You %%U+0027%% ll be part of a wider BB Tech team integrated into the Digital & Automated Credit Crew in Business Lending Domain. The crew is reimagining the way we offer credit to our business customers by focusing on certainty and speed. We do this through building next gen digital and automated credit solutions using BIAN and BaaS microservices architecture.

As an Engineering Manager - Data Chapter Lead, you %%U+0027%% ll provide expert advice relating to technology, solution design and architecture, people leadership and hiring to drive excellence in technical delivery as per group engineering practices and standards. You will bring a perfect blend of people management, technical expertise and will be responsible for shaping the evolution of technical squad through contribution to the BB technology strategy, quarterly crew memo, prioritise backlog, define delivery roadmap, and determine which problems to invest in solving.

**We are seeking people who have:**

- Have the ability to build, lead, and inspire an engaged team of engineers while also fostering an engineering culture of excellence.
- Are data enthusiastic in providing the solutions that source data from various enterprise data platform into data lake, using technologies like Scala, Python, R, PySpark; transform and process the source data to produce data products, transform and egression to other data platforms like SQL Server, Oracle, Teradata and other cloud platforms.
- Are reliable in building data products or data assets from scratch, by integrating large sets of data derived from hundreds of internal and external sources.
- Demonstrated experience in creating libraries using functional languages (python, scala, R) and use them for the config - driven pipeline generation and delivering optimised enterprise-wide data ingestion, data integration and data pipeline solutions for Data Lake & warehouse platforms.
- Have experience and responsible for data security and data management.
- Can collaborate, co-create and contribute to existing Data Engineering practices in the team.
- Encourages risk-taking and constructive challenge while growing diverse and inclusive teams.

**Technical Skills:**

We use a broad range of tools, languages, and frameworks. We don %%U+0027%% t expect you to know them all but experience or exposure with some of these (or equivalents) will set you up for success in this team.

- Experience in designing, building, and delivering enterprise-wide data ingestion, data integration and data pipeline solutions using Hadoop and AWS.
- Experience in building data solution in Hadoop platform, using Spark, MapReduce, Kafka and various ETL frameworks for distributed data storage and processing.
- Strong functional programming and scripting skills in Scala, Java, or Python.
- Proficient in SQL scripting, writing complex SQLs for building data pipelines.
- Experience in working in Agile teams, including working closely with internal business stakeholders.
- Experience in leading and mentoring data engineers, including ownership of internal business stakeholder relationships and working with consultants.
- Familiarity with data warehousing and data mart build experience in Teradata, Oracle or RDBMS system is a plus.
- Certification on AWS is a plus.

**Working with us:**

Whether you %%U+0027%% re passionate about customer service, driven by software engineering, or called by creativity, a career with us is for you.

We support our people with the flexibility to balance where work is done with at least half their time each month connecting in office. We also have many other flexible working options available including changing start and finish times, part-time arrangements and job share to name a few.

Our people bring their diverse backgrounds and unique perspectives to build a respectful, inclusive, and flexible workplace with flexible work locations. We %%U+0027%% re looking for people who truly live our values: Care, Courage and Commitment and we %%U+0027%% ll offer you great opportunities to develop your career with us.

_Whether you %%U+0027%% re passionate about customer service, driven by data, or called by creativity, a career here is for you._

_Our people bring their diverse backgrounds and unique perspectives to build a respectful, inclusive and flexible workplace._ _We are working hard to build a team of people who represent the rich diversity of our customers and communities. If you %%U+0027%% re excited about this opportunity but you don %%U+0027%% t meet every single requirement, or your experience doesn %%U+0027%% t align perfectly, we still want to encourage you to apply. You may just be the perfect candidate for this opportunity or another within CommBank._

_At CommBank we will inspire you with work that makes a difference, surround you with talented people that respect and value each other, and empower you to grow professionally and personally. Most of all, making_ _a positive impact for customers, communities and each other is part of our every day._

_We %%U+0027%% re determined to make a real difference for Australia %%U+0027%% s first peoples. We encourage all interested applicants to apply._ _If you %%U+0027%% re already part of the Commonwealth Bank Group (including Bankwest), you %%U+0027%% ll need to apply through Sidekick to submit a valid application. We %%U+0027%% re keen to support you with the next step in your career._

debugText:
**We %%U+0027%% re looking for people to join the Access family, who share our passion for believing in better, and who will help us continue to grow.**

Love Work. Love Life. Be You. - is central to our success and how we give our customers the freedom to do more of what %%U+0027%% s important to them.

**What does Access offer you?**

We offer a flexible, hybrid working environment where you can balance work and life while maintaining a strong office team-based culture. We deliver on what we say, taking the development of our people seriously. We %%U+0027%% ll work with you to progress your success plan and provide opportunities to accelerate your career.

On top of a competitive salary, our wellbeing days taking you to 25 days leave a year and a health contribution, you %%U+0027%% ll also be able to choose from a range of benefits to suit you. We %%U+0027%% re an organisation that likes to give back, so you %%U+0027%% ll also have three charity days allocated to support a cause that matters to you.

**About you:**

As the Senior IT Manager for Access APAC, you will oversee all IT operations and strategy for APAC. You will be responsible for shaping Access %%U+0027%% s APAC technology operations by providing end-to-end management of our IT team, technology infrastructure and services. You will also be responsible for strategic and workforce planning alongside fiscal management and reporting.

You %%U+0027%% ll also support APAC by successfully delivering IT Operations, M&A, Projects and innovation, managing the IT function, ensuring the security and integrity of our technology architecture and systems environment, and providing strategic leadership and guidance to the APAC Executive team.

In this key role as Senior IT Manager, you will be responsible for facilitating collaboration and driving technology initiatives that support global strategies and objectives whilst maintaining and improving SLA standards for the Service Desk Team

**Day-to-day, you will:**

· Lead and develop the APAC IT team, fostering a culture of continuous improvement, managing staffing levels and skills to ensure they remain up to date with changing technology and business requirements

·Oversee the design, implementation, and maintenance of APAC %%U+0027%% s IT infrastructure. and allocation of equipment upgrades across APAC.

·Implement cybersecurity policies and procedures, ensuring compliance with regulations and cost-effective solutions, maintaining and improving SLA standards & business processes.

·Develop and implement the IT strategy in alignment with the company %%U+0027%% s business objectives & deliver integration projects in line with the IT&O M&A Directors strategy and timelines.

·Provide advice to the APAC Executive Team on emerging technologies and their potential to innovate the business. In addition, providing 1-1 technical support to the APAC Executive Team and providing software training as required

·Providing 1st and 2nd line technical support via our Service Desk system for a wide range of external and internal applications, operating systems and hardware and ensuring team SLAs remain above 95% response times. including complaint escalations.

·Accurate documentation and recording of actions in our Service desk application and ensure compliance with GDPR and ISO27001 along with designing training programs and workshops for staff and conduct regular system audits.

·Overseeing and determining timeframes for major IT projects including system updates, upgrades, migrations and outages

·In conjunction with the FBP: Forecasting, budgeting, managing and annual reporting: APAC IT budget. To include running and sharing regular operation system reports with senior staff.

**Your skills and experiences might also include:**

· Minimum 10 years %%U+0027%%  industry experience; with solid experience in daily IT operational support and minimum 6 years %%U+0027%%  experience at management level.

·Expert knowledge in deploying, configuring, and managing Microsoft 365, InTune, MFA, PaloAlto, Cortex and SNOW.

·Experience managing the IT requirements for acquired companies.

·Demonstrated hands-on experience in the delivery of complex IT projects spanning multiple countries, along with identifying and managing project issues, risks and dependencies.

·Demonstrated experience with office relocation and fitout including audio-visual systems.

·Experienced relationship-building skills and ability to engage with business functional requirements - demonstrating clear communication and convincing presentation skills.

·Rigorous and detail-oriented analytical and problem-solving skills alongside excellent organisation and time management skills.

**What are we all about?**

The Access Group is one of the largest UK-headquartered providers of business management software to small and mid-sized organisations in the UK, Ireland, USA and Asia Pacific. It helps more than 100,000 customers across commercial and non-profit sectors become more productive and efficient. Our products and solutions go beyond providing technology, we connect the right people with the right data, at the right time, through Access Workspace.

**At Access, we are committed to creating a welcoming and inclusive environment where everyone can thrive. If you %%U+0027%% re excited about this role, (even if your previous experience doesn %%U+0027%% t align perfectly), you might just be the perfect fit for us! We wholeheartedly believe in equality for all and the transformative power of diversity.** **Why not join our vibrant team where you can love what you do, love how you live, and most importantly, be authentically you? Let %%U+0027%% s make a difference together.**

**Love Work. Love Life. Be You.**

**We kindly request all interested candidates apply directly online:**

**https://proavsolutions.bamboohr.com/careers/209**

Pro AV Solutions is Australia %%U+0027%% s leading workplace technology integration organisation. We are a workplace where our people feel inspired, fulfilled and safe. We will provide you with a welcoming and experienced group of people to work with, a competitive remuneration package, access to an employee assistance program, birthday gift vouchers and just an overall great place to work.

We are seeking a full-time Draftsperson, located in our Sydney office, facilitating drafting services across our national footprint.
 As a fulltime Draftsperson, you will be responsible for drafting and revising audio-visual (AV) systems which will involve:

- Technical AV Design validation through the shop drawing process.
- Preparing AV signal flow diagrams/system schematics.
- Preparing typical elevations and layouts of AV equipment.
- Assisting in the development and maintenance of drafting workflow, reference libraries and standards.
- Reviewing and liaising with architectural and building trades for coordinated shop drawing packages, including but not limited to; General Arrangements, Elevations, Reflected Ceiling Plans, Cable Schedules, Signal Flow Diagrams, System Schematics, Network Topology, Equipment Details, Mechanical Fabrication.
- Researching AV product information as needed for drawing preparation.
- Coordinating with internal & external stakeholders, vendors and manufacturers as needed.

As the ideal candidate, you will have at least 2 years of fulltime highly relevant post-qualification work experience in the Audio-Visual industry. This experience is where you gained a strong understanding of Integrated AV systems which includes understanding their capabilities and using case scenarios to enable you to make informed decisions. We are looking for someone who has a strong understanding and capability in the use of the software applications we use, AutoCAD and Visio. You will ideally also have the ability to understand architectural & services drawings with 3D modelling experience a plus. You must be able to demonstrate that you are a strong technical thinker, an excellent communicator, have finite attention to detail and great problem-solving skills. Being able to manage your time with the ability to prioritise your work based on timelines, type of opportunities and job size, is a must.

We will provide a great working environment where we get to work on some exciting projects for Australia’s largest companies. We offer comprehensive ongoing training which will help your development and career growth in the audio-visual industry.

We encourage applications from candidates with disabilities, of all ages and genders, Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islanders and diverse community groups.

postTitle: Senior Architect - Core Banking & Product Architecture
debugText:
**About the Role**

As Senior Architect - Core Banking & Products Architecture, you will be responsible for providing strategic leadership and technical expertise in designing and maintaining the architecture of our organization %%U+0027%% s core banking platform (with special focus on Temenos T24). You will play a pivotal role in driving innovation, efficiency, and scalability of our banking technology infrastructure. This position requires at least 10+ years of experience, with deep understanding of banking operations, modern technology trends, and a proven track record in architecting, migrating and implementing a material core banking transformation.

Key Responsibilitie will include:

- Develop and maintain a long-term architecture vision for the Temenos core banking and product systems, aligned with the organization %%U+0027%% s business objectives and regulatory requirements.
- Collaborate with the executive team and other stakeholders to understand business needs and translate them into technical requirements and architectural designs.
- Establish and communicate architectural guidelines, principles, and best practices to ensure consistent and standardized solutions.
- Lead and create architectures and designs of BOQ group’s core banking systems, including but not limited to Temenos T24 core banking platforms, other product systems (e.g. leasing), customer master systems, and integration with third-party services.
- Guide colleagues and other teams with detailed knowledge about T24 Core Banking capabilities, features and configuration possibilities to assist with fit/gap and impact assessments for new requirements

**About you**

Joining our team as Senior Architect - Core Banking & Product Architecture presents an exciting opportunity to shape the future of our BOQ’s digital banking landscape and deliver exceptional services to our business and retail customers. If you are an expert in Temenos T24 Core Banking (or an equivalent mature core banking platform) and a forward-thinking banking technology professional with a passion for innovation and a track record of successful architectural/design, transformation and migration experience we invite you to apply for this position and be a key driver of our organization %%U+0027%% s growth and success.

**About Us**

BOQ Group is a truly unique group of challenger brands with a purpose – to provide a genuine alternative to Australian financial services for customers and employees.

Our family of brands (Bank of Queensland (BOQ), ME Bank, Virgin Money Australia, BOQ Specialist), each come with their own defined customer audience and brand personality, but share one goal – to build social capital through banking. That’s creating trust with customers, exploring staff potential and believing that tiny gestures and big ideas can change the world for communities.

BOQ Group’s inclusive vision is to foster a workspace that values and leverages difference and creates new possibilities, a place where our people feel confident to bring their best selves to work every day. We embrace difference and believe that our workforce should reflect the customers and communities that we serve.

Since 2021, BOQ Group is recognised as an Employer of Choice for Gender Equality by the Workplace Gender Equality Agency (WGEA).

In 2023, we successfully implemented an innovative Reconciliation Plan, driving positive change and promoting inclusivity across BOQ Group.

**Our Benefits**

• Flexible working arrangements

• Discounted financial products

• Salary sacrificing options

• Paid parental leave with no minimum

• Purchase annual leave

• Discounted private health insurance plan

• Employee Assistance Program (EAP)

• Access to employee network groups focused on First Nations Reconciliation, LGBTQIA+, Multicultural, Gender, Early Careers and accessibility

• BOQ Group is a member of Pride in Diversity and a participating organisation in the Australian Workplace Equality Index

**How to Apply**

To apply for this role at #boqgroup #grouptech,
follow the links or apply via our
Careers Page.

BOQ Group
is committed to diversity and an inclusive workforce. Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander People are encouraged to apply.

We celebrate, value and include people of all backgrounds, gender and expressions, sexualities, cultures, bodies and abilities. When you apply, you are welcome to tell us the pronouns you use and please let us know any reasonable adjustments you may need during the interview process.

If you are successful for a role with BOQ Group, it is a condition of employment that background screening is completed to ensure that the Bank complies with its obligations under the Anti-Money Laundering and Counter Terrorism Financing Act. These checks may include, but are not limited to: identity, verification, reference checks, criminal background checks, immigration checks, verification of academic qualifications, bankruptcy checks.

**Please no agency applications.**

debugText:
_The ACEREZ consortium, which includes the ACCIONA COBRA Joint Venture (ACJV), has been appointed Preferred Proponent to design and construct the transmission line infrastructure for the Central-West Orana Renewable Energy Zone (CWO REZ), as part of Australia’s energy transition, outlined in the NSW Electricity Infrastructure Roadmap._

_The new transmission infrastructure, which will combine high-capacity transmission lines, energy hubs and related infrastructure, will enable generators such as solar and wind farms and energy storage providers in the CWO REZ to connect to the electricity grid, providing a reliable supply of clean, affordable electricity for households and businesses across NSW while helping to meet the state’s newly legislated Net Zero targets._

**Job Description**

With a commitment to driving positive change, contributing to the evolution of Australia’s green energy sector, this is your chance to be part of something groundbreaking!

Our Central-West Orana project is currently seeking a dedicated Temporary Works Design Engineer to share their expertise within our growing Project Wide team.
In this role, you will contribute to temporary works engineering activities, manage design aspects, and provide technical support to ensure successful project delivery. You’ll oversee resources and collaborate with teams to move works from design to completion, ensuring alignment with project goals and standards.

_**This role is based in our project office based in Sydney CBD with occasional trips to site (Mudgee).**_

**Key Responsibilities**

- Conduct site inspections, research, and surveys to support engineering strategies and solutions.
- Assist in design processes, identifying potential issues, and preparing technical drawings using CAD software.
- Provide technical support, including analysis, reporting, and logistical tasks for engineering projects.
- Monitor systems and equipment to ensure compliance with safety, time, cost, and legislative standards.
- Perform routine design tasks, including research and developing preliminary drawings under supervision.
- Assist in preparing design schedules and maintaining document control in line with company standards.
- Contribute to project documentation, schedules, and client presentation materials.
- Support design engineering activities, reviewing processes, and making recommendations to meet quality and profit goals.

**Minimum Skills & Qualifications**

- Preferable 5+ years’ experience in a construction/engineering environment with significant exposure to design, costing, estimating and planning.
- Relevant Tertiary qualifications in Engineering or an architectural and/or technical design related discipline.
- Demonstrated experience in foundations, bridges, bulk earth works, roads and/or drainage design.
- Knowledge of accounting, estimating, scheduling, contracts administration, procurement, financial controls and reporting.
- Knowledge of the construction industry including HS&E requirements and environmental engineering and / or design engineering principles, guidelines and developments, including laws and regulations ensuring all relevant regulatory requirements are satisfied.
- Experience in using technical design tools and/or software packages which may include Computer Aided Design (CAD) software and drafting techniques.
- Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
- Demonstrated ability to work effectively with others, leadership skills and high attention to detail.

_We are committed to fostering an inclusive environment where all voices are heard and valued. We welcome applicants of all backgrounds, identities, and experiences. Our goal is to build a diverse team that reflects the communities we serve and drives innovation through varied perspectives. We encourage candidates from underrepresented groups to apply and look forward to creating a supportive workplace together._

Cover-More Group helps people travel safely across the globe every day. We are there at every step of a traveller’s journey, to keep them safe and help them out if something goes wrong. We are committed to providing reliable, fast, flexible and bespoke services for our customers as well as the many well-known brands we partner with, such as travel agencies, airlines, banks and major sporting clubs!

In the post-pandemic world, travel insurance is more important than ever. We are committed to delivering an exceptional service for our customers and we want you to be part of that journey.

**So, what’s the job?**

- You’ll lead and guide the design of program solution architecture
- You’ll contribute to the overall design governance of system architecture across Cover-More Group
- You’ll contribute to designing and governing system integrations
- You’ll ensure quality is maintained for program architecture
- You’ll support the facilitation of governance and adoption of the right solution across your delegated area of responsibility
- You’ll assess the direct and indirect impact of Architecture on the end customer and seek opportunities to improve the overall customer experience (both efficiency and effectiveness outcomes)
- You’ll support the overarching Group Architecture strategy

**And what are we looking for?**

- You’ll have extensive experience in a Solution Architecture role with exposure to business applications, integration, security, and data architecture within a large and complex business environment
- You’ll have Tertiary qualification in Business Information, Engineering, Technology or related field
- You’ll have a thorough understanding of key technology architectural frameworks and standards
- You’ll have strong technical background and exposure to leading technology platform integration frameworks, Integration patterns and cloud-based infrastructure (AWS)
- You’ll have experience designing and integrating mobility solutions leveraging AWS services and platforms
- You’ll be comfortable working in an agile environment
- You’ll ideally have experience within financial services or fintech

**So, why choose us?**

We value optimism, caring, togetherness, reliability and determination.

We have more than 1500 employees worldwide: we’re a global group of digital specialists, actuaries, marketers, doctors, nurses, case managers, claims specialists, finance experts and customer service professionals. We share a global mission to look after travellers, at every step of their journey.

**Job flexibility**. We understand the importance of making sure that work fits into your life, not the other way around.
 Our hybrid work week policy ensures our employees maintain work-life balance with the flexibility of 3 days in the office and 2 days working from home.

**Career growth.** We want you to continue to learn, develop and bring your ideas to the table. We want to hear what you think, and we want you to work with the business - not for the business!

**Take the time you need, for you and your community.** We encourage you to take the time you need, when you need it. We offer regular annual and personal leave benefits along with anniversary leave, volunteer leave and a comprehensive paid parental leave scheme.

**Travel and work with us.** We’ll help you keep travelling in your career, oh and quite literally with free travel insurance for you and your partner. We also offer great discounts through our extensive travel partnerships…so start planning for your next trip today!

**Diversity and inclusion.** We respect who you are and thoroughly embrace diversity. So whatever walk of life you wander, just be you and come as you are.

**Apply today and let’s go great places together!**

**#LI-Hybrid**

You will be working on a variety of projects and engaging / consulting with stakeholders from different parts of the business, leading the design and solutioning and partnering with the engineering team to ensure delivery. You will be required to provide guidance and advice, all the while ensuring proposed solutions address business needs, are fit for purpose and will align to the organisation %%U+0027%% s technology roadmap.

- Advanced knowledge and experience working with a variety of technologies including different operating systems (Windows / Linux), cloud providers (AWS / Azure), networking, storage, database, middleware, virtualisation, containerisation (OpenShift / Kubernetes) and DevOps (Jenkins) / IaaC (Terraform)

debugText:
- **Computer System Officer - Level 5**
- **Temporary Full-Time up to June 2026**
- **Sydney Olympic Park and Parramatta**

**About us**

The NSW Police Force (NSWPF) is one of the largest police forces in the western world, with more than 20,000 employees, including more than 4,000 administrative employees who support the sworn officers that provide a range of law and order services 24 hours a day, seven days a week to the socially, geographically and culturally diverse community of NSW.

**About the role**

We have an opportunity for a
**Solution Architect** to be part of our Enterprise Architecture and
Strategy, Technology and Communication Services Command team. The Solution Architect is responsible for the development of the technology solutions and mapping the business requirements to systems/technical requirements to ensure they are in line with the enterprise architectural plan.

For more information on this role (e.g. essential requirements, key accountabilities and capabilities required for the role), **[click here](https://files.jobs.nsw.gov.au/rdxsoc)** to view the role description.

**To be successful in this role, you will have:**

- At least a minimum of 5+ years’ experience in defining applications solutions architecture and design, integrations, infrastructure and cloud architectures, such as AWS, Azure, and/or Google cloud and hybrid services.
- Demonstrated knowledge and understanding of TOGAF (certification in TOGAF or equivalent).
- Experience in the following technologies/frameworks.
- Software Development Lifecycle (SDLC), Digital technology and development; and Service Orientated Architecture (SOA).
- Experience as a solutions architect including exposure to projects of $10Mil+, with prior experience working on large scale projects within the government sector highly desirable.
- Experience in transformation programs such as data centre refresh and/or migration to cloud.
- Integration architecture experience including iPaaS, API Gateways, ETL, ESB and related technologies (e.g., REST, JSON, etc).
- Knowledge of Virtualisation platforms, such as VMware, OpenShift etc.
- Prior experience in AWS, Azure, and/or Google cloud services.
- Knowledge of emerging technologies, digital, cyber security, and IT industry market trends.
- Highly experienced user of MS Project and MS Office toolset (Word, Excel and Power Point); and
- Excellent communication and stakeholder management skills, and experience in dealing with complex situations.

**What we can offer you**

At NSWPF our people have access to a range of benefits that help balance life at work and at home. Some of the benefits available when you join the NSWPF include:

- competitive salary;
- flexible work options;
- annual leave loading;
- corporate wellbeing programs including seminars and the Fitness Passport;
- free annual influenza vaccination;
- salary packaging options via superannuation contributions or a novated vehicle lease;
- convenient location for public transport and to shops etc; and
- in-house gym facilities.

**How to Apply**

Applications can only be submitted electronically via the I Work for NSW website.

To be considered for this role, attach a cover letter (2 pages maximum) and an up-to-date resume that clearly details your skills & experience as relevant to this role.

Please do not attach copies of qualifications, certificates or documentation (other than what has been requested) - you can bring these if called for interview.

Please address each of the following Target Questions (600 word limit per question) in the text boxes provided in the online application or attach as a separate document.

Target Question 1:

Describe your approach architecting a solution in a large and complex environment. What factors will you consider, including dependencies and other considerations that may impact successful delivery of the project. Please describe high level architecture of the solution that was provided on the migration project. What challenges you faced in the design and implementation of the solution including any security challenge you encountered and the steps you implemented to address it.

Target Question 2

Provide details of any recent cloud migration project you were involved in? Describe your role as an individual on the project and key deliverables you produced as Solution Architect. Please ensure this is a personal experience, not generated via ChatGPT or AI tools, as firsthand experience detail will be queried during the interview process.

Your application must stand on its own merits, and the completeness and relevance of your application will determine if you proceed through to the selection process.

If you require any further information about this opportunity, please contact the hiring manager **Mani Maniruzzaman via (02) 8835 9498.**

To be eligible to apply for this role, you must meet one of the following statuses:

- an Australian Citizen;
- a permanent resident of Australia; or
- a New Zealand citizen.

Prior to commencement, the successful candidate will be required to undergo a rigorous National Police (criminal history) Check and obtain and maintain a Security Clearance as determined by the NSW Police Force.

**Our commitment to Diversity:**

The NSW Police Force is a proud employer of a diverse range of people. We are committed to reflecting the diverse community we serve and creating an inclusive and respectful workplace for all employees. Differences are embraced, contributions are valued, and everyone has a sense of connection and belonging.

We welcome people with diverse skills, experiences, perspectives and backgrounds and encourage applications from Aboriginal or Torres Strait Islander peoples, and individuals who may identify as LGBTIQ, with disability, a culturally and linguistically diverse background, and people of all ages.

If you identify as a person with disability and require further information on the role or you require specific arrangements to participate in the recruitment process, please contact the HR Diversity Team by email at [PCC-INCLUSION@police.nsw.gov.au](mailto:INCLUSIONDIVERSITY@police.nsw.gov.au).

If you identify as Aboriginal or Torres Strait Islander and would like assistance with your application, please contact the NSWPF Aboriginal Employment & Engagement team at [PCC-AEET@police.nsw.gov.au](mailto:hraboriginal@police.nsw.gov.au).

This recruitment may be used to create a Talent Pool for similar future roles (ongoing or temporary) that may arise over the next 18 months.

For more information on applying for roles with the NSW Police Force [click here](https://www.police.nsw.gov.au/recruitment_links/civilian_employees)

Thank you for your interest in this role. We look forward to receiving your application.

debugText:
- **Join the leading new home builder in NSW**
- **Newly created role providing a mix of Citrix support and general
maintenance of infrastructure and services**
- **Based in our Norwest office**

The NEX Building Group is a diverse and expanding organisation with over 1,200 passionate employees. Our brand %%U+0027%% s purpose is to build beautiful homes for Australians. Established in 1987 and continuing to evolve both organically and through acquisition, we are well positioned for growth and committed to achieving our vision of being Australia’s leading home building group. Our iconic brands include McDonald Jones, MOJO Homes, Weeks Homes, Wilson Homes, Arden Homes Brighton Homes and Supaloc Steel Frames.

From architecturally designed first homes and multi-residential projects to luxurious residences and investment properties, our brands strive to set the benchmark in the new home building industry while ensuring that our people, both customers and staff, are at the centre of everything we do along the way.

Building new homes and better futures for Australians is a true honour and so rewarding. Here are some other rewards and benefits we offer our employees.

**Our perks and benefits**

We believe that our employee community is a key strength of our organisation, and we aim to attract the best talent to achieve our strategic goal of being Australia’s leading residential builder and employer of choice in our sector. We are committed to taking care of our employees, that’s why we offer a range of benefits including:

- Discount on building a new home through our building brands (after qualifying period)
- 8 weeks paid parental leave
- Discounted health insurance through nib
- Discounts on whitegoods
- Fitness Passport
- Employee assistance program
- Flu vaccinations
- Professional development and educational assistance
- Attractive remuneration
- And so much more!

**About the opportunity**

The IT System Administrator – Level 3 reports to the IT Infrastructure/Network Manager and is part of the NEX Building Group IT team. The key focus of this role is to act as an escalation point to the IT team as well as maintaining the group’s server and network infrastructure including providing Citrix server support. More specifically, you will:

- Triaging and managing the resolution of Citrix related and level 3 incidents and service requests by providing excellent technical assistance and customer service to all employees
- Aiding in the installation and configuration of server and infrastructure hardware, software and related systems
- Escalation of issues to external technology partners as required, whilst maintaining ownership of assigned incidents and service requests
- Be involved in preparation and make recommendations of capital replacements and systems improvements to management
- System Administration of Server and Network environments

**About you**

You will share a passion for our purpose and be aligned to our core values. In addition, you will demonstrate:

- A minimum 3-4 years’ experience in a similar role within a Service Desk environment
- Experience with installing, upgrading and maintaining a Citrix Virtual Apps and Desktop environment and NetScalers (ADCs).
- An understanding of the Microsoft 365 ecosystem
- Windows Domain and Active directory experience
- Strong customer service ethic
- Good problem-solving techniques with the ability to clearly communicate technical instructions remotely
- Attention to detail

**Interested?**

The appointment of successful applicants will be subject to satisfactory employment screening and depending on the inherent requirements of the role, may involve the completion of a National Police Check and pre-employment medical.

**Apply today!**

If you are determined to make a difference and want to join an innovative and inclusive organisation committed to building better futures, click on the APPLY button.
 To find out more about NEX Building Group go to nexbg.com.au
 or follow us on LinkedIn

_Our Talent Acquisition Team and Hiring Leaders kindly request no unsolicited resumes or approaches from Recruitment Agencies. NEX Building Group and its brands are not responsible for any fees related to unsolicited resumes._
