debugText:
Are you ready to shape the future of infrastructure that enables critical national payments infrastructure at the Reserve Bank?

The Reserve Bank of Australia (RBA) is looking to hire an Enterprise Program Architect for the Core Modernisation Program. The Core Modernisation Program includes a complete re-architecture and rebuild of the Bank %%U+0027%% s primary data centres and underlying technologies, establishing a next generation foundation to meet the requirements for generations to come. The program includes establishment of the new infrastructure, including the replacement of one of the Bank %%U+0027%% s primary data centres with a new co-located data centre, migration of all of the Bank %%U+0027%% s systems to the new infrastructure across two data centres, and the decommissioning of the existing head office data centre. This role is a fixed term contract until June 2027 based at Baulkham Hills.

In addition to participating in the design aspects of the infrastructure and migration, the role will drive alignment across program, technology, and business stakeholders ensuring performance, resilience, availability, and security requirements are met in the target state. This role is part of a team that provides IT strategy and architecture services to the Bank. We work directly with IT and Business teams to ensure our technology investments are aligned with the Bank %%U+0027%% s strategy and plans.

You %%U+0027%% ll bring with you a strategic mindset, strong forward thinking, and the ability to maintain alignment to the agreed target state across program and technical staff.

We are looking for an **Enterprise Architect** who:

- Leads the development of target state strategies and technology plans for the Core Modernisation Program, working closely with Enterprise and Principal Infra Architects, Senior Program and Business stakeholders, and Partners/vendors to ensure performance, resilience, availability, and security requirements are met.
- Leads analysis work and identification of changes needed in the Bank %%U+0027%% s IT target state operating model.
- Proven ability to work with project and technical staff to identify and negotiate opportunities for improvement within the constraints of a project that has strict delivery timeframes.
- Can lead the development of architectures for complex domains/solutions and plan and govern against these, including active participation in Design and Architectural governance forums.
- Has the ability to lead, develop and motivate a practice area or project of IT specialists who exercise independence in their work.
- Will identify and highlight potential delivery and delivered risks/impacts that need to be mitigated throughout the project before transition into BAU.
- Provides senior technical leadership to the IT department, including expertise in infrastructure, data, applications, security technologies and their deployment.
- Helps to set technology standards, advise on their application, and ensure compliance.

**Key skills and experience** required for the role:

- In-depth knowledge and experience in roadmap, strategy, and target state design development for complex data centre migrations.
- Sound understanding of enterprise infrastructure (e.g. Virtualisation, Networking, Storage) relevant to on premise datacentres, with knowledge/experience with cloud-based alternatives and SaaS based supporting technologies (such as Observability platforms).
- Experience in resolving solution design and architecture contentions with stakeholders in a timely way through governance channels.
- Excellent Stakeholder Engagement skills and experience in representing the department across the Bank or similar organizations.
- Has experience working with integration partners/vendors in large programs of work.
- Qualifications relevant to the Bank or IT industry, including TOGAF, and technical domain certifications.

**Be More**

The RBA makes an important contribution to the Australian economy through the pursuit of national economic policy objectives and associated activities in financial markets and banking. We also issue Australia %%U+0027%% s banknotes and operates infrastructure critical to the payments system, all of which contribute to the welfare of the Australian people.

Made up of specialists across a wide range of fields, our people have a meaningful role to play in achieving these objectives. Our people conduct themselves with a high degree of integrity, while striving for excellence in the work they perform and the outcomes they achieve. We encourage intelligent inquiry, and we treat one another with respect while promoting the public interest through our efforts.

We know it is the growth and success of our people that drives the Bank forward. Come and make a bigger contribution while you build and develop your own skills too, because being more means you can do more, for yourself and for Australia.

**The Reserve Bank of Australia is an equal opportunity employer. We are committed to crafting a diverse and inclusive environment and encourage applications from expert candidates seeking workplace flexibility.**

**Software Engineer (.Net) - Cloud Modernisation Crew**

- You are a motivated .Net Engineer with a passion for Problem Solving
- Join one of our high-performing .Net engineering teams
- We are a team of big thinkers who are engineering the future of banking

**Do Work that Matters**

As a Software Engineer, you will be part of Cloud migration & application modernising team that enables Cloud adoption for the rest of the Bank. We put customers at the centre of everything we do. Together we use technology to drive efficient and timely processing, an essential component of great customer service.

The size and nature of our systems and the pace at which our customers %%U+0027%%  expectations are changing means we %%U+0027%% re always seeking out the latest technology, experimenting and pushing the boundaries. Our work is key to future proofing one of Australia %%U+0027%% s largest companies.

**See yourself in our team**

You %%U+0027%% ll migrate and modernise the applications used to power our entire business. You %%U+0027%% ll have the opportunity to pave the way for Cloud journey for complex applications and ensuring they are simpler, faster and more secure.

The cloud movement at CommBank is going strong and continues to grow. We %%U+0027%% re looking for out-of-the-box thinkers who want to use technology to work on real-world problems that have the potential to change the lives of our 17 million+ customers.

You %%U+0027%% ll be helping all CBA Business Units to adopt and deliver applications at scale by leveraging standard hosting patterns. In doing so, you will be helping the application teams with troubleshooting their application deployments from their code, the web servers and the cloud deployments. Your expertise in .NET and Software engineering will be a crucial element for you to be successful in this role.

**We %%U+0027%% re interested in hearing from people who**

- Excellent debugging and troubleshooting skills on .Net
- Excellent understanding of the infrastructure that runs .NET applications - IIS, Web Servers, Kestrel, Containers, etc
- Have experience in CI/CD pipelines with integrated automated testing and governance
- Are passionate about DevOps/Automation and have a powerful desire to solve complex problems in a systematic approach - e.g using PowerShell
- Constantly think creatively and breaking boundaries to solve complex technical problems
- Work well in teams and have strong collaboration skills in driving continuous improved initiatives
- Solid understanding of software engineering fundamentals and best practices
- Work with various application teams to ensure the stability and security of the cloud platform
- Should be well-versed in deploying, maintaining and troubleshooting .Net applications on IIS
- Good understanding on Software Development Kit (SDK) and runtime environments
- Driving automation through understanding processes and implementing improvements
- Good understanding of networking and network protocol will be advantageous
- Strong presentation, verbal communication, and written communications skills
- Hands on skills with scripting
- Experience with the full software development lifecycle and delivery using Agile practices with specific focus on the following concepts: source control, CI/CD, automated testing, logging and monitoring
- Knowledge on cloud especially AWS is an added advantage
- Have a great understanding of software delivery practices and lifecycles in Agile methodologies

**Tech skills**

We use a broad range of tools, languages, and frameworks. We don %%U+0027%% t expect you to know them all but having significant experience and exposure with some of these (or equivalents) will set you up for success in this team

- Demonstrate experience developing applications using MS technologies - C# and .NET / .NetCore
- Sound knowledge of Microservices architecture and RESTful APIs
- Excellent debugging skills with ability to solve complex technical issues in .NET
- Experience operating and troubleshooting CI/CD pipelines
- Experience with Infrastructure as code and automating manual tasks
- Develop, lead, and deploy CI/CD strategies
- CI/CD tooling such as GitHub, TeamCity, Artifactory, Octopus Deploy
- Logging & monitoring: CloudWatch, AppDynamics, Splunk, Grafana and Prometheus knowledge are desirable
- Automating repetitive tasks using Python, shell scripting, PowerShell etc.
- Ability to diagnose and troubleshoot problems across the CI/CD toolchain

**Apply today!**

We operate in a **hybrid working environment**, meaning a blend between being in the office and working remote.

_Whether you %%U+0027%% re passionate about customer service, driven by data, or called by creativity, a career here is for you._

_Our people bring their diverse backgrounds and unique perspectives to build a respectful, inclusive and flexible workplace._ _We are working hard to build a team of people who represent the rich diversity of our customers and communities. If you %%U+0027%% re excited about this opportunity but you don %%U+0027%% t meet every single requirement, or your experience doesn %%U+0027%% t align perfectly, we still want to encourage you to apply. You may just be the perfect candidate for this opportunity or another within CommBank._

_At CommBank we will inspire you with work that makes a difference, surround you with talented people that respect and value each other, and empower you to grow professionally and personally. Most of all, making_ _a positive impact for customers, communities and each other is part of our every day._

_We %%U+0027%% re determined to make a real difference for Australia %%U+0027%% s first peoples. We encourage all interested applicants to apply._ _If you %%U+0027%% re already part of the Commonwealth Bank Group (including Bankwest), you %%U+0027%% ll need to apply through Sidekick to submit a valid application. We %%U+0027%% re keen to support you with the next step in your career._

debugText:
This role is responsible for being the technical product expert for overall end-to-end data flow and architecture for accountable features within the ResMed eco-system from a device perspective whilst ensuring that the system comes together in the most optimal manner to meet the needs of the market and the patient, with a sufficient forward-thinking approach.

This role requires working with other teams across multiple departments within ResMed as well as external vendors. It requires awareness of the market we operate in, emerging technologies relevant to us, and the best practices to incorporate them into our products and processes.

The role is best suited to an adaptive learner, a curious mind, and a natural big picture thinker, who can bring diverse groups together to work towards a common goal.

 **Let %%U+0027%% s talk about the Role:**

This role works across product teams within ResMed and with a broad range of business units including:

- Software, electrical, mechanical, cloud solutions, manufacturing, UX
- Marketing / Product Management
- IoT, MyAir, AirView, GDP
- Information Security, Information Technology
- External vendors

**Let %%U+0027%% s talk about Responsibilities:**

- Being the technical product expert for overall end-to-end data flow and architecture
- Specification of the end-to-end data flow, including providing criteria for system acceptance for the ResMed V&V team and external vendors
- Ensuring that technical artefacts are consistent with customer and corporate expectations for safety, performance, functionality, reliability and efficacy
- ​Evaluating technical design alternatives, to achieve desired functionality, in consultation and co-operation with sub-system technical leads/experts, and other stakeholders as applicable.
- Ensuring that ResMed Product Development Processes are adhered to and recommending process improvements as appropriate.
- Having awareness of the latest cybersecurity standards and making sure that that the ResMed eco-systems is the state of the art.
- Ensure technical artefacts are delivered in a timely manner.
- Providing clarity and communication on desired System Level deliverables to the responsible parties.
- Organising delivery of Systems artefacts including interface and data documentation.
- Identify early indicators of technical issues.
- Analyse problem areas and provide direction for resolution.
- Help plan the Over the Air upgrades to provide additional functionality for customers and patients.

**Let %%U+0027%% s talk about Position Specific Skills and Challenges:**

- Breadth of technical expertise and product knowledge
- Being across all aspects of the end-to-end data flow
- Maintain a broad knowledge of company products, competitors, and customer’s and patient’s needs.
- Understand Software Architecture and Design principles
- Managing the expectations and involvement of multiple stakeholders and multiple teams with a range of needs
- Aligning team planning and decision making with the different business units and product teams.
- Facilitating design and implementation discussions with multiple stakeholders and multiple teams, including external vendors
- Proactively engaging other stakeholders / domain leads when their domain is expected to be impacted.
- Articulating how one area / product / team may affect another.
- Articulating impact of design and decisions, short term and long term
- Engaging in constructive conflict as appropriate during the decision-making process
- Discerning the extent to which to delve into technical and non-technical details, and when to step out to provide a high-level perspective
- Proactively finding information as opposed to waiting for information
- Finding the right group of stakeholders to involve in discussion, decision-making or implementation
- Providing information to the right level of granularity and level, for each audience
- Collaborating to gather information, and deciding clearly when that %%U+0027%% s sufficiently complete

**Let %%U+0027%% s talk about Qualifications and Experience**

Minimum

- Bachelor of Engineering Computer Engineering or Mechatronics OR Bachelor of Science (in Biophysics for example) OR equivalent degree
- Proficiency in Software Development Process
- Proficiency in agile development process and practices
- Excellent written and verbal communication and documentation skills.

Preferred

- Postgraduate qualification in Biomedical Engineering
- 3 years+ Experience in New Product Development environment including hardware development
- Experience working in multi-disciplinary teams

Joining us is more than saying “yes” to making the world a healthier place. It’s discovering a career that’s challenging, supportive and inspiring. Where a culture driven by excellence helps you not only meet your goals, but also create new ones. We focus on creating a diverse and inclusive culture, encouraging individual expression in the workplace and thrive on the innovative ideas this generates. If this sounds like the workplace for you, apply now! We commit to respond to every applicant.

**Senior Project Manager**

- **Salary $106,323.88 to $123,335.16 p/a + super**
- **Permanent full time position – 35 hours per week**
- **Position includes a leaseback vehicle**

**About Ku-ring-gai Council**

Located 16 km’s north of the Sydney CBD, the Ku-ring-gai area covers 84km2, is home to 124,000 residents and set in one of New South Wales’ most attractive natural environments.

**About the role**

Reporting to the **Coordinator Project Delivery**, this role will see you provide a high level of professional and technical support in delivering a complex and wide-ranging portfolio of Council projects.

**Your duties will include, but are not limited to**

- Provide a high level of professional and technical support in delivering Council’s capital works program
- Manage the delivery of a complex and wide-ranging portfolio of projects, including project initiation, development, construction, contracts supervision and administration to the agreed time, cost and quality
- Develop project briefs, specifications and tender documents
- Prepare preliminary budgets and pre-construction estimates for projects
- Develop and monitor allocated capital works programs
- Ensure project work complies with environmental legislation, Council’s Environmental Management System Policy, Development Control Policy and Corporate Standards and Procedures on Environmental Management practices

**Qualifications, Skills & Experience**

- Degree in Civil Engineering, Architecture, Landscape Architecture, Construction Management or equivalent
- Class C Drivers Licence
- Construction white card
- Extensive experience in project management of a portfolio of multi-disciplinary projects
- Experience in contract administration and supervision
- Experience in the management of project finances and budgets, business planning, tendering and contract administration
- Excellent organisational and time management skills
- Ability to work independently with minimal supervision and as part of a team
- Excellent communication, interpersonal and conflict resolution skills
- Proficiency in the use of personal computer applications, in particular the Microsoft suite of products (Microsoft Word, Excel, Outlook, TEAMS and PowerPoint) and the ability to learn new software

This role will utilise your experience in developing strong working and stakeholder relationships to deliver agreed outcomes and results.

**Benefits**

- 35 hour working week
- Position includes a leaseback vehicle
- Health & Fitness $100 yearly reimbursement (conditional)
- Free confidential Employee Assistance Program
- Beautiful Ku-ring-gai Location
- Supportive team environment
- Access to a wide range of development and training opportunities

For more information on the benefits offered at Ku-ring-gai Council, please refer to our website [click here](https://www.krg.nsw.gov.au/Council/Careers/Why-work-at-Ku-ring-gai-Council).

**How to apply**

Applicants are required to address all Essential Criteria as listed within the [Position Description](https://applynow.net.au/jobs/PP0170/assets/25776604) to be eligible for an interview.

**Like to know more? Please** Contact Craig Roberts on 9424 0818

**Closes:** 11.30pm, Monday 28 October 2024

**_Ku-ring-gai Council is an equal opportunity employer_**

**_Together we shape thriving communities, public spaces, places and economies._**

- **Drive Strategic Technology Investments and Solutions**
- **Temporary full-time opportunity to September 2026 + creation of a talent pool for

ongoing and temporary opportunities of the same role or role type**
- **Office location –
Parramatta other NSW locations will be considered by negotiation**
- **Salary relative to experience and ranges from $139,787.00 to $161,663.00 + super**

**What’s in it for me?**

Join our team for a **fantastic culture** with dynamic collaboration and **genuine long-term career support**. We offer **flexibility in work arrangements**, diverse and fulfilling assignments, and prioritize **work/life balance** and wellbeing with initiatives like flex leave and access to support programs. Additionally, we are committed to **fostering a diverse and inclusive workplace** where everyone feels welcome, respected, and empowered to succeed.

**The role**

The **Principal Solution Architect** works closely with a team of Solution Architects to create technology solutions that align with enterprise standards and roadmaps. This role involves developing capability models, analysing solution options, and collaborating with technology teams to document and implement end-to-end solution designs on schedule.

As the Principal Solution Architect, your key responsibilities will include defining solutions that meet business demands and align with enterprise architecture, working with service providers to ensure IT solutions deliver business benefits, and managing service level agreements. You will be responsible for interpreting business requirements, informing strategic technology investments, and ensuring solutions are implemented as expected. In this role, you will be challenged with balancing project interdependencies, developing tailored solutions to align with various architectures, and staying current with industry best practices.

For more information read the full Role Description:
[**Principal** **Solution Architect**](https://www.dpie.nsw.gov.au/?a=621184)

**What you will bring to the role**

- Excellent communication skills, both verbal and written, to effectively present ideas and communicate with stakeholders and teammates
- Strong problem-solving abilities to navigate complex challenges, adapt to evolving situations and deliver to tight deadlines
- Strong teamwork and collaboration skills, with a willingness to contribute to group efforts and support colleagues in achieving objectives and adopting new knowledge
- Outstanding stakeholder engagement skills, fostering strong relationships and ensuring alignment with diverse stakeholders to achieve outcomes
- Capable of driving outcomes while effectively involving stakeholders throughout the process to foster collaboration and buy-in.

**What is an essential requirement:**

- Tertiary qualification in a relevant discipline and/or equivalent relevant experience

**About us**

The [Department of Planning, Housing and Infrastructure](https://www.nsw.gov.au/departments-and-agencies/department-of-planning-housing-and-infrastructure)
(DPHI) improves the liveability and prosperity of NSW. To achieve this, we: create vibrant, productive spaces and precincts; manage lands, assets and property effectively and deliver affordable and diverse housing. We strive to be a high-performing, world-class public service organisation that celebrates and reflects the full diversity of the community we serve and builds the cultural capability of our department to improve outcomes with and for Aboriginal people, communities and entities.

We are an inclusive and accessible workplace, where your individual contributions are valued, and where everyone is encouraged to feel a sense of connection and belonging. DPHI supports various employee affinity groups, practices flexible working, offers job share and workplace adjustments.

**Join us**

If excited by the information above, we look forward to receiving your application, including a copy of your resume and cover letter expressing your interest and suitability for the role.

Applications close **Monday 28th October at 11.55pm.**

Should you require further information about the role please contact Prajwal Subedi on [prajwal.subedi@environment.nsw.gov.au](mailto:prajwal.subedi@environment.nsw.gov.au).

_A recruitment pool may be created for ongoing and temporary opportunities of the same role or role type that may become available over the next 18 months._

Please note to be eligible to apply for this position you must be an Australian or New Zealand citizen or permanent resident, or hold a valid Australian working Visa for the duration of the appointment.

We encourage and support applications from people with disability. Please reach out to us to discuss any [accommodations or adjustments](https://iworkfor.nsw.gov.au/adjustments-for-individual-needs) that may be needed during the recruitment process, ensuring that you have every opportunity to showcase your talent, skills, and potential. Contact the Talent Team via [talent.acquisition@dpie.nsw.gov.au](mailto:talent.acquisition@dpie.nsw.gov.au) or (02) 63637676​ - HR Support, option 3, DPHI People Advisory, option 1 and reference  %%U+0027%% Request an Adjustment - Job Title and Reference Number %%U+0027%% .

Check out our
[Aboriginal applicants guide](https://www.nsw.gov.au/sites/default/files/2024-05/dphi-working-with-us-guide-for-aboriginal-applicants.pdf)
to assist with applying for the role or contact our
[Aboriginal Career pathways](https://nswdpie.tfaforms.net/1025)
team for a yarn.

debugText:
Here at UKG, our purpose is people™. Our HR, payroll, and workforce management solutions help organizations unlock happier outcomes for all. And our U Krewers, who build those solutions and support our business, are talented, collaborative, and innovative problem-solvers. We strive to create a culture of belonging and an employee experience that empowers our people – both at work and at home. Our benefits show that we care about the whole you, from adoption and surrogacy assistance to tuition reimbursement and wellness programs. Our employee resource groups provide a welcoming place to land, learn, and connect with those who share your passions and interests. What are you waiting for? Learn more at
www.ukg.com/careers
 #WeAreUKG

**What You’ll Do and Who You’ll Work With**

Join us as a Sr. Technical Support Engineer and you’ll be at the forefront of our service offering to our customers across diverse sizes and industries including retail, hospitality, healthcare, manufacturing, services, distribution, and the public sector.

The Sr. Technical Support Engineer’s primary role is to delivery high quality, world class technical support on UKG Suite of products to a variety of end users. As a member of the you will provide support to our SaaS customers by accepting, troubleshooting, and resolving cases for issues related but not limited to the , as well as the infrastructure that delivers it.

Your keen interest in information technology alongside your superior communication skills will provide you with the creative problem-solving skills you’ll need to excel in this role. We offer a structured training plan, and long-term development opportunities across our business.

Reporting to the Manager of Technical Support Engineering and working within a team of passionate Technical Support Specialists you will have the opportunity to grow your career within Technical Support. This role is based in Australia and can offer a flexible working from home and office arrangement.

**Your Responsibilities**

• Develop in-depth product knowledge on UKG ProWFM and learn how to recognise and effectively troubleshoot the different focus areas of the application.

• Research application questions by setting up scenarios and testing within the application.

• Troubleshoot, analyze, and solve complex customer issues utilizing documentation, knowledge base, bug tracking system and senior team members expertise.

• Replication customer scenarios for configuration/environmental solutions and/or readying the issue for Engineering review.

• Analyze customer configurations and think ‘outside the box’ to resolve and/or find an appropriate alternate solution.

• Fully document all activities, interactions, and next steps throughout the lifecycle of a case per departmental guidelines.

• Provide technical expertise to conduct specific performance or functional tests associated with resolving issues regarding UKG applications.

• Identifying more technical complex issues for escalation to senior Technical Support staff.

• Provide weekend, public holidays cover and after hour service as needed to meet business requirements.

**Qualifications**

Required Qualifications

• Experience in the software industry (WFM and/or HCM environments highly desirable) with significant related working experience in a Customer Support Center function, with at least 3 years of experience.

• Intermediate level of competency within the following technologies:

o An understanding of web technologies such as Java/XML, MS IIS, HTML.

o Familiarity with Oracle or SQL relational database management systems and SQL scripting.

o Java.

o Microsoft Operating systems.

o Networking technologies.

o Experience with CRM solutions such as Salesforce.

o Solid Operational statistical analytical ability using applications such as Excel etc.

• The ability to manage multiple tasks of varying complexity and ambiguity to completion with minimal supervision.

• Experience in both small and large companies in a B2B environment is highly desirable.

• Excellent communications and interpersonal skills are essential.

• Track record of accomplishment and effectiveness within organisations.

• Experience in working in 24x7 support operations and with teams across multiple locations is essential.

• Ability to remain focused with a solid attention to detail.

• Ability to translate business issues into appropriate outcomes.

• Strong verbal and written English skills are essential.

• Bachelor’s degree or equivalent Technical/Application support experience.

• You will understand our UKG Global Job Architecture career matrix profile for Global Support Sr. Technical Support Engineering. This role is expected to be fulfilled in an OWNING capacity.

**Equal Opportunity Employer**

Ultimate Kronos Group is proud to be an equal opportunity employer and is committed to maintaining a diverse and inclusive work environment. All qualified applicants will receive considerations for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, age, disability, marital status, familial status, sexual orientation, pregnancy, genetic information, gender identity, gender expression, national origin, ancestry, citizenship status, veteran status, and any other legally protected status under federal, state, or local anti-discrimination laws.

postTitle: Electrical Project Sales Engineer and Estimator
debugText:
**About us**

VASS Electrical Industries is the Australian specialist and market leader in Busway power distribution solutions since 1958. VASS occupies a purpose-build facility located in Ingleburn, Sydney.

VASS was recently acquired by Legrand, the global specialist in electrical and digital building infrastructures and a leader in Australia and New Zealand for many decades. Legrand has built a strong infrastructure of sales, service, manufacturing, R&D and logistics across both the countries. Every day, over 450 motivated employees work hard to enhance the buildings of tomorrow and make them more sustainable for everyone. This makes VASS a perfect place to learn, grow and build brilliant careers.

**About the Opportunity**

Are you an experienced professional with a passion for electrical power distribution systems? We are seeking a dynamic and skilled Electrical Project Sales Engineer and Estimator to join our team. In this role, you will be at the forefront of customer relations, technical support, quotations, and project coordination, driving business growth across diverse sectors. This role will be reporting to the CEO.

**Key responsibilities:**

- review, respond, and prepare requests for quotations for both local and international customers
- provide product and technical support, offering expert advice to our customer base
- promote and provide application solutions utilising our Electrical Power Distribution Systems
- establish and nurture new business relationships across all market sectors
- manage and coordinate projects between customers and our engineering/manufacturing departments
- ensure projects are delivered on time and within budget

**To be successful in this role you will have:**

- Electrical Tertiary qualification or Electrical Trade Background
- ability to interpret electrical drawings, schematics, architectural drawings, and engineering specifications
- computer literacy in MS Office software (Word, Excel, Access, PowerPoint) and Aconex
- excellent written and verbal communication skills
- strong negotiation skills at senior account levels

**What %%U+0027%% s on Offer**

- an engaging and supportive work environment
- opportunities for professional growth and development
- a chance to be part of a period of significant growth and transformation
- access to amazing benefits and a great work environment
- an extensive reward and recognition program
- free on-site parking

We recognise that in real life, great people don %%U+0027%% t always  %%U+0027%% tick all the boxes %%U+0027%% . That %%U+0027%% s why we hire for potential as well as experience. Even if you don %%U+0027%% t meet every point on the role description, if this role and our company feels like a good fit for you, we still want to hear from you.

postTitle: Enterprise Infrastructure Architect - Data Centre Migration
debugText:
**A leading Financial Services provider is seeking an Enterprise Infrastructure Architect with proven experience in data centre migrations to join their team on a long, fixed-term engagement.**

This organisation is currently embarking on a large transformation programs to build a new data centre, modernise their on-prem infrastructure and migrate critical applications onto the new target state infrastructure.

With a proven background in designing and architecting large-scale data centre migration programs, you will be possess superior skills in engaging / consulting with stakeholders from different parts of the business to resolve design issues, partnering with technology teams and vendors to develop solutions for the planning of the migration and help facilitate the successful migration of their to the new data centre.

**To be successful in this role you will need:**

- Tertiary qualifications and/or relevant industry certifications
- Strong experience working as an Enterprise Architect / Senior Infrastructure Architect within large complex environments
- Demonstrated experience designing and architecting a previous data centre migration
- Superior interpersonal and client engagement skills, with a proven ability to negotiate and influence with senior stakeholders and vendors
- Excellent verbal and written communication skills

**In return my client is offering:**

- Hybrid work from home / office (required to be in their Bella Vista office five days per fortnight)
- Attractive salary package
- Fantastic team environment

**To be considered for this exciting opportunity, please apply online now!**

debugText:
- **Permanent full-time role supporting large-scale information architecture programs**
- **Collaborative and inclusive team**
- **Attractive hybrid work model  %%U+007C%%  Energy Discounts  %%U+007C%% Career Growth Opportunities**

Alinta Energy is one of Australia’s biggest energy retailers, generators and developers with over 1.1 million customers. Australia’s energy system is undergoing the biggest transformation in its history and we’re right there with it. We’re investing in and developing large-scale renewables and storage projects as part of our ongoing effort to provide our customers with reliable, affordable and sustainable energy.

**_About the role_**

We are looking for an experienced Enterprise Architect to join Alinta Energy %%U+0027%% s IT team in a full-time, permanent role. You will work across the Merchant Energy business (Power Generation, including new energy renewables, Trading, and Portfolio Management) and report to the GM Strategy and Architecture. In this key role, you will lead the technology strategy, roadmaps, and implementation of cutting-edge solutions that drive our Merchant Energy business forward.

**_Why you’ll love working here_**

We’re a welcoming bunch who put our energy into being the best company we can be. For us, this means shared respect, great communication between teams, acting on our ideas, and looking out for each other’s wellbeing. There are plenty of great perks, from flexible working to a long list of exclusive Alinta benefits.

**_What you’ll do_**

- Lead technology strategy and roadmaps for Merchant Energy, ensuring alignment with business objectives, including cloud architecture strategies for scalable energy trading systems
- Develop and implement target-state architecture (1-3 years) and transition roadmaps, guiding the future enterprise architecture and supporting business strategy
- Advise on emerging technologies such as AI/ML, carbon trading platforms, and renewable energy systems to optimize trading decisions and drive innovative energy solutions.
- Ensure compliance with industry regulations, developing and enforcing robust architecture governance aligned with IT principles.
- 
Support development and delivery practices, driving improvements in automation, software quality, and Agile methodologies across Merchant Energy

**_Your experience_**

- Extensive expertise in IT architecture is essential, previous energy industry experience (retail, generation, transmission, or trading) is preferred
- Strong ability to build relationships across business units and deliver architectural artifacts that influence decision-making
- Experience with preparing and evaluating RFP/RFI/RFQs for both commercial and technology outcomes
- Certification in industry-recognised frameworks/methodologies such as TOGAF or Zachman
- Experience with AI/ML for predictive maintenance and renewable energy platforms would be highly desirable

This role offers a unique opportunity to shape the future of our enterprise architecture, guiding decisions that will propel the business forward.

**_Like what you’re seeing?_**

If you like the sound of this, and you’ve got experience in a similar role, we’d love to talk to you. Come and _discover better together_ with Alinta Energy.

We are a 2024 Circle Back Initiative Employer – we commit to respond to every applicant.

If your application progresses, we will need to complete background and pre-employment checks, such as immigration checks, reference checks, criminal background checks, qualification checks, and additional checks for roles related to finance.

**We look forward to hearing from you.**

Click ‘Apply’ to submit your application.

Closing date: 28 October 2024

debugText:
**Join Our Team as a Senior Embedded Software Engineer!**

**Location:** St Marys

**Position:** Permanent Full-Time – Start ASAP

**Pay:** Competitive Salary

We are currently seeking a passionate Automotive Embedded Software Engineer with a drive for zero-emission vehicles and cutting-edge technology. This role offers the opportunity to apply your technical creativity to develop custom embedded solutions for advanced applications such as charge controllers, DC-DC converters, multiplex systems, and electric vehicle control.

**About Us:**

Based in Sydney %%U+0027%% s Western Suburbs, Custom Denning is leading the charge in locally manufactured electric vehicles. We’re working closely with the NSW government to transition buses to an electric fleet by 2030, contributing to a cleaner, zero-emission future.

**Key Responsibilities:**

- Develop embedded software for both prototyping and volume manufacturing.
- Assist in the selection of suppliers for high-voltage electric vehicle components.
- Capture and specify detailed software requirements.
- Design and analyze software architecture, focusing on hardware-software interfaces.
- Utilize auto-generated software tools like MATLAB/Simulink for software design.
- Conduct Model-in-the-Loop (MIL), Hardware-in-the-Loop (HIL), and Software-in-the-Loop (SIL) testing and validation of control strategies developed in Simulink.
- Evaluate third-party software components and tools, using evaluation boards for prototyping.
- Apply knowledge of the software development lifecycle (e.g., V-life cycle) to all phases, including requirements capture, architecture development, software design, implementation, and testing.
- Diagnose vehicle faults and optimize system performance.
- Work with communication interfaces such as CAN and LIN.
- Mentor junior engineers and provide technical guidance as needed.

**Essential Experience:**

- 5+ years of embedded software development (automotive experience preferred).
- Proven experience with auto-generated software tools (MATLAB/Simulink).
- Experience in control strategies, simulation testing, and validation processes.
- Strong knowledge of communications interfaces (CAN, LIN).
- Effective verbal and written communication skills and strong time management.
- Ability to work collaboratively and mentor other team members.

**Desirable Skills:**

- Expertise in CAN communication and diagnostic protocols (CCP, J1939, UDS, OBDII).
- Familiarity with vehicle development and calibration tools (e.g., CANalyzer, CANape).
- Experience launching software into production.
- Knowledge of vehicle energy optimization, system simulation, and dynamics control.
- Understanding of functional safety systems (ISO 26262, IEC 61508).

**General Requirements:**

- Bachelor’s degree in Engineering.
- Strong analytical, problem-solving, and listening skills.
- Proficiency in Microsoft Office (Word, Excel, PowerPoint).
- Ability to multi-task and thrive in a fast-paced, dynamic environment.

**What We Offer:**

- Secure, permanent roles with career growth opportunities.
- Employee Assistance Program for you and your family.
- Referral Program.

**Ready to Join Us?**

If this sounds like you, apply now for a detailed discussion about the role. Please note that only shortlisted candidates will be contacted.

**About the Group**

As Canva continues to grow and scale to 1 billion users, the Global User Voice Enablement group ensure that our customer service operations are supported to be successful (learning, training, QA, systems and tools).

**About the Role**

As the Engineering Manager, you will be leading the team that secure, scale and builds the systems and tools daily used by our 900 customer happiness specialists to answer more than 1 million tickets annually:

- Consolidate and define what the future of Canva back offices looks like, not just for our customer support portal but for the whole business.
- Improve and roll out the permission framework to make our platform secure for all our customer agents.


We have plans to house all the admin portals at Canva.

**At the moment, this role is focused on:**

- Leading and coaching a motivated team of 4 engineers
- Leading the break-down and delivery of large projects
- Operate service(s) with excellence (including being on call)
- Work with senior members of the group to guide the technical vision
- Support team growth via feedback and reviews
- Design, develop and deploy solutions and hands-on software development– working closely with leads, designers, and product managers
- Foster an impactful team via an effective code review culture, knowledge sharing, design showcases, and process improvements
- Promote a safe and productive team culture with a focus on collaboration and open communication
- Advocate for engineering needs to non-technical partners within the group

**You %%U+0027%% re probably a match if you have:**

- Experience or genuine interest in supporting internal users and internal tools
- Experience/knowledge in security and scaling systems
- Experience in working with diverse stakeholders (both technical and non technical)
- Validated experience in technical people leadership, making sound decisions and delivering outcomes on technical projects
- Success in leading cross-disciplinary teams (frontend and backend), from mid to senior levels
- Exceptional problem-solving skills, with the ability to break large projects down into smaller ones and deliver on them through others.
- Exceptional communication and team collaboration skills, both written and verbal.
- Firmly grounded computer science and engineering fundamentals including concurrency, multithreading, data structures, solution design, architecture, and design patterns.

**It would be great if you had (though not essential!):**

- An interest in security (authentication systems, permissions, security posture)
- An interest in customer support systems
- Commercial experience in Java

**What %%U+0027%% s in it for you?**

Achieving our crazy big goals motivates us to work hard - and we do - but you %%U+0027%% ll experience lots of moments of magic, connectivity and fun woven throughout life at Canva, too. We also offer a stack of benefits to set you up for every success in and outside of work.

**Here %%U+0027%% s a taste of what %%U+0027%% s on offer:**

- Equity packages - we want our success to be yours too
- Inclusive parental leave policy that supports all parents & carers
- An annual Vibe & Thrive allowance to support your wellbeing, social connection, office setup & more
- Flexible leave options that empower you to be a force for good, take time to recharge and supports you personally

Check out lifeatcanva.com for more info.

**Other stuff to know**

We make hiring decisions based on your experience, skills and passion, as well as how you can enhance Canva and our culture. When you apply, please tell us the pronouns you use and any reasonable adjustments you may need during the interview process.

Please note that interviews are conducted virtually.

Join the team redefining how the world experiences design.

Hey, g %%U+0027%% day, mabuhay, kia ora,你好, hallo, vítejte!

Thanks for stopping by. We know job hunting can be a little time consuming and you %%U+0027%% re probably keen to find out what %%U+0027%% s on offer, so we %%U+0027%% ll get straight to the point.

**Where and how you can work**

Our flagship campus is in Sydney. We also have a campus in Melbourne and co-working spaces in Brisbane, Perth and Adelaide. But you have choice in where and how you work. That means if you want to do your thing in the office (if you %%U+0027%% re near one), at home or a bit of both, it %%U+0027%% s up to you.

debugText:
**Overview**

With over 17,000 employees worldwide, the mission of the Customer Experience & Success (CE&S) organization is to empower customers to accelerate business value through differentiated customer experiences that leverage Microsoft’s products and services, ignited by our people and culture. Come join CE&S and help us build a future where customers achieve their business outcomes faster with technology that does more.

The Global Customer Success (GCS) organization, an organization within CE&S, is leading the effort to enable customer success on the Microsoft Cloud by harnessing leading, AI-powered capabilities and human expertise to deliver innovation solutions that accelerate business value, drive operational excellence and nurture long term loyalty.

We are looking for a Presales and Delivery Excellence Cloud Solution Architect (CSA) for the Support for Mission Critical (SfMC), a team within Microsoft, part of GCS, that provides solution-specific expertise designed to drive resiliency and optimum performance of a customer’s most important solutions. Presales and Delivery Excellence CSAs in SfMC guide customer journeys to the cloud, readying them to innovate with AI, and providing thought leadership by constructively challenging customer thinking. You will enable customers to achieve their business objectives by positioning innovative proactive services, applying knowledge of the customer %%U+0027%%  %%U+0027%% s situation and leveraging subject matter expertise, IP, industry/market insights and a deep understanding of customer success, ensuring solution quality and reliability.

This role is flexible in that you can work up to 100% from home.

Microsoft’s mission is to empower every person and every organization on the planet to achieve more. As employees we come together with a growth mindset, innovate to empower others and collaborate to realize our shared goals. Each day we build on our values of respect, integrity, and accountability to create a culture of inclusion where everyone can thrive at work and beyond.

**Qualifications**

• Bachelor %%U+0027%% s Degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, Engineering, Business, or related field AND 7+ years experience in cloud/infrastructure technologies, information technology (IT) consulting/support, systems administration, network operations, software development/support, technology solutions, practice development, architecture, and/or consulting OR equivalent experience.

• 6+ years experience working in a customer-facing role (e.g., internal and/or external).

• 6+ years experience leading technical projects.

• 3+ years experience in presales, sales or business development.

• Broad knowledge of Microsoft Azure Technologies (IaaS, PaaS, Security).

Leadership, communication, and negotiation skills demonstrating ability to navigate through senior/executive stakeholders.

Strong consulting background to bridge the gap between technical potential & business value.

Ability to develop and deliver proof of concept (PoC) services that demonstrate the value of Microsoft solutions.

Problem solving ability to remove blockers and drive customer satisfaction.

Ability to meet Microsoft, customer and / or government security screening requirements are required for this role. These requirements include, but are not limited to the following specialized security screenings: Microsoft Cloud Background Check: This position will be required to pass the Microsoft Cloud Background Check upon hire / transfer and every two years thereafter.

**Responsibilities**

Customer Impact:

Guide customer journeys to the cloud and ready them to innovate with AI.

Provide thought leadership by constructively challenging customer thinking.

Position and ensure delivery of Well-Architected VBDs (Microsoft IP).

Enable cloud adoption and consumption on SfMC accounts.

Lead Delivery Health Reviews and support Internal Service Reviews.

Practice Impact:

Contribute to driving the closure of renewed and new deals

Contribute to team targets in leading sales to delivery handovers and onboarding workloads.

Drive renewal planning and contribute to renewal success.

Ensure data hygiene and accurate business pipeline reporting.

Minimize Microsoft risk on complex deals and identify overconsumption risks.

Leadership:

Stay updated with the SfMC offering evolution and articulate new strategies.

Engage with local/global communities.

Publish customer stories, contribute to team and Solution Area success.

Share and leverage best practices across territories.

Ensure up-to-date skills assessment and own development plan.

Sales Support:

Partner with sales and account teams to create proposals with scopes and cost.

Develop new opportunities for add-ons & upsells on existing contracts, collaborating with delivery team and contribute to transition plan execution.

Support sales efforts through ideation and deal shaping, contributing to presentations, demonstrations, workshops, and proofs of concept.

Lead discussions with delivery teams and stakeholders in renewal & new deals

Benefits/perks listed below may vary depending on the nature of your employment with Microsoft and the country where you work.

__ Industry leading healthcare

__ Educational resources

__ Discounts on products and services

__ Savings and investments

__ Maternity and paternity leave

__ Generous time away

__ Giving programs

__ Opportunities to network and connect

debugText:
We are seeking a highly skilled **Senior Solution Architect** who will contribute to uplift RBA %%U+0027%% s Risk Management System. The position is a 1 year fixed-term contract.

We are looking for a Senior Solutions Architect who:

- Define solutions architectures, high-level designs, and impact assessments for initiatives and/or systems in the Bank.

- Take ownership of Architecture deliverables for Conceptual and Solution Architecture documents and ensure that they are agreed and endorsed by all stakeholders.

- Work with analysts in defining business requirements, and work with subject matter experts to develop high level designs, in line with the enterprise architecture, patterns and practices. This may occasionally extend to assist with detailed design work.

- Collaborate with project managers and other stakeholders in scoping initiatives, ensuring they are scoped in accordance with architectural objectives and principles.

- Has experience in producing Solution Architectures for complex solutions (including infrastructure, cloud, on-premise and hybrid solutions)

- Ability to identify and document / call out dependencies with other projects / systems.

- Drive Architectural Certification process to completion for key project deliverables.

**Technical Capabilities**

- Highly Desirable to have experience in Risk Management System (e.g., Protecht) implementation.

- Experience with development principles, tools, and frameworks.

- Strong interpersonal skills, including teamwork, facilitation, and negotiation.

- Demonstrated ability to communicate, influence and persuade peers and senior stakeholders.

- Understanding of strategic and new and emerging technologies and their practical application.

- Understanding of relevant models, notations and tools.

- Strong experience in resolving solution design and architecture contentions.

- Sound experience in architectural disciplines across a range of complex projects and technologies.

**Qualifications**

- TOGAF is preferred.

- Tertiary qualifications relevant to the Bank or IT industry.

**Be More**

The RBA makes an important contribution to the Australian economy through the pursuit of national economic policy objectives and associated activities in financial markets and banking. We also issue Australia %%U+0027%% s banknotes and operates infrastructure critical to the payments system, all of which contribute to the welfare of the Australian people.

Made up of specialists across a wide range of fields, our people have a meaningful role to play in achieving these objectives. Our people conduct themselves with a high degree of integrity, while striving for excellence in the work they perform and the outcomes they achieve. We encourage intelligent inquiry, and we treat one another with respect while promoting the public interest through our efforts.

We know it is the growth and success of our people that drives the Bank forward. Come and make a bigger contribution while you build and develop your own skills too, because being more means you can do more, for yourself and for Australia.

**The Reserve Bank of Australia is an equal opportunity employer. We are committed to crafting a diverse and inclusive environment and encourage applications from expert candidates seeking workplace flexibility.**

- Highly experienced with **.Net Core backend**
- Experience with any **Workflow Automation tools** such as Microsoft Power Apps/Platform, Pega, Appian etc.
- Experience with CRM Implementation (Dynamics/Salesforce etc.)- Highly Desirable

**Do work that matters**

Retail Technology at CommBank is responsible for the world-leading application of technology across every aspect of CommBank and Bankwest Retail - from our digital experiences to product platforms and essential tools within our business.

This role sits within **Wealth & Private** in Retail Technology. Wealth & Private deals with high Netwealth customers to provide technology for our bankers and enable customers for end-to-end journey.

You will be working with our Private Banking Technology Team along with business for modernization journey.

**See yourself in our team**

As a Senior Staff Software Engineer, you will work with various value stream leads and product owners to drive technical decisions and assess how our solutions will fit with the architecture of the crew and the bank.

This role will see you building and implementing a CRM for our private bankers to use for our high net worth customers.

Using your deep technology experience, fast decision-making and expert collaboration and communication skills, you will be delivering high-quality technology solutions at scale and pace.

**We %%U+0027%% re interested in hearing from people who:**

- Proven experience in **solution design and architecture.**
- Have a passion for designing, developing and deploying high quality software solutions and System Design.
- Are familiar with the **full software development lifecycle** (SDLC) with a focus on CI/CD, infrastructure cloud pipelines, logging and monitoring.
- **Have implementation experience on any CRM platform**
- **Understands the workflow; experience on any workflow tool will be good to have**
- Have ability to think outside the box and break boundaries to solve complex problems.
- Contributes to a culture where quality, excellence and openness are championed.
- Have a natural drive to educate, communicate and positively influence various stakeholder groups including C-Suite executives.
- Can coach & mentor junior engineers, share knowledge to uplift and improve software development practices.
- Can perform code quality control through peer programming, code review and automated pipeline release management.

**Tech skills**

This is a highly technical role, requiring a broad range of tools, languages, and frameworks. You %%U+0027%% ll be a good match if you have previous experience in:

- Developing 3-tier application both on-premises and on cloud covering:
  - **Frontend: React and Redux (Preferred) or Angular.**
  - **Backend: .Net Core (preferred)**
  - **Database: SQL and NoSQL experience**
- **Experience with implementation of CRM** (eg Salesforce)- Highly Desirable
- **Experience with workflow automation** (tools such as Microsoft Power Platform, Appian, Pega etc.)- A Must
- **Cloud experience** AWS (preferred) or Azure
- Infrastructure as code preferably using CloudFormation or Terraform experience.
- Exposure to Event Driven Architecture
- Design and implementation of Microservices to deliver highly scalable APIs
- CI/CD tools such as GitHub Actions, TeamCity or Octopus.
- Application Security.
- Observability tools will be highly regarded.

If this sounds like you, **apply now**!

We operate in a **hybrid working environment**, meaning a 50% blend between being in the office and working remote.

_Whether you %%U+0027%% re passionate about customer service, driven by data, or called by creativity, a career here is for you._

_Our people bring their diverse backgrounds and unique perspectives to build a respectful, inclusive and flexible workplace._ _We are working hard to build a team of people who represent the rich diversity of our customers and communities. You may just be the perfect candidate for this opportunity or another within CommBank._

_At CommBank we will inspire you with work that makes a difference, surround you with talented people that respect and value each other, and empower you to grow professionally and personally. Most of all, making_ _a positive impact for customers, communities and each other is part of our every day._

_We %%U+0027%% re determined to make a real difference for Australia %%U+0027%% s first peoples. We encourage all interested applicants to apply._ _If you %%U+0027%% re already part of the Commonwealth Bank Group (including Bankwest), you %%U+0027%% ll need to apply through Sidekick to submit a valid application. We %%U+0027%% re keen to support you with the next step in your career._

debugText:
**The Company...**

With over 50,000 employees in over 100 countries, this worldwide organisation is known for their technological expertise and innovative sustainable processes.
 Although this is a global company, they have a strong local footprint and work as one entity to reach shared goals while focusing on offering their customers quality products and services.

Due to a recent project, they are looking for an experienced IT Business Analyst to join their operations team on an initial 12-month contract, with the possibility of a 12-month extension. Please note, the successful candidate will be required to work full-time at the Alexandria office.

**Benefits...**

- 12-month contract, with the possibility of a 12-month extension!
- An excellent opportunity to work with a globally recognised organisation!
- The office is conveniently near a variety of cafes and shops, offering easy access to local amenities!

**The Job...**

 In this versatile Technical Business Analyst role, will be mainly responsible for the following duties:

- Work with external vendors to lead the design, development, and deployment of microservices and APIs, enhancing service delivery and customer experience. Reengineer critical applications to streamline navigation and facilitate online transactions, effectively reducing channel dependencies.
- Direct engineering teams in digitizing solutions, driving digital transformation through modernization and software-driven strategies.
- Oversee data platforms, analytics, governance, information security, and privacy initiatives to enhance data maturity and operational efficiency.
- Simplify enterprise architecture by consolidating redundant systems, decommissioning outdated applications, and integrating connections into a unified platform.
- Lead IT projects involving SAP S/4HANA and in-house CRM, ensuring alignment with vendor-supported templates.
- Provide guidance on business process improvements, translating requirements into functional designs and resolving complex technical issues.

**You...**

 To be successful in this role, you must have experience in the following areas:

- 5 years of experience in technical business analysis within a large commercial organisation, ideally manufacturing and/or engineering sectors.
- Strong foundation in programming, with either practical or theoretical expertise.
- Proficiency in S4HANA and Salesforce or similar CRM systems.
- Highly reliable, with a commitment to a 2-year project duration.
- Strong analytical skills, with excellent attention to detail.
- Outstanding communication and interpersonal abilities.
- Bilingual language skills are an advantage.

**How to apply...**

 Be quick to apply for this exciting contract role! Please apply directly through our job board or Linked In.

 Please be advised only shortlisted candidates will be contacted.

_We take the security of our candidates seriously and will never ask for your bank details during the hiring process nor will we contact you via WhatsApp or Telegram. If you receive any communication from us requesting this information, please do not respond and contact us immediately._

postTitle: Project Architect - Life Sciences - Mid Level
debugText:
At Gensler, we design for people. We leverage our global perspective and local presence to innovate at every scale. We’re not just designers. We’re tinkerers, craftspeople, visionaries, innovators and thought leaders. Fueled by passion and entrepreneurial spirit, our people bring new ideas to solve challenging problems. Whether you’re into sketching new ideas, hacking a building or growing client relationships in global markets, there’s something here for everyone.

Our depth of expertise spans disciplines—from aviation and transportation to education, hospitality, retail, technology and more. At our core we embody an entrepreneurial spirit, always looking ahead for new ways to innovate and add to our clients %%U+0027%%  success. We share the belief that design has the power to transform organizations and change lives; whether we’re refreshing a retailer’s brand, planning a new urban district or designing a super tall building.

Our work reflects an enduring commitment to sustainability, and we believe that a diversity of voices and cultures is one of the most powerful strategic tools for securing lasting competitive advantage.

As the world’s largest design firm, Gensler has a unique obligation and opportunity to focus on sustainability in the built environment. We deepened our commitment to combat the impact on climate change in the built environment when we launched Gensler Cities Climate Challenge (GC3) in 2019. This is our pledge to meet an ambitious goal: the elimination of all greenhouse gases from our work by 2030.

**Your Role**

As a
Project Architect, it’s your job to lead a team of architects and designers to deliver unparalleled projects of Life Sciences and Lifestyle sector (Residential, Commercial, Hospitality, Retail, F&B etc.). Leverage your industry experience and technical acumen to drive client projects from concept through to build.

You combine creativity and technical knowledge with business skills and understanding to produce functionally beautiful spaces for clients. As a member of the Lifestyle Architecture team, you will be a part of a team that creates impactful and memorable experiences that will be remembered for a lifetime.
 Your successful track record on these projects and ability to problem solve both individually and part of a team makes Gensler a perfect place to cultivate your career.

In this position, you will collaborate with our Design Directors and design leadership on a variety of exciting residential and mixed-use developments with commercial, mixed-use, and retail components. You will produce technical documentation and communicate project progress to team members to ensure success. You’re a fit for this role if you have experience in Residential Mixed Use project’s conception and construction documentation, are proficient in Revit, and enjoy working with a team of architects/ designers that bring design dreams to life.
 This is a good role for someone who is technically proficient and enjoys working with a highly creative, collaborative team dedicated to innovative problem solving and design excellence.

**What You Will Do**

- An integral part of the design team, leads towards a cohesive and rational design solution which conforms to the project brief and is technically, legally and financially responsible.
- Based on a very good understanding of local and national codes, be able to guide the team to design in alignment with the requirements.
- Guides skill development of junior designers
- Contributes to and reinforces the “team effort” method of producing design projects
- Takes responsibility for implementing approved briefing approach
- Leads project meetings as a
Design Manager
- Solves complex design problems through schematic design and design development
- Oversees the preparation of graphic materials for presentation to client
- Researches and recommends appropriate systems, materials and finishes
- Present design schemes and documents to the client with the Design Manager
- Oversees the design development package for production
- As Design Manager, liaises as necessary with client on issues of design
- Developing strategic planning, conceptual designs, design development, and production
- Perform design assignments that include conceptual design, schematic design, design development & construction documents.
- Provides design support for completion and execution of design projects
- Develop space planning concepts and generate program documents
- Participates in selection of palettes & material presentations, and generate specifications
- Manage multiple aspects of client, team and project coordination, including full documentation coordination with consultants (structural, MEP, lighting, AV, acoustical, accessibility, building envelope, life safety, etc.)
- Support communication between project team, client, vendors, contractors, and consultants
- Actively participate and contribute to the financial performance of project
- Utilize hand and 3D software renderings to communicate design concepts
- Establish and maintain ongoing, productive client relationships through successful project delivery
- Participation in business development effort
- Participate in exciting design and research projects and bring a new perspective to what we do for our clients
- Contribute to office activities, initiatives, and learning programs

**Your Qualifications**

- Australian Registered Architect.
- 6+ years minimum postgrad experience in Australia.
- Strong understanding of NCC/BCA and City of Sydney Planning Regulations.
- Life science project delivery experience essential, taking projects from concept design through to construction completion.
- Advanced Revit user.
- Strong project management & control, and team leadership skills.
- Strong client presentation skills.
- Demonstrated commitment to sustainability and sustainable building practices.
- Aptitude for DFMAD (Designing For Manufacturing Assembly and Disassembly) highly desirable.
- Salary package negotiable based on applicant’s skill set and level of experience.

Your Design Technology Qualifications

Essential:

- Deep knowledge and experience in Autodesk Revit for design authoring, documentation, data extracts and project delivery.
- Experience in collaboration within the BIM context, including cloud-based markups, consultant coordination and clash detection.
- Deep understanding of Real-Time Visualization development within the context of BIM, specifically in the use of Escape/ other rendering mediums.
- Experience in creating FF&E schemes and developing them through detailed technical specification

Desirable:

- Working knowledge in the use of VR walkthroughs and panoramas for client presentations, consultant coordination and internal design review

Applications we work with:

- Design Authoring - Revit, Rhino, Autocad, Navisworks
- Collaboration - BIM360 • Computational Design - Grasshopper, Dynamo
- Building Performance Simulation - Insight, Sefaira, Diva, Ladybug tools
- Visualisation – Vray, Enscape, Twinmotion, 3DSMax ,Graphics & Productivity - Adobe


 Creative Suite, Microsoft Office Suite, • Experiential – Unreal Engine, Unity ,Development – C#, Python

**Life at Gensler**

Gensler Asia-Pacific and Middle East is committed to Diversity, Equity and Inclusion through our Five Strategies. In partnership with our clients, we strive to create a just and equitable future for our communities and our colleagues. We celebrate our diversity and are focused on creating an inclusive workplace environment for all.

As a people-first organization, we are as committed to enjoying life as we are to delivering best-in-class design. From internal design competitions to research grants to “Well-being Week,” our offices reflect our people’s diverse interests.

We encourage every person at Gensler to lead a healthy and balanced life. Our comprehensive benefits include medical, dental, vision, disability and wellness programs. We also offer profit sharing and twice annual bonus opportunities. As part of the firm’s commitment to licensure and professional development, Gensler offers reimbursement for certain professional licenses and associated renewals and exam fees. In addition, we reimburse tuition for certain eligible programs or classes. We view our professional development programs as strategic investments in our future.

Opportunity exists within Northern Sydney Local Health District (NSLHD) and Central Coast Local Health District (CCLHD) for an Infrastructure Architect to join a dynamic Architecture team within a complex Health Care setting.

**Employment Type**:
Permanent
Full TimePosition Classification: Health Manager (Level 4)Remuneration:
$2,628.91 - $3,132.15 per weekHours Per Week:
38Requisition ID:
REQ525485

**Who we are** : We are a health service that touches thousands of lives across the Northern Sydney Local Health District, together as a team of like-minded people. We are passionate, driven and have the skills and knowledge to care for our patients whilst creating the best services possible. Our teams have meaningful, interesting and rewarding work everyday. We challenge and nurture each other, sharing our knowledge and experience so that we can deliver better care for everyone There’s a real sense of belonging here because we value and respect our patients, employees, and teams’ voices. You’ll feel a real privilege being a trusted caregiver in our patients, their families, their carers, and our communities’ lives.

NSLHD is proud of our diverse and inclusive workplaces, a place where health care professionals can thrive and feel they belong. We are committed to ensure that all our people feel respected and participate safely within a work environment without aggression, sexual harassment, discrimination and racism.

**Where you %%U+0027%% ll be working** Digital Health Services, Level 4 Douglas Building, Royal North Shore Hospital. Travel to CCLHD as required.

**What you %%U+0027%% ll be doing**

This role is responsible for defining and developing the overall IT infrastructure strategy, working closely with business stakeholders and technical teams to ensure alignment with business objectives and technical requirements.

A key part of this role is to act as a coordination point between IT senior leaders, business stakeholders, DHS project, technical, architecture, and delivery teams, to translate business requirements and problems into technology solutions, and provide detailed design, in conjunction with feedback from DHS technical and architecture teams.

**People of Aboriginal and/or Torres Strait Islander background encouraged to apply.** Candidates will need to meet the following criteria **:**

1. Bachelor %%U+0027%% s degree in Computer Science, Information Technology a related field or equivalent relevant experience.
2. Demonstrate understanding of IT infrastructure technologies and trends, including cloud computing, virtualisation, storage, networking, and security specifically in relation to a large Healthcare environment.
3. Demonstrate examples where you have demonstrated strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with the ability to develop creative and innovative solutions to complex problems and then communicate and collaborate with vendors, business stakeholders, delivery, technical and architecture teams.
4. Demonstrate examples of your ability to translate business requirements into technology solutions, and provide detailed design, in conjunction with feedback from technical and architecture teams.

Need more information?

1) Click here for the Position Description

2) Find out more about applying for this position

For role related queries or questions contact Leanne Bendall on Leanne.Bendall@health.nsw.gov.au

**Applications Close: 1 November 2024**
